templatetext:
Company Overview    The global Digital transformation is well underway across Australia and with that one of the greatest demands sits across Data & Analytics. This is an opportunity to
          join an entrepreneurial, software engineering and data recruitment agency inheriting everything across the Data space.   This agency is not your vanilla recruitment operation. They put a huge emphasis on content
          creation, strategic digital marketing and weekly mentoring workshops to get consultants to where they need to be. This small, close knit team are well ahead on industry standards, averaging $41k (per head, per month) and are
          able to draw on 15-20 PSA customer relationships.   If you are smart, curious and courageous then this could be a great fit.     About the role    We are looking
          for a senior agency recruiter with a genuine interest in the emerging Data Science and Analytics space. Partnering with the two founders you will build out the Data market within their existing clients (as work does get consistently called in)
          and go out and develop your own portfolio.   We are looking for a recruiter who will truly engage with their community; someone who will go out to meet ups, look to host their own events, as well as, be proactive and work to a pace.            Why work here

Weekly mentorship from the Founders on best practise recruitment and wider business-related discussions  
Strategic relationship driven partner development NOT cold calling
High performing team - every employee to date has made commission from Month 2
Plenty of office banter, everyone is friends outside of work.
Market leading commission structure (Monthly), lower than market threshold
The offices are a phenomenal - Co-Working space in the CBD with amazing views and balconies - Inhouse bar, Yoga, Events & Party’s every week, free catered breakfast on Mondays.
The Fun stuff - Holly Moley Golf, Long Lunches, Fishing Charters, Clay Pigeon Shooting, Whiskey tasting, Melbourne Cup at Randwick, Driving Range, Sunrise Kayaking under the harbour bridge.
Laptop and mobile phone to allow you to work anywhere. 
 Next Steps    To apply, please send your CV and covering letter to mark@bartonmills.com.au

Strong written and reporting skills are highly desirable
Relevant experience with Excel (Advanced), SQL and R code.

Ability to liaise with internal and external stakeholders

title: Senior Health Data Analyst

templatetext:
Strong leadership background
Experience in the management of large data collections
Permanent full-time position based in Brisbane CBD
Salary (AO8): $123,131 - $130,201 per annum + super    

The roleThe Manager, Data Collections is responsible providing leadership, management and direction to Data Collection staff, and providing advice to the Director, Statistical Collections and Integration on strategies and
          policy for the conduct and delivery of cost effective information services and systems for Queensland Health.  The role will also assist with developing corporate level information management strategies and plans for the Department's information
          services and their delivery, and develop resourcing plans and negotiate corporate resourcing to support these plans.  Additionally, the role will establish a collaborative relationship working towards a coordinated approach to data collection
          and dissemination with other units and branches within the Department, and formulate and control work programs, prioritise tasks and manage senior data collection staff and other resources accordingly.  The successful personThe
          successful candidate will have experience in managerial and leadership roles pertaining to health-related information management, particularly with regard to data services, including data definitions, standards, collection, reporting and analysis. 
          You will demonstrate knowledge of survey and study design methodology, and have proven experience in project planning, management, and implementation of major data collections within a critical service delivery organisation.  Additionally,
          you demonstrate strong analytical, conceptual, and critical thinking capability, and exceptional written and verbal communication skills.  Further, you will have a strong track record in building and maintaining effective professional and
          consultative relationships with senior stakeholders, and demonstrate a supportive and collaborative leadership style.  About usThe Statistical Services Branch (SSB) is responsible for ensuring the availability
          of trusted, timely, validated information for the Department to enable policy development, decision-making, clinical improvement, planning, performance monitoring and evaluation of health services, for reporting required under legislation and
          national agreements and to maximise funding.  The Branch acts as a central reference point for health-related statistical information enquiries, and provides leadership, expert advice, strategies and support in relation to statistical issues,
          maintains and develops state-wide statistical standards and reference files and the corporate statistical metadata repository.
Statistical Collections and Integration (SCI) is one of four units in the SSB and is responsible for the centralised collection, processing and validation of data from several major corporate health-related data collections. The data are used
          for health services planning, research into diseases, monitoring standards of care, determining funding levels, and national reporting requirements.Benefits of working with the Department of Health:By joining the
          Department of Health you will work within a fast-paced, challenging and supportive environment where every employee plays a critical role in our ongoing success.  You will enjoy a variety of benefits, including:•    Competitive
          salary + generous superannuation and leave loading•    Flexible working arrangements•    Diverse work culture•    Career training and developmentTo reflect the diversity within
          the communities and people we support and serve, we seek to hire a workforce that is both representative and diverse. With a focus on inclusion, accessibility and flexibility, we are committed to supporting you in your career with us.To
          apply for this opportunity, please submit your resume and a 1-2 page cover letter outlining your skills and experience relevant for this role.  For further information, please contact Rod Leeuwendal on (07) 3708 5670.
Applications Close: Tuesday 12th February 2019Job Reference: QLD/SPP300057
title: Manager Data Collections

templatetext:
**This opportunity will be based in either our Sydney, Canberra, Adelaide or Brisbane office** 
About AFSA:
The Australian Financial Security Authority (AFSA) is responsible for managing the application of bankruptcy and personal property securities laws through the delivery of personal insolvency and trustee, regulation and enforcement and personal
            property securities services. 
About the Role:
The Senior Statistician and Data Manager will lead the delivery of AFSA’s statistics and reporting to bring about financial outcomes and impact in the Australian economy. You will develop a forward looking statistics program to support AFSA’s
            ‘future state’ to further benefit the Australian community.
You will prepare briefings on a range of statistics and the broader economy, and provide expert advice on statistical governance. Your ability to engage with and build relationships with diverse stakeholders will see you achieve success in this
            dynamic opportunity. 
About You:
To be successful in this role you will have:

a tertiary qualification or demonstrated experience in economics, statistics or quantitative fields;
demonstrated experience in producing published statistics, including developing and implementing statistical governance;
demonstrated success applying your expertise in economic analysis and modelling to influence strategic goals;
high level consultancy and advisory skills, with the ability to interpret and illustrate findings to diverse audiences.  

Why AFSA?
You will enjoy excellent conditions including generous superannuation (15.4%), a modern work environment, flexibility to balance work and personal life, and professional growth. 
We encourage applications from Indigenous Australians, peoples from culturally diverse backgrounds and people with disabilities.                                 
                                               
We value employee commitment and contribution and we provide a working environment that supports staff to reach their full potential.
Applications close Sunday 3 February, 2019
title: Senior Statistician and Data Manager

templatetext:
The Organisation
At UNSW, we pride ourselves on being a workplace where the best people come to do their best work.  We aspire to be Australia’s global university, improving and transforming lives through excellence in research, outstanding education and
          a commitment to advancing a just society.
The Mark Wainwright Analytical Centre (MWAC) is part of the Division of Research and sees the colocation of major research instrumentation in the University in purpose-built high-grade facilities for the study of the structure and composition
          of biological, chemical and physical materials and includes preparation laboratories, smaller instruments and computing facilities. In addition, MWAC provides the technical/professional support for these instruments. Analytical Centre staff
          members are expected to contribute to the overall success of the Centre by making a major contribution to Centre initiatives and participating fully in cooperative education and research projects.
The Opportunity
Stats Central is based in the Mark Wainwright Analytical Centre in the Division of Research and offers UNSW researchers support in study design and analysis, as part of the university’s 2025 Strategy.
Reporting to the Senior Statistical Consultant and the Director, you will provide statistical consulting services to all UNSW researchers, but especially those in the Medicine & Science faculties. Key responsibilities include statistical consultation
          and collaboration with UNSW researchers, the development and running of regular professional development workshops; offering statistical support during grant writing; outreach to consultants around campus and documenting Stats Central activities.
About the successful applicant: 
You have a PhD in Applied Statistics or related discipline and the ability to work in a statistical consulting role.  Key criteria include:
• Demonstrated experience communicating and collaborating with applied researchers lacking high-level statistical expertise
• Ability to effectively instruct applied researchers on statistical techniques in a short course setting, and develop materials for short courses
• Ability to review research grants and journal articles under supervision
• Proficiency in a range of statistical methodologies and statistical packages
Associate Lecturer (in addition to the core criteria above)
• Demonstrated track record of independent research published in high quality journals and conferences
Lecturer (in addition the core criteria above)
• Experience working in a statistical consulting role
• Demonstrated ability to effectively instruct applied researchers on statistical techniques in a short course setting, and develop materials for short courses
• Experience reviewing research grants and journal articles
• A strong inter-disciplinary publication record including publications in statistical methodology journals
 UNSW Position Description StatsConsultant_29Nov18 (2).pdf
To apply:  If providing statistical support to academics is of interest to you, please submit your CV, Cover Letter and Responses to Selection Criteria.
Contact
Shiree Thomas
Talent Acquisition Consultant
E: shiree.thomas@unsw.edu.au
T: 02 9385 2401
Applications close: 11:00pm, Sunday 3rd February 2019
UNSW aspires to be the exemplar Australian university and employer of choice for people from diverse backgrounds. UNSW aims to ensure equality in recruitment, development, retention and promotion of staff, and that no-one is disadvantaged on the
          basis of their gender, cultural background, disability, sexual orientation or identity. We encourage everyone who meets the selection criteria to apply.
title: Statistical Consultant

templatetext:
Apply your expertise in computer science/software engineering.
Lead strategic and industry research projects to tackle the major challenges in software architecture
Join CSIRO’s Data61, the largest data innovation group in Australia.

In this prestigious position as a Principal Research Scientist you will be part of Data61’s’ Architecture & Analytics Platform team, and tackle the major challenges in software architecture, blockchain and distributed ledger technologies,
          data analytics, computing infrastructure, business process management, and dependability. You will lead individual research efforts and contribute to the acquisition and execution of external projects.  Your role will be to provide scientific
          leadership; to play a lead role in securing project funds; and to develop and pursue research agendas to investigate the use of novel ICT and mathematical systems, methodologies, techniques for the creation of models of real-life phenomena,
          in particular in the field of extended enterprise computing comprising both inter- and intra-enterprise interactions. The modelling is target to the creation of effective and efficient software able to provide conceptually sounds model of the
          domain at hand and able to comply with internal and external constraints.  Your duties will include

Leading research projects, including the negotiation of resource requirements and pursue research to advance the state of the art in the broad fields of software architecture, software engineering and distributed systems.
Producing high quality scientific and/or engineering papers suitable for publication in high quality international conferences and journals.
Working effectively as the leader of a multi-disciplinary research team, to undertake independent scientific investigations and carry out associated tasks and contribute to management of the research group in coordination with other senior researchers.

 
Location: Sydney, NSW or Brisbane, QLD Tenure: Indefinite Salary: $134K - $201K + up to 15.4% Superannuation Reference: 60177  To be successful you will need

A doctorate or equivalent research experience in a relevant discipline area, such as Computer Science / Engineering.
An established research track record, including publications in peer reviewed, top-tier outlets.
Solid technical expertise in some of the following specific research areas.

- Distributed ledgers in general or Blockchain technology in particular, and applications building on those technologies
- Business process management, including process mining, modelling, and execution
- Data analytics platforms
- Software Architecture and Engineering
- Enhancing dependability and security of computer systems.

Demonstrated original contribution to science and/or engineering resulting in a significant influence on a field of research and/or its transfer to industry/community.
Demonstrated ability to lead a research team, and carry out independent individual research, to achieve organisational goals.

For more information please view the Position Description  We’re working hard to recruit diverse people and
          ensure all our people feel supported to do their best work and empowered to let their ideas flourish. Flexible Working Arrangements  We work flexibly at CSIRO, offering a range of options for how, when and where
          you work. Talk to us about how this role could be flexible for you. Balance  About CSIRO  At CSIRO, we solve the greatest
          challenges using innovative science and technology.  We imagine. We collaborate. We innovate.  Apply Online  To apply online, please provide a CV and cover letter outlining your suitability and motivation
          for the role.  Applications Close  28 February 2019

templatetext:
The Opportunity  

Use Your Skills and Make an Impact on Data Innovation Outcomes!
Immerse Yourself in an Inclusive Culture
Join CSIRO's Data61 - Australia's Largest Data Innovation Group


 
CSIRO is seeking to appoint a Research Scientist/Engineer with expertise in navigation, planning and control algorithms for field robots. The types of robots include wheeled, tracked and legged platforms. The position requires someone who is comfortable
          working with real platforms outdoors and obtaining results beyond simulation, as well being familiar with concepts of system integration, combining hardware and software for robust solutions outdoors. This is an exciting opportunity which requires
          a high level of competence in navigation, planning and control. Additionally, you will also require competence in software engineering using ROS/C++.    Your duties will include 

Undertaking innovative, impactful research of strategic importance to CSIRO that will, where possible, lead to novel and important scientific outcomes
Developing and maintaining innovative navigation, planning and control algorithms for field robotics
Working in the field with autonomous large and medium scale robots
Communicating openly, effectively and respectfully with all staff, clients and suppliers in the interests of good business practice, collaboration and enhancement of CSIRO’s reputation
Location: Pullenvale, QLD  Salary: AU$97K - AU$105K plus up to 15.4% superannuation  Tenure: Indefinite  Reference: 59649    To be successful you will need 

Demonstrated knowledge of navigation, planning and control algorithms used in mobile field robotics.
Extensive experience working with navigation, planning and control algorithms for mobile field robotics in outdoor environments, beyond simulation environments.
Knowledge and experience working with the Robot Operating System (ROS).
 For details about who to contact and for more information please view the Position description    Pre-Requisite/Eligibility  A doctorate in a relevant discipline, such as Electrical, Electronic, Mechanical or Control Engineering, Robotics Engineering or Computer Science, plus at least 1 year of relevant
          postdoctoral research experience.    CSIRO’s Commitment to Diversity   We’re working hard to recruit diverse people and ensure all our people feel supported to do their best work and empowered to
          let their ideas flourish.     Flexible Working Arrangements  We work flexibly at CSIRO, offering a range of options for how, when and where you work. Talk to us about how this role could be flexible
          for you. Balance    About CSIRO  At CSIRO you can be part of helping to solve big, complex problems that make
          a real difference to our future. We spark off each other, learn from each other, trust each other and collaborate to achieve more than we could individually in a supportive, rewarding, inclusive and truly flexible environment.
 
 
Who we are  CSIRO’s Data61 business unit is the largest data innovation group in Australia, bringing together approximately 600 research and development staff
          working in digital technologies to create benefit for Australia. Data61 develops Australia's future leaders with its strong 300+ PhD student program in collaboration with our best universities across Australia.    Apply Online  To apply online, please provide a CV and cover letter outlining your suitability and motivation for the role.   Applications Close  Open until filled
title: Research Scientist/Engineer In Field Robotics

title: Perception Engineer

templatetext:
About the Opportunity
FFA has an exciting opportunity for a Fisheries Economist to join their team in Honiara, Solomon Islands, on a 3 year, fixed term contract with possibilities for extension. The responsibilities and benefits for this position
          are dependent on the skills, experience and qualifications of the successful candidate. This will be classed at Band 10 for a candidate with less experience or Band 12 for candidates with more extensive experience and higher qualifications.
Reporting to the Director of Fisheries Development, in this role you will be responsible for conducting economic analysis and collecting the required economic data to be used in bio-economic models.
You will also assist in developing bio-economic models to guide fisheries management and policy at the national, sub-regional and regional levels. 
An important aspect of the role will be using models and other analysis to provide policy-related information to members via written reports and oral presentations at regional and sub-regional meetings as well as national consultations. 
About the Benefits
The Pacific Islands Forum Fisheries Agency (FFA) is offering the successful candidate a competitive salary package circa USD$64,018 (Band 10) - USD$86,131 (Band 12) (dependent on your skills and experience) inclusive of COLDA and location allowances which is TAX-FREE for
          most FFA member countries. 
You will also have access to accommodation assistance and relocation expenses covered, with an establishment grant paid on arrival in Honiara. Annual airfares back to your country of repatriation will be provided,          and a repatriation allowance of 2 weeks’ base salary on return to home-base at the end of your contract. There is also a retention incentive of 21% of your base salary which will be paid on
          the completion of your three-year contract. 
Your superannuation will be paid at 7.5% into either a nominated fund or as an additional cash supplement. FFA reimburses all reasonable medical, dental, and optical expenses for yourself and dependents. Insurance coverage
          is also provided for personal accident, life, medical & repatriation.
Education for dependent children will be reimbursed at 75% of tuition fees (Conditions apply). If your dependent child is educated overseas, paid school travel may be available for you or your child to visit each other once a year. 
On top of all this, you will have access to 6 weeks of annual leave each year, giving you plenty of time to explore this stunning part of the world!
About the Organisation
The Pacific Islands Forum Fisheries Agency (FFA) is an intergovernmental organisation working to strengthen national capacity and regional solidarity so Pacific nations can manage, control, and develop their tuna fisheries now and in
          the future.
Based in Honiara, Solomon Islands, FFA's 17 member nations are Australia, Cook Islands, Federated States of Micronesia, Fiji, Kiribati, Marshall Islands, Nauru, New Zealand, Niue, Palau, Papua New Guinea, Samoa, Solomon Islands, Tokelau,
          Tonga, Tuvalu and Vanuatu.
Since 1979, FFA has facilitated regional cooperation so that all Pacific countries benefit from the sustainable use of tuna - worth over USD $3 billion a year, and important for many people’s livelihoods in the Pacific.
Don't miss this amazing opportunity to live and work in a tropical paradise while making an impact with this key NGO - click 'Apply now'!
title: Fisheries Economist - Pacific Islands Fisheries Forum Agency

templatetext:
The Process Automation Specialist will be working closely with clients and Lean Process Practitioners to support automation improvements to existing business processes and drive initiative. If you are passionate about business transformation an
          automation and want to work in a market leader with emerging technologies, this is the ideal opportunity for you.
What you'll do:

Analyse the current business requirements and identify high impact tasks to automate
Identify opportunities to improve business processes
Design the overall automation solution, including and selection of integration technologies (e.g. Robotic Process Automation, Middleware or BPM technologies) and designs that support scalability, auditability, monitoring, exception management
            and version management.
Define the business case for automation and determine the associated metrics;
Define, and assist the client to establish operating models and team structures to manage the implementation of automation solutions
Define the governance models to continue the on-going extension of the automation platform
Manage the build, test and deploy life cycle.
Draw on team members to embed machine learning and cognitive capabilities into integration workflows and automated processes
Translate solution outcomes in the context of business impacts and benefits.

What we are looking for:

A sound understanding of business process based solutions.
Design and implementation experience with RPA tools such as Automation Anywhere, Blue Prism, UiPath or Open Span
Demonstrated experience with process automation tools such as, IBM BPM, Pega BPM.
Demonstrated experience in systems integration comprising of tools used for real-time application integration e.g. enterprise service bus, and tools more aligned to user interface integration (eg. Automation anywhere).
A detailed understandings of the different integration architectures (eg. point to point, hub and spoke and service oriented architecture).
Sound understanding of the non-functional characteristics of an integrated solution (eg. audit processing, exception handling, security governance, performance management).
Demonstrated experience with a range of real-time and batch integration tools: IBM Message Bus, MuleSoft, Tibco Application Integration, Microsoft SSIS, etc
A vision for how clients can benefit in transitioning from basic process automation to cognitive capabilities embedded in business processes.
A disciplined approach to problem solving and an ability to critically assess a range of information to differentiate true business needs as opposed to user requests.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills


To apply please click apply or call Camille Vachon on +61 2 82893158 for a confidential discussion.
title: Process Automation Specialist

templatetext:
Overview
If you have a passion for finance reporting & SQL and want to be part of an energy company that is dynamic and fast-paced, then this is for you!
Reporting to the Analytics and Data Management Manager, you will provide accurate, timely and relevant business analytics to meet ongoing operational needs across the entire business.
You will support key decision making by building reports with a focus on descriptive, discovery (insights), predictive analytics and data management. Outside of financial reporting will also include sales and marketing, energy services, operations,
          commercial, debt and regulatory and compliance reporting.
Your advanced knowledge in SQL reporting and the retail customer journey will allow you generate reports that will enable the business to innovate and visualise a better way of doing things. You’ll be a switched-on individual with the ability
          to take ownership and deliver on a wide range of projects and outcomes for the business.
Responsibilities:
The key accountabilities critical to this position are:

Perform descriptive, discovery (insights) and predictive analytics across the business based on ad-hoc, project and self-initiated (team based or individual) requirements.
Consult stakeholders to gather all appropriate requirements to complete requests.
Take ownership of analytics jobs and manage to completion.
Development, optimisation and automation of dashboards and scripting (Oracle, SQL Server, Tableau, Python, R, Excel, VBA etc.).
Development, optimisation and automation of data pipelines through to data warehouse.
Commit to constant iterative development in line with identified areas for improvement.
BAU approach to innovation in all tasks
Contribute to, develop and maintain team documentation platform to assist in knowledge sharing capabilities.
Collaborate and assist team members when required.

Skills, Qualifications & Experience
To succeed in this role, you will be team oriented, enjoy continuous improvement and driving for results. You will also have the following skills, qualifications and experience:

Relevant tertiary degree e.g. Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, or Business.
Excellent communications skills (verbal and written)
Experienced in a similar role
Proficient in SQL (Oracle or SQL Server) and ETL principles
Familiarity or knowledge of R or Python Programming Languages and Tableau.
Knowledge of data science industry, terminology and value chain.
Demonstrated ability and understanding of data science (scipy stack, R packages etc., feature engineering etc.).
Established development best practices (documentation, commenting, version control, requirements gathering etc.)
Familiarity or knowledge of Agile Scrum methodology.
Previous Retail Energy, Telco, Utilities or financial sector experience looked upon favourably.
Proven willingness to learn and improve
Advanced trouble-shooting ability
Advanced/Intermediate Excel
Strong problem-solving skills
Collaborative mindset

Based in the CBD of Melbourne, ENGIE provides an excellent long-term career opportunity and a chance to grow and develop!
All applicants must have unlimited working rights to work in Australia.  You must provide at least two referees who are current and previous line managers.
This is a maximum duration contract opportunity for a period of up to June 2020.
Next Steps:
If you are interested, apply with a covering letter and an up-to-date resume via the apply now button.
Applications close 13 February 2019.
Please note we may consider applications on an ongoing basis and therefore encourage you to apply at your earliest opportunity.
title: Reporting Analyst

templatetext:
DATA ENGINEER - AWS & SPARK - CONTRACT SYDNEY CBD
 
A Marketing Analytics Company are looking to add a further Data Engineer to their 5 strong team based in Central Sydney on this exciting and initial 3 month contract.
You will build and maintain data pipelines in Python and Spark, model data in an AWS technologies, and deploy machine learning models to drive their cutting-edge Data Science product and consultancy offerings. The data is a really diverse blend
          of Social Media data, Transactional Data, Financial Services data, and more which should provide interesting challenges operating at scale.
This is a great opportunity to join a well-known business, fun team delivering interesting client led solutions.
 
There is also the opportunity to do more data science focused work further down the line when projects demand it.
 
THE ROLE
 
As a Data Engineer, you will:
 
Development of data pipelines on AWS and Apache Spark.
Design and develop new algorithms for extracting insight from social data using SQL and Python
Develop crawlers to extract data from the web or APIs
Build infrastructure around existing internal tools to enhance capabilities and improve data flow.
Implement statistical models and algorithms including clustering on large scale graph data
Deploy to, work on and manage AWS especially EMR and S3.
 
YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
 
To qualify for this Data Engineering role, you will need one or more of the following:
 
Ideally Python programming skills, although other languages can be considered
SQL and Data Modelling
Experience in Cloud technology (e.g. AWS )
An understanding of distributed computing in Hadoop or Spark
A driven and collaborative approach to work.
Please apply directly via the Apply for this job button. Only suitable candidates matching client criteria will be contacted.
title: APACHE SPARK & AWS ENGINEER

templatetext:
#CLOSER #BRAVER #FASTER
The Role 
IAG's purpose is to make the world a safer place. Our job in Customer Futures is to drive the customer strategy, culture and understanding of the customer experiences that bring this purpose to life.
You will be responsible for bringing a behavioural and social sciences approach to improve our understanding of our customers as well as employing this approach in the development and delivery of customer experience strategies to meet business
          objectives. This role will also involve the exploration of the combined application of behavioural science, data science and computing.
Key Responsibilities: 

Determine and embed a behavioural and social sciences approach (way of working) that meets end-to-end business objectives
Provide information and support to stakeholders in understanding the theory and commercial application of this approach
Lead and apply this evidenced-based approach to the development of Group customer experience strategies as well as the development of customer value propositions, innovation, marketing & communications, go-to-market strategies and business
            growth. This may include:
            
Scoping and identifying opportunities for the application of the approach to inform, improve or positively influence customer decision-making and behaviour
Diagnosing and articulating behavioural issues by analysing qualitative and quantitative secondary data or designing and undertaking primary behavioural research and analysis
Using behavioural insights and findings to inform the design of behavioural interventions or solutions or applying behavioural science principles to guide interventions and solutions 
Applying or assisting with ways to measure and evaluate the effectiveness of these behavioural interventions or solutions using experimental and statistical methods
Prepare briefings, presentations and reports for a range of internal and external stakeholders for the business


Keep up to date with industry trends as well as external research and findings in the field of behavioural and social sciences, behavioural economics and consumer neuroscience as well as trends in the combined application of behavioural science,
            data science and computing.

Skills & Experience

Insatiable curiosity about people - their needs, motivations and behaviour
Tertiary qualification (honours or masters level) in psychology, behavioural economics or sciences, social sciences or equivalent OR;
Qualifications, experience and expertise in the combined application of mathematics, statistics, computing and behavioural science
Mastery in the commercial application of behavioural and social sciences (including behavioural economics)
Strong qualitative, quantitative and experimental design and statistical analysis skills
Leadership, diverse stakeholder engagement and strong influencing skills
Strong project management skills  

About Us 
At IAG, we believe that everyone has a unique point of view to share, shaped by their life experiences, cultures & passions. We celebrate and commit to:
#Proud to be me - we value difference, not sameness
#Together - harnessing our collective wisdom enables us to be our best for our customers & each other
#No boxes - it's not about labels, boxes or categories. It's about building a diverse and inclusive mindset into everything we do
IAG is the largest general insurance group in Australia and New Zealand. We own some of the region's most trusted brands, including NRMA Insurance, CGU, SGIO, SGIC and WFI.
Let's Talk 
Start your career journey with us and click ‘Apply'!
In addition to a diverse and inclusive culture, some of our benefits include 13% superannuation, 50% insurance discounts, flexible work and leave options, generous parental leave and return to work program, recognition and reward program, and
          various corporate partner discounts.
We encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders to apply for this position.
title: Principal, Behavioural and Social Sciences

templatetext:
About our Graduates
Our graduates come from a range of backgrounds with a common link—a passion for innovation and technology, with a drive to succeed. At Capgemini we understand that business value cannot be achieved through technology alone, it starts with people:
          experts working together to get to the heart of individual business objectives and develop the most adapted solutions to fit these requirements. We believe this human-centered approach to technology is what makes the difference to our clients.
About the Role
In this 12 month program you will get to work on client projects whilst participating in industry leading courses on cloud business consulting, agile foundations, project management, software engineering, architecture, UX design, devops, change
          management, business operating models, data science, strategy and transformation. From day one, you will be immersed in a fun, friendly and informative environment that will provide you with the opportunities to set you up for success. In return
          for your hard work and fresh insights, we'll provide you with the ability to accelerate your development, along with the support and guidance you are looking for to allow you to take your career in the direction you choose.
Most importantly about you:
• Passionate about technology, data science, digital services, transformation and innovation • Willing to challenge and be challenged• Creative and innovative in your thinking and approach• Good interpersonal skills to build relationships
          with clients and key stakeholders• Extremely passionate about bringing positive change to organisations• Willing to travel and relocate as required• An interest in working with leading global & local organisations across a broad
          range of industries including financial services, retail & consumer goods, government, energy and utilities. • Graduated with a Bachelor's Degree or above within the past 2 years • An Australian Citizen          or Permanent Residence. 
What we can offer you?
We offer our Graduates a structured 12 month accelerated Graduate program, leading industry certifications, a hands-on approach to your everyday learning and work; the ability to participate in a range of corporate sustainability initiatives;
          a comprehensive learning program facilitated by subject matter experts.
Our Graduate Recruitment Process
Applications close February 8 2019. Shortlisted applicants will undertake an online assessment. Selected candidates will be invited to our Assessment Centre which will be held on 11th February in  Sydney and 12th February in Melbourne.
          Successful hires will then commence full-time employment March 18th (Sydney) or 25th (Melbourne) 2019. Click on the "Apply" button now and discover your future with Capgemini Australia.
About us:
Capgemini is one of the world's foremost providers of consulting, technology, outsourcing services and local professional services. Present in over 40 countries with more than 200,000 people, the Capgemini Group helps its clients transform in
          order to improve their performance and competitive positioning.
Ranked among Ethisphere's 2018 Most Ethical Companies in the World; our seven values are at the heart of everything we do - Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Team Spirit, Freedom, Fun and Modesty.If you believe you have "La Niaque" to go the extra
          mile, then apply by submitting your resume and cover letter.
Want to know more? To learn more about Capgemini and find out about what makes our people unique, log onto our careers page, Linkedin or Facebook. 
Proof of work entitlements and visa status will be required prior or at offer time. Successful applicants will be required to complete a Criminal Record and Reference checks prior to commencement of employment.

templatetext:
Leadership role supporting our Technical and Governance team and the broader Life business
Key role providing quantitative support
Sydney location

 
The Role
The Manager Insights & Solutions is a lead role for supporting our Technical and Governance team and the broader Life business with data mining, reporting and metrics monitoring needs. This is a key role providing quantitative support for
          the development underwriting philosophy and strategy.  
Key Responsibilities

Lead the delivery of integrated reporting and analytics solutions and strategic insights required to support the product, underwriting and pricing team’s reporting and performance management needs
Provide thought leadership in interpretation of data into actionable outcome
Sourcing, analysing and crossing reference data to produce actionable insights and recommendations
Managing the business analytics tools, extracting data and producing management reports as well as deriving insights
Research current and emerging issues to inform the Lifestyle team
Identify and flag risks or heightened exposure
Actively participate in projects and/or key business initiatives e.g. data insights for regulatory responses
Proactively respond to business priorities and needs

Skills & Experience 

University qualified, ideally post graduate study in a relevant discipline (Mathematics, Commerce, Actuarial, Statistics or Data Science)
Life Insurance experience – highly desirable
Advanced data mining skills
Management reporting and Data Analytics within the life insurance space
Expert level MS Excel
SQL skills and database skills
High quality stakeholder and relationship management skills, including communication, presentation and negotiation skills; ability to represent Risk Assessment and the Suncorp brand externally 

Benefits 

Flexible working arrangements i.e. working from home 1 day per week
Up to 25% off insurance, Banking, superannuation
Employee share scheme (permanent employees only)
Continuity of service (MTC roles, contract to permanent)
Employer of choice for gender equality
Study Support, Employee Referral Program ($600), Years of Service Recognition
Discounted home Loan and Personal Loan rates

For additional information about the company click on link below.
https://www.suncorp.com.au/
If this sounds like you, apply online today.

templatetext:
My client is looking for an AWS/Cloud expert to assist in a greenfield migration project for a rapidly changing International SaaS business in Sydney. 
   
 In this permanent position, you will be advising on the best practices for Cloud computing as this company is changing their business structure from the traditional on-site service structure to modernised technologies within the cloud. This
              will best suit the companys ability to innovate and scale as they continue to build out multiple teams in their business including new DevOps, and Data Science teams to derive insights from data to develop and expand their value offering.  
              
   
 As the company is focusing on Cloud, they are looking for AWS/Azure Engineers with a background in Software Development. The company uses NodeJS on the Server side and Angular6 on the Front End but are open to training people from any OO language
              up into these technologies.  
   
 Must have Skills:   

AWS OR Azure 
JavaScript 
Strong experience in one or more of the following languages - NodeJS, C#, Java, Python or Golang

   
 For more information, please contact Toni Dwyer on toni.dwyer@teksystems.com or alternatively please call me on 02 9087 6513 in office hours.
title: Senior Cloud Engineer

templatetext:
Coates Hire is Australia's largest equipment hire company with over 130 years of experience in industry, supplying to a wide variety of markets including Engineering and Building Construction & Maintenance, Mining & Resources, Manufacturing,
          Government, and Events.
As part of the Coates Hire business strategy our Customer Support Centre (CSC) focuses upon providing superior customer service whilst generating new business opportunities across Queensland. Working toward best practice process and development
          of a continuous improvement culture, the information gained from the Business Analyst is critical to the ongoing success of the CSC.
 
Key duties and responsbilites will include: 
 

Analysing service delivery data to identify opportunities for continuous improvement
Combining performance data sets to build a picture of service delivery and outcomes
Combining data from a range of sources to populate dashboards
Working with data custodians to interpret a range of data sources
Identifying trends or patterns in complex data sets using data visualization tools
Analysing current operational data to process map business improvement opportunities
Ensuring IT requirements map to business needs and are approved by stakeholders
Working with Learning and Development to deliver training processes for documentation
Proposal of alternative processes and applications likely to bring quality outcomes
Provision of accurate and reliable reporting as required by management

 
Skills & Expertise:
 
Along with more than 2 years’ experience in a similarly analytical position with a focus on continuous improvement, we anticipate you will bring experience working on data related projects such as business intelligence, data science, data migrations,
          data management. You will have technical knowledge of data models, database design and data mining techniques. And your strong analytical skills will enable you to map processes and interpret large volumes of data.
 
This positon will suit someone wanting to develop further their analytical skills and knowledge in a supportive challenging and ever changing environment. Based in a modern office on the Brisbane City fringe, public transport is nearby.
If you believe this is you, we welcome your application.
title: Business Analyst (Data focus)

templatetext:
You've studied hard and now you want to put your knowledge and skills to the test. Exam results are important, but we know they are only a part of your story. At Finity we offer the career building and professional development opportunities you
        need to create the future you've been aiming for.   Finity Consulting is Australia and New Zealand's largest independent actuarial and analytical consultancies and a leader in the development of data-driven insights.  We
        work with both large and niche insurers, as well as government agencies, using best practice analytics and cutting-edge techniques to deliver world -class actuarial and consulting advice. We work within both traditional and non- traditional areas
        of Actuarial consulting.  Being a Graduate/Analyst at Finity Our graduates and analysts quickly develop technical expertise and gain confidence working alongside industry leaders. Our team structure allows you
        to work across a diverse range of clients and projects.  Our onsite experts take the time to share their knowledge and insights to help you develop your skills and expertise, and you are rewarded every step of the way with market leading
        remuneration and bonus structures.    Sound good to you? Here's what we're looking for:• 1 - 2 years experience in a similar role OR in the final year/semester of your Statistics, Data Science or related
        degree • Experience with programming languages such as R, Python and/or SAS • Strong technical ability  • Strong academic results • Innovative thinking • Confidence in communicating with colleagues and clients•
        Self-starter who has a passion to learn • Someone who enjoys rewarding professional challenges • A well-rounded individual with interests outside of studies • An inquiring mind    To apply: submit your cover letter, resume and latest academic transcript below.https://www.finity.com.au/careers
title: Statistics Graduate/Analyst

templatetext:
About Coles:
GJ Coles opened the first Coles store 104 years ago in Collingwood with a simple purpose: To give customers the best value, products and service. Our vision is to make life easier for Australians by delivering quality, value and service to the
          21 million customers who shop with us each week.
About Digital:
The Digital Technology Team is focussed on enabling the business to operate at its peak and respond with agility to an ever-changing environment allowing us to better serve our customers. To achieve this, the team continuously assesses how the
          business can benefit from applying the latest technologies available or how to use established technologies in innovative ways.
The team supports over 2,500 retail stores and 115,000 team members. We are a unique group comprised of specialists across engineering, infrastructure, data science & analytics, solution design, human centred design, development and project/program
          management (among many others).  
About the Team:
The Fintec team is responsible for the Technology payments solutions and services supporting Coles and Wesfarmers retail brands. They are an innovative and forward thinking group looking to focus on core products, continue to build digital capability
          and transform for the future. 
The role
As the Senior Functional Analyst, you will undertake a leadership role in mentoring less experienced analysts and, promote and support the IT methodologies and tools.

develop functional requirements, business process improvements, process mapping and design
provide input to the testing strategy and plans that support the business process. Undertake testing as required
utilise process mapping, design and re-engineering tools
facilitate workshops sessions
identify and assess alternative process solutions that optimise the use of software application solutions
collaborate with Product Managers & Business Analysts
strong operational experience, 24 x 7 rostered support

To be successful, you’ll have:

at least 3 years’ experience as a functional analyst having
prior experience of working with Payment Switch and Settlement Systems, Payment System Testing (Tools like FINSIM etc), Payment Compliance (Scheme Mandates & Compliance)
strong functional knowledge of the relevant core packages, Postilion,  would be an advantage and to provide functional designs from a package perspective
gathering and documenting functional requirements
strong written & verbal communication skills
utilised process mapping tools to map processes and identify process improvement
facilitation and Microsoft SQL Skills
previously developed business cases and managed small projects
excellent analytical and problem solving skills

Culture
Coles is a fast-paced, constantly changing business that focuses your talents and challenges you to perform at your best.
As a team, we’re bold with ideas and operate with pace and passion, always looking for better ways to transform retail and delight customers.
Benefits 
Not only will you receive a competitive salary, you’ll also have access to these great benefits:

a 5% discount when shopping at Coles, Kmart, Officeworks and Target
learn new skills and develop your existing capabilities - we provide excellent ongoing training and development
12 weeks of paid parental leave for primary care givers and 1 week of paid leave for secondary care givers
no need to pay for car parking - you can park your car in our multi-level car park, which is exclusive to our team
get fitter, stronger and faster at our on-site gym

Please Note 
We prefer to deal with you directly and have not engaged an agency for this role, so if you’re interested, please apply. 
At Coles, we aim to ensure our team represents the community we serve, embracing the richness of Australia's diverse population.
title: Senior Functional Analyst – Payments

templatetext:
About Us Have you imagined a world free of disease? At The iQ Group
        Global, that’s all we think about. We provide a turnkey solution for life sciences companies, spanning from corporate advisory and investment banking, through to research, development, commercialisation and sales. The iQ Group Global facilitates
        an end-to-end solution along the drug lifecycle creating the medicines of tomorrow.  About the role The Digital Analyst (performance marketing manager) will generate leads and deliver acquisition via digital platforms
        (i.e. paid and organic search, social media, display, retargeting, content and website optimisation). This is an end-to-end role that leads the planning, execution and optimization of our digital performance and helps steer the global marketing
        and communications strategy.    About you The successful candidate will have an entrepreneurial attitude and a strong analytical and technical skillset. They will be results driven, highly inquisitive and
        understand the nuances and rationale of marketing. They have had experience working in relevant roles  (i.e. Performance Marketing Manager/Specialist,  Digital Analyst and/ Digital Marketing Specialist) and solid experience in designing
        and optimising lead generation campaigns.    Essential Experience

Experience working in relevant roles (i.e. Performance Marketing Manager/ Specialist,  Digital Analyst, Digital Marketing Manager/Specialist).
Extensive experience designing and optimising lead generation campaigns (B2B and/ B2C).
Advanced knowledge of Facebook advertising, Google campaign management tools (Google Ads and/or Google Marketing Platform) and web analytics (Google Analytics 360).
CRO/AB testing.
Display media/programmatic and retargeting experience.
Data illustration (i.e. building dashboards and presenting insights in a simple and meaningful way).
Experience presenting data and providing recommendations to different stakeholders.
  Qualifications 

Marketing
Data Science

title: Digital Analyst

templatetext:
The focus on technology across all of the Australian economy means that there has never been a more exciting time to be part of Australia’s innovation community. EY’s Research & Development (Tax) team contributes by assisting companies to access
        tax incentives, government grants and export incentives.  The national team consists of programmers, engineers, scientists, lawyers and accountants who have a genuine interest in technology, innovation and growth.  Does this sound like
        you? The opportunityEY’s Research & Development (Tax) team wishes to hire a number of talented individuals to engage with Australia’s innovation community and support our clients in accessing tax incentives
        for R&D, as well as other government incentives. In this unique role, you will have the opportunity to use your technical expertise and specialist knowledge to support clients on their innovation journey.  Your key responsibilities Drawing
        on your technical knowledge gained in a similar R&D Tax role, you will advise and support clients in accessing government grants and incentives to support their R&D and innovation processes. You will engage with technology-active
        companies to understand their development objectives and drivers, analysing complex project information to assess eligibility for government support. Working in high performing teams, you will build strong relationships prepare detailed work papers
        and reports to help deliver exceptional results to EY’s clients.  Skills and attributes for success

Genuine interest in innovation and technology
Strong written and verbal communication skills, relationship building and articulating complex information to clients will be key
Ability to work with complex and detailed information, including problem solving and numerical skills
Interested in networking to build enduring trusted relationships with EY colleagues and clients
Ability to liaise with all stakeholders, including EY clients, in a confident and professional manner
 To qualify for the role you must have

Undergraduate and/or postgraduate qualifications in at least one of the following:
            
Information Technology - including computer science, software engineering, data analytics, science communication
Engineering - including mechatronic, robotics, electrical, mechanical 
Science and Mathematics - including chemistry, physics, geosciences, mathematics, biotechnology, environmental science, biology


You may also have a background in commerce or law- double degree applicants with a technical background are not required but will be looked at positively
Previous work experience in industry, ideally working in a sales and/or customer-facing context 
Interest/experience in writing technical reports 
Strong business acumen with proven time management skills
A proactive approach and good communicator
 Ideally, you’ll also have

Previous experience in a R&D Tax or Government Incentives position
An interest in innovation and entrepreneurship, and the role that technology innovation can play in creating a better working world
Drive to provide excellent service to clients and build a better working world
 What we look for We’re interested in leaders with a genuine creative vision and the confidence to make it happen. You can expect plenty of autonomy in this role, so you’ll also need the ability to take initiative
        and seek out opportunities to improve our current relationships and processes.  If you’re serious about innovation, R&D and new technology and ready to take on some of our clients’ most complex issues, this role is for you.    What working at EY offers You
        would be working with the largest tax professional services in Perth, and you will gain invaluable experience working with some of the largest Australian and globally headquartered businesses in the market.   We
        offer a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and the value you bring. Our Total Rewards package includes support for flexible working, career development, and an extensive range of wellbeing and benefit
        offerings. We are happy to consider formal and informal flexible working arrangement.  To find out how some of our people are using these arrangements to help them achieve a lifestyle balance, please click here.  Who we areEY
        is an inclusive and equal opportunity employer offering a vast range of internal networks including Unity, our LGBTI network and our Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander network.  These provide our people with the opportunity to connect
        across offices and allow us all to embrace and value the diverse society we live within.  We are committed to making reasonable adjustments to provide a positive, barrier-free recruitment process and supportive work environment. If you have
        any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application.  About EYAs a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we’re using the finance products,
        knowledge and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join, however long you stay, the
        exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.   Make your mark.   Apply now.  The preferred applicant will be subject to employment
        screening by EY or by their external third party provider. © 2018 Ernst & Young Australia. All Rights Reserved. Liability limited by a scheme approved under Professional Standards Legislation.

title: Business Analyst

templatetext:
An opportunity has now arisen for the right person to join our awesome team. We're on the lookout for a customer-centric Digital Marketing Lead who has a thirst for knowledge, the ability to lead a team to create data led 
            best in class digital customer journeys and proactively maintain and grow the digital marketing engine at Liberty.
About the Role: This role will lead and support Digital Marketing for the Group, reporting into the General Manager- Marketing & Communications. The key focus of this role is to work collaboratively with the General
            Manager – Marketing & Communications and the General Manager - Data Science to determine Liberty’s overall strategy, management, measurement and optimisation of our digital marketing channels.

You will contribute to the successful execution of all paid traffic acquisition activities, such as search engine advertising, social ads, programmatic, retargeting, etc. through Google, Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, YouTube, Twitter and
              other leading platforms.
Keep up to date with emerging trends and propose innovations to implement in the business
Support a marketing team that has testing and data at the heart of it; be a great mentor and teacher for your team, facilitate ongoing self-learning
Help identify new sources of customer acquisition through emerging platforms, partners, strategies and channels
Help define and drive our marketing targeting & segmentation strategy, identifying opportunities to differentially engage with key segments of our audience across paid and CRM (site, emails, inbound)
Provide strategic support for our broader marketing team to build engaging lifecycle marketing campaigns that drive high-value behaviours, help reduce churn and increase lifetime value
Partner with the broader marketing team to ensure connectivity and cohesiveness between organic / brand marketing and digital performance marketing efforts
Support the development of marketing analytics to capture the impact of organic / brand activities on overall marketing funnel
Build and deliver on monthly/annual budgets and forecasts
Support accurate attribution across media channels and assist the business in understanding channel attribution, performance forecasting and media/promotion selection
In partnership with the broader marketing team, ensure our marketing campaigns have effective landing experiences and optimise our full conversion funnel
Work with the Liberty’s Data Science team to: 
              
leverage Liberty’s unique data to create innovative, custom analyses and tools to address business challenges
extract, organise and synthesise data analysis from multiple systems and sources to uncover leanings and trends that provide value to the organisation and brand
monitor and maintain data quality, accuracy and integrity of marketing and analytics databases
create and maintain metrics reports on marketing and sales activities, effectiveness, and business impact
research and evaluate current macro- and micro-economic conditions in the media and advertising industry that may impact support of the organization’s campaigns



Qualifications and Experience:To really get us excited you should have:

Min. Bachelor degree in Marketing, Digital Marketing or relevant discipline
5+ years of experience supporting a high-performance marketing team
Experience across performance marketing channels such as: Paid Social, Paid Search, Display, Affiliate, TV and OOH
Proven track record of managing SEO, conducting A/B testing, landing page optimisation and a range of other related skills
Deep understanding of how marketing channels complement one another to run effective cross-channel marketing campaigns that drive the highest efficiencies
Understand the importance of brand at all levels of the marketing funnel
Highly analytical, metrics-driven, with ability to turn empirical data into insightful, strategic decisions and tactical team plans
Power user of Google Analytics and/or HEAP; SQL and BI/data visualization tool experience a plus
Strong experience supporting teams against performance-based media objectives and executing marketing campaigns that are part of multi-channel marketing strategy that crosses teams and organizations
Experience working effectively with creative, social and content teams by delivering clear strategic briefs and insights; ability to work effectively with both creative and analytical team members
Ability to multi-task, handle pressure and meet deadlines in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment without a lot of direction or oversight
Optimistic, open-minded, curious, and highly motivated to make an impact
Exposure to analytical studies from: crafting the methodology, mining/analysing data, and ultimately delivering final insightful recommendations
CRM knowledge and expertise for sales and marketing business process, data availability and analytic opportunities
Ability to communicate findings clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences

Who Are We?Established over 20 years ago, we were pioneers in specialty finance, offering flexible monetary solutions previously not available from other financial institutions. Fast-forward to today and Liberty has evolved
            into a progressive and people centric FinTech company. We pride ourselves on providing an exciting, stable and rewarding work environment for the right people.
Why Liberty?We offer a collaborative, sociable, conscientious and dedicated culture, a dynamic work environment with ongoing support and training. What's more, we are dedicated to developing our staff to provide a rewarding
            career. Some of our awesome perks:

Daily fruit, snacks and afternoon tea
Yoga classes
Monthly events
Onsite school holiday program
Staff massages
Health and well-being subsidy
A well-rounded employee assistance program

www.liberty.com.au | www.libfin.co.nz
Liberty Financial is an Equal Opportunity Employer, making employment decisions without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class.
To email your application please click the "Apply Now" button below.
title: Digital Marketing Lead

templatetext:
Nature Research is publisher of the esteemed science journal Nature.  We are seeking a Senior Editor/Editor to commission, produce, write and edit content related to scientific research performance and metrics for Nature Index print supplements
          and online at Natureindex.com.
The Nature Index covers research in a unique way – with an emphasis on quantifying the impact of scientific investigation. Many of the stories are based on Nature’s proprietary database that tracks the publication of papers across
          a broad range of scientific disciplines all over the world.  Nature Index provides a close to real-time indicator of high-quality research output and collaboration at the institutional, national and regional levels.
The Role
This is a full-time, seven month fixed term position (parental leave replacement) commencing in April 2019 and based at Nature’s Sydney office. The Senior Editor/Editor will:

Collaborate with data, design, production, web, editorial and other colleagues in the development of print and online stories about scientific research performance, metrics and publishing to deadline under the guidance of the Chief Editor.
Edit, co-ordinate and oversee production of Nature Index print supplements to deadline
Liaise closely with Nature Index data team and external data providers to develop ideas for data stories and visualisations 
Write and produce news and feature stories including data stories and visualisations for publication
Promote Nature Index content on social media and with key editorial colleagues inside the company to engage a wide readership
Supervise Nature Index editorial assistant in consultation with Chief Editor 

The ideal candidate will have:

Strong, demonstrated experience (minimum five years) writing, editing and producing print and online journalism, preferably with science and/or data focus, or equivalent.
Bachelor’s degree in science or journalism or equivalent.
Excellent language and communication skills
A demonstrated ability to edit stories about science so that they are understandable by readers who are not specialists in the subject matter
Strong interest in developing ways to present information visually both in print and online
Ability to work both unsupervised and collegially with staff, freelance writers, designers and proof-readers
Ability to prioritise own workload effectively to meet deadlines and quality requirements (high attention to detail and accuracy)
Computer skills, especially Word, Excel, and digital visualisation software applications

If you think you have the skills and motivation for success, please apply now with your CV and a covering letter explaining your interest and relevant experience.  Please also include two recent examples of your work as a science journalist.
title: Editor or Senior Editor

templatetext:
JOB REF:DEC336855

A unique opportunity to work in a people oriented role whilst applying your data science and/or agricultural knowledge
Join a company passionate about innovation and improving the productivity of agriculture for our customers
Permanent / Full or Part Time / Perth based - flexible working arrangements available

Wesfarmers Chemicals, Energy & Fertilisers (WesCEF) operates businesses that service a range of sectors in both domestic and international markets. We recognise that our people are central to our success; after all they have helped drive our
          businesses to become well-recognised industry leaders for over 100 years. We are a talented and engaged group of people who strive to support our innovative and sustainable businesses through diversity of thinking, skills and experiences.
Part of WesCEF, Decipher is an evolving agriculture technology (Ag Tech) business offering a suite of easy-to-use, integrated agriculture technology
          solutions to help farmers and ag service providers manage nutrition.
About this opportunity
Do you enjoy engaging with people and sharing your knowledge about data and technology? Do you find it rewarding to have a role that actually impacts the ongoing success of your customers and the business? In this role, you can tick ‘YES’ to
            both – it is a position that offers true value to our customers and to our business.
As a Technical Support Specialist for an innovative and evolving technology in the agricultural industry, and with dedicated, ongoing training, some of your key responsibilities will include:

Managing the onboarding of data from new and existing customers, providing education on the capabilities of our product and how it can meet customer needs.
Supporting our customers/retailers over the telephone, online and in person to resolve technical issues that may arise such as with machine and sensor data.
Engaging external stakeholders and promoting our products including attending field days and industry events.
Providing insight and support to our technical development team to continuously improve our technology and products.
Playing an important role in future projects and development, and the Decipher innovation process.

About you

An interest in agriculture and a passion for new technologies.
The ability to connect with people and build collaborative relationships with people from all walks of life.
Planning and organisational skills – complemented by a strong attention to detail.
Experience in providing customer support in a technology/data environment.
Exposure to and awareness of data management and various data formats.
A tertiary degree in spatial or data science, agriculture science or agricultural business management.
Although not essential, knowledge of precision agriculture software packages such as SMS, MyJohnDeere or Topcon will be helpful.
Prioritise your safety, and the safety of others in all practices.

We welcome people with different skills, and life experiences and encourage individuals from diverse backgrounds to apply.
We pride ourselves on developing and supporting people and recognise the importance of flexibility. When you apply, please let us know if you are seeking a flexible employment arrangement.
Applications close 5pm, Monday 4 February 2019.

templatetext:
About Woodside:  As a diverse and expanding organisation we have many divisions that support our business. You will find development and career opportunities, you’ll be valued, recognised, challenged and rewarded. What’s
          more, as a WA-based company, executive and leadership decisions are made right where you work.  Explore your Woodside at woodside.com.au/careers  About the Role:  At Woodside we aspire to have digitisation
          embedded in everything we do. When you join Digital at Woodside you will work with teams pioneering new technologies and the application of cloud, data science, artificial intelligence and cognitive computing. Our success is determined by the
          pioneering spirit of our people, who live our values every day: respect, discipline, working sustainably, working together, integrity and excellence.  We are looking for people with proven technology experience who approach their work
          with passion and will collaborate extensively to help us realise our Digital Strategy.  The Creative Experience Team Lead provides innovative guidance through the solution design process from user research and ideation to journey maps,
          wireframes, interaction and interface design. Managing a small team, this role will strategically drive a change in software development across the business, ensuring user experience is at the front of the solution design.  This role
          is for a 2 year fixed term contract based at our head office in Perth, Western Australia.  Duties & Responsibilities:

Plan, organise and monitor application design including ideation, prototypes and interaction design
Work in partnership with the Software and Integration Manager and application developers to ensure solution design aspects are consistent with Digital technology vision and roadmap
Work in partnership with the business led Strategic Technology Managers to ideate, explore and adopt a design first approach to solution design with the organisation
Work in partnership with the Digital Technology Portfolio lead to ensure all delivery activities consider integration into Woodside’s cognitive adviser
Architect the user experience of Woodside’s cognitive adviser program
Promote reusable, sustainable approaches to solution design
Develop and review design scopes of work for outsourced engagements, ensuring solutions delivered meet Woodside Engineering Standards
Skills & Experience:

Extensive experience in senior design/creative roles (including agency environments)
Demonstrated experience in software solution design including; User Experience and User Interface
Previous experience in graphic design, solution design for cognitive systems and Artificial Intelligence interfaces
Demonstrate a good understanding of humanistic behaviour with respect to systems and design thinking practices and tools
Recognition & Reward:  A career with Woodside is rewarding both personally and professionally. We offer:

Flexible work arrangements, including part time and job share opportunities
Career development through professional development programs and by working alongside industry leaders
Possibility of educational assistance to support your career development
Opportunities to undertake interesting work on world-class projects
A values driven environment where working together is key
The opportunity to participate in voluntary initiatives in the community
Financial rewards that are linked to performance through an annual bonus
Above industry superannuation contributions
Industry leading 16-weeks paid parental leave
Flexibility of leave provisions for events such as community service, cultural and volunteer activities (one day per annum)
Subsidised gym membership in some locations
