title: Creative Experience Team Lead

templatetext:
The role
As a Statistical scientist and Data specialist, you will initiate and design the practical data collection and customer segmentation strategies aligned with the best practices that needs to be followed.
This position reports to the Project Lead under the Faculty of Business and Law that employs over 450 staff across three campuses and also operates a shared centralised administrative structure. This role requires an experienced Data Specialist
          with sound knowledge working on the statistical data and involve in maintaining high standard of data record keeping.
Based at the Burwood location, you will be working on this key project on a part-time fixed term contract until August 2019.
To be successful, you’ll have:

tertiary qualifications in any relevant advanced quantitative disciplines
demonstrated an ability in undertaking the advanced quantitative research studies and experience working with the large data sets, research analysis and relational databases
ability to design and analyse longitudinal panel surveys, behavioural data analysis and communicating results
demonstrated experience in running the research projects through to completion with minimal support and guidance
excellent organisational, analytical, computational and communication skills
ability to maintain a high standard of data record keeping and maintain effective relationship with the key stakeholders

Your key responsibilities will be to:

design practical data collection and prepare reports and coordinate communication and execution of project deliverables to research client
execute, support, inform and influence research projects and compile any data and documents required
interact closely with the team members and relevant internal and external stakeholders to ensure that all deliverable are executed on time and to high quality standards
undertake research and analysis to identify project requirements, best practice approaches, issues and risks
deliver clear insights and recommendations as and when required

Culture 
Deakin University is proud to be recognised as an organisation that offers a friendly, supportive and challenging working environment. Our staff are committed to making a genuine difference to people’s lives through excellence in education and
          research.
We acknowledge the importance of providing a dynamic and diverse working environment and offer variety in day-to-day roles as well as professional development opportunities to assist staff to grow and progress their careers.
Deakin University staff have the opportunity to interact with colleagues from a diverse range of cultures and professional backgrounds, all of whom share a common interest in lifelong learning.
Benefits 
We value our staff and understand that they are more than just their jobs, that's why we offer benefits that enhance work life. Some of Deakin’s workplace benefits include:

17% superannuation
flexible work arrangements
discounts with third party suppliers for health insurance, car rentals IT and more

About us 
The flexible learning options we provide our students and our diverse team of professionals and academic experts has enabled us to achieve a 5-star rating by the prestigious university ranking organisation Quacquarelli Symonds. For eight consecutive
          years, we've achieved the highest level of overall student satisfaction among Victorian universities.
We have a network of campuses, learning centres and research centres across Victoria and corporate offices in Melbourne, China, Indonesia, India and Sri Lanka.  Our online Cloud campus provides more than 13,000 students with access to state-of-the-art
          digital tools and direct access to world-renowned academics.
As a Victorian university with a global impact, Deakin is translating its research into commercial outcomes that will help drive innovation for Australia’s economy.
At Deakin we value diversity, embrace difference and nurture a connected, safe and respectful community. Deakin is an Employer of choice for Gender Equality, a proud member of the SAGE Athena SWAN program seeking gender equity for Women in STEMM, and a bronze award holder in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTI inclusion.  We strongly encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and people of all cultures, abilities, sex and genders.

            to match your skills and personality to a role that you will enjoy and thrive in.  About the company  We are currently recruiting for one of Australia’s leading telecommunications providers in their Talent
            Acquisition teams. This organisation is widely known and has a large presence in the market. They have a wonderful team with supportive and caring managers who will help you to flourish in the role.  About the role  As a Recruitment Sourcing Partner, you will be assisting with the sourcing process for those trickier to fill roles and developing strategies to attract passive and active candidates. We are looking for someone with a true passion for
            IT and recruitment, who can creatively think of strategies and bring forward ideas that will attract hard to reach candidates in the market. You will be recruiting for candidates in the area that you are most excited by across digital, infrastructure,

title: Recruitment Sourcing Partner

templatetext:
Excellent opportunity to work for a global mining organisation
Opportunity to work with the dynamic Growth and Innovation team
Brisbane CBD location

About the role
We are looking for a Senior Advisor Operational Systems to support the ongoing development, implementation and embedding of functions enabled by Operational Systems (OS). This includes the support of the existing Mine
          Monitoring & Control Global Operating Model and integrating new functions as they are required.
This role is a great opportunity for an enthusiastic individual who can work under pressure while keeping in mind Rio Tinto's core values. Reporting to the Principal Operational Systems, you will be:

Developing & maintaining expertise in the Operational Systems solutions including fleet management, machine guidance systems, asset health fatigue management and vehicle interaction solutions, etc.
Working across time zones and regions with mine sites to implement the Global Operating Model including assisting in development of the business cases, capital approvals and operational improvement projects.
Undertaking best practice assessments using workshops, interviews and data collection techniques to identify improvement opportunities.
Facilitate the MM&C Community of Practice.

About you
To be successfully considered for this role, you will have:

Extensive knowledge (theoretical and applied) of Monitoring and Control systems
Demonstrated experience with mining operations involving production, planning, reliability, maintenance, processing or other support type role.
A proven track record of effective engagement with client groups including understanding needs and delivery of value adding solutions.
Strong data acquisition and analytical skills on business and organisational challenges.
Track record of generating practical and innovative solutions to multi-faceted technical and/or operational problems.

It will also be beneficial if you have:

Degree / Post Graduate qualification in engineering, mining or data analysis related fields
Portfolio of proven Operational Productivity Improvements
Statistics and Data Science Experience

Where you will be working
The Growth & Innovation group operates through the entire life cycle of Rio Tinto’s mines and assets, creating value through exploration, project development and technical excellence. Working in close partnership with all product groups, it
          focuses on finding safer, smarter and more efficient ways to manage resources and operations. 
About us
As pioneers in mining and metals, we produce materials essential to human progress.
Our long history is filled with firsts. We’ve developed some of the world’s largest and best quality mines and operations, and our people work in around 35 countries across six continents. Aluminium and copper, diamonds, gold and industrial minerals,
          iron ore, coal and uranium: our materials make up the world around us. You’ll find them in smartphones, planes, cars, hospitals and throughout your home. 
Creating an inclusive and diverse workforce
We are a diverse team of talented, enthusiastic individuals who foster a culture of inclusion. No matter how they may differ, our people share one thing in common. It’s a belief that work is more rewarding when we are accepted and valued for our
          differences, not judged by them. We all have something to contribute, and it’s this contribution that makes for a great organization and fulfilling career.
Apply today if you want to work with the latest technology and innovation, in an environment where we challenge you to drive positive change.  Please note, in order to be successfully considered for this role you must
          complete all pre-screening questions.
title: Senior Advisor Operational Systems

templatetext:
See yourself in our team
Group Treasury is responsible for the Groups funding and liquidity management, capital forecasting and execution, and asset and liability management. Group Treasury works closely with the business units across a number of areas providing strategic
          assistance and advice to support the decision-making processes of the Asset & Liability Committee (ALCO), Executive Committee and the Board.
Do work that matters 
As part of the treasury business management team, you will

Proactively contribute to treasury projects & productivity initiatives through process improvement and automation.
Provide effective, efficient and reliable business management support.
Coordinate the requirements and implementation of small and large scale initiatives.
Analyse and coordinate Line 1 Risk operational and compliance oversight for Group Treasury.
Contribute to the enhancement & assurance of the treasury operational risk & compliance frameworks.

We’re interested in hearing from people who have

Considerable experience working as a Data Analyst.
A data architecture focused mindset, with a strong emphasis on process improvement and advanced SQL/VBA experience.
The ability to proactively collaborate with key stakeholders of the business, including but not limited to Global Markets, Financial Market Operations, IT and Risk for consistency & synergies.
A genuine interest in the banking industry and operational risk, with a willingness to learn.
Relevant qualifications in computer science, data science, engineering, maths/science or actuarial science.

The people, businesses and communities we serve are wonderfully diverse. To reflect this, we're committed to hiring a similarly diverse workforce. With a focus on inclusion, accessibility and flexibility, we'll support you at every stage of your career.

The ability to proactively collaborate with key stakeholders of the business, including but not limited to Global Markets, Financial Market Operations, IT and Risk for consistency & synergies.
A genuine interest in the banking industry and operational risk, with a willingness to learn.
Relevant qualifications in computer science, data science, engineering, maths/science or actuarial science.

The people, businesses and communities we serve are wonderfully diverse. To reflect this, we're committed to hiring a similarly diverse workforce. With a focus on inclusion, accessibility and flexibility, we'll support you at every stage of your career.
title: Manager, Treasury Business Management (Analytics)

templatetext:
See yourself in our team
Group Treasury is responsible for the Groups funding and liquidity management, capital forecasting and execution, and asset and liability management. Group Treasury works closely with the business units across a number of areas providing strategic
          assistance and advice to support the decision-making processes of the Asset & Liability Committee (ALCO), Executive Committee and the Board.
Do work that matters 
As part of the treasury business management team, you will

Proactively contribute to treasury projects & productivity initiatives through process improvement and automation.
Provide effective, efficient and reliable business management support.
Coordinate the requirements and implementation of small and large scale initiatives.
Analyse and coordinate Line 1 Risk operational and compliance oversight for Group Treasury.
Contribute to the enhancement & assurance of the treasury operational risk & compliance frameworks.

We’re interested in hearing from people who have

Considerable experience working as a Data Analyst.
A data architecture focused mindset, with a strong emphasis on process improvement and advanced SQL/VBA experience.
The ability to proactively collaborate with key stakeholders of the business, including but not limited to Global Markets, Financial Market Operations, IT and Risk for consistency & synergies.
A genuine interest in the banking industry and operational risk, with a willingness to learn.
Relevant qualifications in computer science, data science, engineering, maths/science or actuarial science.

The people, businesses and communities we serve are wonderfully diverse. To reflect this, we're committed to hiring a similarly diverse workforce. With a focus on inclusion, accessibility and flexibility, we'll support you at every stage of your career.
title: Manager, Treasury Business Management (Analytics)

templatetext:
Want to join one of Australia's largest and most forward-thinking Data, Tech and Analytics agencies? 
We are Annalect. We're a part of global marketing company OMG (Omnicom Media Group), and we're looking for a Tagging Executive join our team. We use data, analytics and technology to drive digital strategy and achieve outstanding
          results for our rapidly expanding clients.
This is a great opportunity to work on market-leading brands and develop your career! 
Why you'll love us
Through our people philosophy "Because I am, we are", we believe that happy people with a great work/life balance are able to bring the #WOW factor to work. They're also much more fun to share an office with. Join us and surround yourself
          with like-minded, high achieving individuals.
Together, we can change the way digital works.  
We can offer:

Unbeatable career development opportunities and mentoring
Flexible working arrangements centred on work / life balance
State of the art tools - we have a dedicated internal tools team
A social culture with a well-being focus - yoga, nutrition, meditation + more

Why we'll love you
You have a passion for Data, Tech and Analytics and you're ready to make a real impact. As the Executive, you will play a critical role in the day to day execution of a world class Analytics product, which may include working across various measurement
          and analytics technologies with a focus on making clients media and customer journeys efficient and effective.
The role will include close collaboration with SEO, CRO, Content, Programmatic and Paid Search divisions within the wider agency group and working day to day with Annalect's specialist BI, Technology and Data Science teams.  Specifically,
          the role may include collecting & processing data into value adding reports, recommending strategies for media and user journey optimization, technical implementation of measurement solutions, dashboard development, analytics platform configuration
          across Adobe and Google Analytics 360 and supporting advanced media pixel implementation.
You will continuously seek and explore innovative ways to improve internal processes, client services and client delivery. You will be the expert of your focus area and will drive the growth of this area within Annalect's offering.
Here's what you'll need

In an ideal world, you will have 12 months experience in a similar role
Experience working inside a Digital Agency would be to your advantage.
Strong understanding of Tag Management experience (DTM, Ensighten, SuperTag, etc)
Understanding of javascript, data layer and tagging approaches across digital assets
Understanding of analytics solutions (e.g. Adobe Analytics or Google analytics) including coding and implementation experience.

 
Why our love will last
Not just anyone can fill this role. We want someone who can take it and make it their own. To do this, we want to see you:

Develop your technical knowledge through self-learning, on-the-job shadowing, & making the most of company training opportunities
All outputs are of the highest quality. You have excellent attention to detail.  Your work requires little to no checking by others
Deliverables are completed in a timely manner and deadlines met
Build strong relationships with your immediate team and the wider Group
Excellent communication skills - being able to both interpret and convey information in a clear, concise way.  Communication is equally effective over all platforms and situations e.g. location, culture, written, and verbal.
You are aware of your own strengths & developmental areas; learning to manage weakness and utilise strengths. You understand how your own behaviours, attitudes, beliefs and actions impact others.

templatetext:
Join a global Fortune 500 Organisation based in Melbourne
Work across multiple disciplines with exposure to world-class projects
AECOM offer flexible work options including flexible start & finish times

The Role
Make Amazing Happen!
An outstanding opportunity to join a Global Leader awaits a passionate and goal oriented Graduate. We are seeking enthusiastic, customer focused graduates who have a passion for learning. You will gain hands-on experience in working for a leading
          Professional Services company. You will have the opportunity to build relationships with our technical experts and begin to develop knowledge about our business and the industry.You will work alongside graduates and industry leaders
          on projects that help shape and connect our cities and communities.
We are seeking a Graduate to join our Analytics team based in Melbourne. This is a specialist technical role in the field of Infrastructure Advisory services. In this role you will have the opportunity to contribute to the delivery of high-profile
          transport infrastructure projects for a broad range of government and private sector clients, as well as supporting senior staff in the development of opportunities (business development, marketing and networking) and preparation of bids. We
          are looking for an agile individual who loves problem solving and has an excellent approach to client/customer service.
Job Responsibilities:

Assist the team and project managers with data and analytics work, and develop good working relationships with clients during the delivery of projects
Perform data collection, cleaning and analysis for a variety of projects and assist with model development and visualisation of results
Ensure that information management and quality assurance procedures are followed for compliance with AECOM standards and procedures
Acquire and maintain knowledge of best industry practice and continuously work on self-development to ensure the team has the most up to date knowledge and skills
Develop good relations with your team and other teams across multiple business areas and locations
Undertake internal training and work towards accreditation relevant to your profession.

About You

Tertiary qualification in Mathematics, Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering or other relevant degree
0-2 years' experience
Proficient with Microsoft Office suite including Word, Excel and Power Point
Knowledge of programming languages, preferably a coding or scripting language such as Python or R
Some knowledge and experience of modelling and visualisation tools; Tableau or PowerBI would be advantageous
Knowledge of simulation and analytics software such as AnyLogic, Simul8, ExtendSim or AIMMS is desirable but not essential
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Demonstrated time management and organisational skills
A strong sense of commitment, a willingness to learn, and a desire to work in a dynamic deadline driven environment
Attention to detail and commitment to consistently deliver error free high quality of work
Ability to work well as a part of a cross functional team, collaborate well, share knowledge and drive continuous improvement
Ability to work away on site and interstate occasionally

Benefits at AECOM
The Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA) recognises AECOM as taking a sophisticated, holistic approach to supporting women and men’s participation throughout our workplace.
We provide a diverse and inclusive work environment and offer many benefits to ensure your professional development & wellbeing.

Flexible start and finish times, working from home, part time and job share options;
State of the art, modern and contemporary offices;
Paid parental and partner leave;
Purchased additional annual leave + salary packaging;
Corporate Employee discounts from up to 400 retailers;
Wellbeing benefits e.g. Vaccinations, health insurance discounts;
Employee stock purchase plans;
Study assistance;
Professional and technical development opportunities.
title: Graduate Consultant - Analytics

templatetext:
Senior Advisor Operational Systems

Excellent opportunity to work for a global mining organisation
Opportunity to work with the dynamic Growth and Innovation team
Perth CBD location

About the role
We are looking for a Senior Advisor Operational Systems to support the ongoing development, implementation and embedding of functions enabled by Operational Systems (OS). This includes the support of the existing Mine
          Monitoring & Control Global Operating Model and integrating new functions as they are required.
This role is a great opportunity for an enthusiastic individual who can work under pressure while keeping in mind Rio Tinto's core values. Reporting to the Principal Operational Systems, you will be:

Developing & maintaining expertise in the Operational Systems solutions including fleet management, machine guidance systems, asset health fatigue management and vehicle interaction solutions, etc.
Working across time zones and regions with mine sites to implement the Global Operating Model including assisting in development of the business cases, capital approvals and operational improvement projects.
Undertaking best practice assessments using workshops, interviews and data collection techniques to identify improvement opportunities.
Facilitate the MM&C Community of Practice.

About you
To be successfully considered for this role, you will have:

Extensive knowledge (theoretical and applied) of Monitoring and Control systems
Demonstrated experience with mining operations involving production, planning, reliability, maintenance, processing or other support type role.
A proven track record of effective engagement with client groups including understanding needs and delivery of value adding solutions.
Strong data acquisition and analytical skills on business and organisational challenges.
Track record of generating practical and innovative solutions to multi-faceted technical and/or operational problems.

It will also be beneficial if you have:

Degree / Post Graduate qualification in engineering, mining or data analysis related fields
Portfolio of proven Operational Productivity Improvements
Statistics and Data Science Experience

Where you will be working
The Growth & Innovation group operates through the entire life cycle of Rio Tinto’s mines and assets, creating value through exploration, project development and technical excellence. Working in close partnership with all product groups, it
          focuses on finding safer, smarter and more efficient ways to manage resources and operations. 
About us
As pioneers in mining and metals, we produce materials essential to human progress.
Our long history is filled with firsts. We’ve developed some of the world’s largest and best quality mines and operations, and our people work in around 35 countries across six continents. Aluminium and copper, diamonds, gold and industrial minerals,
          iron ore, coal and uranium: our materials make up the world around us. You’ll find them in smartphones, planes, cars, hospitals and throughout your home. 
Creating an inclusive and diverse workforce
We are a diverse team of talented, enthusiastic individuals who foster a culture of inclusion. No matter how they may differ, our people share one thing in common. It’s a belief that work is more rewarding when we are accepted and valued for our
          differences, not judged by them. We all have something to contribute, and it’s this contribution that makes for a great organization and fulfilling career.
Apply today if you want to work with the latest technology and innovation, in an environment where we challenge you to drive positive change.  Please note, in order to be successfully considered for this role you must
          complete all pre-screening questions.
title: Senior Advisor Operational Systems

templatetext:
For over 16 years Quantium have combined the best of human and artificial intelligence to power possibilities for individuals, organisations and society. Our solutions make sense of what has happened and what will, could or should be done to re-shape
          industries and societies around the needs of the people they serve.
Times and technology have changed, but this remains our goal. Instead of wrangling single, SQL-based databases, our Map Hadoop platform runs across 200 nodes with multiple clusters using the latest big data technology.
The procurement specialist is responsible for ensuring the contractual and regulatory procurement obligations of Quantium across IT and office equipment. This person will provide budget and forecast submissions and tracking for all procurement
          activity. This person will also provide guidance and establish strong business relationships with key vendors as/when required.
For the right candidate this role can be performed part time, across 4 or 5 days (approx. 30 hours per week). Quantium are also open to exploring the role being done in a full-time capacity.
Key responsibilities

Work closely with vendors to ensure we are achieving optimal pricing, service quality and delivery
Work closely with different business units in IT, Operations, and Finance to satisfy procurement needs for the business
Manage marketing merchandise procurement and inventory

Key Activity 

For all procurement needs, source appropriate vendors and request quotations
Select optimum vendor, with regard to price, reputation and quality of goods or service
Raise purchase orders, having received appropriate approvals
Liaise with IT and Operations to co-ordinate delivery, installation and storage of IT and office equipment
For major purchases, enter into contract negotiations, using negotiation skills to receive optimum price and terms and conditions and engage with the legal department to ensure any risks for Quantium are mitigated
Ensure accurate and complete records are kept for all IT licences
Prepare budgets and forecasts for all procurement activity, and conduct monthly review on performance compared to budgets/forecasts
Participate in systems enhancement projects, for both procurement and as part of the wider Finance team
Under the direction of the Marketing Manager, manage procurement and inventory for marketing merchandise
Co-ordinate the issuing of marketing merchandise to employees

Experience, capabilities and education required

At least 2 years’ procurement experience in a professional services/technology environment
Tertiary qualifications in Procurement, or a similar discipline
Collaborative style and structured communicator (both written and verbal)
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to innovate intelligent, with a continuous improvement mindset
Great hustle, taking personal accountability to make things happen

Desirable

Stakeholder management experience
Budgeting and cost management experience
Experience working with Microsoft Dynamics AX
Intermediate EXCEL skills
Systems enhancement experience

As one of the world’s fully diversified data science and AI leaders we operate across every sector of the economy and we’re growing fast - with growth comes opportunity! We’re passionate about building out our team of smart, fun, diverse and motivated
          people.
We combine a team of experts that spans data scientists, actuaries, statisticians, business analysts, strategy consultants, engineers, technologists, programmers, product developers, and futurists – all dedicated to harnessing the power of data
          to drive transformational outcomes for our clients.
We actively foster a culture where our people can stretch themselves to reach their full potential. We also know that work has to work for you, and modern life is fast paced and balance can be tricky. You want to work where you are respected and
          valued as an individual, not a number. Quantium embraces a flexible and supportive environment dedicated to powering possibilities for our team members, clients and partners.
Quantium are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We are a multicultural team of various beliefs, sexual orientations and gender identities. We celebrate our diversity of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation,
          age, marital status and disability status.
Please note, this role is not suitable for Graduates. If you are a graduate and you’d like information about our Graduate Academy please visit https://au.gradconnection.com/employers/quantium/about-us/
If you submit an application or expression of interest to The Quantium Group Pty Ltd, we may disclose your application or expression of interest on a confidential basis to our related companies, and joint venture companies, including Quantium
          Health Pty Limited.  We will only make such disclosures for the purpose of considering your application or expression of interest and opportunities in those organisations.
title: Procurement Specialist

templatetext:
Work on a complex Greenfield project for a well-recognised company you will know!

Australian household name
$100K - $120K + Bonus
South Eastern Suburb location
   COMPANY + ROLEA leading web-based company that you will have heard of and may have used is growing their in-house capabilities. You will be working with some very talented individuals whose history and workplaces
        are very highly regarded! Growing a new squad by another two developers you will be working on a greenfield application solving complex problems. We have a history of a few of our apps outsourced where tech has been chosen by them
        but now, now it is our time to turn this around! We will be building with emerging tech to consolidate these applications for the future with a goal to retire the older applications.Day to day you will be talking with the BA and IM as you
        build on the requirements. We are looking at implementing React, Redux, Node and GraphQL, on AWS. The current stack is in Java with elements of PHP and .NET for the data science, we are moving away from this.    YOU

Have a deep understanding of software development (4 years+ experience)
Know core concepts (OOP, MVC, design patterns etc)
Have worked with an up to date JavaScript framework (React/Angular 2+/Vue)
Java or PHP experience
AWS
DevOps
Have an appreciation for the backend 
Are eager to learn
Have a “can do” attitude
Like to jump in and experiment
 BONUS

Node
GraphQL,
DynamoDB
Docker
Microservices experience
  APPLY NOW!(Valid PR Visa required) If this feels like a role you are interested in then send through your Folio/GitHub to alex@redwolfrosch.com.au or give Alex a call on 0481868551
title: Senior Full-Stack Software Engineer (Java/PHP/Node)

templatetext:
Who Are We? Our Auckland team of 45 are down to earth, humble, passionate and highly collaborative, and love to win - something we are getting particularly good at after a phenomenal 2018. We also don’t take ourselves
          too seriously and have some bloody good fun together - after all, its people that make a work place special. Our size as the largest privately owned talent management and recruitment business in APAC brings resources,
          tools and brand awareness without the hierarchy, politics and ‘leadership via spreadsheet’ you might expect. We’re not your typical ‘corporate’ recruiter, and value culture over just KPIs.
The Opportunity  Two years ago we took the plunge to invest in Analytics as a standalone Practice, to reflect the growing scale and importance of this function within our clients’ organisations. Today we have a really
          capable team and our strong industry networks with leading employers and track record of delivery have made us the market leader for roles across Business Intelligence and Data Science, as well as specialist HR, Risk and Customer Analytics in
          both Auckland and Wellington.  You’ll join a hugely experienced leadership team here in Auckland, reporting directly to the General Manager. You’ll be responsible for continuing the momentum of this national practice, being hands on
          with relationship development and getting involved with some delivery to clients too. You’ll create a business plan to support building on the existing headcount of three.  This an ideal leadership challenge for someone looking to write
          their own success story without starting from scratch.  You  You value relationships, thrive off seeing other’s success and appreciate the power of collaboration. Your leadership experience has also taught you
          that creating a high performance culture and bringing the best out of others comes from far more than cranking the KPI wheel - that approach won’t work here.  We’d prefer you have networks within the local technology or analytics community
          but we’re more interested in a great recruiter who wants to build on their leadership experience and create a high performing team.  What you’ll get  You’ll be able to progress your own career with leadership
          training and transparent career progression criteria, and most importantly you’ll work with some top shelf people. Although the extra annual leave, flexibility, extensive resources and a brand that opens doors doesn’t hurt!  Hear what
          other Hudson people leaders think about the advantages of working for us at: hudson-careers.com/people-leaders  Please apply via this website, or email your resume in Word format to cv.nz@hudson.com, quoting Ref. No. 9X/00386          in the subject line. Want to talk first? Contact Tony Pownall, GM Auckland, on (+649) 977 9970.
title: Recuitment Manager, Analytics

templatetext:
Data Scientist required to join the Data & Analytics division of a leading fintech business. As a Data Scientist, you will be responsible for:

engaging with senior business stakeholders to understand their needs and strategic goals
building predictive models and implementing them on a Cloud platform
identifying and cleansing data, and drawing out actionable insights
presenting findings and recommendations back to the business
 To be successful for this role, your CV will need to reflect on following skill-set:

Data mining and modelling experience with strong R and Python skills
Demonstrated experience in requirement gathering, functional scoping and documentation
Strong commercial acumen, with proven experience delivering actionable insights
 To express an interest in this role please send through your CV (in Word format) via this advert. For further questions please contact Sabina Ahuja on (03)99828478
title: Data Scientist

templatetext:
My client is a cutting edge AI Product Development company with operations and customers across the globe and an Engineering hub here in Sydney. They are currently looking for a well-rounded and talented ETL/BI Developer to join their
            team.With a primary focus on BI and Reporting in this role (customising reports, designing reports etc. for cloud based web/mobile app's) naturally also demands solid ETL experience to ensure the integrity and quality of the data so
            I am looking for candidates with at least 3 (ideally 5) years recent experience working with ETL and BI tools (e.g. Datastage, SSIS, ODI, Informatica, Airflow, Kafka, Talend Open Studio for ETL & BI tools eg Tableau, Qlikview, Business
            Objects, Cognos, Cognos, SQL Server, Yellowfin, JReports et al). You will need this experience as you will be heavily involved ETL processes and data transformations for enterprise software (client software managed by the company usually)Strong
            SQL skills are essential (stored procedures, packages, triggers, query optimisation etc) as are good experience with a major RDBMS (e.g. Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL etc), data modelling skills would be useful but aren't essential. I
            am also looking for candidates who can combine this ETL/BI skill set with some meaningful Java experience (ideally 3+years but at least 18m minimum required) - by this i mean Java or Java Virtual Machine based language (e.g. Clojure, Groovy,
            Jruby,  Jython et al).
This is a role where you will be working in cross-functional teams, working closely with Product Owners/Managers, Marketing etc. and you will need to analyse data to understand existing and proposed new client reports so you can influence outcomes,make
            suggestions etc. and be solutions focused so it's very important that you possess really good communication skills and have a high level of commercial awareness and can talk about business processes, business outcomes with non-technical stakeholders
            etc. This combined with good Analysis skills, database/schema design experience and reports design/development is critical to this role.The ability to deliver on projects is key as this is a heavily project focused role so being capable
            of working to deadlines and work under pressure is crucial. Agile development environment. Any version control experience is also useful (Git). Alongside the Data Science team & Software Engineering Team sits a DevOps team so
            knowledge of Docker, Kubernetes would also be good but as long ass you can demonstrate some interest in this space this should suffice for my client.  Other than that other useful skills range from Front-End tools/frameworks
            etc. (CSS, HTML, JQuery) through to server side Systems level knowledge (Unix, Linux) and scripting skills (Python, Korn Shell, PHP etc.)In the fullness of time my client plans to move to streaming data processing architectures etc so
            an interest in this space is also considered useful.As you can see this is an expansive and wide ranging advert in terms of skills and experience, therefore if you have the ETL and BI skills and 50% or more of the rest and can demonstrate
            the smarts and ambition to pick up new skills quickly then you will be given serious consideration for the role.My client is in the heart of the Sydney CBD, offers an excellent working environment and a collegiate style culture where self
            and professional development are encouraged. With superb partnerships in place with the leading tech companies on the planet on offer is access to high profile conferencing, technical training, seminars etc. With serious growth planned for
            2019 and beyond this is the time to join and boost your career by riding and contributing to their wave of success.Interested candidates should apply with an up to date CV/Resume ASAP either online or email me at declan.oboyle@indmand.com.au
            or call on 0452 411 968 for a confidential discussion.
title: ETL/BI Developer (full-stack) with Java Skills, AI Product, Sydney CBD

title: ANALYST/PROGRAMMER

templatetext:
About Digital:
The Digital Technology Team is focussed on enabling the business to operate at its peak and respond with agility to an ever-changing environment allowing us to better serve our customers. To achieve this, the team continuously assesses how the
          business can benefit from applying the latest technologies available or how to use established technologies in innovative ways.
The team supports over 2,500 retail stores and 115,000 team members. We are a unique group comprised of specialists across engineering, infrastructure, data science & analytics, solution design, human centred design, development and project/program
          management (among many others).  
About the Team:
As a part of the broader insights and services team which is responsible for providing the engineering support for various data warehousing applications, you will play a key part in the development and deployment of different reporting solutions such as pixel perfect reports, mobile dashboards and other visual representations using various BI tools.
About the role:

developing business intelligence applications for data analysis, optimized for the best performance and scalability requirements using Microstrategy
liaise with business stakeholders to understand their requirements and assist in the development of dashboards, visualizations and solutions tailored to their needs
creating Microstrategy Schema Objects (facts, attributes, transformations) and Application Objects (filters, metrics, prompts, templates) to build documents and reports
performance tune reports/documents/dashboards and knowledge of utilizing VLDB property settings to achieve execution efficiency
performing Microstrategy Administrative tasks
creating dashboards and reports for Microstrategy Web and Mobile

About you:

deep understanding and experience in Microstrategy design, architecture, development and administration
understanding of data/dimension modelling and concepts (star model, snow flake)
hands on experience with one or more databases such as Oracle/Teradata
proficient in Microstrategy 10.x product suites including Developer, Architect, Object Manager and Command Manager
strong SQL skills with the ability to optimize, analyse, and improve database SQL performance
experience in developing and deploying application Microstrategy mobile platforms

Culture 
At Coles, we push boundaries everyday by looking ahead, reinforcing a positive experience for those who become a part of our family. We believe in igniting that energy by having you become part of a more purposeful work life. We are a dynamic,
          fast paced and a collaborative organisation. With Coles, we support you in bringing your best self today and every other day. So, how will you bring good things at Coles?
Benefits:
As a Team Member of Coles you will receive:

team member store discount and exclusive offers
flexible working arrangements to support you and your life outside of work
sample new products and flavours before they hit the shelves
access to a fitness centre and body therapy clinic
competitive base and super package
a fun and inclusive culture where customer, community and team are at the heart of what we do

Please Note 
We prefer to deal with you directly and have not engaged an agency for this role, so if you’re interested, please apply. 
At Coles, we aim to ensure our team represents the community we serve, embracing the richness of Australia's diverse population.
title: Senior Technical Analyst - Microstrategy

templatetext:
DATA ENGINEER / SPARK & AWS / 3 MONTH CONTRACT / SYDNEY CBD 
 
A Marketing Analytics Company are looking to add a further Data Engineer to their 5 strong team based in Central Sydney on this exciting and initial 3 month contract.
You will build and maintain data pipelines in Python and Spark, model data in an AWS technologies, and deploy machine learning models to drive their cutting-edge Data Science product and consultancy offerings. The data is a really diverse blend
          of Social Media data, Transactional Data, Financial Services data, and more which should provide interesting challenges operating at scale.
This is a great opportunity to join a well-known business, fun team delivering interesting client led solutions.
 There is also the opportunity to do more data science focused work further down the line when projects demand it.
 
THE ROLE 
As a Data Engineer, you will:
 
Development of data pipelines on AWS and Apache Spark.
Design and develop new algorithms for extracting insight from social data using SQL and Python
Develop crawlers to extract data from the web or APIs
Build infrastructure around existing internal tools to enhance capabilities and improve data flow.
Implement statistical models and algorithms including clustering on large scale graph data
Deploy to, work on and manage AWS especially EMR and S3.
 
YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE 
To qualify for this Data Engineering role, you will need one or more of the following:
 
Ideally Python programming skills, although other languages can be considered
SQL and Data Modelling
Experience in Cloud technology (e.g. AWS )
An understanding of distributed computing in Hadoop or Spark
A driven and collaborative approach to work.
 
Please apply directly via the Apply for this job button. Only suitable candidates matching client criteria will be contacted.

Join a fast paced, dynamic and agile team

At NAB, we believe success comes from our people. We're committed to supporting your talent and skills through your career, as you help us build a culture that affects change for our customers - and for the community too.

          performance. This is achieved by:

Embedding analytics across NAB to drive a data driven culture so we can grow, attract & retain talent
Make it easier to perform high quality analytics & provide access to data, platform and tools
Enable experimentation to drive innovative solutions for our customers powered by analytics.

Reporting to the Manager, Delivery Analytics Experiments, the Data Scientist will collaborate with line of business stakeholders, leveraging NAB’s technology and data to conduct discovery activities, and deliver advanced analytic insights to improve
          customer experience and add shareholder value. You will work within cross functional experiment teams, conducting experiments using advanced analytics and machine learning techniques to discover actionable insights.

Working on analytic experiments in the Analytics Hub

Machine Learning
Teradata Aster/SQL MapReduce
Hadoop, MapReduce, Hive, Pig, Spark

About Digital:
The Digital Group is a team focused on enabling the business to operate at its peak and respond with agility to an ever-changing environment allowing us to better serve our customers. To achieve this, the team continuously assesses how the business
          can benefit from applying the latest technologies available or how to use established technologies in innovative ways.
The Digital team supports over 2,500 retail stores and 115,000 team members. We are a unique group comprised of specialists across engineering, infrastructure, data science & analytics, solution design, human centred design, development and
          project/program management (among many others).  
The role
Reporting to the Head of Liquor Digital and Technology, this role will see you deliver projects and initiatives in the Above Stores and Online channels, where you will build, drive and deliver on the strategic vision and architecture for Coles
          Liquor through the prioritisation and delivery of key transformational initiatives.
Your key responsibilities will be to:

build and deliver on the strategic vision and architecture for Coles Liquor through the prioritisation and delivery of key transformational initiatives
build, lead and leverage a team of Analysts and Project Managers to deliver exceptional outcomes for the Liquor business
oversee a portfolio of complex projects, guiding and helping the team through the setting of clear priorities, objectives and expectations that are well communicated to the appropriate stakeholder groups

To be successful, you’ll have:

demonstrated track record of delivering successful outcomes, meeting or exceeding project on-time, on-budget targets
extensive experience in program, project or service management.
experience managing teams of IT professionals and vendors
proven experience in working with complex back-end systems and business processes, in regulated industries
tertiary qualification preferred
exceptional passion for delivering for customers
ability to handle ambiguity with clear and focused decision-making skills

Culture 
Coles is a fast-paced, constantly changing business that focuses your talents and challenges you to perform at your best.
As a team, we’re bold with ideas and operate with pace and passion, always looking for better ways to transform retail and delight customers.

a 5% discount when shopping at Coles, Kmart, Officeworks and Target

            with our Medical and Wellbeing Centre provide a multidiscipline approach to care.
At Bupa our people are transforming and making a difference in the world of health & care.

The Health Services Business Unit provides clinical services to Bupa members and the broader Australian community through our Dental, Optical, Therapy and government contracted (DVA, Home Affairs and Defence) services. This role is responsible

High level of professional maturity

Join us
Bupa believes in hiring the best talent in the market. We are known for our vibrant, high performing and incredibly rewarding workplace, and we take pride in creating exceptional and meaningful work experiences, encouraging innovation, delivering

Bupa has everything – growth, passion, results and a caring & supportive culture that surround a burning ambition and purpose that is the best in the world. Our people reflect the diversity of our community.  At Bupa, your wellbeing,

templatetext:
Finance Transformation Consultant
 
 
In a world where robots are beginning to work alongside humans, it is time to reimagine the art of the possible. Driven by digital enablers and with a heightened appetite for Finance to be a commercial and strategic advisor to the business, the
          role of Finance is transforming and drastically expanding.
 
 
 
Whilst Finance must remain vigilant and increase its stewardship and governance oversite, the ability to use financial and non-financial information to uncover hidden insights and improve investment decision making across the organisation is moving
          Finance towards fulfilling its destiny as an integrator and value creator. These drivers of change and new roles are having a significant impact on the future of work, the workforce and the workplace for Finance and their end customers / stakeholders.


 
As part of Deloitte’s Finance Consulting practice, you will be leading the way amongst pioneers shaping the course of modern finance in the digital world.
 
 
 
Our Team
 
 
Deloitte’s market-leading Finance Transformation (FT) practice assists CFOs, Executives and Finance’s customers / stakeholders to step change performance by defining and executing Finance function strategies and transformation programs enhancing
          governance, control, finance efficiency and business partnering capabilities.
 
 
Our work encompasses future operating models, outsourcing, shared services, centres of excellence, finance factories, process improvement, capability uplift and the application of digital and disruptive technologies. We team with our clients to
          chart this course, go on the journey with them to realise these new destinations and uplift their capability along the way so they can continue to stretch and grow.
 
 
You will be a joining a dynamic and growing team committed to driving innovation, delivering different and distinctive client outcomes, and making an impact that matters. The strength of our team lies in the diversity of the background and skillset
          of each member, fostered in a collaborative environment.
 
 
Your Opportunity
 
 
As a Consultant within our Finance team you will:

Deliver programs of work in cross-functional and diverse teams, assisting with the coaching and development of junior staff
Lead conversations around critical client issues and help navigate to meaningful outcomes through structured problem solving, design thinking and team collaboration
Partner with client leadership to drive the design and creation of innovative, high quality deliverables and results
Deliver compelling client proposals and build and grow Deloitte’s thought leadership to drive innovation
Build and maintain strong relationships with a range of internal and external stakeholders

 
About You
 
Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree or higher in Business / Commerce or a quantitative field (e.g. Engineering, Maths, Science, Statistics)
Professional experience in any of the following fields: Finance, Accounting, Engineering, Data Science, Customer experience /UX design or finance transformation
Excellent structured problem solving skills and analytical thinking with attention to detail
Strong written and verbal communication skills, including strong presentation skills
Ability to deal with ambiguity and demonstrate resilience and strong commitment towards project and personal goals
Ability to work as an effective team member
Outstanding design thinking, creative and innovation capabilities
Strong functional knowledge around financial operating models, processes, systems and information (combining financial and non-financial)
Proven skills as a team member on at least one Finance Transformation project
Prior consulting / professional services experience (preferred)

 
About Us
 
 
Join a high performing culture of talented people, who are highly motivated and passionate about delivering impactful analytic and creative solutions and insight. We are innovative and different because YOU are… we pride ourselves on our team
          of diverse, high performing Deloitte Professionals who are talented, supportive, inclusive and social - and who are at the heart of our success.
 
Our aim is to ensure that all our people feel confident to bring their whole selves to work, and as a result, build a workplace that encourages the true spirit of 'And different'.
 
 
From day one at our Firm you’ll be considered part of the Deloitte community and our development and career progression framework will help you develop the skills and capabilities that will set you up to succeed - in every sense of the word.


 
At Deloitte, we assume that you perform other roles within your life…you could be a student, a teacher, a passionate hobbyist and a caring family member. We recognise the importance of balance and embrace agility, understanding that this means
          different things to each and every one of our employees.
 
 
Next Steps
 
If this sounds like an exciting career challenge, that aligns with your personal goals and expertise, please apply now. Check out our YouTube page and social channels for further insights into life at Deloitte.
 
 
This position is only open to Australian Citizens due to the nature of client engagements. For oher positions, we encourage Non-residents, Non-citizens to view our Careers page and apply.
 
 
‘By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent & exceptional Deloitte experience globally.’
title: Finance Transformation Consultant

templatetext:
Data Hub Technical Support Engineer
$99,723 – $112,730 + 15.4% Superannuation
The National Earth and Marine Observations (NEMO) Branch provides national leadership in the definition, acquisition, stewardship and application of satellite remote sensing and seabed data. NEMO’s work is underpinned by world-class expertise
          in marine, remote sensing and information sciences. The NEMO Operations Section maintains a number of critical operational and production capabilities in support of delivery of Geoscience Australia’s Earth and Marine Observation capabilities.
          This includes data hubs that are used to sync and distribute satellite imagery from various sources across the globe using information and communication technology and digital infrastructure.   
Copernicus Australasia Regional Data Hub (the Hub), is one of these hubs, a multi-party capability that supports Europe’s most ambitious and multifaceted Earth observation Copernicus programme. It provides free and open access to Sentinel satellite
          imagery over Australia and its Antarctic Territory, New Zealand, as well as South-East Asia and the South Pacific. The Hub is established under a series of partnership agreements including Consortium partners that manage and operate it, delivery
          partners who sync and distribute the data across the globe, and supporting partners who provide access to the data.   
NEMO’s Operations and Production Section is looking for a Technical Support Engineer to help with the operations of the Hub. The successful candidate will be responsible for the provision of high level technical support and advice to the Director
          of Data Enabling Services managing the Hub and consumers of Copernicus Australasia’s services. The successful candidate will contribute to preparation and provision of technical information and supporting materials such as ‘how to guides and
          help’ to facilitate the continuation and expansion of the Hub’s operations and services. The role will additionally provide programming and scripting support for NEMO Operations and lead technology exploration towards future operational scenarios.
This role requires an individual with integrity, initiative and a commitment to personal development, who is willing to learn new systems and who has high level organisational, management and communication skills. The role will be accountable
          for:

provision of advice and monitoring relevant day-to-day operations of the Data Hub including: data ingest processes, collection gap-filling, facilitate removal of duplicate content, model data storage needs and reporting;
monitoring and refinement of support tools, software and services that integrate into the existing environments, data management, data services, cloud and supercomputer environments;
support for a variety of web and database platforms including data downloading, registration, distribution systems, notification systems for user status, as well as websites;
delivery of a high quality service for users of the Hub including providing subject matter expertise and technical help desk functions;
continuously improve and optimise the Hub’s policies, processes and systems and contribute to the establishment of a network within the Australia Earth Observation and or High Performance Computing (HPC) sectors; and
performing duties as required in line with the EL1 APS Work Level Standards.

To be successful in the role you will have:

tertiary qualifications relevant to remote sensing, spatial data sciences, and data management;
high level programming skills and demonstrated understanding and experience in software engineering;
strong understanding of scientific digital supply chains and experience in range of computing platforms.
experience managing complex stakeholder environments including the ability to communicate effectively and work collaboratively with others; and
established, or be able to establish a network within the Australian Earth observation  and/or HPC sectors.

Applications Close 27 January 2019
Geoscience Australia is an Australian Government listed entity within the Jobs and Innovation portfolio. Geoscience Australia is Australia's pre-eminent public sector geoscience organisation. We are the nation's trusted advisor on the geology
          and geography of Australia. We apply science and technology to describe and understand the Earth for the benefit of Australia. We apply our diverse professional expertise, our deep and trusted knowledge, our national-scale Earth observation
          infrastructure and our strong partnerships, to the opportunities and challenges that face our nation.
title: Data Hub Technical Support Engineer

templatetext:
My client is a cutting edge AI Product Development company with operations and customers across the globe and an Engineering hub here in Sydney. They are currently looking for a well-rounded and talented ETL/BI Developer to join their
            team.With a primary focus on BI and Reporting in this role (customising reports, designing reports etc. for cloud based web/mobile app's) naturally also demands solid ETL experience to ensure the integrity and quality of the data so
            I am looking for candidates with at least 3 (ideally 5) years recent experience working with ETL and BI tools (e.g. Datastage, SSIS, ODI, Informatica, Airflow, Kafka, Talend Open Studio for ETL & BI tools eg Tableau, Qlikview, Business
            Objects, Cognos, Cognos, SQL Server, Yellowfin, JReports et al). You will need this experience as you will be heavily involved ETL processes and data transformations for enterprise software (client software managed by the company usually)Strong
            SQL skills are essential (stored procedures, packages, triggers, query optimisation etc) as are good experience with a major RDBMS (e.g. Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL etc), data modelling skills would be useful but aren't essential. I
            am also looking for candidates who can combine this ETL/BI skill set with some meaningful Java experience (ideally 3+years but at least 18m minimum required) - by this i mean Java or Java Virtual Machine based language (e.g. Clojure, Groovy,
            Jruby,  Jython et al).
This is a role where you will be working in cross-functional teams, working closely with Product Owners/Managers, Marketing etc. and you will need to analyse data to understand existing and proposed new client reports so you can influence outcomes,make
            suggestions etc. and be solutions focused so it's very important that you possess really good communication skills and have a high level of commercial awareness and can talk about business processes, business outcomes with non-technical stakeholders
            etc. This combined with good Analysis skills, database/schema design experience and reports design/development is critical to this role.The ability to deliver on projects is key as this is a heavily project focused role so being capable
            of working to deadlines and work under pressure is crucial. Agile development environment. Any version control experience is also useful (Git). Alongside the Data Science team & Software Engineering Team sits a DevOps team so
            knowledge of Docker, Kubernetes would also be good but as long ass you can demonstrate some interest in this space this should suffice for my client.  Other than that other useful skills range from Front-End tools/frameworks
            etc. (CSS, HTML, JQuery) through to server side Systems level knowledge (Unix, Linux) and scripting skills (Python, Korn Shell, PHP etc.)In the fullness of time my client plans to move to streaming data processing architectures etc so
            an interest in this space is also considered useful.As you can see this is an expansive and wide ranging advert in terms of skills and experience, therefore if you have the ETL and BI skills and 50% or more of the rest and can demonstrate
            the smarts and ambition to pick up new skills quickly then you will be given serious consideration for the role.My client is in the heart of the Sydney CBD, offers an excellent working environment and a collegiate style culture where self
            and professional development are encouraged. With superb partnerships in place with the leading tech companies on the planet on offer is access to high profile conferencing, technical training, seminars etc. With serious growth planned for
            2019 and beyond this is the time to join and boost your career by riding and contributing to their wave of success.Interested candidates should apply with an up to date CV/Resume ASAP either online or email me at declan.oboyle@indmand.com.au
            or call on 0452 411 968 for a confidential discussion.
title: ETL/BI Developer (full-stack) with Java Skills, AI Product, Sydney CBD

        we use agile ways of working and modern tools to deliver value at speed.    An opportunity that you're really excited by  RXP are looking for their next Insight Data Generalist/Consultant to join the
        team in Sydney. This is a multi-disciplined data practice, encompassing analytics, visualisation, information management and integration.  A position suited to your skills and experience Some of the skills
        used in this area include:

Cognos

 Making Happier Humans is our mission for Australian Businesses, including our own  Our people are insightful and intelligent industry leaders who are passionate about contributing to our clients’ digital futures. Through

        and celebrates who you are at and outside of work. If you like the sound of us, then learn more about joining us by visiting http://rxpservices.com/careers    Note: To be eligible to apply for this position, you must have existing Australian work rights. The shortlisted candidate/s may be required to undergo a Criminal History /Background/Police /Qualifications Check at the later stages of the recruitment process.    RXP Services operate a National Talent Management function and do not accept unsolicited Recruiter resumes. title: Data Generalist/Consultant

templatetext:
About Digital:
The Digital Group is a team focused on enabling the business to operate at its peak and respond with agility to an ever-changing environment allowing us to better serve our customers. To achieve this, the team continuously assesses how the business
          can benefit from applying the latest technologies available or how to use established technologies in innovative ways.
The Digital team supports over 2,500 retail stores and 115,000 team members. We are a unique group comprised of specialists across engineering, infrastructure, data science & analytics, solution design, human centred design, development and
          project/program management (among many others).  
The role
We’re looking for a UX Designer with eCommerce experience to join Coles Group.
You’ll be a member of the Coles' Human Centred Design team, designing innovative customer experiences across our eCommerce platforms - Coles Online, First Choice Liquor Market, Liquorland and Vintage Cellars. The ideal candidate is passionate
          about designing for the customer, identifying pain points, exploring opportunities, solving problems, delivering solutions and iterating upon them. You will have a genuine interest in creating digital experiences for mobile, online, and voice.
As a part of a strategic and growing team you get the opportunity to work with Service Designers to re-imagine how people interact with physical and digital touchpoints, engage with Design Researchers to uncover authentic behavioural insights
          and engage with Accessibility experts to ensure Coles  creates inclusive designs.
Join us to make life easier for our customers...
To be successful, you’ll have:

experience in a similar User Experience/Product Design role
proven experience in an eCommerce design role
working knowledge of Human Centred and Design Thinking practices
ability to create detailed wireframes for eCommerce solutions, and build and iterate robust prototypes
experience in facilitating user testing sessions and design thinking workshops
experience with creating personas, empathy maps and customer journeys with an omni-channel outlook will be a massive advantage
strong communication and story-telling capabilities
communicating and rationalising design decisions with viability and feasibility as considerations
working knowledge of the tools of the trade. Such as Sketch, Adobe CC, InVision, user testing tools and rapid prototyping tools.
you should understand digital accessibility, WCAG and inclusive design
you’re an effective collaborator, who can direct and work with fellow UX Designers, Visual Designers, Creative Agencies, Solution Architects, Developers and data insight teams

Culture 
Coles is a fast-paced, constantly changing business that focuses your talents and challenges you to perform at your best.
As a team, we’re bold with ideas and operate with pace and passion, always looking for better ways to transform retail and delight customers.
Benefits
Not only will you receive a competitive salary, you’ll also have access to these great benefits:

a 5% discount when shopping at Coles, Kmart, Officeworks and Target
learn new skills and develop your existing capabilities - we provide excellent ongoing training and development
12 weeks of paid parental leave for primary care givers and 1 week of paid leave for secondary care givers
no need to pay for car parking - you can park your car in our multi-level car park, which is exclusive to our team
get fitter, stronger and faster at our on-site gym

Please Note 
We prefer to deal with you directly and have not engaged an agency for this role, so if you’re interested, please apply. 
 
At Coles, we aim to ensure our team represents the community we serve, embracing the richness of Australia's diverse population.
title: UX Designer

templatetext:
Is furthering your corporate career a goal for 2019? Are you seeking to work with some of the most impressive companies in Australia? Let us tell you 
About us:
As an established boutique recruitment consultancy, we work closely with some of the leading pharmaceutical, medical device, clinical research and FMCG companies in the world as well as Government Departments. We proudly support them in finding
          the best talent in Regulatory, Quality, R&D, Laboratory, Clinical Research and Sales and Marketing. 
At On Q Recruitment we work hard - and we play hard too with something fun always on the calendar. We have been around since 1999 and have an enviable reputation with our clients and candidates built on trust, reliability and getting it right
          for them. 
We do things differently from other recruitment companies out there; We are boutique, so we focus on doing a few things really well and are experts in our niche. Based in St Leonards ours is a small team with over 80 years recruitment
          industry experience combined and we are good at sharing that knowledge so our new recruits can be as successful as we are. 
Typically in recruitment you're expected to work long hours - call us old fashioned, but we believe everyone should have a life too. Time at your desk isn't valued - outcomes are! We also believe people should be rewarded for the work they do,
          hence your earning potential is uncapped - you get out what you put in.
You will be joining a friendly, professional, open and relaxed team environment where we enjoy what we do and celebrate success. You will feel valued and supported in your career progression. Sound good?...
About the role
We know that training is the key! You will be fully trained to be able to fulfil the complete recruitment role over time, which involves:

Building relationships with (new and existing) clients and taking job briefs
Writing and placing job advertisements
Reviewing CVs
Interviewing candidates and advising of suitable job opportunities
Booking client interviews, briefing candidates and following up
All on-line administration to manage the interview process from start to finish

Who are you?

You are a go getter who's looking for a great opportunity to springboard your career in a new direction
You have at least 3 years work experience doing something else which isn't lighting you fire any more
You are serious about your work and career, but not serious to have around the office
Because this is a people focused job, you have to enjoy that interaction and have exceptional communication skills
A background in customer service or sales would be advantageous
Other handy attributes are tenacity, resilience, organisational skills and influencing ability
You'll have a Bachelor's Degree - ideally in Science, Engineering, Data Science, Pharmacy, Business or HR
You'll be an Australian Citizen (or Permanent Resident) and have an Australian driver’s license

And the Rewards?

A competitive starting base salary (dependent on experience) + Super + uncapped commission (no ceiling on your earning potential)
Development through a full training and mentoring plan to ensure your best chance of success
Technology to enable you to work from home as needed once you have earned your stripes
Work/life balance - all work and no play isn't good for anyone afterall!
A fully stocked kitchen so you'll never go hungry
Extra holiday time - you can accrue one extra day's leave per year (up to five days)
Casual dress on Fridays (we like to relax into the weekend!)

If you are excited to hear more, we'd be excited to hear from you! Please submit your resume and cover letter and tell us what makes you think this could be the perfect match for you. If you'd like to speak to someone first, please call Liz on
          0402 275113. We look forward to hearing from you. All successful applicants will be notified by 10th February
 
Please send your Cover Letter and Resume in Word Doc Format (no text boxes or tables please) and follow the Apply Links. Visit onqrecruitment.com.au to review all our current vacancies.
title: Recruitment Consultant Trainee - Scientific fields

templatetext:
My client is a cutting edge AI Product Development company with operations and customers across the globe and an Engineering hub here in Sydney. They are currently looking for a well-rounded and talented ETL/BI Developer to join their
            team.With a primary focus on BI and Reporting in this role (customising reports, designing reports etc. for cloud based web/mobile app's) naturally also demands solid ETL experience to ensure the integrity and quality of the data so
            I am looking for candidates with at least 3 (ideally 5) years recent experience working with ETL and BI tools (e.g. Datastage, SSIS, ODI, Informatica, Airflow, Kafka, Talend Open Studio for ETL & BI tools eg Tableau, Qlikview, Business
            Objects, Cognos, Cognos, SQL Server, Yellowfin, JReports et al). You will need this experience as you will be heavily involved ETL processes and data transformations for enterprise software (client software managed by the company usually)Strong
            SQL skills are essential (stored procedures, packages, triggers, query optimisation etc) as are good experience with a major RDBMS (e.g. Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL etc), data modelling skills would be useful but aren't essential. I
            am also looking for candidates who can combine this ETL/BI skill set with some meaningful Java experience (ideally 3+years but at least 18m minimum required) - by this i mean Java or Java Virtual Machine based language (e.g. Clojure, Groovy,
            Jruby,  Jython et al).
This is a role where you will be working in cross-functional teams, working closely with Product Owners/Managers, Marketing etc. and you will need to analyse data to understand existing and proposed new client reports so you can influence outcomes,make
            suggestions etc. and be solutions focused so it's very important that you possess really good communication skills and have a high level of commercial awareness and can talk about business processes, business outcomes with non-technical stakeholders
            etc. This combined with good Analysis skills, database/schema design experience and reports design/development is critical to this role.The ability to deliver on projects is key as this is a heavily project focused role so being capable
            of working to deadlines and work under pressure is crucial. Agile development environment. Any version control experience is also useful (Git). Alongside the Data Science team & Software Engineering Team sits a DevOps team so
            knowledge of Docker, Kubernetes would also be good but as long ass you can demonstrate some interest in this space this should suffice for my client.  Other than that other useful skills range from Front-End tools/frameworks
            etc. (CSS, HTML, JQuery) through to server side Systems level knowledge (Unix, Linux) and scripting skills (Python, Korn Shell, PHP etc.)In the fullness of time my client plans to move to streaming data processing architectures etc so
            an interest in this space is also considered useful.As you can see this is an expansive and wide ranging advert in terms of skills and experience, therefore if you have the ETL and BI skills and 50% or more of the rest and can demonstrate
            the smarts and ambition to pick up new skills quickly then you will be given serious consideration for the role.My client is in the heart of the Sydney CBD, offers an excellent working environment and a collegiate style culture where self
            and professional development are encouraged. With superb partnerships in place with the leading tech companies on the planet on offer is access to high profile conferencing, technical training, seminars etc. With serious growth planned for
            2019 and beyond this is the time to join and boost your career by riding and contributing to their wave of success.Interested candidates should apply with an up to date CV/Resume ASAP either online or email me at declan.oboyle@indmand.com.au
            or call on 0452 411 968 for a confidential discussion.
title: ETL/BI Developer (full-stack) with Java Skills, AI Product, Sydney CBD
