templatetext:
Freelancer Limited, the ASX-listed company that owns Freelancer.com and Escrow.com, is hiring. Eleven-time Webby award-winning Freelancer.com is the world's largest freelancing and crowdsourcing marketplace, which connects millions of employers
          to freelancers across the globe. Escrow.com is a global fintech industry leader in secure online payments, having handled over US$3.5 billion in transactions buying and selling boats, cars, airplanes, jewelry, fine art, and even trips to the
          planned Aurora space station in 2021!
Freelancer Limited has multiple open roles in product management across the group. Product managers are the CEO of the product they manage. They have responsibility over every aspect of the product including design, engineering, quality, testing,
          monitoring, analytics, data science, UI/UX. marketing, communications, growth, product optimisation, legals, associated operational product teams, copy writing, support., feedback, NPS and user testing.
Product managers run a team of engineers, data scientists, growth hackers, graphic designers (and other roles). They live and breathe the statistics of the the product. They are responsible for writing the product specification and wire frames,
          and breaking that specification down into an agile development process. Ultimately, the most important thing is that they figure out how to grow the north star metric and usage for the product.
If you thrive on taking an evidence-based approach, love pushing the boundaries of web products, and are passionate about having a real impact on a global (and growing) technology company, then we want to hear from you! 
Requirements

MS/BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent preferred
Ability to process and analyse complex data sets, and interpret them to make business decisions. Knows SQL.
Deep understanding of the web user experience (e.g. pricing strategy, technology, user flow)
Understanding of the technical architecture of complex and highly scalable web applications
Experience designing simple and intuitive user interfaces - ability to create wire frames and mockups
Solid technical background with understanding and/or hands-on experience in software development and web technologies
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Proven ability to develop product and marketing strategies

What makes a good product manager?

Attention to detail
A sense of ownership over all aspects of the product
A sense of urgency to deal with issues 
Hybrid skill sets, a jack of all trades
Technical background e.g. computer science, electrical engineering, science
Growth hacker
Maths & statistics
Initiative & leadership
Great communicator
Can write great copy, a born marketer
Engaging presenter to audiences small and large
Frequently talks to customers
Can rapidly iterate product to achieve an outcome

Benefits
This won't be a cog-in-the-machine job; you will be joining a global technology company that is a meritocracy, so if you are looking to make a difference and be rewarded for your efforts, this is the place for you.
We also offer a fun atmosphere working with smart people in an awesome office with fully-stocked kitchens, social events, hackathons, and more.
For more information see www.freelancer.com/careers
title: Product Manager

templatetext:
The Vocus Group Limited (ASX:VOC) is an award-winning and fast-growing telecommunications infrastructure provider to the telco and corporate markets in Australia. Vocus is fast becoming recognised as an employer of choice
        and an organisation where your career can grow with us.As the fourth largest Telco in Australia, Vocus Group continues to grow and we are looking for a Reporting & Data Analytics Specialist.The day to day

Create and manage dashboards to communicate complex information so that it is easy to understand, influence business leaders to take action and make effective and cost-efficient decisions based on the insights provided
Lead the implementation of strategic transformation of technology operations reporting utilising next generation data storage, processing, exploration, visualisation and prediction tools
Drive creative and predictive insights to highlight business problems, risks and opportunities that support recommendations for consideration in the formulation of tactical and operational plans / new initiatives
Develop and undertake or contribute to research projects
Support the exploration of productising data analytics offerings to Vocus customers
 What you will to the bring to the table

Demonstrated experience in interpreting data/outcomes to highlight business problems, risks and opportunities
Previous experience in report development or other business intelligence/data analytics experience
Experience conducting end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering and requirements specification
Working knowledge of SQL and/or PL-SQL or similar development tools, experience in creating dynamic dashboards using PHP, Java, MySQL or similar tools
Strong technical aptitude for data science (data analysis, data visualization, data structure)
Strong understanding of predictive/analytical modelling techniques, theories, principles, and practices
 If you are keen to jump on our boat and make it go faster, click on the link below and get busy on your resume and cover letter and apply to the company that wants to be the most loved Telco! And just before you go........... a bit
        more about us. We are about market domination and having fun on the way there. We know how to celebrate when we smash it and we know not to sweat the small stuff. We are all about flexible working and hand on heart practice work-life balance.
        We let you buy more leave, and hand it out if you hang around for 5 years. We have no dress code and we give you a day off on your anniversary. There is sooooo much more, so jump on our careers site or LinkedIn and have a read about us........promise,
        it will make you smile!https://www.vocusgroup.com.au/careers

templatetext:
Job no: 0046220Work type: Fixed TermLocation: ParkvilleDivision/Faculty: Faculty of Business and EconomicsDepartment/School: Melbourne Institute
            of Applied Economic and Social ResearchSalary: $69,148 - $93,830 (Level A)Role & Superannuation rate: Academic - 17% superannuation

The Melbourne Institute is Australia’s pre-eminent economic and social policy research institution. It undertakes high quality, independent and impartial applied research, and contributes to the development of public policy in Australia. The
              Institute provides high calibre research to government, business and community groups.
The Survey Statistician/Methodologist is a member of the Household, Income and Labour Dynamics in Australia (HILDA) Survey team within the Melbourne Institute: Applied
              Economic and Social Research which sits within the portfolio of the Faculty of Business and Economics.
About the role
This is an exciting role within the HILDA Survey team which focuses on the design and management of the HILDA Survey, providing insights into a wide range of economic, social and demographic issues.
As a Survey Statistician/Methodologist, you will report to and work under the broad direction of the HILDA Director and HILDA Deputy Director (Survey Methodology).
You will be expected to provide survey methods and research support including maintaining and enhancing the complex survey support systems and, undertaking statistical analysis and contributing to the research agenda of the HILDA Survey team.
              You will also be expected to pursue research opportunities (up to 0.2FTE) to present and publish work in your area of expertise.
To be successful in the role you will be an experienced statistician/researcher with exceptional organizational and time management skills, the ability to work within a team and be a self-starter.
About you

Strong empirical and statistical skills with honours degree in statistics, data science, economics, or a closely related field.
Excellent written and analytical skills including the ability to conduct critical appraisal of relevant literature and write academic reports of publishable standard.
High level quantitative skills, including the ability to design and describe appropriate statistical analyses and to use statistical software to manage and analyse large scale complex data.
Demonstrated ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team to achieve project goals and meet agreed deadlines.

A police check is a requirement of the appointment. 
Benefits

Maximise your benefits through our Salary Packaging scheme
Flexible family friendly policies, providing generous leave and working conditions
The opportunity to work in a culturally rich environment
A substantial discount to eligible staff and their immediate families in undertaking further studies at the University of Melbourne

To find out more, go to http://about.unimelb.edu.au/careers/working/benefits  
Culture
The University is a vibrant campus. We have well established clubs and networks giving the opportunity to engage and collaborate with other staff around the University. We strive to create an environment where staff and students promote culturally
              inclusive behaviour and activities, ensure cultural differences are heard and explored, and actively seek to learn from other cultures.
† The University of Melbourne is the Number 1 University in Australia and among the leading Universities in the world, according to The Times Higher Education world reputational ranking, the National Taiwan University ranking, The Times Higher
              Education world university ranking and Shanghai Jiao Tong Academic Ranking of World Universities.
*For information to assist you with compiling short statements to answer the selection criteria/competencies, please go to http://about.unimelb.edu.au/careers/search/info/selection-criteria
Position Description

templatetext:
A high performing team is an organisation's number one asset. QBE has an ambitious journey ahead, so we will be making a large investment to ensure we have the right skills and roles to get us there.
With the objective of becoming simpler, stronger and more customer-centred, several new roles have been created across QBE.
An exciting opportunity of Senior Data Specialist has become available within the Data and Analytics division of the Australia and New Zealand Operations (ANZO). Reporting to the Data Insights and Information Management Lead this role will provide
          the support for the business through the development of its data and analytics platform. With demonstrated knowledge and experience within data management, architecture, solution design and delivery, you will be given a fantastic opportunity
          to support the business in a period of change and growth.
The Opportunity:

Lead design and develop of data engineering assets and scalable feature engineering frameworks to support data science activities.
Evaluate feature importance and manage production of data features.
Code, test and document new or modified data models and ETL tools to create robust and scalable data assets for reporting and analytics.
Establish code standards and guidelines for data specialists.
Expand and increase data platform capabilities to resolve new data problems and challenges by identifying, sourcing and integrating new data.
Develop ETL solutions on Python, R, Microsoft Technology Stack to load data across multiple sources into the Data and Analytics platform.
Implement solutions that adhere to architecture best practices.
Contribute to our ambition to develop a best practice Data and Analytics platform, leveraging next generation technologies.
Define and build the data pipelines that will enable faster, better, data-informed decision-making within the business.
Work across the Data & Analytics function to ensure we are developing our models, architecture and technical solutions in a scalable and maintainable way, that is in line with best practices.
Proactively identify rationalisation opportunities and implement changes to the reporting suite to increase customer usage and reduce wasted effort.
Ensure data integrity within reports and dashboards by reviewing data, identifying and resolving gaps and inconsistencies, and escalating as required to foster a partnered approach to data accuracy for business reporting purposes.

What does success look like?

Bachelor degree in Information Technology or other related discipline.
Minimum of 10 years experience within data management, solution design and delivery.
Demonstrated experience in data mapping, modelling (3NF, Star-Schema, Big Tables, Key-Value Pair and JSON based documents), data engineering, information architecture, data platform design and parallel processing. 
Demonstrated experience in leading a team/teams of data experts.
Strong leadership and motivational ability.
Demonstrated experience in managing technical resources.
Strong leadership and motivational ability.
Advanced communication, influencing and negotiation skills, with the ability to articulate and present technical concepts to business leaders.
Strong working knowledge of the end-to-end data management lifecycle and data quality management.
Experience working with MS Stack (Microsoft SQL Server, SSIS, SSRS, SSAS, Power BI, SQL), Datastage, Informatica or other ETL, MongoDB/Cassandra or other no SQL databases, Graph databases, programming languages (R, Python, SQL VStudio), CI/tools
            (Bamboo, or similar), GitHub, Jira and Confluence.

What’s in it for you?
You will be provided with a competitive salary package and benefits, in an environment that offers support, and encourages career development and learning.
QBE recognises the value of diversity in the workplace and supports a range of flexible work arrangements to promote a better family/life/work balance.
Applicants will be required to provide evidence of their eligibility to work in Australia, and at a minimum be required to undertake police and basic credit checks as a condition of employment. If you are a QBE employee, please inform your Manager
          before applying. 
For more information, click the APPLY button to submit your details.
title: Senior Data Specialist

templatetext:
Observatory Operations and Data Section Leader 
$118,509 - $147,689 + 15.4% Superannuation
The Observatories and Science Support (OSS) branch within GA’s Positioning and Community Safety Division (PCSD) provides core technical, engineering, laboratory and science services to support GA projects and programs. As Observatories Operations
          and Data Section Leader within this Branch, you will provide the strategic direction and day-to-day leadership and management of key technical and operational support to GA and collaborative projects, researchers and senior staff members.
You will lead the Systems Engineering and Data QC & Delivery teams that provide system level design, support and fit for purpose data for many of Geoscience Australia’s mission critical activities and other projects across the Agency.These
          roles will maintain and promote a strong client focussed technology service culture to support Geoscience Australia’s business operations.
In this role you will:

Lead and manage the Observatory Operations and Data Section including people, performance and resources.
Provide system level design and support to the Agency’s seismo-acoustic, remote sensing and geomagnetic networks to agreed service levels as well as assisting with other projects as required
Oversee the development and delivery of specialist services, including data collection, data distribution and data quality management.
Provide strategic leadership to the Agency’s geophysical and remote sensing network operations.
Plan, manage, and implement business continuity plans and preventive system maintenance regimes.
Drive continuous improvement in WHS, quality and daily work process and systems as well as technology refreshes to ensure best practice models are used.
Engage with stakeholders and provide strategic leadership to meet the Agency’s current and future requirements.

To be successful in the role you will:

Significant experience and a proven record in program management, preferably in a systems, scientific and/or data based environment.
A good understanding of data workflows, QC process and data management.
Experience in geomagnetism, seismology, infrasound, remote sensing.
Experience in as well as remote data communications and networking.
Strong system engineering and quality system experience.
A proven record of strategic leadership and delivery in an operational environment with conflicting priorities and with limited resources.
Significant experience in stakeholder engagement and collaboration.

Geoscience Australia is an Australian Government listed entity within the Jobs and Innovation portfolio. Geoscience Australia is Australia's pre-eminent public sector geoscience organisation. We are the nation's trusted advisor on the geology
          and geography of Australia. We apply science and technology to describe and understand the Earth for the benefit of Australia. We apply our diverse professional expertise, our deep and trusted knowledge, our national-scale Earth observation
          infrastructure and our strong partnerships, to the opportunities and challenges that face our nation.
title: Observatory Operations and Data Section Leader
Senior Back End Engineer - Java or C++ - work with Scala!

templatetext:
Who Are We? Our Auckland team of 45 are down to earth, humble, passionate and highly collaborative, and love to win - something we are getting particularly good at after a phenomenal 2018. We also don’t take ourselves
          too seriously and have some bloody good fun together - after all, its people that make a work place special. Our size as the largest privately owned talent management and recruitment business in APAC brings resources,
          tools and brand awareness without the hierarchy, politics and ‘leadership via spreadsheet’ you might expect. We’re not your typical ‘corporate’ recruiter, and value culture over just KPIs.
The Opportunity  Two years ago we took the plunge to invest in Analytics as a standalone Practice, to reflect the growing scale and importance of this function within our clients’ organisations. Today we have a really
          capable team and our strong industry networks with leading employers and track record of delivery have made us the market leader for roles across Business Intelligence and Data Science, as well as specialist HR, Risk and Customer Analytics in
          both Auckland and Wellington.  You’ll join a hugely experienced leadership team here in Auckland, reporting directly to the General Manager. You’ll be responsible for continuing the momentum of this national practice, being hands on
          with relationship development and getting involved with some delivery to clients too. You’ll create a business plan to support building on the existing headcount of three.  This an ideal leadership challenge for someone looking to write
          their own success story without starting from scratch.  You  You value relationships, thrive off seeing other’s success and appreciate the power of collaboration. Your leadership experience has also taught you
          that creating a high performance culture and bringing the best out of others comes from far more than cranking the KPI wheel - that approach won’t work here.  We’d prefer you have networks within the local technology or analytics community
          but we’re more interested in a great recruiter who wants to build on their leadership experience and create a high performing team.  What you’ll get  You’ll be able to progress your own career with leadership
          training and transparent career progression criteria, and most importantly you’ll work with some top shelf people. Although the extra annual leave, flexibility, extensive resources and a brand that opens doors doesn’t hurt!  Hear what
          other Hudson people leaders think about the advantages of working for us at: hudson-careers.com/people-leaders  Please apply via this website, or email your resume in Word format to cv.nz@hudson.com, quoting Ref. No. 9X/00386          in the subject line. Want to talk first? Contact Tony Pownall, GM Auckland, on (+649) 977 9970.

templatetext:
Doctoral research scholarship awarded to understand cellular and molecular mechanisms regulating cardiac cellular landscape in health and disease
These prestigious scholarships, established by La Trobe University in partnership with the Baker Heart and Diabetes Research Institute, will be awarded to outstanding applicants who are interested in exploring how the cardiac cellular landscape
          is regulated by cellular and molecular mechanisms in health and disease. Research will be performed at the Cardiac Cellular Systems Laboratory at the Baker Heart and Diabetes Institute (https://www.baker.edu.au/research/laboratories/cardiac-cellular-systems)
          under the supervision of Dr Alexander Pinto.
As an applicant you should have a demonstrably high level of motivation and an ardent interest in understanding fundamental mechanisms regulating cardiac biology using cutting-edge approaches such as single-cell RNA-sequencing, high-dimensional
          flow cytometry and microscopy.
Benefits of the scholarship
Benefits of the scholarship include:
· a La Trobe Research Scholarship for three and a half (3.5 years) years, with a minimum value of $27,596 per annum, to support your living costs [2019 rate].
· Potential top-up of $6000 per annum for suitable individuals.
· a fee-relief scholarship (LTUFFRS) for four years to undertake a PhD at La Trobe University (international applicants only).
· opportunities to work with La Trobe and Baker’s outstanding researchers, and have access to our suite of professional development programs.
Eligibility criteria
To be eligible, you need to:
· have an Australian Bachelor’s degree with honours year at an H1 standard, or approved international equivalent.
Selection criteria
·High self-motivation with strong desire to learn new and complex techniques, including emerging data science and computational biology approaches.
· Strong written and communication skills.
· Ability to work independently and in a team oriented context.
Value
$96,586 (up to $119,586 for suitable candidates).
How to apply
If you wish to apply for La Trobe University – Baker Heart and Diabetes Research Institute Doctoral Research Scholarship (“the Scholarship”), follow these steps:
How to Apply
Applications should include a current resume quoting reference AP01.  To be eligible to apply for this position you must have an appropriate Australian or New Zealand work visa.  For a position description or further information, please
          visit our website at: https://www.baker.edu.au/career. 
We will close this job ad as soon as we have enough applicants so please apply without delay.
The Baker Institute is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we welcome interest from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders for roles within the Institute. We value diversity and gender equity and are proud members of the SAGE Athena Swan pilot.
Closing dateApplications are open until the position is filled.
title: Doctoral Research Scholarship

templatetext:
#CLOSER #BRAVER #FASTER
The Role 
At IAG, our purpose is to make your world a safer place. We are customer led and data driven and believe we have important responsibilities to enable the communities and people we service to be safer, stronger and more confident.  In order
          to deliver on this purpose, we expect our people to demonstrate the IAG Spirt, take reasonable care for their Health & Safety and to celebrate and respect diversity in all its forms. 
The purpose of the role is to have delivery capability in Customer Labs, CL Data Strategy & Delivery Optimisation team to stay focused and organised as we deliver solutions towards the CL Data strategic initiatives on which IAG's future decisions
          will be built. 
The Delivery Principal will use lean and agile principles and leverage diversity in thought leadership to scope out and size the problem and solutions and determine the course of action to follow.  
This role would also support and enable CL Data to contribute to the Customer LAB ways of working. 
Key Responsibilities

Lead and manage timely delivery of strategic and prioritised initiatives for CL Data
Build the Huddle Lead capacity for CL Data working across all IAG divisions
Communicating the goals, expected outcomes, approach and risks across Customer Labs and stakeholder networks
Coordinate with other leads in Data Strategy & Delivery Optimisation team to maintain status of initiative using agreed reporting tools and systems and alleviate challenges and issues
Supports team members to identify best methods to contribute / collaborate within and across organisational boundaries
Contribute to Customer Labs Ways of Workings and its continuous improvement
Delegated authority -  Dollar value for approval or role level People authority - No Direct Reports
VARI Assign authority - The right to assign tasks and manage the workload of the team

 Skills & Experience

High result oriented and outcome focussed attitude
Advanced strategy and planning skills
Powerful communication skills including the ability to translate deep technical concepts into simple and easily understood business terms
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
An accomplished thought leader in driving strategy
Exceptional negotiation skills and managerial courage
Strong customer focus and collaborative mindset
Able to lead and coordinate meetings and present to/ engage with senior leadership
Advanced stakeholder management and relationship building skills
Advanced ability in building and inspiring high performing teams
Bachelor's Degree in Business Analysis, Analytics/Data Science, Management Information Systems or related field Industry and/or field experience

 About Us
At IAG, we believe that everyone has a unique point of view to share, shaped by their life experiences, cultures & passions. We celebrate and commit to:
#Proud to be me - we value difference, not sameness
#Together - harnessing our collective wisdom enables us to be our best for our customers & each other
#No boxes - it's not about labels, boxes or categories. It's about building a diverse and inclusive mindset into everything we do
IAG is the largest general insurance group in Australia and New Zealand, with a growing presence in Asia. IAG owns some of the region's most trusted brands, including NRMA Insurance, CGU, SGIO, SGIC, WFI and Swann Insurance.
Let's Talk 
Start your career journey with us and click ‘Apply'!
In addition to a diverse and inclusive culture, some of our benefits include 13% superannuation, 50% insurance discounts, flexible work and leave options, generous parental leave and return to work program, recognition and reward program, and
          various corporate partner discounts.
We encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders to apply for this position.
title: Delivery Principal

templatetext:
Looking to take more ownership of your time and activities? Craving a trust-based culture with the freedom to reach outcomes in your own way? This role will suit an experienced recruiter with a track record of delivering high quality service and
          sustainable results. There’s also a real opportunity to bring or build a team around you.  The role  As a Senior Consultant in our Technology & Digital team you’ll be based in either our Sydney CBD or Parramatta
          offices. We offer a genuinely flexible work environment (very school holiday friendly!) and an opportunity to sit alongside (and hopefully learn from) other established recruiters. A background in contracting/temporary/permanent recruitment
          would be hugely advantageous for this role, although specific Technology recruitment experience is not mandatory - if you possess a strong interest in this space, we are happy to provide training.  We currently focus our energy in the
          following areas:

Data Science and Analytics
Digital
Project Management & Business Analysis
Security & Infrastructure
Software & Development

We’re open to you specialising in one of these areas, or bringing something new to the table.  Our existing client base is diverse, ranging from local digital start-ups to multinational firms with an even split of temporary and permanent
          activity. The ideal person for this role will be creative with a passion for candidate relationships, business development, efficient delivery and achieving fabulous feedback.  What we value  Enabling Success.
          Our mission is to enable the success of our candidates, clients, and colleagues.  Work-life integration is important to us and we adopt a flexible approach to working hours. It’s a culture built on trust and doing what it takes to meet,
          and ultimately exceed, the expectations of all stakeholders. KPI’s are rarely discussed.  Flexibility  Preferably a full-time role, we will consider part-time and are flexible on the location you base yourself
          from (offices in both Sydney CBD and Parramatta, close to public transport), including your home. In exceptional circumstances we are able to provide sponsorship and relocation.  What we can offer you

Top biller incentives, including a chance to travel to Japan/other APAC offices
A small specialist business with a strong APAC network and integrated database
Across APAC last year we worked with 97 of Interbrand’s “Best 100 Global Brands”
Business casual dress daily
Sophisticated technology and systems
Opportunity for career advancement locally and internationally
Our Sydney CBD office has quality end-of-trip facilities and free fitness programs
Cross sharing of leads across APAC region
Sociable, friendly and professional atmosphere
No client location restrictions

A little bit about our history  Founded in Australia in 1989 (as Calibrate Recruitment) and acquired in 2012 by en world, we are now part of a Group providing services to 2800 clients annually with 800 staff across Australia,
          India, Japan, Singapore, Thailand and Vietnam. Last year we worked with 97 of Interbrand’s “Best 100 Global Brands”, which means we get to present some seriously appealing roles to potential candidates across APAC. en world forms part of en
          Japan, Japan’s leading specialist internet-based employment solutions provider and is listed on the Tokyo Stock exchange. There are numerous examples of career mobility within the Group.  Our key verticals in Australia

Accounting, Finance & Corporate Services
Engineering, Manufacturing & Construction
Executive
Sales & Marketing
Supply Chain, Procurement & Logistics
Technology & Digital

Next Steps  If you think this sounds like you and you'd like to explore further, we'd welcome the opportunity to discuss in more detail. Please contact Adriana Haydter on +612 9431 6502. All conversations and applications
          will be treated confidentially.  To submit an application, please click the "Apply for this job" button and we'll be in touch shortly.
title: Senior Recruitment Consultant - Technology & Digital

templatetext:
GHD is one of the world's leading professional services companies operating in the global markets of water, energy and resources, environment, property and buildings, and transportation. With a global network of 10,000 professionals, we combine
          the benefit of local knowledge with an ability to access our people from anywhere, helping clients enjoy the rewards of a one GHD network.
 
We operate in an environment where the power of technology is advancing at an astonishing rate. Regardless of business size or industry, digital transformation is vital. Our digital services have been designed to help our clients reimagine their
          future business model, to improve the customer experience and reduce total cost of ownership of infrastructure assets. GHD Digital helps our clients to think differently, to embrace rapidly emerging digital advancements and to future-proof their
          businesses. Please visit our website for more information: www.ghd.com/en/services/digital.aspx.
  
The team:
 
Our Data and Analytics team understand that big data means nothing without intelligent insights. Using leading edge data analytics and business intelligence technology, we help clients see patterns in their data and find insights to improve the
          way the business operates. We work clients to help make better business decisions.  
  
The role:
 
Reporting to the Practice Director, Data & Analytics; as a Business Analyst, you will be working on external client facing projects and be responsible for defining detailed requirements, analysing business needs, and the validation of reporting
          solutions including the provision of dashboard solutions that will enable the achievement of the clients’ overall goals.
  
Key responsibilities include:


Reviews and collects business requirements related to data, business intelligence and analytics through workshops, interviews, document analysis, surveys, use cases, business process descriptions, and workflow analysis.


On-going analytical support through the utilisation of data management, modelling and technology. 


Identifies, analyses, and interprets trends and patterns in complex data sets, drawing insights that will aid the business in developing a suitable course of action.


Regularly audits system data in order to guarantee compliance, accuracy, and duplication management. 


Designing of targeted reports and dashboards that will provide insight and enable sound business decision-making.


Collaboration with the rest of the Data and Analytics team and broader Digital business


Identify process automation opportunities and functions that will streamline current and future data management and reporting for the business. 


Maintain a clear understanding of analytics, reporting, and technology and apply this knowledge to develop and recommend solutions that will further enhance the business’s competitive edge and place the business at an advantage over competition
              at all fronts in the market.


Desired Skills and Experience


3 to 8 years’ experience of relevant, data related business experience


Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Information Technology, Economics, Information Systems, Statistics, Applied Math, Business Administration, or any other related field

Strong analytical skills and the capacity to interpret quantitative and qualitative data
Strong problem solving skills
Strong visualisation skills with tools such as PowerBI, Tableau etc.
Intermediate to Advanced SQL skills
Strong inter-personal and communication skills
Proven team player, with the ability to develop and maintain internal and external relationships
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Excellent written and verbal communication
Proven team player, with the ability to develop and maintain internal and external relationships

Why work for GHD?

It is an exciting time to join GHD Digital as we are on the cusp of the new digital revolution;  
You will have exposure to interesting IOT asset data; 
You will be surrounded and inspired by leading industry specialists; 
Working in a multidisciplinary environment promotes a collaborative working environment; 
We are proud of our culture, and promote flexible working arrangements, foster gender balance and diversity

We are committed to creating a nurturing environment where people are empowered and are encouraged to bring their whole-self to work.


We offer a professional and friendly culture based on our core values of Safety, Teamwork, Respect and Integrity. 


GHD also provides attractive career and lifestyle options including professional development through the GHD Business School, flexible work options and family-friendly practices.


Please click the following link to apply.

title: Data Scientist - Machine Learning Engineer

templatetext:
Progressive Government Department
Initial contract until 30 June 2019 + extensions
Premium hourly rates $$

A highly regarded Federal Government Departments is looking to engage an experienced Data Scientist to join a multi-disciplinary team to use cutting-edge technologies providing actionable insights, innovative strategies
            and tailored solutions within the department. The successful Data Scientist will be offered an Initial contract until June 2019 + 12 month extension options and rewarding hourly rate. The successful Data Scientist will be responsible for, but not limited to;

Working within the department to develop the project requirement's prototype
Creating the foundational infrastructure needed to enable future data science projects
Developing machine learning models for the analysis of structured and unstructured data
Contribute to the development of a data science framework and practice
Solving problems by understanding their needs, the data and systems to produce machine learning models

The successful Data Scientist must have experience in the following

Minimum 3 years’ experience as a Data Scientist
Demonstrated achievements and knowledge of machine-learning and natural language processing
Demonstrated skills in R of Python including expert level understanding of relevant ML packages and libraries is advantageous
Ability to explain technical data science concepts to stakeholders from non-technical backgrounds
Bachelor’s degree in quantitative field (e.g. physics, engineering, computer science, etc)

This is a rare opportunity for an experienced Data Scientist to join a reputable organisation. The successful Data Scientist will be offered an initial contract until June 2019 + 12 month
            extension options at a competitive hourly rate. If you have the required skills, DON'T DELAY, APPLY NOW please forward your resume to jobs@hitechaust.com quoting reference number JB0057 for
            further information. For more opportunities go to www.hitechaust.com
title: Data Scientist - Machine Learning, Python

templatetext:
Spatial Scientist – NSW Government    A Spatial Scientist is required by a NSW Government Department in the Sydney CBD to work on a transformation program focused around the way digital data
        is captured, maintained and delivered throughout the state.    This role will support the role out of new property data services to Local Government and other NSW Government agencies, by providing technical support and advice
        to the Program Manager, team members and clients.     Selection criteria:

Strong communication and client relationship management skills 
Concise and accurate documentation of business processes 
 Experience with:

GIS packages, such as ESRI, MapInfo, QGIS
Data translation tools such as FME
Spatial data transfer protocols, in particular Web Feature Services
Databases such as SQL
Process automation utilising spatial data 
Local Government and/or utility service providers 

If you have the relevant experience, apply now with your most recent CV (in Word format)
title: Spatial  Data Scientist

templatetext:
This Leading Financial Technology Services Company is growing their analytics team and looking for a Credit Risk Analyst to join their small team, based in their funky Sydney office.As a Risk Analyst you will delve directly into data to
          gain meaningful insights into their portfolio and its performance. You will be involved in the end-to-end credit lifecycle from development of decisioning models and policy rules, to building delinquency forecasts and stress testing. You will
          create elegant solutions to optimise their return on risk.Responsibilities: 

Develop, monitor, and review risk models.
Determine the impact of policy changes on their portfolio performance.
Work with the Senior Risk Analyst to develop strategies for deploying changes in into their Credit Decision Engine.
Engage with the wider Risk Insights and Solutions (RIS) team to leverage their experience and improve results.
Collaborate with the wider business to identify how RIS impacts their activities.
 

3 + years of experience in an analytics environment, ideally focusing on credit risk
An undergraduate degree in a quantitative discipline (mathematics, statistics, engineering, econometrics, actuarial science, etc), postgraduate study preferred.
Your ability to work independently, generate ideas, and challenge the status quo.
An understanding of the consumer or business lending process.
Your quantitative and/or mathematics background, and your ability to apply it in the real world.
Being able to analyse data, generate insights, communicate findings.
Having started your journey in learning some programming with a keen interest in learning new technologies.
• R / Python / SAS / MATLAB programming or similar experience with a keen interest in learning new technologies
 Please apply online or email your resume to daniela@talentinsights.com.au
title: Data Scientist- Credit Risk Projects

This role is a perfect opportunity for a Junior Data Scientist experienced with Cognitive Services to take career to the next level! 

Reputable company
Melbourne CBD
Opporutnity to work on the latest technologies

This role is a great opportunity for a Junior Data Scientist looking to get exposed to working on exciting projects and new technologies. 
This company is a market leader specialisting in analytics. Currently expanding, they are looking for a Junior Data Scientist with strong fundamental knowledge, strong in maths and commercially minded.

Ideally, you would have 1-2 years of experience
You have good fundamental knowledge of maths, data science, programming
PhD is desired but not essential

Ideally, you have been exposed to working with Azure Cognitive Services
You have excellent communication skills and ability to communicate and manage stakeholders

A Senior Data Scientist is required at one of Australia’s most recognised companies.  
        
Attractive remuneration package
Work on state-of-the-art projects
Work with complex datasets
  The role of a Senior Data Scientist at this company will involve leading a data driven project centred around customer insights and analytics. This is an opportunity to join one of Australia’s most recognised companies with
        a national presence. The role will involve joining together disparate data sources to develop a cohesive reporting and campaign system.  Requirements 

Degree qualified in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer science or relevant field.
Strong understanding of AI

Experience working within a media environment highly desirable

        to bella.frater@s2p.com.au
title: Senior Data Scientist
Senior Data Scientist

templatetext:
Your new role with a financial services organisation will encompass data modelling and analytics including the design, development and implementation of scorecards and portfolio risk monitoring models across the credit life cycle and well as providing
          insights into optimisation of risk and collection related strategies.
Your role:

Design and development of scorecards and models across the credit life cycle (e.g. application, behaviour, fraud and collection scorecards) for the retail credit portfolio
Review and update portfolio risk monitoring models and assist in the reporting of portfolio risk
Contribute to the Financial Planning processes e.g. loss & IFRS9 compliant reserve forecasting, recovery forecasting, capacity planning etc.
Development and monitoring of credit scoring, risk segmentation, predictive models and other modelling techniques to enhance credit decision making as well as optimize acquisition, collections and recovery activities.
Partner with Credit Risk and Collection Teams to support credit strategies through account level performance based analytics and design of appropriate champion/challenger tests as well as preparing policy options/changes/recommendations based
            on analytics and/or regulatory requirements.
Partner with Enterprise Risk on Risk Appetite Frameworks, KRIs and Stress Testing of the portfolio
Partner with key stakeholders such as regional lending teams, dealer sales Head Office, strategic planning, compliance etc. to drive improvements in business process.

Your skills:

Educated to a degree level in data science/quantitative disciplines such as statistics, finance, engineering, mathematics etc.
A successful track record in Analytics, Credit Risk Management or related field (min 2 years)
Strong experience in statistical model building is essential
Strong analytical skills, experience in business use of statistics is a pre-requisite. Strong working knowledge of SQL, SAS, R, Excel, Word and PowerPoint

If interested please apply directly or call Matthew on 0282512110. Thanks.
Sthree Australia is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.
title: Data Scientist

templatetext:
Our client is an established global Asset Manager with exceptional pedigree and offices in Sydney and London.
Key to their research and rigorous decision making processes are in-house built and be-spoke quantitative tools, which are valued by the investment analysts to provide them with the insights needed to uncover true value in the global equities
          markets.
These tools ingest large data sets across thousands of market indicators from a variety of sources, but their performance is attributed to the creative quantitative data engineers, who shape and develop these tools to drive meaningful insights. 
As a senior engineer in the team you will take ownership of the front-to-back development of these tools, including the delivery of the web-based application interface, to the statistical modelling in R to drive the analytics engine, to the management
          of their data environment and infrastructure.
This is the perfect role for an exceptional data engineer who has complemented their software development skills with the additional education in areas such as Mathematics and Statistics. You may well be an aspiring data scientist or already be
          on that journey, but to be successful in this rewarding and high performance role, you will need to possess deep technical development skills (R, SQL, web development and Linux systems) and have the grounding in Maths to know how to apply the
          data and question it’s commercial use.
If this sounds like the next step in your career, please contact me with your resume for a confidential discussion at jeremy.taylor@tomexecutive.com
title: Senior Data Scientist

templatetext:
Awesome opportunity for a Data Analytics Engineer to join this awesome new team within an enterprise, TV & Content Media Delivery
You will be responsible for the robust and efficient delivery of the streaming media products and services for the TV and Content division for the brand new enterprise team.
What you will be doing

Identifying key metrics and insights from stakeholders in business / marketing / engineer / management and operations
Working with various business division teams to determine how to collect data safely and efficiently
Design Data storage and security retrieval mechanism
Conduct analysis of data to derive performance improvements
Design Flow Diagrams that indicate intelligence dashboards
Ensure data integrity across multiple sources through the inclusion of end-to-end unique user id / token / session information

What you will ideally have 

7 + Years as a data-scientist / Data Engineer / Business analyst
High volume / traffic experience, managing operations of high traffic, real-time consumer-facing web and mobile applications and large data sets
Web Architecture: Experience with tech stacks such as CDN, Load Balancers, Web servers, API, microservices, Databases.
Programming languages; R & Python
Experience with tech stacks such as CDN, Load Balancers, Web servers, API, microservices, Databases.
You are obi-wan of the data world, with a passion for new tech and the ability to manage a challenge!

If this is the role for you apply today to be considered, successful applicants will get called for more info! 
 
 
 To be considered for the role click the 'Apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Coral Shankland on 0294645631. Please quote our job reference number: 200183374.
title: Data Scientist - Machine Learning Engineer

templatetext:
Here you'll have the opportunity to influence and shape a core AI Analytics product that is used by a significant client roster of FMCG/Retail brands. If scalability in offering and global product appeal is what you're after then you'll
        love it here.  As a Lead Software Engineer you'll be required to take the lead on the products engineering, collaborate with product managers, data scientists and the Co Founders to bring forward new iterations and features. Experience
        sought: 

Python 
People and Engineering Management
Increasing code quality (lifting the bar) 
Stakeholder management and collaboration
Cloud migration (AWS, GCP or Azure) 
 This is a significant opportunity to join a highly professional start up based moments from Central Station (Surry Hills). Great offices, a really cool vibe and quality work.  To learn more contact ronny@theonset.com.au
title: Lead Software Engineer

templatetext:
About the job
Boral’s data team creates the infrastructure that empowers the business to make better decisions. As part of this new entrepreneurial team, you will craft solutions to help productionize and deploy machine learning models and build services for
          operational systems to consume.
As a Data Engineer in Boral you’ll be guiding and contributing to the data team development process. You will guide the data scientists in the team on software engineering process, assisting them with productionising and orchestrating of their
          pipelines and models. You will consult with the business and assist in designing and implementing cloud solutions to drive value from our data for continuous improvement and operational excellence. You will be working with data generated from
          our various operational mobile (Trucks) and fixed assets (Machinery). Additionally you’ll work closely with end users to refine and expose insights effectively across the business.  
Boral is building Australia’s infrastructure for the future, laying the foundations for residential, commercial and civil projects. Boral’s data team will play a pivotal role helping Boral Australia’s 6,500 employees work in safer environment,
          be the number one choice for our customers and employees and assist in more informed decisions to continuously improve our operations.
Responsibilities

Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve Boral’s data software projects (Data pipelines and services)
Identify and implement new features and feature gaps, provide guidance on existing issues, and collaborate with product owners, data scientists and engineers to influence the future of Boral’s data platform
Solve complex Cloud deployments and DevOps challenges with support from vendor customer engineers
Work with data scientists to engineer innovative, high impact data products for Boral

Our offer to you

A culture of continual improvement that seeks to transform and create technology and market leading outcomes
A working environment that is supportive and dynamic with a clear focus on continually encouraging and developing their people
The opportunity to make a real and visible difference in the market and for customers/users, helping transform a blank canvas into a showcase for Digital Solutions at one of Australia’s most iconic brands
Exposure to a wide variety of data sources, ranging from customer data to telematic and manufacturing data
Transport options (Public bus, Keoride, Boral bus)

Please click on the apply button or visit http://careers.boral.com.au
title: Data Engineer

templatetext:
Data Steward I’m currently looking for a new Data Steward to help implement a new enterprise data governance framework. Your main task will be to help set up the new frameworks / processes with different businesses areas,
          maintain effective governance across assigned business units and help data stewards in the business to follow the new strategy. 
In a nutshell, you will be the expert around the proper use of data. Hence, your mandate will be to engage various business heads and data users to establish how they use their data and if they comply with privacy laws.  Conducting data governance
          assessments, supporting business data champions/stewards and evolving the established framework will be your main task. 
Experience Required: 
• Experience as a Data steward or Governance who understands privacy law and how to classify data accordingly to privacy law (i.e. APRA, CPG)• A background in data governance and data quality is essential • Able to work
          autonomously and maintain effective communication with different stakeholders ranging from very technical (i.e. data scientist) to non-technical (i.e. head of marketing ) will be crucial. • Experience in understanding how data is being
          consumed (i.e. have good understanding of data warehousing, data analysis, reporting etc).• Be the thought leader behind a data driven culture and co-create the new frameworks
This is a very high profile role joining at the start of what will be an exciting greenfield journey for this outstanding business.Please contact me on eli.gunduz@tomexecutive.com to discuss further.
title: Data Steward

templatetext:
Product ManagerAI/Data Analytics AUD 140,000 - AUD 160,000 + SuperThe CompanyEstablished 3 years ago by Founders with a diverse skill-set across Business, Data Science
        and Design, this growing tech business already have an established range of products and international clients. Utilising AI Products, their mission is to reduce costs by simplifying the complexities of data science through human-centred
        design principles. What will I be doing?In this newly created position, you will build a brand new, scalable Product, to be used internationally. You will work closely with the founders, data scientists, software
        engineers as well as customers to determine the best possible product and to drive it into its market.Main responsibilities include:

Own the Product roadmap, strategy and execution
Agree on the vision with founders, client and the team
Ensure product is fitting for customers as well as being scalable by ensuring a market fit
Assist with making key business decisions and market analysis in support of the Product development
 What do I need?You will have a proven track record of building end-end products whether in a large or small organisation. With several years of experience behind you, you will have the technical, analytical, and communication
        skills to ensure a viable product is built whilst working with a world-class team of data scientists and engineers. Interested? Either apply directly or send your profile to paul@theonset.com.au. No Cover Letter necessary.
title: Product Manager

templatetext:
Award winning independent agency is seeking an experienced Group Account Director to join their growing team.    Due to strong business growth, there is an opportunity for a Group Account Director to join this established and
          successful agency.    The ideal candidate would have strong digital agency credentials as well as CRM, data and customer focussed marketing experience, preferably within the financial services or telecommunications industry.Key
          to the success of this role is your leadership experience; proven ability to nurture and support a growing account service team; ability to lead and work with cross functional teams including creatives, strategists, data scientists and technologists.          Your client relationship skills are paramount - you must be able to develop a true partnership built on respect, trust and the motivation to deliver innovative, insightful, customer first communications.     This is an
          opportunity to sit on the management team and work with other  inspiring leaders, giving you the opportunity to grow your portfolio of clients and to be an integral member of this well regarded, industry awarded agency. If you have
          the the relevant digital agency experience, driven, a passionate leader with a strong customer engagement focus, we'd love to hear from you.
title: Group Account Director

templatetext:
Working with an advanced data team.
Fantastic team culture.
Flexible working hours.

 
Summary of the team
An exciting data position based in the CBD in which you will be able to grow your already strong data modelling, data development and data warehousing skills. The team are very collaborative and you will be expected to be a flexible individual
            who is not tied down to just doing the basics. If you see some interesting and useful work that needs to be done it will be expected that you step up and take control. The environment is an advanced data team within a growing team. They are
            looking for innovative and creative people to join a really tight team culture.
Summary of the role

Completing the end to end process
Data warehousing, data modelling and data development
Engage with various stakeholders across the business
Work closely with data developers, data engineers and data scientists

Experience expected

Excellent MSBI stack and PowerBI skills 
Strong end to end experience is essential
Good communication skills in order to liaise with stakeholders
Solid BI knowledge

 
Culture

A supportive team environment. 
You will be working experienced Data Engineers, Data Scientists and Data Developers.
The option of flexibile working hours.

If you are interested in these positions please apply directly or contact Laura Nailard at laura @precisionsourcing.com.au
title: BI Developer

templatetext:
Challenge yourself in this fast paced, fun environment
An opportunity to be bold and innovative in your approach
Fantastic career development within a large team

Who are We?
Our vision is simple: To provide our customers with quality fashion and basics for everyone at low prices. An iconic Australian retailer, our story began in 1926 when George Lindsay and Alex McKenzie opened a drapery store in Geelong, Victoria
            with a focus on great quality and value.
Over 90 years on, we’ve grown & evolved, but our philosophy remains the same.  Part of the Wesfarmers group, one of Australia’s largest employers, we’re immensely proud of our history and building our store network to over 300 stores
            across Australia and over 13,000 team members who work as part of the Target brand across our Store operations and in our Store Support Office in addition to our team based in our Asian sourcing offices.
We are seeking an experienced Customer Insights Data Analyst to join our Marketing team based in our Store Support Office in Williams Landing in West Melbourne. 
What will you do?
The key focus in this role will be to execute the customer analytics program, enabling timely business decisions geared toward driving positive commercial outcomes for Target, in line with Target’s values.
Other key responsibilities may include:

Source and manage efficient tools and database infrastructure, including our customer transactional data that achieves business aims.

Organisation, maintenance, analysis and reporting of data across multiple sources

Analyse and organize the data available to the business.
Develop, build and maintain regular analytics reports including product data, basket associations, RFM segmentation, loyalty and penetration measures



Ongoing maintenance of Data Management Platform (DMP)

Ability to manage/optimize/mine complex sets of campaign and audience data
Develop actionable media recommendations and strategies supported by analytics
Create data / audience sets and profiles that feed into larger programmatic buying solutions


Evaluation of marketing program effectiveness and clear communication of results/insights

What are we looking for?
The ideal candidate will have a Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Econometrics, Applied Statistics, Engineering or related field along with strong working experience in a similar role.  Advanced analytics / data scientist skills is essential
            as is understanding of Advanced Analytics best practice and standards as they relate to retail, loyalty and CRM, experience in using CRM and Data Management Platforms, along with strong project management skills and ability to demonstrate
            good business and commercial acumen.
Target values diversity and we pride ourselves on representing the diverse and multicultural communities of which we are a part. 
Agencies will only be engaged if required. Please do not contact us or send applicants to us unless requested to by the Recruitment Team.
title: Customer Insights Data Analyst

templatetext:
About us:
Primary Health Care is one of Australia's leading publically listed healthcare companies. The Primary pathology subsidiary SDS Pathology is an amalgamated business comprised of a number of well-established brands across Australia.
Dorevitch Pathology is a leading provider of pathology and medical diagnostic services to doctors, specialists and hospitals throughout Victoria, as well as commercial and Government organisations in Australia and internationally.
About the position:
Our Warringal laboratory is currently seeking an experienced Laboratory Assistant to work in our 24/7 laboratory at the Warringal Private Hospital.
Be part of our dynamic team where your self-motivation, enthusiasm and innovation will compliment your technical abilities in this pivotal role. Your duties would include prompt sorting, processing and accessioning of pathology specimens, data
          entry and supporting the scientist in the lab as required.
About you:
You will thrive in a busy environment, and have the ability to work in a fast pace multi-skilled laboratory and demonstrate high attention to detail. A strong customer focus is essential.
Key requirements:

Effective verbal and written communication
Accurate data entry skills
Commitment toward good customer service
Demonstrated understanding of quality and confidentiality
Ability to work with minimal supervision
Ability to work efficiently in a team
Attention to detail
Quality focused

It is currently a Friday shift, but will require your flexibility to cover leave on the other days Monday to Thursday. You may also be required for rostering on public holidays and weekends.
Applications:
Please send your applications to:
Ms Chris Culliver
Chris.Culliver@dorevitch.com.au
All appointments are made subject to the successful applicant having full immunity against Hepatitis B, providing evidence of such and a current satisfactory National Police Certificate.
You must have the right to live and work in Australia to apply for this job.
title: Laboratory Assistant (Part time job share)
Become a Data Visualisation specialist via paid training and industry placement

templatetext:
WorkCover Queensland is committed to making a positive difference to people’s lives. Our purpose is simple: we partner with and support our customers to keep Queenslanders working. Our customers are at the heart of everything we do. We aim to
          understand our customers deeply to deliver valued experiences and tailored solutions. Our people are connected to purpose and we’re creating an environment that inspires them to make a difference.
About the role
Our brand new Data Engineer position will join our Data Infrastructure team within our larger Solutions and Technology Group. Your range of responsibilities will be focused understanding WorkCover’s data and delivering data pipelines to underpin
          business systems and decisions. You will work with a range of internal stakeholders such as data scientists and software developers to understand data driven needs and implement robust processes to produce accurate data sets for analysis. You
          will actively participate in a team that is committed to a consultative culture and making a difference. Your key responsibilities will see you:

Understand data sources, ingestion and consumption use-cases, data quality, latency and other considerations such as data and storage formats, persistence needs, data volatility, business rules & aggregations and other data consideration.
Design data pipelines, create and build dimensional models and data schemas.
Maintain system configuration and processes documentation and manage change control for the data pipeline.
Develop end to end data pipeline solution including integration, scheduling, transformation and consolidation
Ensure data pipeline is operationalised, monitored and supported to uphold model performance and prevention of outages
Develop and maintain strong relationships with key internal customers, providing expert advice regarding the effective use of data pipelines and delivery of data sets

About you
We are looking for a passionate, pragmatic and highly collaborative team player who has a proven track record of delivery in an Agile environment and thrives on working in a culture of delivery and continuous improvement.
With a minimum of six years experience in data engineering, warehousing, pipelines or development of BI reporting, you will enjoy building relationships with internal customers and stakeholders and providing expert advice to support joint goals.
          Your relationships are underpinned by your understanding and experience in:

Design and creation of data pipelines
Data modelling (SQL and NoSQL databases).
Automation tools
Programming languages (e.g. Java, Python, R).
Structured and un-structured data  
Relational and non-relational databases.
Change management processes and practices
Monitoring and administration of data pipelines.

How do I apply?
Please submit your resume and covering letter via the ‘Apply Now’ link with applications closing at 9:00am Monday 11th February 2019.

title: Data Engineer

templatetext:
Fun and collaborative work environment 
Join a global Fortune 500 organisation based in Sydney
AECOM offer flexible working options that reflect the needs of the modern workforce

The Role
AECOM's Sydney Environmental group is the lead provider of contaminated land assessment, impact assessment, and remediation services in NSW. AECOM provides environmental services across all market sectors including oil and gas, defence, government,
          mining, manufacturing, energy, waste and land development.
A rewarding opportunity exists for an experienced Data Scientist as a self-starting Technical Officer - Data Management Support in our Geosciences and Remediation Services workgroup in Sydney. Reporting to the
          Workgroup Manager- Geosciences and Remediation Services, you will primarily work in consultation with both the National and NSW Data Managers, and will be responsible for the management of data obtained from a wide range of environmental field
          programs including contaminated sites. 
You will be part of a team that provides data management solutions for our environmental projects with an eye for improving efficiency and accuracy in the data collection, reporting and analysis process.  With an uncompromising commitment
          to health and safety and client service, you will be an experienced Data Manager who will be able to multi-task, contribute to and prepare reports independently.
Located in the centre of the Sydney CBD in our modern offices, AECOM provides a great place to work where we place a high priority on a fun and engaging work environment offering career development and mentoring as well as social and wellbeing
          opportunities.
You will be working with driven professionals across various end-markets who are passionate, smart, creative, curious and quirky but proud to be part of a company that is dedicated to delivering a better world.
About You
Ideally you will have:

Experience with scientific data collection and analysis
At least three years’ experience with MS Excel, Access and SQL database Training in data management systems
Experience using ESdat and EQuIS
Attention to detail and data entry skills
Experience working with project/client specific databases
Ability to trouble shoot and problem solve
Have previous experience in data management with a desire for quality outcomes
Be committed to safety in the workplace
Be enthusiastic, energetic and hard working
Be eager to learn, be mentored by industry leaders and to share your own knowledge.

To be eligible to apply you must have Australian citizenship.
Benefits at AECOM
We provide a diverse and inclusive work environment and offer many benefits to ensure your professional development & wellbeing.

Flexible start and finish times, working from home, part time and job share options
State of the art, modern and contemporary offices
Paid Parental and Partner Leave
Purchased additional annual leave +  salary packaging  
Corporate Employee discounts from up to 400 retailers
Wellbeing benefits e.g. vaccinations,  health insurance discounts
Employee stock purchase plans
Professional memberships
Study assistance  
Professional and technical development opportunities
title: Technical Officer - Data Management Support

company: Morgan Campbell - the #1 SAP Recruitment Experts
title: SAP BW/BI Architect - New Zealand

templatetext:
UI/UX Designer Developer  The perks don't stop at collaborating with great people on exciting and innovative projects. We also offer Super, Flexible Work Hours, Time-off, Bonus on Achievements - and a Culture of Learning.  DESCRIPTION  Our team is looking for passionate, experienced UI/UX Developers to join us in scaling the new payment platform. As a UI/UX Developer, you will help solve a variety of technical challenges through design
          innovation and create an end-to-end experience that will drive customer adoption and satisfaction. You will help invent new features, design, develop and deploy next generation payment products as the company undergoes a re-brand. The position
          on offer will depend on your experience and skill-set.  If you are an experienced developer that really wants to make a difference in customer experience, we would love to talk to you. In our team, you will have the opportunity to: 


Build exciting new web services and products


Work directly with developers as your customers and shape the vision of your product


Brainstorm, prototype, test, and iterate on new ideas


Work with the latest technologies and tools


Learn from others and help grow those in your team


See the positive impact of your work on real customers


Thrive in a start-up, innovative environment


Work on user facing products include customer on-boarding flow, performance dashboard, payment pages and flows.


Collaborate with cross functions (designers, product managers, data scientist, sales and marketing managers) to come up and conduct experiments to improve user experience and reduce frictions.


Collaborate with Product Managers, Sales and Marketing to iterate on the design and implementation of our product


BASIC QUALIFICATIONS


Bachelors and/or Masters degree, preferably in CS, or equivalent experience


4+ years of software development experience


Fluency in HTML, CSS, and related web technologies


Experience with modern JavaScript libraries and tooling (e.g. React, Agular)


Awareness of cross-browser compatibility issues and client-side performance considerations


Knowledge of Git


CI/CD experience


Have cross platform design experience (web, iOS, Android, email)


Experience creating prototypes or highly detailed wire-frames for complex web applications and/or workflows


An online portfolio demonstrating samples of enterprise work and UX deliverables (wireframes, journey maps, personas) is required to apply for this role


Solid ability to present a strong rationale for design decisions


Rigor in designing for a beautiful customer experience


Ability to work well with others


THE IDEAL CANDIDATE


Experienced in delivering UX solutions for projects of large scope and complexity


Experience with UX design for technical end users or domain experts


Experience in video game development


Experienced in performing user research or gathering quantitative customer data


Fluency in best practices for information architecture and interaction design, user-centred design process, as well as strong knowledge of user experience principles, techniques and patterns


Experienced in performing user research or gathering quantitative customer data


Able to bring new knowledge and ideas to the team


Demonstrated ability for innovation in a fast paced environment


For further information on this role or to confidentially apply, please contact Andy Helsby on 02 8227 9200 or apply directly via the Apply for this job button.
          Only WORD FORMAT resumes will be accepted.
