title: UX Developer

templatetext:
Green Light are assisting in delivering projects for an industry leading organisation and have an immediate requirement for a talented Sr Data Engineer. The Data Engineer will be working on Data Transformation
        project. The successful candidate will have extensive experience with Data Integration, Data Migration, Data Quality and Data Architecture.  Responsibilities include: 

Work as a lead and takes the responsibility to work on the solution and controls
Build robust, efficient and reliable data pipelines consisting of diverse data sources to ingest and process data into Cloud based data lake platform
Design and develop real time streaming and batch processing pipeline solutions
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements
Design, develop and implement data pipelines for data migration & collection, data analytics and other data movement solutions
Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs
Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems
Optimise data systems and build them from the ground up.
They will support software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects.
 Essential skills and experience: 

Australian Citizenship
Demonstrable experience working in designing and architecting and with full development cycle .
Developed and demonstrated scalable and robust end to end data quality solution
Conducted workshops with Data Governance/business stakeholders to formulate data standardization rules to maintain consistency of data representation.
Interpreted Data Governance specifications into technical specifications to cleanse the data using SAP Data Service Tool
Analysed and collected data profiling stats for different entities in SAP CRM System.
Designed processes using technologies such as SAP Data Services
Understands Address Data and its relationship. - Address Data Profiling and Data Quality Report.
Developed Data Service Jobs to cleanse address data.
Tuned multiple parameters for each iteration to cleanse address data.
Profile business partner and its relationship data and prepare data health check report.
Developed SQL scripts in HANA to analyze data and develop jobs in SAP BODS for data cleanse.
Ability to work in team in diverse/ multiple stakeholder environment
Experience in working in a fast-paced Agile environment
BS in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field
  If you are interested, please call Deeksha Khanna- 0412 644 681 or APPLY NOW.
title: Senior Data Engineer

templatetext:
High growth organisation
Leadership position
Have a positive impact on your community

Highly regarded amongst its peers, and renowned as a values centric, contemporary and services focused organisation, our client has an enduring and positive impact on many lives.  Significant in scale and with a sophisticated approach, they
          provide great career experiences for their employees. Due to the further development of their corporate structure, they now seek a Head of Analytics to lead data analysis and insights.
A critical position that will assist in driving the strategic direction of key elements of the organisation, the position responsibilities will include:

Developing and disseminating performance dashboards and reports
Data preparation, analysis, modelling
Development, implementation and maintenance of decision-support tools
Data architecture and integrity governance
Input into standards and methods
Collaboratively drive the implementation of software, tools and technologies for data storage and analysis

Your experience may come from a variety of contexts where there is high volume of communication with large numbers of members, customers or stakeholders. You will be adept at:

Problem-solving business questions to maximise outcomes, assessing stakeholder requirements and building business intelligence reports
Developing hypothesis testing, correlation and factor analysis
Analysing and interpreting data queries from large databases
Developing and building models and decision-support tools
Preparing and presenting reports and recommendations to change behaviour or inform decision making
Developing reports and performing analysis to address business questions

It is an exciting time to join this growing organisation. With a direct report to the Executive Director and interactions with a high calibre team, this position will suit your collaborative, customer focused and adaptable approach, and see you
          using your exceptional analysis, problem solving and communication skills in a position that has highly visible impact.
Apply today and see your career take a new dimension.
 
deliberatepractice is a vibrant, contemporary, leading HR consulting firm. For over 8 years we have delivered contemporary and practical HR solutions, drawing upon our deep specialisation in HR Recruitment, Leadership Assessment & Development and Outplacement.
title: Head of Analytics

salary: AU$111,663 - AU$130,848 plus up to 15.4% super
templatetext:
The Position 
Data61 has an exciting new opportunity to join the Graph Visualisation team in Data61.
We are currently designing and building a new data visualisation platform that will have real impact for Australia. We are seeking a creative front end engineer to join our StellarGraph project and to work together creating practical data visualisation
          products for Australian government and industry.
We work in an open, collaborative environment with flexible working hours where people can take ownership of their area, experiment with new technologies, and can learn and grow to their full potential.
Your duties will include:

To design and build beautiful user interfaces and to ensure their implementation is efficient, elegant and maintainable.
Implement graph visualisation applications using front-end technologies.
Experiment with technologies, evaluate and present the results.
Collaborate effectively with engineering, research, UI/UX and product teams.
Maintain high ethical and performance standards.

Location:      Docklands VIC, Canberra ACT or Eveleigh, Sydney NSWSalary:          AU$111,663 - AU$130,848 plus up to 15.4% superannuation  Tenure:      
            Fixed term until July 2020Reference:    57663
To be successful you will need:

Bachelor degree in a scientific or engineering discipline such as Computer Science or equivalent commercial experience in software engineering
Ability to think creatively and prototype new ideas.
Experience with ReactJS
Experience with two or more of the following web technologies: JavaScript, CSS, HTML5, SVG, ES6, TypeScript, NodeJS

For details about who to contact and for more information please view the Position Description 
We’re working hard to recruit diverse people and ensure all our people feel supported to do their best work and empowered to let their ideas flourish.
Flexible Working Arrangements
We work flexibly at CSIRO, offering a range of options for how, when and where you work. Talk to us about how this role could be flexible for you. Balance
About CSIRO
At CSIRO you can be part of helping to solve big, complex problems that make a real difference to our future. We spark off each other, learn from each other, trust each other and collaborate to achieve more than we could individually in a supportive,
          rewarding, inclusive and truly flexible environment. 
CSIRO’s Data61 business unit is the largest data innovation group in Australia, bringing together approximately 600 research and development staff working
          in digital technologies to create benefit for Australia. Data61 develops Australia's future leaders with its strong 300+ PhD student program in collaboration with our best universities across Australia.
CSIRO’s Commitment to Diversity
We’re working hard to recruit diverse people and ensure all our people feel supported to do their best work and empowered to let their ideas flourish.
Apply Online
To apply online, please provide a CV and letter outlining your suitability and motivation for the role.
Applications Close
Friday 01March 2019, 11.59pm AEST

title: Font End Engineer

templatetext:
The Company
My client is redesigning the future of healthcare with an ambitious goal of making consumers the CEO of their own health and delivering the most optimal healthcare in the hands of everyone in the world. Their focus is simple - produce an AI platform
          trained by doctors and built by computer data scientists to help self-triage the patients to the right level of care.
 
The Role
As a NLP Scientist, you will use your next level skills in machine learning and natural language to help us create a new generation of personalised healthcare.
We're not looking for a cog in a machine. We want someone with creativity, self-motivation and a pride in their work to be a core member of our diverse and talented team.
In return we offer the opportunity for you to take a leading role working on products that create meaningful change in peoples lives.
 
What you’ll do

Develop methods for our information retrieval and relation extraction pipeline
Research on text representation, entity recognition, text summarisation, disambiguation and coreference resolution
Develop tools, processes and metrics to help build high quality clinical linguistic resources
Prototype new models, evaluate with small scale experiments, and produce solutions at scale to millions of users.
Work with a cross-functional team of engineers, researchers, designers, and others to build new product features.
Create IP and publish papers in reputed international journals and conferences

 
Essential Experience:

Programming in Python (preferred), Java, or C+
Strong understanding of text pre-processing and normalisation techniques, such as tokenisation, POS tagging, parsing and entity linking
Experience with one of the following NLP library: spaCy, NLTK, GATE, CoreNLP, gensim, et al.
Experience with Deep Learning applied to NLP, for example through distributed representations (e.g. Word2Vec, fastText, etc)

 
Desired Experience: 

MS/PhD in Computer Science/ Machine Learning/ Data Mining or equivalent.
Expertise and interest in building healthcare ontologies, clinical taxonomies, and semantic meaning representation frameworks.
Experience with FSMs.
Previous experience in IR, NLU, SMT, or dialog systems.
Published papers at relevant conferences like ACL, EMNLP, NAACL etc
title: NLP Specialist

templatetext:
For over 16 years Quantium have combined the best of human and artificial intelligence to power possibilities for individuals, organisations and society. Our solutions make sense of what has happened and what will, could or should be done to re-shape
          industries and societies around the needs of the people they serve.
As one of the world’s fully diversified data science and AI leaders we operate across every sector of the economy and we’re growing fast - with growth comes opportunity! We’re passionate about building out our team of smart, fun, diverse and motivated
          people.
 The Senior Visual Designer is responsible for leading and championing Quantium’s visual aesthetic across all key communication points, including PowerPoint decks (60-70% of the work), product and client collateral, website,
          content development and animation. You will lead a small team which involves providing guidance, direction and coaching to build the capability of the team. You will develop and sustain trusted advisor relationships with senior stakeholders
          and provide expert advice to deliver best practice visual communication.
While this role can be full time there is also the option for the right person for it to be performed 4 days per week or even in a job share capacity.
Key responsibilities

Maintain brand identity and style guides across the business, ensuring all Quantium’s collateral is consistent and adheres to design standards and principles
Collaborate with various disciplines (CEO, Executive team and Consultants) to transform presentation decks and various collateral into best practice visual communications
Manage the execution of design assets: PowerPoint, product and client collateral, website, company invites, email and other content
Solve problems with innovative visual solutions across PowerPoint, product and client collateral and other content i.e. presenting data in visual and innovative ways
Work cross-functionally with other creative leadership, designers, developers and brand teams – such as the UX and CET teams
Develop clean and effective graphic templates and style guides including ways to translate to the wider business
Manage multiple project requests while simultaneously meeting tight deadlines
Be a trusted advisor and thought leader, providing expert advice to the visual designer
Provide support to the business, assisting in developing diagrams, visualisations, concepts and mock-ups

 Key activities

Champion and lead the Company brand aesthetic throughout the business:
            
Delivering best practice PowerPoint presentations
Delivering simple and clean product collateral that effectively communicates key messaging
Ensure that brand design is consistent throughout the business


Ensure all design brief requests are fulfilled on time and reflect best practice design standards
Build and embed design capability organisation wide, including:
            
Training workshops to build design capability throughout the organisation
Bi-monthly emails communicating different design hacks and design resources available


Strategic comms:
            
Partner with key Executive members to help them solve for innovative design solutions to better communicate key thoughts or ideas


Build great rapport with the key business stakeholders to be considered a trusted leader. This should be facilitated via regular meetings with stakeholders to help them achieve their key collateral that will support the business objectives
Budget management across key projects
Assist marketing with email and website continuous design and communication improvements

Experience and education required
Qualifications and experience:

Minimum 5 years of relevant design experience in a professional services / Technology environment
Formal design training

Skills:

Advanced experience in the Microsoft Office suite, particularly PowerPoint
Advanced experience in Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator and HTML
Strong conceptual development skills with the ability to communicate conceptual ideas and design rationale
Possess exceptional understanding of style guidelines, typography, design processes, and creative workflow
Comfortable giving and receiving critical design feedback
Collaborative style and structured communication (both written and verbal)
Experience in leading, developing and coaching teams in a dynamic, complex, matrixed environment
Experience advising and influencing senior executive stakeholders
Outstanding communication, presentation, and storytelling skills

More about Quantium
As one of the world’s fully diversified data science and AI leaders we operate across every sector of the economy and we’re growing fast - with growth comes opportunity! We’re passionate about building out our team of smart, fun, diverse and motivated
          people.
We combine a team of experts that spans data scientists, actuaries, statisticians, business analysts, strategy consultants, engineers, technologists, programmers, product developers, and futurists – all dedicated to harnessing the power of data
          to drive transformational outcomes for our clients.
We actively foster a culture where our people can stretch themselves to reach their full potential. We also know that work has to work for you, and modern life is fast paced and balance can be tricky. You want to work where you are respected and
          valued as an individual, not a number. Quantium embraces a flexible and supportive environment dedicated to powering possibilities for our team members, clients and partners.
Quantium are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We are a multicultural team of various beliefs, sexual orientations and gender identities. We celebrate our diversity of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation,
          age, marital status and disability status.
Please note, this role is not suitable for Graduates. If you are a graduate and you’d like information about our Graduate Academy please visit https://au.gradconnection.com/employers/quantium/about-us/
 
If you submit an application or expression of interest to The Quantium Group Pty Ltd, we may disclose your application or expression of interest on a confidential basis to our related companies, and joint venture companies, including Quantium
          Health Pty Limited.  We will only make such disclosures for the purpose of considering your application or expression of interest and opportunities in those organisations.
title: Senior Visual Designer

templatetext:
Job description
Quantium Health is a joint venture between Quantium and Discovery Health. We work across clinical, commercial strategy and policy domains, bringing together a unique set of disciplinary backgrounds to solve health care problems using data.
The Role
We have multiple opportunities available in our Canberra office for talented Consultants / Senior Consultants.
The Consultant is a commercial and technical role that delivers high quality end-to-end analytical support across one or two projects within Quantium Health as a member of a project team. The role will see you partnering with internal stakeholders
          and the wider team to execute analytical solutions. You will also manage day to day client engagement and present findings both internally and to clients as required.
The Senior Consultant is an experienced in both analytical techniques and business/Government strategy in order to bring together a knowledge of client needs and Quantium Health solutions. The Senior Consultant will be expected to lead teams of
          Consultants and Analysts across a range of consulting projects.
Responsibilities
As a Consultant, you will:

deliver high quality data analysis, including data quality assessment, ingestion, data manipulation, method selection, design & application, insights generation and visualisation
participate in Intensive learning and acquisition of analytical, technical and commercial skills and obtain Quantium business knowledge to become a proficient Analyst working under minimal supervision
often in collaboration with your internal stakeholders, transform client questions and problems into analytical solutions
communicate analytical solutions in graphical, numeric and written form in concise slides
help clients understand and optimise use of Quantium products and / or solutions

Success as a Consultant will see you proactively owning more complex tasks and design simple analytic modules, rather than just executing them.
As a Senior Consultant, you will:

oversee the delivery of projects or modules within a project to clients, from briefing through to execution, ensuring adherence to quality standards
be accountable for the delivery of the module plan, deliverables, and success across for the portion the project they are responsible for
be responsible for task management including overseeing and delegating technical tasks amongst analysts
use insight to present compelling stories that deliver tangible commercial value
contribute to building capabilities of Quantium Health employees
support the Lead Consultant with solution design, business development and thought leadership for our clients

Success as a Senior Consultant will see you delivering large, complex, analytical solutions for our clients using your technical and commercial skills.
Experience  

Tertiary qualifications in engineering, mathematics, actuarial studies, statistics, physics, or a related discipline
Experience in an analytics environment, carrying out data analytics, data science or consulting work
Experience with successfully engaging internal and external stakeholders towards delivering an analytical answer
Coding and analytics experience in SQL / R / Python / SAS and / or other relevant big data analysis tools
Experience working with large, complex datasets
Experience leading projects will be leveraged for senior roles
Flexibility to travel interstate for projects
Australian citizenship essential 

More about Quantium Health 
We actively foster a culture where our people can stretch themselves to reach their full potential. We also know that work must work for you, and modern life is fast paced, so Quantium embraces a flexible and supportive environment where you are
          respected and valued as an individual, not a number.
You will have the opportunity to collaborate and learn from our team of experts that spans data scientists, actuaries, statisticians, business analysts, strategy consultants, engineers, technologists, programmers, product developers, and futurists
          – all dedicated to harnessing the power of data to drive transformational outcomes for our clients.
Quantium are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We are a multicultural team of various beliefs, sexual orientations and gender identities. We celebrate our diversity of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation,
          age, marital status and disability status.
If you submit an application or expression of interest to The Quantium Group Pty Ltd, we may disclose your application or expression of interest on a confidential basis to our related companies, and joint venture companies, including Quantium
          Health Pty Limited. We will only make such disclosures for the purpose of considering your application or expression of interest and opportunities in those organisations.
title: Consultant / Senior Consultant - Quantium Health

templatetext:
Analytics Principal Consultant

Become a leading member of a growing consultancy
Build and chose the direction the MSBI teams moves
$160,000 – $ 180,000 + Super 
 Develop and further your leadership skills by taking the existing team and building it into something the business can rely on. Work within a company that prides itself on employees that don’t hide behind co-workers and are ready to
          tackle any challenge they have presented to them. Successful applicants will have an interest and drive to build the business. Not just manage a team and a project but to see opportunities and act. Responsibilities:

You’ll help solve a variety of cost and agility challenges some of the most iconic, high profile companies in ANZ from large enterprises to startups.
Lead teams through high impacts projects, using the latest data analytics technologies
Highly autonomous role, taking ownership of Data and Analytics offerings.
Help to plan, debug, and oversee business critical Data applications and migrations.
Work hand-in-hand with Solutions Architecture, Business Development, Professional Services.
You will be responsible for coaching and mentoring a team of Business Intelligence Consultants & Data Scientists. You’ll be someone for our team members to look up to and help them in their career progression
  Skill and experience

Minimum 5 years experience in Analytics field
Deep understanding of SQL databases
Advanced understanding of reporting tools
Have an understand of business practices
Deep understanding of the data space – no preference sector
Lateral thinker.
Have a knack to express your ideas effectively to a variety stakeholders
Degree educated in relation to field or demonstrable experience
Able to work autonomously and with minimal guidance and oversight
An external interest in self development of new technologies
Well connected within the Sydney market
   Mindset and approach is key for this role. Sector, technical background and exact years of experience all agnostic. Desire to build the business and an understanding of how to do so is the core focus.   Don’t
          wait till it’s gone. Hit apply now and send in your CV (word format please) and let’s get started or call Arthur on 02 8089 0157
title: Principal Analytics Consultant

templatetext:
Data Analyst – CommBiz Solutions Delivery

You love working with data and are an expert in analytics 
We are the largest bank in Australia with world-class platforms and cutting-edge technologies
A Career defining opportunity to provide actionable analytics, insights and solutions to businesses across IB&M and BPB

See yourself in our Team:
CommBiz is CBA’s premium banking platform, serving medium to large businesses across Australia. Our platform is continuously evolving with emerging technology so that we retain our competitive edge. Working in CommBiz is dynamic and rewarding,
          and we get to learn to become experts at what we do by embracing new technologies and new ways of working.
Analytics team will help Product and Strategy team to market and deliver features/products that matters to our customers
Your new role
As a Data Analyst, you will be tasked to enable the CommBiz business with data. The purpose of this role is to proactively provide actionable analytics/insights/solutions to IB&M/B&PB frontline sales teams, IB Marketing, CTS, BCF and Strategy
          teams to improve efficiency and effectiveness
Do Work that matters | Your responsibilities: 

Provide analytics support to frontline sales segments, strategy and product teams
Support the Manager, Business Analytics and Optimisation to manage relationships with various stakeholders and promote a data driven decision making culture aligning to business priorities
Perform complex behavioural and descriptive analysis/segmentation to identify opportunities and produce insights to improve efficiency and effectiveness
Work closely with Frontline Sales teams, strategy, product and to identify/recommend potential target markets thru advanced data mining, segmentation and market research
Complete analytics & ad-hoc requests providing unique actionable insights on strategic and tactical business and productivity initiatives

Identify and define opportunities or problems, and develop hypotheses within business context
Select the most appropriate analytic frameworks, tools and data to test hypotheses
Enrich collected data from multiple data sources and turn it into insightful information
Generate insights and present actionable recommendations to the Business, in person or via self-designed/developed dashboards or tools

Collaborate with the analytics team members to provide training and support to stakeholders in relation to the team’s analytical solutions

What you will need to succeed

Ability to generate insights and present solutions/recommendations to a variety of stakeholders with varying technical capabilities
Sound SQL (Teradata and SQL Server) and Visualisation (Tableau) experience
Knowledge of Excel VBA
Exposure to large complex data environments (e.g. Finance, Telecommunications)

The Future
At CommBank, we’re committed to building a respectful, inclusive and diverse workplace, reflecting the customers and communities we serve. As a values driven organisation, we nurture and support
          our people; through focussing on skill and talent development, flexibility and internal promotion. With service in mind at every touch point, we take accountability for the role we play in improving the financial wellbeing of people and communities.
          At CommBank you can be you.
title: Data Analyst | CommBiz

templatetext:
This is an exciting opportunity to be part of TAFE NSW Student Services team.  The CRM Data Analyst is responsible for the provision of in depth data analytics support relating to the TAFE NSW CRM platform (Oracle CX
          Cloud) and integrated systems to various portfolios. Using insights gleaned from customer and business process data, the CRM Data Analyst provides a range of advice aimed at improving marketing, sales, service, support and regulatory reporting
          processes. You’ll love this role if you: 

Have experience in analysing and presenting customer and business process data for successful business improvements.
Have experience in CRM Applications (Oracle Service Cloud/RightNow experience highly regarded), highly advanced Excel capability and experience in the use of Analytics Tools.

 Reporting to the CRM Project Manager, the successful applicant will:

Provide continuously improving data analytics and reporting support for a range of TAFE NSW portfolios.
Produce CRM reports and analysis based on customer and business process data to inform marketing, sales, service, support and regulatory reporting performance improvement.
Take ownership of data analysis problems and provide potential solutions for improving processes and reporting.
Thoroughly understand customer processes being measured and validate accuracy of data being produced against expectations to ensure high quality reporting and communication.
Develop approaches to analyse and interpret customer insights, and support internal customers in the use of this data for customer engagement decision making.  

If you have…

Demonstrated experience in analysing and presenting customer and business process data for successful business improvements.
Experience in CRM Applications (Oracle Service Cloud/RightNow experience highly regarded), highly advanced Excel and SQL capability and in the use of Analytics Tools
Certificate IV in relevant discipline or equivalent skills, knowledge and experience.
Ability to address and meet focus capabilities as stated in the Position Description.  

Desirable…

Solid understanding of CRM customer lifecycle concepts as they apply to higher education, including marketing, sales, service and support   We would love to hear from you!

 TAFE NSW’s purpose is to skill the workforce of the future. It is Australia's leading provider of vocational education and training with over 500,000 annual enrolments and a proud history for setting the benchmark for
          quality service. As the NSW public provider, it supports the NSW Government's priority to grow skills for the economy and jobs of tomorrow. Critically, TAFE NSW plays a vital role in providing vocational education in rural and regional NSW,
          and job training pathways for the most vulnerable in the community. Status: Temporary full time until 28 June 2019 Job Grade/Classification: TAFE Worker Level
          4 Location: Negotiable Recruitment Reference: 00006ST4 Closing date: Monday 4 February 2019, 11:59pm To learn more          about this position please review the Position Description and Information Package Job Specific Enquiries          please contact Gemma Frith Talent Resourcing Officer on 02 6586 2276. Selection Criteria forms a specific part of the selection process.  Candidates for this role are required to address each of these items specifically in
          their application. Candidates will also be required to answer two target questions. Target Questions

Please provide a recent example of when you have been required to analyse and present customer and business process data in order to contribute to business improvement.  
Please describe your level of experience in the use of the following technologies:
            
CRM Applications (Oracle Service Cloud/RightNow)
Microsoft Excel
Analytics Tools
Working knowledge of SQL and data manipulation



 If you experience difficulties whilst submitting your application online at JobsNSW please contact the support team on 1800 562 679.  NOTE: This is a child-related position. A Working With Children Check is a prerequisite for anyone in child-related work.  It involves a national criminal history check and review of findings of workplace misconduct.  More information can be found at Working With Children Check.

title: CRM Data Analyst

templatetext:
A little bit about us!     LeasePlan is the world leading vehicle and fleet management company, you may have heard of us! We operate a fleet of more than 1.5 million vehicles worldwide and provide our clients with
        the opportunity to outsource their fleet and the day-to-day management of their vehicles.  This is a Fixed Term contract running until October 2019. The position is responsible for creating and maintaining customer master
        data. We produce high quality data which in turn has a significant impact upon service delivery. The role will be responsible for maintaining master data objects (such as customer hierarchies, business partner records and master lease agreements),
        monitoring data integrity and providing guidance to internal colleagues.  We need someone who has exceptional attention to detail with an appreciation of data quality and an understanding of the flow on effects.  What will your day look like?

Dealing with new products, new customers, implementations, restructures and generally "funky fun things"
A large majority of your day will be spent working on a variety of data maintenance activities and allocated projects so you will be constantly juggling deadlines
Interpreting customer requirements and configuring master data to facilitate the delivery of services
Problem solving and finding solutions to data questions
 What we are looking for?

Someone who is detail orientated and can make a conscious effort to understand the root cause not just the effects
A problem solver who can understand the requirements and adapt them to the customer’s needs
You must have a growth mindset and love accepting a challenge
An Excel savvy guru!
And lastly someone with a great sense of humour
 What’s in it for you? Why become part of the LeasePlan team?

We are a great bunch of people!!
We offer a wide range of benefits
We offer a competitive remuneration package with career development opportunities
  So, What's next for you?  PLEASE NOTE: resumes may be sent and interviews may take place prior to closure date for applications. To give yourself the best chance of selection, please do not leave your application
        to the application ‘close’ date. Employment in this position will be subject to the successful completion of a background check (criminal and bankruptcy).
title: Customer Data Analyst

templatetext:
What is an Energy Data Analyst (Energy Accounting)?As energy contracting, forecasting and budgeting become increasingly complex, energy accountants manage client’s energy spend, interrogate their data and deliver accurate,
          insightful reports. Similar to that of a Billing Analyst. How do they do this:Bill validation and energy retailer management: Through expert management of client’s energy accounts and strong relationships with energy
          retailers, we contain costs, proactively address billing anomalies and identify opportunities to improve energy performance across their operations. Sustainability data management: Disclosure of carbon liabilities
          and reduction strategies has never been more important with scrutiny growing from government, investors, the ASX and activist groups.  We ensure that our client’s data is complete and accurate to give them confidence in the integrity of
          their reports and risk management approach.Operational energy monitoring and optimisation: Energetics' energy specialists help businesses understand how energy is being used so that they can take corrective actions,
          identify energy savings opportunities and report with confidence.Metering and sub metering: Energetics' cost effective on-bill metering service integrates with data management
          platforms to help clients confidently manage and report this significant operating cost.Budgeting and forecasting: With more than 30 years’ experience in energy consulting, Energetics leverages utility data to accurately
          inform the development of our client's energy budgets.   Like the sound of this?We’d love to hear from you. We are looking for a couple of people to join our growing Energy Accounting Solution so
          the time is right to come on board.What background works best?There isn’t a typical background for successful people in this role. Consistent across our team members however are strong analytical and problem-solving
          skills and the ability to confidently engage and consult with internal and external stakeholders. Yes, you’ll need to be good with numbers but if you’ve taken the time to read about the role we’re assuming you’re passionate about checks and
          balances!A little bit about usEnergetics is Australia's leading specialist consultancy in energy and carbon management. We partner with Federal and State governments and large energy users to deliver value through
          integrated and comprehensive services from strategy through to implementation, covering carbon liability advice and assistance with carbon management, energy efficiency, emissions reporting, renewable energy assessment and procurement and strategic
          sourcing.Only candidates that hold a valid Australian working visa may apply.
title: Energy Data Analyst

templatetext:
This is an exciting opportunity to be part of TAFE NSW Student Services team.  The CRM Data Analyst is responsible for the provision of in depth data analytics support relating to the TAFE NSW CRM platform (Oracle CX
          Cloud) and integrated systems to various portfolios. Using insights gleaned from customer and business process data, the CRM Data Analyst provides a range of advice aimed at improving marketing, sales, service, support and regulatory reporting
          processes. You’ll love this role if you: 

Have experience in analysing and presenting customer and business process data for successful business improvements.
Have experience in CRM Applications (Oracle Service Cloud/RightNow experience highly regarded), highly advanced Excel capability and experience in the use of Analytics Tools.

 Reporting to the CRM Project Manager, the successful applicant will:

Provide continuously improving data analytics and reporting support for a range of TAFE NSW portfolios.
Produce CRM reports and analysis based on customer and business process data to inform marketing, sales, service, support and regulatory reporting performance improvement.
Take ownership of data analysis problems and provide potential solutions for improving processes and reporting.
Thoroughly understand customer processes being measured and validate accuracy of data being produced against expectations to ensure high quality reporting and communication.
Develop approaches to analyse and interpret customer insights, and support internal customers in the use of this data for customer engagement decision making.  

If you have…

Demonstrated experience in analysing and presenting customer and business process data for successful business improvements.
Experience in CRM Applications (Oracle Service Cloud/RightNow experience highly regarded), highly advanced Excel and SQL capability and in the use of Analytics Tools
Certificate IV in relevant discipline or equivalent skills, knowledge and experience.
Ability to address and meet focus capabilities as stated in the Position Description.  

Desirable…

Solid understanding of CRM customer lifecycle concepts as they apply to higher education, including marketing, sales, service and support   We would love to hear from you!

 TAFE NSW’s purpose is to skill the workforce of the future. It is Australia's leading provider of vocational education and training with over 500,000 annual enrolments and a proud history for setting the benchmark for
          quality service. As the NSW public provider, it supports the NSW Government's priority to grow skills for the economy and jobs of tomorrow. Critically, TAFE NSW plays a vital role in providing vocational education in rural and regional NSW,
          and job training pathways for the most vulnerable in the community. Status: Temporary full time until 28 June 2019 Job Grade/Classification: TAFE Worker Level
          4 Location: Negotiable Recruitment Reference: 00006ST4 Closing date: Monday 4 February 2019, 11:59pm To learn more          about this position please review the Position Description and Information Package Job Specific Enquiries          please contact Gemma Frith Talent Resourcing Officer on 02 6586 2276. Selection Criteria forms a specific part of the selection process.  Candidates for this role are required to address each of these items specifically in
          their application. Candidates will also be required to answer two target questions. Target Questions

Please provide a recent example of when you have been required to analyse and present customer and business process data in order to contribute to business improvement.  
Please describe your level of experience in the use of the following technologies:
            
CRM Applications (Oracle Service Cloud/RightNow)
Microsoft Excel
Analytics Tools
Working knowledge of SQL and data manipulation



 If you experience difficulties whilst submitting your application online at JobsNSW please contact the support team on 1800 562 679.  NOTE: This is a child-related position. A Working With Children Check is a prerequisite for anyone in child-related work.  It involves a national criminal history check and review of findings of workplace misconduct.  More information can be found at Working With Children Check.

title: CRM Data Analyst

templatetext:
Join a world leading technology company as a Data Analyst where you will be helping customers maximise their PPC/SEM investment. 
 
This is an initial 12 month contract with a strong possibility of it being extended. It is located in North Ryde and you will be required to work in the City one day per week. 
Responsibilities:

Development of regular network reporting and performance related analysis.
Development of analysis aiming at identifying network level opportunities, relating but not limited to marketplace, business segment and product performance.
Development, report, and execute demand led sale programs.
Partnering with internal teams on scoping, processing, interpreting and visualising data underpinning network, demand and marketplace insights.
Effective workload management through impact based prioritisation and stakeholder communication.

 
Requirements:

Strong analytical, visualisation and project management skills.
Hands on approach to data analysis with a strong focus on accuracy and quality.
Skilled at interpreting data and translating it into action.
Strong experience with Power BI, PowerPoint and Microsoft products.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Have a good understanding of the advertising industry. 
3+ year's experience in online media industry with a good understanding of SEM/PPC advertising is imperative. 


To apply please click apply or call William Swan on +61 2 84231024 for a confidential discussion.
title: Data Analyst (SEM/PPC)

          Cloud) and integrated systems to various portfolios. Using insights gleaned from customer and business process data, the CRM Data Analyst provides a range of advice aimed at improving marketing, sales, service, support and regulatory reporting
          processes. You’ll love this role if you: 

Have experience in analysing and presenting customer and business process data for successful business improvements.
Have experience in CRM Applications (Oracle Service Cloud/RightNow experience highly regarded), highly advanced Excel capability and experience in the use of Analytics Tools.

 Reporting to the CRM Project Manager, the successful applicant will:

Provide continuously improving data analytics and reporting support for a range of TAFE NSW portfolios.
Produce CRM reports and analysis based on customer and business process data to inform marketing, sales, service, support and regulatory reporting performance improvement.

title: CRM Data Analyst

templatetext:
Extract and report on data to optimise business performance.  Your new company A leading insurance company in the Northern Territory are seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join their finance team. This
            role will be temporary initially with the potential for permanent employment.  Your new role In this role you will report to the Financial Controller and will be responsible for developing consistent and integrated
            reporting of data. You will be extracting data from internal systems, analysing and providing reports in relation to claims, performance, operations, management, variances and trends. Continuous improvement of data analysis and reporting.  What you'll need to succeed A successful candidate for the role will have:

Prior experience in a similar role - ideally within the finance industry
Proficient using Excel and Cognos will be highly regarded
Available to commence end of February 19’

 What you'll get in return In return you will enjoy working for a company where you have an opportunity to improve business performance and be rewarded for that. This company offers fantastic career development opportunities
            and employee benefits.  What you need to do now If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now on (08)89436000. Alternatively email Katie.James@hays.com.au.
            If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.  At Hays, we value diversity and are passionate about placing people in a role where they
            can flourish and succeed. We actively encourage people from diverse backgrounds to apply.

templatetext:
Role Details

PowerBI Developer
International Organization
6 Month Fixed Term
East Melbourne

DescriptionThis role sits in the performance and planning team and is responsible for building PowerBI Dashboards. These dashboards will be used to measure the performance of the businesses and will enable better decision
          making related to activities and campaigns.To be successful in this role you will need:

Demonstrable experience producing PowerBI Dashboards
            
Be able to articulate why these dashboards were built.
What decisions did they enable? How did they help the business?


The ability to organize, transform, and manipulate data.
            
Tell me about when you have used SQL/ SQL Server to solve a complex problem.

An understanding of financial systems, financial reporting, and the principals of accounting.

This role will act as a conduit between the business and technical teams, so the ability to communicate ideas to different types of stakeholders is crucial.

title: Business Intelligence Data & Reporting Analyst

templatetext:
Employment Type: Permanent Full TimePosition Classification: Health Manager Level 1Remuneration: $72,591 - $97,649Hours Per Week: 38Requisition ID: REQ90387Applications Close:        Friday 15th February 2019
        What you'll be doing
The Procurement Data Analyst leads the selection, deployment, and use of data resources, analytical tools and methodologies to provide procurement intelligence to support procurement and category management strategies, decision making and performance.
 
Illawarra Shoalhaven Local Health District is committed to equal employment opportunity and embraces diversity and inclusion within its workforce. As such, people from diverse backgrounds are encouraged to apply. This includes but is not limited
          to Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander People, People with Disability, Women and People from Culturally and Linguistically Diverse backgrounds.
    
An eligibility list will be created for future Temporary and Permanent Full-Time and Part-Time positions.
 
Please note: Employment of a temporary visa holder may only occur if no suitable permanent resident or citizen of Australia has been identified for this position following suitable labour market testing.
Selection Criteria

Relevant tertiary qualifications, such as in management, business administration or technically orientated, or equivalent experience, in a relevant discipline to facilitate effective procurement services.
Demonstrated knowledge of procurement processes including contemporary issues in tendering and product selection activities.
Demonstrated ability to successfully develop and implement effective metrics and reports to continually monitor and assess the performance of individual procurement arrangements and the risks and benefits realised for the total category/procurement
            function.
Excellent interpersonal, negotiation and influencing skills including the ability to interact constructively and collaboratively with a diverse range of stakeholders, throughout all organisational levels.
Demonstrated ability to work independently but with a capacity for effective team work.
Demonstrated organisational skills and experience working in a high volume and demanding professional environment with a capacity to prioritise competing demands and achieve results with a customer focused approach.
Willingness to travel in accordance with the demands of the position (drivers licence required).


Need more information?   1) Click here for the Position Description   2)
          Find out more about applying for this position For role related queries or questions contact Jodi Chiumento on Jodi.Chiumento@health.nsw.gov.au                  
   To view the position description or submit your applications please click the 'Apply' button below.  We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity, Ethical Practices, and the principles of Cultural Diversity
        and promote a smoke-free work environment. Appropriate criminal record and child protection checks conducted for all positions.

templatetext:
Responsibilities 

Perform analysis to drive business objectives, business benefits and risks
Contribute to requirements (Design/Documentation) for SAP solutions for Finance system re-platforming
Manage data modelling efforts for Finance project
Advise/inform project team on data migration / data cleansing approaches
Advise/inform project Test Teams on testing strategy / setup
Taking responsibility for analysis within the project & delivery teams to identify business requirements and design valuable change solutions
Ensure requirements and solutions address people, processes, systems and information, where applicable
Utilise and promote best practise business analysis principles and techniques, and mentoring junior members of the delivery team
Facilitate workshops and agile ceremonies towards successful outcomes
Establish and maintain effective relationships with stakeholders and product owner

Requirements

Strong stakeholder management skills including the ability to influence, build credibility and gain commitment
Strong attention to detail
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to thrive in a complex, fast-paced and fluid environment
Experience collecting, analysing and modelling data, promoting data driven decisions
Advanced data modelling skills
Significant expertise with SAP Finance Modules and TM1
High level of initiative with the ability to deal with multiple projects simultaneously

title: Procurement Data Analyst

company: Sirius Technology Melbourne part of Sirius People Pty Ltd
templatetext:
You will have an opportunity to work with one of Melbourne’s Analytics Professionals. You will be working on a data migration project which will require you to cleanse, prepare, migrate and analyse data. You will be able to build dashboards and
          reports on Tableau providing meaningful insights to the business. At times you will need to use Python queries to pull data from the database. Your Benefits:

Melbourne CBD
Established Company
5 month contract
Immediate start
Data Migration project

Your Role:

You will be responsible for performance reporting
Responsible for data cleansing and ETL and write queries in SQL
You will liaise with internal stakeholders to understand what they need and provide analytics solutions from your analysis.
Build reports and dashboards in Tableau 

You will need:

Bachelor's Degree in IT/Stats


Demonstrated experience in a similar role reporting into a Business unit rather than IT
Proficient in Excel and relational database experience
Some experience in Python, ETL and SQL (Essential)
Strong critical thinking and high attention to detail
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Must have demonstrated work experience on Tableau

You must have relevant working rights and available to start immediately. We are moving quickly. APPLY NOW.
title: Data Analyst - Data Migration Project - Contract - Melbourne

company: Dimensional Fund Advisors Australia Limi ted
templatetext:
As a subset of the Research group within Dimensional, Investment Analytics & Data (IAD) is a core member of the Investments team, providing quality data and analysis to Portfolio Management, Trading, Research, Marketing, Institutional Client
          Services, and Financial Advisors Services. The IAD group is responsible for the creation, maintenance and enhancement of the company wide data management solution and associated analytics for making investment decisions and reporting on those.
          This includes but is not limited to working with security reference data, company financials, fund and index data, and all other data crucial to the investment process and downstream reporting. All members of this group share responsibility
          for clean, accurate data to internal and external clients. Attention to detail is crucial, as is inventiveness at finding different ways to analyze data. 
Responsibilities

Perform regular and ad hoc data validation of security reference and financial statement data, ensure data accuracy, and oversee various data reporting tools and processes.
Partner with various internal departments to answer performance and reporting questions, assist with ad hoc requests, and collaborate within a global team to identify solutions to any issue.
Create, understand and interpret returns, characteristics, and attributions for portfolios and indices.
Contribute to ongoing efficiency efforts to improve processes and tools.
Complete projects involving the collection, validation, analysis and presentation of data.

Requirements

Bachelors’ degree in a related field (i.e. Finance, Economics, Accounting, STEM academic disciplines or similar).
Professional industry experience (including internship/s) in an analytical capacity will be highly thought of.
Proficient communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to build lasting relationships with stakeholders.
Passion for finding solutions to complex analytical problems with keen attention to detail.
Ability to partner with peers as part of a collaborative team on various projects and successfully meet deadlines.
Strong computer skills (in particular, Excel), with the ability to learn additional programs.
A genuine interest in programming; coding experience will be viewed favourably (SQL, VBA, C#, etc.).

We're an equal opportunity employer who values individual differences and offers global opportunities for its employees.
For details of how we deal with your Personal Information, please see our Privacy Policy Statement located on our website (http://au.dimensional.com/policies/privacy.aspx), or available upon request.
title: Analyst, Investment Analytics and Data

templatetext:
About us:Wisely is a dynamic Australian business providing end to end asset management solutions and professional consulting support to a vast range of industries including mining & resources, aviation, rail, defence,
        ports & infrastructure. Whilst our head office is in QLD and we conduct many projects and contracts in the surrounding regions, we support work all across Australia as well as internationally. We are proud to be a flexible
        business where we tailor packages based on individual needs, locations and circumstances to attract and retain industry experts within our team.The opportunity:With over 20 years asset management experience, we are
        seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join our mining maintenance team. Working directly within the Reliability Improvement team your key focus will be to analyse and collate data from various systems such as; SAP, Spotfire and others to identify
        maintenance requirements. You will be systems savvy, improvement focused and have previously worked in a similar position to be successful in this role. Benefits of joining our team:

Family-friendly position: no weekend work required.
Free travel and accommodation - flights, vehicle and camp accommodation provided for the right person.
Flexible contracts - you will be offered an attractive industry leading full time package or the option of casual or to subcontract through your own ABN.
Free mental health support for you and your family through our employee assistance program. 
Professional development opportunities plus coaching from our leadership team of industry experts. 
Recognition and diverse career opportunities across varied industries.
Salary sacrificing options for hire vehicles, superannuation and novated leasing.
Employee discounts on private health insurance, car rentals, accommodation and fitness.
 How to apply:'Apply now' or for a confidential conversation please call:Bridie DoddResource CoordinatorP: 1300 947 359Email: bridie.dodd@wisely.com.au
title: Data Analyst
Reporting and Performance Analyst. Permanent F/T position

templatetext:
A new opportunity has become available for an experienced Data Analyst who has been involved in complex data migrations and data transformations to join a great team in the CBD on a 6 month fixed term contract. 
This role will be supporting the Data Migration Lead in the successful migration of the legacy data to the new Microsoft platform (Dynamics CRM, AX and custom SQL), analysing the legacy data, developing migration scripts, and resolving
                      rejects to ensure the success of the data migration. 
The ideal candidate will have strong SQL Server, SSIS and Stored Procedures. 
Key Responsibilities:

Hands on development, QA and performance tuning where necessary of SQL Scripts and packages  
Work with Accenture / Avanade to deliver the Data Migration 
Work with the SME and IT teams to deliver the data migration 
Analyse and document data needs for business processes, workflows and interfaces 

Requirements:

Tertiary qualifications in technology 
10+ years proven experience in the data field 
5 + years proven experience using Microsoft SQL Server 
Expert knowledge in MS SQL Tools – SSIS, SSAS, SSRS- and MS-Excel  
Experience in script performance tuning  
Experience of analysing complex databases structures 
Proven experience (2+) in large scale data migration projects onto MS SQL platform 
Demonstrable evidence of analysing and documenting complex data models  
Experience in analysing large datasets, uncovering trends & data patterns  
Proven ability to convey technical data constructs in business language  
Competent knowledge of RDBMs based data models 
Experience in meta-models  
Experience in the use and creation of Data lineage models 
Results orientated with good communication and interpersonal skills 
Desired experience in MS CRM, MS AX & Web based systems

For more information and to apply, please send your CV in WORD format to melina@progressivepeople.com.au  quoting 9419 or apply to this ad.
title: Data Analyst

company: Talent – Winner ‘Seek Large Recruitment Agency of the Year’ 3 consecutive years!
templatetext:
Iconic WA Company
Immediate start
Mining giant  
This iconic WA company are currently about to start a number of IT projects throughout the business including a large investment in the Analytics area.  These projects have been approved to start and have budgets in place. The successful
        candidates will need to be a self-starter who can work both on their own and in a team.Tasks and Responsibilities 



Talk to business stakeholders about their business needs and formulate analysis to enable you to make business recommendations
Automate, develop reports and build dashboards to enable you to provide insights and solve analytical needs
Make sure the full suite of Dashboards are up to date and relevant
Manipulate complex databases to develop practical models
Technical Skills 



Proven Data Modelling and Analytical skills
Data Visualisation tools background ideally PowerBI and/or Tableau
Experience in SAP, Ariba or Oniqua would be highly beneficial
Data Mining

title: Data Analyst / Business Analyst  - Perth CBD - Contract

templatetext:
A leading Australian Household brand is currently seeking an experienced Data Analyst with proven customer analytics experience to execute data driven and insightful marketing & customer strategies
 
Reporting to the CRM Analytics Manager, you will be passionate in utilising their customer rich data to facilitate the organization's growth, working cross functionally to translate data into actionable insights.
 
Key Responsibilities

Assist with the development and execution of customer strategies
Drive analytically backed strategy to maximize the impact of their customer journey
Identify and segment prospective customers and leverage your data driven insights to strategize how best to approach them
Drive retention and growth across the customer base
Conduct advance SQL queriying to extract and manipulate data 

 
Key Skills

Have advanced skills in querying large volumes of customer data using SQL
A strong understanding of CRM systems to interpret data to produce customer insight and sound commercial recommendations
Have proven results in driving growth within a retail entity 
Feel comfortable working and collaborating with a wider team of passionate analysts
Have experience in presenting your data driven strategy to technical and non-technical audiences alike
Modelling experience will be highly regarded 
Experience across statistical modelling tools such as R, Python and/or SAS will be highly regarded

This is a unique opportunity for a passionate and experienced CRM Analyst who is looking to enhance their career within a creative and influential company.
 
For more information, please call Corrin on 03 83305003
IMPORTANT: By submitting your email address and any other personal information when you APPLY to a job, you consent to such information being collected, held, used and disclosed in accordance with our COLLECTIONS NOTICE and PRIVACY POLICY.
http://www.bluefinresources.com.au/privacy-policy
title: CRM Data Analyst

templatetext:
Data Analyst required to join a leading financial services provider  Your new company This large banking organisation has an established footprint within Australia and has been commended on the overall quality of
            its financial products service. An opportunity exists for a data analyst to support remediation and work across a varied customer base.  Your new role You will identify data to be collected from financial systems
            and other related applications and assess and determine the techniques and tools to be used in the collection, analysis and communication ensuring consistent, accurate and repeatable delivery of data. The role requires executing codes for
            assessment during the discovery phase of remediation, providing detailed data assessment required as part of the customer financial impact assessment and revising and validating analysis as required through to visualisation.  What you'll need to succeed

Strong knowledge of data extraction and analysis from large customer bases
Experience with SAS, SQL Excel, Tableau
Use of data warehouses and core databases
Ability to turn quantitative and qualitative analysis into business insights and solutions.


Excellent stakeholder engagement skills
Analytic experience within the following would also be highly valuable - Mortgages, Deposits or Credit Cards

  What you'll get in return This is a great 12 month contract opportunity working across interesting projects for a financial services provider.  What you need to do now If you have a
            strong understanding of the skills required, a passion for data and you want to make an impact in an organisation then please apply now or email your application direct to Adelina.Ekechukwu@hays.com.au
title: Data Analyst

templatetext:
The position: An exciting opportunity has become available for a data analyst to join our global pharmaceutical company based out of Macquarie Park. The department has implemented a large data project and is requiring an experienced
          professional to support and lead this process. You will work with a data analyst to complete this project in a timely and effective manner.
Daily Responsibilities: • Liaise with 3rd party vendors both local and international to implement business rules to streamline sales data • Map customers and products to a single customer/product in the system • Validate
          sales data and format to be loaded to CRM system • Manage elements of master data for the department
To ensure your success you must possess: • 3+ years in a similar role • Extremely high attention to detail • Advanced Excel skills and knowledge • Experience using Salesforce, Veeva or other CRM systems • Advanced
          database experience • Good oral and written communication skills • Stakeholder management experience • Ability to work autonomously as well as part of a small team
About our client: Our client is a leading Pharmaceutical company with around 50,000 employees work to further develop technologies that improve and enhance life - from biopharmaceutical therapies to treat cancer or multiple
          sclerosis, cutting-edge systems for scientific research and production, to liquid crystals for smartphones and LCD televisions. Our client provides innovative medicines, vaccines, biologic therapies and animal health products to help improve
          health and well-being.
Our client is wanting to get someone onboard ASAP so please click ‘APPLY NOW’ or email your interest to savannah.lee-hong@au.manpowergroup.com

This is an exciting opportunity to be part of TAFE NSW Student Services team.  The CRM Data Analyst is responsible for the provision of in depth data analytics support relating to the TAFE NSW CRM platform (Oracle CX
          Cloud) and integrated systems to various portfolios. Using insights gleaned from customer and business process data, the CRM Data Analyst provides a range of advice aimed at improving marketing, sales, service, support and regulatory reporting

title: CRM Data Analyst

templatetext:
Working for AMP 
 
Working for AMP means being part of a company that values diverse thinking, encourages collaboration and promotes innovation.  It’s an environment that offers challenging and exciting work as well as opportunities for professional growth.
          We’re flexible enough to allow you to make the most of your life, both professionally and personally. 
We are looking for those that have the courage and agility to navigate changing and complex environments so that we can deliver the best solutions for our customers. We value people with integrity, an innate willingness to help others and an eagerness
          to perform to the best of their abilities. 
 
 
About the role
 
The purpose of this excitring role is to manage the “single-source-of-truth” recordkeeping system capturing all regulator engagement across AMP
 
 
Key Responsibilities
 

Manage the daily in-take of all regulatory engagement correspondence into the GRGT mailbox
Track down missing data that does not come into the mailbox, where appropriate
Facilitate (when needed) and track the progress of regulator responses through submission and acknowledgement by the regulator
Apply a critical lens to all data processed from a regulatory perspective:
Assist in the review of regulator responses for consistency and tone
Assist in analysing and assessing activity to identify common regulatory themes, areas of increased regulator attention, and other areas of interest for AMP
Proactively identify and raise issues
Prepare overall status reports and dashboards that summarize or illustrate activities of the program for various levels of management:
Track and report on key risk indicators for the program
Prepare and present weekly regulator commitment and meeting reports to management

 
 
Capabilities & Experience
 

Demonstrated experience in data management, ideally in a risk, compliance or legal role or similar type function
Excellent data management skills, including proven ability to identify detailed gaps in data quality, perform data profiling and standardization (e.g. for reporting, analytics and audit)
Intermediate - Advanced skills in Excel, pivot tables and macro.
Ability to distil complex and / or highly technical concepts into a format accessible to a variety of audiences
Excellent stakeholder engagement and management skills
Understanding of the broader regulatory environment
Strong communication and influencing skills with the proven ability to influence credibly at a senior level

 
 
 
Wellbeing & Benefits 
As a company that values wellbeing, we offer a range of great benefits to support you financially, professionally and personally. These include access to a wide range of flexible working options including the ability to purchase extra leave, retail
          discounts, onsite wellbeing centre including a gym (Sydney Office), Employee Assistance Program, competitive home loan rates, leading superannuation contribution, discounted financial advice and personal insurance.
 
Inclusion & Diversity
AMP recognises individual differences and welcomes people from a variety of life and work experiences. The diversity of our people is core to our ability to innovate, grow and to fulfil our collective aspiration of helping people to own their
          tomorrow. A natural curiosity, a respect for differences and a growth mindset are valued at AMP
title: Data Analyst - Group Regulatory Risk

The Company 
 
Robert Half has an exciting opportunity for a tenured Data Analyst to join a well-established Financial Services business. You will work out of modern CBD offices and join a high performing team, taking part in a major Cyber Security project.

Your Profile

Experience using visual analytics and reporting tools, ideally Tableau,
Ability to code efficiently and automate data solutions across various data warehouses/platforms,
Deep understanding of ETL processes,
Experience using SQL and working with data warehouse environments.

Apply Today
