title: Data Analyst - Research

templatetext:
Pernod Ricard Australia is part of the Global Pernod Ricard Group – the World’s Co-leader in the Wine and Spirits Industry with an unrivalled collection of iconic brands, including Jacobs Creek®, Mumm®, Stoneleigh®, Absolut® Vodka, Chivas Regal®, Jameson®, and more.
 
A newly created role has become available within Pernod Ricard Australia for a Data Analyst to join our high performing Finance team. The Data Analyst will be responsible for cleaning, administering and analysing multiple datasets (from Finance,
          Marketing, Sales…), as well as consolidating them from the various systems used by the business into ‘one source of truth’ BI database.
 
In addition, the role will lead the process of the creation of BI dashboards (with a focus on Power BI) to generate key business insights and improve speed of decision making.
 
The Data Analyst will ensure business data is accurately captured and streamed to populate the BI platform (Datalake, Jupyter Notebooks) and any other key Data Management tool identified. 
 
The Data Analyst will manage the maintenance of the reports and BI infrastructure (including configuration of the user accounts, technical support, backups, staff training, etc.) and liaise with support function teams to discuss and identify solutions
          on data capture and report generating.
 
Responsibilities:

Evaluate datasets for consistency, completeness and accuracy
Audit data on a regular basis and ensure data integrity
Identifies and prioritises data quality issues impacting data provisioning to the BI platform 
Manage the regular report running schedule and process
Mapping out and maintaining the company's critical business processes
Develop process improvements for data management activities
Acquisition, distribution and validation of business data for analytical purposes
Support of existing and creating new reports and dashboards
Point of contact for distribution and collection of analytical outcomes
Perform data management activities in accordance with customer, company, contract, and regulatory requirements
Perform data analysis using statistical tools
Continuous improvement of systems and tools used within the business
Address any issues, questions and problems in accurate and timely manner

 
The successful Candidate will have:

A relevant degree qualification in a technical field (e.g., Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or related discipline)
Between 2 and 4 years of working experience
A good data processing understanding and knowledge of Python
Understanding of data models and integration of data from various sources
Experience with reporting packages and Business Intelligence tools (MS Power BI or Tableau)
MS Excel: excellent level, knowledge of pivot tables, functions such as INDEX, MATCH, etc.

 
This is an exceptional opportunity to join a global organisation with a portfolio of iconic international brands. We are a company of people with commitment and integrity, we value entrepreneurship and conviviality. It's a winning mix that's seen
          the Pernod Ricard Group ascend to co-leader in wine and spirits globally, and makes it a great place to work for like-minded people.
 
If you have the required skills and are looking for a new challenge, please apply today.
 
For further information, please visit our career website:  http://www.pernod-ricard-australia.com/people/current-opportunities
 
Please note that only those holding full working rights in Australia will be considered for this role.
 
Applications close 12th February 2019.
title: Data Analyst

templatetext:
OUR CLIENT is a long-standing leader in mining technology. They are now a part of an international parent company that set the standard for quality and performance.     WE ARE SEEKING        a highly motivated and energetic DATA ANALYST who can deliver a superior level of professional excellence and contribute to maintaining their position as the world leader in real-time Mine Management Systems across their blue-chip
        customer base. This role is based on the beautiful Central Coast of NSW.     This full-time position forms part of a dedicated professional team focusing on maximizing the “value in use” provided by their
        industry leading products and solutions to customers operations.    RESPONSIBILITIES

Delivery of "value in use" to customers by visiting site and reviewing how the system is being operated.
Identify improvement opportunities such as training, assisted operations and advise on system usage and navigation.
Assist in the preparation of data analysis pre and post site visits to benchmark, identify issues and potential improvements.
Prepare and coordinate reports for customers.
 ESSENTIALLY YOU

Tertiary qualifications in engineering, IT, mining or a similar related field.
Highly analytical, ability to swiftly identify opportunities and solutions.
Experience in mining and/or knowledge of the related terms, processes, technology applications and solutions.
Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to present information in a clear and concise manner.
High level of computer literacy with Microsoft® Office competency.
Willing to travel to mine sites throughout Australia on a regular basis
 DESIRABLES

Process improvement training/qualifications such as Six-Sigma and familiarity with the Gemba approach.
Experience with related Fleet Management or Machine Guidance products.
 The successful applicant will be required to gain in-depth skills and knowledge of our client’s systems products and in-house programming language.    If you have what is required, along with the vision and drive to meet the
        challenges of this position, then on offer is great career potential in a fast-paced, team orientated environment within a progressive organization.    If you meet the requirements are excited by the opportunity, apply now! For
        any enquiries outside the information above, please contact Ty Brennock on 0412 428 240.
title: Data Analyst

templatetext:
About the company: Established in 2001, Australian owned and operation DX Solutions is one of Sydney's leading end to end ICT Service Providers having built a reputation for innovation, insight and leadership in the professional
        services industry.  As a rapidly growing business, DX was listed in BRW's  Fast100 in 2014 and 2015 consecutively acknowledging the drive and commitment of our team of over 200 employees.    Project and Engagement Brief: This
        is a 6 month contract based in the northern Sydney area with DX Solutions on site at a well-known global organisation within the automotive and financial services space.We looking to consolidate multiple BI tools, data marts and DWH’s
        into a common platform to have readily available data to enable core business growth and drive real-time decision making.   This will Enable Self Service BI and Analytics capabilities  and remove duplication of legacy data systems
        and tools.  The project is using an agile delivery model. The intent is to implement a Data Governance Framework design that will allow them to actively manage compliance, risks and support BI & Analytics Self Service enablement.          Main Responsibilities:

Analyse requirements
Build test scripts
Execute ST/Integration level testing
Defect management
QA Lead to assist with selection of Test Tool
 Mandatory Skills:

Testing on Data Warehouse projects
Strong SQL Server 2016
Bit Bucket
Jira/Confluence
API testing
Strong Excel experience
title: Data Warehouse Test Analyst

templatetext:
Leading ASX listed hospitality group who own and operate a range of food and beverage venues, accommodation and bottle shops is seeking a Data Insights Analyst to fill a newly created role.
Your role will be to improve the customer experience through your data analysis and modelling. Starting from a fresh landscape of untapped data, you will provide recommendations to internal stakeholders that will show a thorough understanding
          of the customer behaviour and build business cases to promote consumer growth and extend the customer life cycle.
Responsibilities:

Influencing external business partners
Identifying new and innovative opportunities for growth
Acting as a thought leader in the measurement of CRM activity & performance
Driving a culture of experimentation across the business

You

Experience working with large and complex data sets
Strong communication and stakeholder engagement skills
Experience in attributing marketing & sales outcomes on a commercial level
A minimum 2 years' experience in a similar or related role
Experience with SQL

Please contact Dana on 9220 3400 for a chat or submit your resume in MS Word (.doc/.docx) format. PDFs will not be accepted.
title: Data Insights Analyst

templatetext:
The Organisation:
Our client is responsible for national policies and programs that help Australians access quality and affordable education and training.
The Opportunity:
This is an opportunity to further or launch your data analysis career in the APS in a team doing research that is aiming to positively impact the lives of Australians.  You will be working in a research based team that is using data
            to better understand the significant social and health risk factors that prevent Australians from completing their studies or effectively transitioning from tertiary education into employment. This project will support current reforms in the
            health, social employment and education portfolios and will engage with policy areas delivering those reforms. This project also supports broader Data Integration Partnership for Australia/Australian Bureau of Statistics priorities to inform
            policy decision making through data integration.
The Role:
This is a newly created role at the APS4 level for an initial 6 month non-ongoing contract with a high probability of a 6 month extension for the right candidate. The focus of the position is in supporting quantitative data analysis.
You will be undertaking research including literature reviews, analysing data, and contributing to policy consultations, reports and publications. It will also involve coordinating and drafting responses to queries and briefs for review by senior
            staff and contributing to project delivery.   In the role you will provide administrative and briefing support for the research projects.
The Person:
You have experience in data analysis, casual interference, statistical significance testing and clustering model.
You are likely to have a tertiary degree with a major in actuarial studies, statistics, mathematics, finance, computer science, or a closely related discipline which includes a substantial mathematics component.  You have developed excellent
            written and verbal communication skills, and the proven ability to communicate results of data analytics into meaningful and actionable insights for diverse audiences. 
The Salary
$68,231 - $72,970 + 15.4% super
HorizonOne has quickly established its data analysis capability based on the quality of our candidates and roles. If this role isn't quite right for you and you would like to discuss other data related roles please contact me on the details
            below.
To apply online, please click on the appropriate link. Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, please contact Lucas Walker on 02 6108 4878, quoting Ref No. 8522

templatetext:
Reporting to the Strategic Pricing Manager, you will contribute to the success of the company by providing expertise to ensure the completeness, accuracy and integrity of data administration, with a key focus on our customer, supplier and product
          data. Our client is based in Melbourne’s south east suburbs and is looking for an experienced Master Data Analyst to join their team.    About you

Minimum 2 years Master Data experience (FMCG or Retail organisation highly regarded)
Experience using Infor M3 or similar ERP
Ideally exposure to other systems: Demand/Supply Planning; Tradespend/Rebates
Proven ability to engage stakeholders and build relationships, both internal and external to the organisation
Previous experience working cross-functionally to align processes and expectations (highly regarded)
Proven experience in database administration and maintenance across multiple systems
Advanced knowledge excel and application across large data sets
    About the role

Contribute to the implementation of master data standards across the company.
Assist in establishing and ongoing maintenance of clean and effective master data processes.
Data entry with a key focus on customer, supplier and product data sets and integration into multiple system to ensure data completeness and accuracy company wide.
Commissioning and decommissioning of data sets.
Help identify areas for improvement within the master data processes, systems and policies through collaboration with other functions.
Provide governance and visibility of master data across new product development process (eg Stage and Gate) and business planning cycles (Budgeting, forecasting).
Support development of policy that provides visibility and control across master data and multiple systems in conjunction with other functional data owners.
Advocate for adherence to master data principles and standards to enable ongoing improvement of data quality.
Support system implementation through mapping, cleansing and conversion of master data in readiness for system transition into BAU.
Undertaking user acceptance testing (UAT) to ensure accuracy and completeness of data is achieved at Go Live for transition to new ERP.
Helping to develop business reporting on status, risk and issues relating to master data.
Identify areas for improvement within the master data processes, systems and policies.
 Please apply via the link below. For further information contact Anita Schmidt on aschmidt@sharpandcarter.com.au or 0434537103   By submitting your email address and any other personal information when applying to a job, you consent

We are seeking an experienced data analyst who has worked on a large data migration before, ideally from SAP CRM to Salesforce.  My client is a large corporate who are replacing their main technology platform which has touch points across
          the whole organisation and will involve improved ways of working. 
 
You will be joining an existing data team and will bring analytics capability that will allow them to expand on what they can currently do with their data.  Primarily, you will be migrating the data from SAP CRM to Salesforce. 
 
Your broad responsibilities will include;

Analyse and profile data in the existing system
Build/program any data transformation rules to ensure successful migration
Manage current and future data cleansing initiatives
Assist with physical data migration and provide end to end input on the migration processes
Assist with translating migration approach to layman terms
Provide input to the data migration strategy

 
This is a 12 month daily rate contract based in the CBD.

Analysing detailed application performance data sets to identify opportunities for continuous performance improvement.

Excellent knowledge of Excel.
Technical knowledge of data models, database design and data mining techniques

templatetext:
Sydney CBD
icare is currently seeking an experienced Senior Data Analyst with a commercial mindset and a passion for social impact to join the icare team

Exciting and integral role within the Care and Community service line
12-month initial opportunity
Salary from $108,044 + superannuation

We’re looking for someone with superior and current SQL skills to determine stakeholder business requirements and translate them into effective reporting solutions.
You’ll be working with a diverse mix of creative, curious, hardworking and smart people who really care about making a difference for people and the NSW community. You will have a mind for getting things done and a heart for people and you will
          set the bar high through the quality of the work you do and the people-oriented decisions you make.
In addition to SQL, you’ll bring your QLIK experience and analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret performance information and make sound decisions in a complex environment to the role. Your skills in leading and undertaking
          complex data analysis and ability to provide strategic advice are also necessary for this role. You enjoy working in a cohesive team and have excellent stakeholder and rapport building skills. The challenge of interpreting technical information
          to non -technical colleagues is one you relish.
It’s an exciting environment where no two days are the same. But on a typical day you might find yourself:

producing accurate, timely data transfer to Scheme Agents and SIRA
undertaking aspects of design, development, coding and testing, of data requirements for our care schemes
work on and manage data integrity and data cleanse initiatives for the business.
working closely with team members and the business unit to understand regular business requirements
working with business owners and key stakeholders to elicit, analyse, communicate and validate requirements and then document these requirements into data specifications

We’re a new kind of organisation, one that’s as supportive and socially conscious as it is agile and explorative. Our DNA of commercial mind and social heart captures who we are at our core.
If you think you’re the right person for this role, send us your resume (up to 5 pages). Don’t delay as we’re assessing applications as they are received. We’d love to hear how your capabilities, achievements and experience set you apart.
We know our strength comes from the diversity of our people and so we want people with different experiences and backgrounds to apply. We recognise the importance of balance and flexibility and understand that it’s not a one size fits all approach,
          so we’d be happy to talk about and consider your specific needs.
If there are any accessibility adjustments you need to help you be able to apply for this role, or if you require any further information about the role, please contact Kerry Goode on (02) 9216 3060          for a chat.
Please note that you must be an Australian citizen, a permanent resident of Australia, a New Zealand citizen with a current New Zealand Passport or a citizen of another country with a current visa that allows you to work in Australia for the duration
          of this temporary role. 

icare is the brand of Insurance & Care NSW
For more information about icare visit our website
icare operates a direct sourcing model so no agency introductions will be accepted
title: Senior Data Analyst

templatetext:
About IRESS
We began in 1993 as a small Australian tech start-up. Now we're a global team of over 1,750 brilliantly-minded people across five continents – and we're still growing. We're listed on the Australian Stock Exchange, with a strong financial track
          record and our continuous investment in product development and innovation is what keeps us ahead of the game. We may be one of the largest financial software providers, but we haven't forgotten our roots; we've kept the entrepreneurial spirit
          and agility that defined our early years - it's something we continue to look for and admire in our people.
About you
We are seeking a Business and Data Analyst to sit within the IRESSnet Product team. The role requires strong business, analysis and technical skills. This role entails analysing user requirements and documenting functional specifications to build/enhance
          software systems and engage in user-testing. This requires working globally with internal and external stakeholders as well as end users. The successful candidate will need to work in collaboration with a number of departments including Development,
          Test and Product to ensure client requirements are managed and delivered at a superior level.
Accountabilities & Deliverables

Liaise with internal and external users/clients to understand requirements/expectations as well as current business processes and offerings  
Comprehensive analysis on the status of existing business processes and offerings and provide insight to improvement methods and suggested efficiency enhancements  
Assessment of data provider file formats and requirements to align integrated content into IRESS’ product suite  
Preparation of high quality Business Requirements, Design Concepts and Functional Specifications for new/enhanced software modules and new datafeed imports for development teams  
Testing of new/enhanced software modules and functionality ensuring all client requirements are met and all Quality Assurance tests are passed before the deployment into the Production environment  
Development of Project Plans and effective monitoring of timelines and progress of delivery  
Communicating progress on projects to all internal and external stakeholders and clients/users Liaise with IRESSnet Head of Product to understand team priorities and scheduling required development  
Provide timely and concise responses to internal and external stakeholder and client/user queries  
Document all software and functionality changes and use in the delivery of training sessions for all internal and external users affected  
Provide first class product support to all internal and external stakeholders through formal Q & A sessions, identifying and resolving any problems that may arise swiftly and effectively  
Recognise and meet continually shifting priorities  
Continually analyse the IRESSnet Product and provide insight into efficiencies to enhance functionality

About You

Establish and maintain relationships with relevant stakeholders and users/clients  
Clearly articulate (both verbal and written) ideas, concepts and designs  
Ability to analyse and write well-structure documentation/specifications  
Ability to work within given timeframes and deadlines both at an individual level and a team level  
Time management skills with the ability to prioritise tasks  
Knowledge of XML and delimited file formats/structures  
Experience with implementing new processes and following through with required discipline  
Knowledge of file transport protocols such as sFTP and Web Services (desirable)  
Problem solving and troubleshooting skills

What we offer you in return
We work hard and we play hard. We recognise and reward hard work with a great benefits package. On top of a good remuneration package we’ll give you a generous holiday allowance, retirement fund and insurances.  You will have the opportunity
          to work on a range of technologies. We provide a flexible work environment and like to get our people together to have fun whether it's over a drink on a Friday afternoon, having a friendly kick about on the footy field or doing some team bonding
          for a charity event. We don’t sweat the small stuff either, our dress code is as relaxed as we are.
With offices worldwide, we offer exciting opportunities for you to learn, grow and progress. A career at IRESS really can take you anywhere.

Senior Data Analyst

title: Senior Data Analyst, Health System Reporting

templatetext:
This position sits with our client based in North Sydney for a 6 month initial contract with view for extension. The Data Analyst will be responsible for analytics and knowledge discovery as well as underlying data modelling and data engineering
          for a number business insights initiatives within the organisation.
The role will require using a broad range of techniques in data analytics, data mining, knowledge discovery, data modelling and statistics all with the ultimate goal of enabling effective and efficient data driven business decision making.
The role is also responsible for understanding the stakeholder requirements and data issues within the broader organisation, incorporating this knowledge into data analysis and data engineering and thereby delivering reporting / data solutions
          that are agile while at the same time robust and scalable.
This is a great opportunity for a candidate with strong data analytics foundation and commercial acumen to be a part of a team of all-rounders, to get involved in solving high impact data insights problems and to work with a wide range of stakeholders.
Key Responsibilities: 

Consulting and educating senior stakeholders through a business story-telling service using data, reporting, analysis & modelling
Analysing data and developing reporting packs to allow for executive managers / general manager to make effective decisions for the organisation. 
Developing ad-hoc reporting to ensure stakeholders are serviced in a timely fashion
Designing and building data analysis solutions, from concept through to prototyping and productionising phases
Understanding complex data relationships and data structures and their alignment with the business issues and strategy
Researching and selecting the latest and best tools and methods for data analysis, data visualisation, data modelling and data wrangling
Designing, engineering and support of conceptual data models and data structures that enable analysis and reporting
Championing agility and responsiveness, while ensuring robustness and scalability of data structures and data models
Contributing to the improvement of data analysis processes and methods and to alignment of data analysis with organisation's broader strategy. 

Role Requirements: 

Strong stakeholder management; someone who can translate technical language into business language. 
Experience with visualisation tools (Tableau). 
SQL, Transact SQL packages and SSIS experience. 
ETL knowledge and data warehousing concepts (dimensional modelling). 
Experience in R or Python programming. 

 
 
 To be considered for the role click the 'Apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Alyssa Lau on 02 9464 5658. Please quote our job reference number: 200184800.
title: Data Analyst

templatetext:
The Master Data Analyst will assist with the development and leading of the data management infrastructure across multiple Operational systems in the business.
This role will be responsible for developing best practice data processes through ongoing maintenance and system testing, whilst working with various system implementation teams to capture, provision and upload data. 
As a key contributor within the team, you will be instrumental in providing accurate and timely data management across all systems. 
Duties and Responsibilities

Liaise with the relevant business partners to ensure that data regarding new inventory and products is kept up to date, and reflected across relevant systems
Development of controls and sign off processes for the importation and upkeep of data into each system
Maintain and upkeep Hungry Jack’s product codes, including set up of the product name/ codes, recipe, price and other information across the store back-office (Macromatix) and POS (NCR) systems
Maintain inventory codes and inventory costings across all relevant systems
Establish new stores and maintain existing stores in the systems, or the transfer of stores between company owned and franchise owned stores
Manage the addition, modification and deletion of POS, Hot Schedules (Macromatix), Oracle Fusion and other system items
Proactively identify process and data integrity improvement opportunities and participate in their implementation
Cross training of self and other team members across all systems, including new systems deployed within Hungry Jack’s
Active participation in Hungry Jack’s projects where master data input and involvement is required

Skills and Experience 

2+ years in retail Assistant Manager role or higher

templatetext:
The Opportunity
Due to significant growth an opportunity for a suitably qualified SQL Data Analyst has arisen to work for one of South Australia's leading organisations and true success stories. Working with cross-functional teams in a consultative role, the
          SQL Data Analyst is responsible for data related activities including interpreting the outcomes required from data queries, extracts and data reporting. The SQL Data Analyst primary focus will be designing, defining and enhancing analysis &
          reports used by key stakeholders.
 
The Company
We are a proudly South Australian family business, operating for over 30 years. Our story began in 1984, when Fred (Fathi) Shahin saw a local Woodville Park service station for sale with an adjoining home and immediately bought it. Each of Fred
          Shahin's sons subsequently joined the business and to this day, the same family-based, ethical and sustainable values remain a hallmark of Peregrine and underpin every decision.
Peregrine Corporation is now the largest private company in South Australia with over 3500 employees and it continues to grow. Our excellence in retail operations is recognised at an international level, with high profile Company brands including
          On The Run convenience stores and Smokemart & GiftBox outlets.
For more information about Peregrine please visit our website www.peregrine.com.au
 
Key responsibilities include:

Translate business requirements into specifications that will be used to implement the required analysis & reports, created from multiple data sources.
Work with key stakeholders to validate and formulate strategies for advancement in maturity of the use of information.
Create solutions that allow capture and utilisation of existing data into useable data formats.
Create solutions using SQL to extract data and produce reports.
Define new stored procedures and SSIS packages.
Liaise with management and business users to identify problems and to gather suggestions for improvements.
Perform and document critical information analysis requirements with an outcome focus.
Proactively provide technical assistance and cross training to other team members.
Design and implement technology best practices, guidelines and repeatable processes.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues via phone, web and in person.
Offer flexibility to take on new data related tasks with ability to deliver to deadlines with little supervision.

 
The Successful candidate will possess:

Tertiary qualifications in IT or equivalent industry experience is essential.
Advanced skills using SQL Server.
Strong understanding of SQL and stored procedures, with the ability to make modifications to existing stored procedures.
Experience executing on relevant packages to check data and migrate data to/from data staging tables in SQL.
Experienced with ETL process and concepts.
Outstanding interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills with the ability to communicate with Customers using non-technical language.
Evident track record delivering technical/digital solutions to address business problems in a complex, multi- stakeholder environment.
Displays positive team attitude and willingness to help the team where needed.

 
What's in it for you?
You will have the opportunity to join a fast paced, growth focused organisation and take the lead on a number of key projects. Working in a large SA based organisation with a National footprint, you will be offered real career growth and a challenging,
          rewarding environment.
 
If you believe you fit this role please submit your CV and Cover Letter by clicking the 'apply now' button below. Please note only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.

About Xero
 
Here at Xero we are all about people and building beautiful experiences for our customers. Join our passionate team who love to learn and get involved in the community. We focus on developing solutions to make it easier for small businesses to
          grow through beautiful accounting software. With us you have a chance to have an impact on the lives and businesses of people globally.
Working at Xero will provide you with a diverse and inclusive environment alongside people who will respect, challenge, support and mentor you to have fun while you do the best work of your life. We are a place where personal development, innovation,
          and change are not only inspired but also celebrated. We value our people and want them to enjoy and take pride in their work.
About the role
As a member of our product team, you will play a key role in how we understand and use our data to deliver amazing experiences in our product. You will achieve this through:
 

Analysing our current data gathering tools and processes to identify ways to make improvements - making it easier and quicker to collect, analyse, interpret and share data and findings

 

Using a range of simple and advanced analytical techniques and approaches to understand how our customers use our products, and collaborate with various teams across the business to help collect data and establish insights that inform product
            & roadmap decisions

 

Continually explore and analyse customer behaviour to identify patterns and drive improved conversion and retention, helping make our products better and our customers happier

About you
We are looking for someone with a passion for building great products and, just as important as the experience, is the ability to be #human and take ownership of your environment. We are so lucky to have excellent people to work with and offices
          to work in and we'd love you to be a part of it.
So for you to be successful as Xero’s next Senior Product Data Analyst you'll ideally have some experience in:

A previous Analyst role where you were responsible for applying data driven insights to recommendations in commercial settings
Applying data modelling aggregation and visualisation techniques and methods
Working with analytics software and tagging tools to support a complex product or digital experience(s)
Applying programmatic statistical packages and libraries such as R, Python or similar
Driving insights and recommendations from A/B testing
SQL and proven ability wrangling data from multiple sources.
Creating, maintaining and improving clear and easy to understand documentation
Establishing relationships with a broad technical and non-technical stakeholder group and presenting your message in a concise and consistent manner
Building your own skill set in an ever changing, innovative, global environment.

Xero is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity, foster innovation and reward success.
If you want to come to work with friends every single day and help to make Xero even more special, please apply!

templatetext:
Senior Data Analyst
 
We are looking for passionate data professionals in the Canberra Risk Advisory team.
 
About the role
Based in Canberra, we are looking for a Senior Analyst to get involved in:
 
Problem-solving

Liaise with key stakeholders and clients to determine complex risk issues affecting clients.
Design analytical solutions in response to risk issues.
Identify and evaluate organisational risks and recommend optimal process and system changes to better manage future risk.

People

Work collaboratively with other members of the Risk Analytics team.
Support recruitment of new team members.

Communication

Manage the analysis and interpretation of data towards relevant communications to explain the value of the work completed; to both clients and other Deloitte team members.
Contribute to proposal development and the communication of proposals to clients and other Deloitte team members.

Technology

Identify data to be collected from enterprise systems and other related data sources
Assess and determine the techniques and tools to be used in collection, analysis and communication for a project.
Apply selected analytical techniques and tools to achieve project outcomes.
Evaluate the reliability and utility of source information.

Projects

Manage project deliverables - working within project management methodologies and contribute to the development of project plans, scope, risk management and knowledge management.

About You
The ideal candidate will possess the following:

Australian Citizenship with an active Security Clearance (or ability to obtain a Security Clearance)
Knowledge and experience of data management/analysis and the ability to apply this across a range of government agencies, and/or a Bachelor degree or higher qualification in any discipline. Some of our best people have degrees you do not normally
            associate with data analysis!
Experience in Microsoft CRM
Experience in Cloudera/Hadoop or Apache Spark or other tools will be an advantage
Experience extracting and analysing data from enterprise systems and other data sources
An awareness of the appropriateness of applying rules-based analytics and data driven analytics
Experience in applying Risk Analytics to at least one of the following industries - Government, Financial Services & Insurance, Energy & Resources
Ideally, structured problem solving skills
Ideally, an understanding of core accounting and business concepts
Some overnight travel may be required

About UsWe pride ourselves on our team of diverse, high performing Deloitte Professionals who are talented, supportive, inclusive and social - and who are at the heart of our success. Our aim is to ensure that all our
          people feel comfortable to bring their whole selves to work, and as a result, create a workplace that encourages the true spirit of 'And different'.
From day one at our firm you’ll be considered part of the Deloitte community and our development and career progression framework will help you develop the skills and capabilities you need to succeed - in every sense of the word.
 
Next Steps
To apply, please follow the application process.If you have any questions, contact Laura Martin from the Talent Acquisition Team via LinkedIn.
 
This position is only open to Australian Citizens due to the nature of client engagements. For other positions, we encourage Non-residents, Non-citizens to view our Careers page and apply.
 
 
By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent & exceptional Deloitte experience globally.
title: Senior Data Analyst

templatetext:
Senior Data Analyst

Superannuation with ethical investment options
Flexible work arrangements - work in a way that suits you best!
18-weeks paid parental leave

Do you find satisfaction in unlocking insights that data can hold? Our Canberra Risk Analytics team is after a Senior Analyst to join us. Apply now.
 
What will your typical day look like?
 
Step into our Canberra Risk Analytics team where support and collaboration is at the heart of our success. You’re definitely a people person and will excel in managing project deliverables whilst liaising with senior stakeholders and clients to
          excavate complex risk issues. Then, work with our team of talented Risk specialists to craft and recommend analytical solutions that protect clients from future risk.
 
About the team
 
It is the age of automation and algorithms - the future is now. Emerging technologies introduce reliable data, but when managed poorly - costs and risks. Companies are constantly seeking to monitor and protect themselves against major risk events.


Join us.
 
As a group of IT experts, we work together to help clients operate “control safety nets” and offer sophisticated advice to handling and distilling their data into valuable insights.
 
Enough about us, let’s talk about you.
You are someone with:


Australian Citizenship with an active Security Clearance (or ability to obtain one)


Experience with Microsoft CRM

Experience with Cloudera/Hadoop

Confidence in data interpretation and an ability to clearly articulate insights to both clients and team members.


Experience in applying Risk Analytics to at least one of the following industries is ideal - Government, Financial Services & Insurance, Energy & Resources


Flexibility in work arrangements - some overnight travel may be required


Why Deloitte?At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. We value difference, and embrace people with
          diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.Next StepsSound
          like the sort of role for you? Apply now.If you’ve got any questions or wish to have a confidential conversation about this role, contact Laura Martin from the ­­­­Talent Acquisition Team via LinkedIn. We’d love to hear from you!
title: Senior Data Analyst

company: The Department of Finance, Services and Innovation
templatetext:
High profile government agency
Temporary role of up to 12 Months based in Sydney, The Rocks
Salary package up to $131,969 per annum 
 
About us: 
 
We deliver property solutions and great places for the people of NSW. 
 
Property NSW is focused on excellence in property, infrastructure and places. We deliver continuous improvement and innovation. Our approach is to collaborate with stakeholders to deliver government objectives for the community. We manage the
          State's significant property portfolio and its places, which results in better visitor experiences and services for the people of NSW. 
 
Property NSW remains part of the Department of Finance, Services and Innovation. The ICT team proactively supports the business in the delivery of innovative, digitally enabled property services. In partnership with external service providers,
          ICT’s purpose is to deliver best ​practice ICT services and advice as trusted advocates​​ of information​​​ technology.
 
 
About you: 

Extensive experience in business improvement and organisational change initiatives
You will be able to engage internal stakeholders at all levels to communicate and guide    
You will be able to develop a practical and sustainable framework to ensure that Property NSW continues to manage its data sets provide analysis and technical support to internal and external stakeholders.

Key accountabilities:

Work collaboratively with internal stakeholders in developing processes for efficient and secure management of data.
Provide analysis, advice on information systems, processes and governance pertaining to data management and recommend improvements
In conjunction with the Data Architect and other internal architects, identify gaps in existing architecture, processes and documentation and develop a plan to remediate 
In conjunction with the project team develop an overall delivery plan that will drive how the framework is implemented  
Participate in projects to support the delivery of business objectives and compliance with effective data governance.
Working with operational teams help to identify and resolve data quality and management issues to facilitate the use, consumption and presentation of operational data

 
Challenges:
 
·    Embedding sustainable frameworks and governance processes into normal day today operations 
·    Working with large data sets from a broad range of sources, both internal and external, taking into considerations data privacy, availability. integrity and integration

The Position:

This position is part of a team structure (Business Systems and Architecture) that will implement, alongside key business staff, an overall data governance framework across the business. You will work with existing architecture staff and all facets
          of the business to complete the architecture of all data sets, held both internally and with external service providers. The outcomes expected include the development of a sustainable  The work is part of a coordinated approach under project
          management control. At times you will be expected to work autonomously but also within this project reporting structure to contribute to developing a roadmap and structure and working model that underpin the management, analysis and reporting
          of property data on behalf of whole of government.
 
Join us: This is a unique opportunity to deliver quality outcomes for government that positively impact NSW.
 
Learn more: Please review the Role Description and visit us at Department of Finance, Services & Innovation or
          Property NSW. For enquiries regarding this role, please contact Bob Millevoi – Senior Manager Business Systems and Architecture on 02 8276 8331 or bob.millevoi@property.nsw.gov.au.
 
Salary: Grade 9/10. Salary package up to $131,969. Package includes a base salary ($108,044 - $119,061) and employer’s contribution to superannuation.
 
Closing Date:  6th February 2019 (11.59PM). If you are interested in this role please apply online and include (in a maximum of 5 pages) your resume and a covering letter which clearly details your capabilities and experience
          relevant to this position. As well answer the two targeted questions below.. Applicants invited for interview may be required to complete additional assessments. There are no selection criteria to be addressed.

Targeted Questions:
1.      Provide details of experience you have where you have played a significant part in organisational change implementing a new methodology/framework. (Max 300 words)

2.      Outline the details that need to be considered and addressed when considering data governance for an organisation. (Max 300 words)
 
 
Job Status: Temporary/Term role for up to 12 months under the Government Sector Employment Act 2013.
 
Apply now: at iworkforNSW Should you encounter any technical problems, please contact I Work for NSW support desk on 1800 562 679. For any questions about making
          your application, please contact DFSI Recruitment Team 02 9372 8121.  If you require any assistance with technology, visual/hearing aids or location access for the interview process, please indicate within your application or contact
          the DFSI Recruitment team.
 
Job reference: 00006PZF
  
The Department of Finance, Services and Innovation is an EEO employer and welcomes applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people from diverse cultures and people with a disability. At DFSI, we endeavour to make roles flexible. While these roles are advertised as full time, we will consider requests to undertake flexible work arrangements including on a part-time or job share

title: Finance & Data Analyst

templatetext:
Data Analyst – Local Area Coordination

Full Time, Fixed-Term contract until 30th June 2019
Location: Adelaide, SA
Opportunity to help the lives of Australians in need 

About Us 
Mission Australia is a non-denominational Christian charity that has been helping vulnerable Australians move towards independence for more than 155 years.
Every day we support people nationwide by combating homelessness, assisting disadvantaged families and children, addressing mental health issues, fighting substance dependencies and much more.
We're generously supported by our funders, partners and tens of thousands of everyday Australians, who make the work of our tireless volunteers and staff possible.
Your Opportunity
The Data Analyst meets reporting and contractual requirements for Local Area Coordination services, by analysing data and generating insights that contribute to the delivery of a range of activities focused on improving service delivery, client
          outcomes and contractual compliance. This directly contributes to informing business decision-making and planning, supporting the broader organisation to achieve its strategic priorities, as well as delivering on regular reporting requirements
          to meet compliance.

Review and analyse data collection processes.
Engage in continuous quality improvement activities for data collection and reporting.
Collate, review and analyse data for reporting purposes, developing high quality reports that contribute to contractual compliance. 
Regularly update and provide analysis findings to leadership team.
Build strong partnerships with internal and external stakeholders, to collaboratively share data insights and make suggestions for improvement initiatives.
Represent Mission Australia positively by working professionally and with integrity.
Effectively prioritise workloads, ensuring reporting schedules and quality assurance processes are adhered to.

Requirements for Success

Solid experience in data analysis and generating advanced Excel/PowerPoint reports to generate insights to inform decision making and deliver project outcomes.
Proven ability to undertake report writing activities that utilise qualitative and quantitative data to evidence outcomes/ performance.
Demonstrated ability to build strong, respectful relationships and to collaborate effectively to achieve business outcomes.
Proven ability to synthesise, analyse and communicate complex information, in a simple yet compelling way, both in writing and orally, across a wide audience.
Previous Human Services or not-for-profit sector experience.
Understanding of the National Disability Insurance Scheme is extremely desirable.

As part of our Employment screening process you will be required to undertake a National Criminal History Check if you haven’t completed one in the last 12 months.
In addition, there is a requirement to possess a current Working with Children check or apply if you do not already hold one. It is unlawful for prohibited persons to apply for work with children, and, as such, prohibited persons cannot apply
          for this role.
Culture & Benefits  
A career with Mission Australia will offer you rewarding experiences to make a difference to the lives of Australians in need. We have an innovative and supportive culture guided by our values of compassion, integrity, respect, perseverance and
          celebration.
To ensure our employees feel valued, empowered and celebrated we provide a range of employee benefits including:

NFP salary packaging benefits reducing taxable income (details via Advantage)
Discounted childcare rates with participating centres
Generous discounts with hotels, travel insurance and major retailers
Free, confidential counselling services via our EAP
Discounted health care with Medibank Private

Diversity & Inclusion
Mission Australia is an inclusive employer. We celebrate our diversity and strive to reflect contemporary Australian society and all the communities in which we work, in order to better serve our clients. We welcome and encourage applications
          from Women, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, Culturally and Linguistically Diverse people, People with Disability, Sexually and Gender Diverse people, people with lived experience of adversity and from people of all ages.
Next Steps
To be considered for this opportunity, please click ‘apply’ and send your cover letter and resume today.
For more information, feel free to view the Job Description via  PD Data Analyst, Jan 2019 (2).pdf
For further information regarding working with us visit Working for Mission Australia.
Applications close midnight, Sunday 3rd February 2019, however candidates are encouraged to apply earlier as shortlisting and interviews will commence soon.

title: Business Data Analyst

templatetext:
Your new role
Based in our West Perth office, this is an exciting opportunity to join our Risk team; leveraging your knowledge and experiences to develop data driven strategies for AFG.
 
Reporting directly to the Head of Risk you will be a partner to business units across the AFG Group as we build new data driven strategies to power a growing home loans portfolio and thriving broker aggregation business.
 
Our organisation thrives on being fast paced and innovative. This role will answer the “why” and the “how” as well as the “what”.  The successful candidate will work closely with our IT team to build out our data analytic environment and
          platform tools; in addition to partnering with stakeholders from Sales, Finance and Operations.
 
Who are you
You come from a background which excels at managing risk versus reward. This may be in a lending environment where measuring against risk appetite is common and superior analytics provides a competitive advantage.
 
You enjoy creative problem solving to achieve superior internal and customer outcomes. Data analysis and modelling is a path you have chosen and you want to partner with an organisation that recognises these skills to grow and succeed.
 
You will be required to demonstrate:

Tertiary degree qualified in statistics, commerce/accounting, computer science or equivalent
At least 3 years’ experience analysing data, producing insightful reporting via BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau or similar
Competency using analytical tools such as SAS, R, Python or similar
Proven track record in solving complex problems related to growing  businesses using data driven strategy
Building predictive models using regression or other statistical techniques will be highly regarded
Confidence to engage stakeholders and present to the senior leadership group
Excellent work ethic and time management skills

 
 
Get What You Give
AFG employees have access to benefits including flexible working arrangements, business casual dress, secured buildings with end-of-trip facilities, education assistance, employee assistance and wellbeing programs and a social calendar of events.
          You will have the ability to liaise with and learn from our executive team as well and develop your career. All over Australia, our AFG team members love being a part of the business and the length of time they choose to stay with us is evidence
          of this.
 
Watch our Working at AFG video below to find out more and hear from those who enjoy being a part of the AFG family.
For more information visit our website at www.afgonline.com.au because we have so much to say we can't fit it all here!
 
Who is AFG
Australian Finance Group (ASX:AFG) is one of Australia's largest mortgage broking groups, employing 200+ staff across Australia. As a category leader, AFG has over 2,950 mortgage brokers under its umbrella who have access to over 4000 financial
          products from over 50 of Australia's leading lenders spanning across residential and business lending. 
Through our broker network, AFG processes around one in eleven of all Australian residential mortgages and manages over $145 billion in mortgage finance. In addition to our broker network AFG have a rapidly growing home loan business, and an expanding
          footprint in the provision of business lending solutions.
 
AFG is committed to our culture. We provide an inclusive workplace where all are welcomed and recognised for their unique ability, regardless of gender, race, religion, disability, orientation or other identity attribute.
 
If you are looking to take the next step in your career and develop your skills in a professional, friendly work environment please apply by forwarding your covering letter and CV via the link below. Any questions can be directed to Tony Bird,
          Head of Risk and Compliance via email at tony.bird@afgonline.com.au.
title: Senior Data Analyst

templatetext:
Exciting opportunity to join a dynamic and high performing team
Great Parramatta location
Generous remuneration package. Starting salary from $94,782 plus super and leave loading

 
Do work that matters
Our Water Utilities team is looking for a Data Analyst interested in water utility performance to join our busy team. This is an exciting opportunity to make a significant contribution to ensuring that the water and wastewater services provided
          by regional NSW’s local water utilities are safe, secure and sustainable
As a Policy Officer with a focus on data analytics, you will be contributing to the collection, compilation, validation and analysis of performance data within local water utilities in regional NSW. You will support the delivery of water utility
          specific performance monitoring and benchmarking to ensure the department meets its performance monitoring and reporting requirements.
To learn more about the role, please click here to view the role description.
 
About You
To be successful in this role, our ideal candidate will demonstrate:

Ability to analyse complex issues and provide innovative solutions
Strong communication skills
Capacity to effectively monitor your own workload and balance competing demands and priorities
Experience in data analysis and database management

 
About Us
The NSW Department of Industry leads the state government’s contribution to making NSW a place where people want to live and work, and businesses choose to invest and grow. Our Water Branch exists to efficiently manage water in NSW with the objective
          to create a contemporary government water agency focused on planning and policy, regulation, information and insights, and programs and performance.
 
Applying for the role
Please include your resume and a brief cover letter demonstrating your relevant experience and outlining your suitability for the role.       
Applications Close:  Sunday, 10 February 2019 11:55 PM
Contact: Mr Sascha Moege, Manager Water Utility Policy at0414 310 763
A recruitment pool may be created for ongoing and temporary roles of the same role or role type that may become available for filling over the next twelve months. 
 
The Department of Industry is committed to ensuring the sector reflects the NSW community it serves. We promote a flexible and inclusive workplace where staff have access to opportunities and resources at all levels, enabling our team to drive innovation, productivity and the delivery of high-quality services.  
We welcome and encourage applications from people across our diverse community. We believe everyone has the right to feel safe, respected, valued and heard regardless of their gender, sexual orientation, ethnic background or disability.

title: Policy Officer, Data Analyst

templatetext:
· Temporary Opportunity for 2 Years
· Based in Sydney CBD, convenient location
· Attractive remuneration package
 
About us
 
The Strategy and Policy Division is responsible for ensuring that the Department's policy framework is aligned with the Government's current priorities, and provides high level expert policy advice and support to the Justice Cluster Ministers,
          the Department and other departments in designing and delivering significant justice system reforms.
About the role
 
The role of Senior Data Analyst contributes to the development of data assets, tools and systems for the Justice System Performance and Analysis Unit, which supports system-wide insights on operational performance across the Justice
          system. The role will be working alongside a diverse team of policy analysts, business analysts, financial analysts and various stakeholders across the department in building new data products for stakeholders across the justice system.
 
The role’s responsibilities include working closely with stakeholders to understand requirements, undertaking investigation, sourcing and maintaining data collections, performing a range of data cleansing, data transformation, data analysis and
          data visualisation tasks using analytical tools such as SQL and Tableau and delivering data products to support the Unit’s work plan. The role will also help implement data management best practices and the use of appropriate tools and processes
          that help the Unit make the best use of data.
 
For more details regarding this role, please click here to download the role description.
 
About you
 
The role requires technical skills in data management, an understanding of how data is used to provide business insights and influence decision-making, and good stakeholder engagement skills to source and manage data from multiple sources across
          the justice system. 
 
The role requires the ability to work well in a small team, providing support to colleagues and helping to implement good practices, and operating effectively in a complex, sensitive and changing environment with significant data challenges. Knowledge
          of the justice system or other complex public sector systems and their data management issues would be an advantage but is not essential.
 
Essential Requirements

Tertiary qualifications in computer science, statistics or similar field or relevant equivalent experience
Experience in SQL/T-SQL, TABLEAU and SSIS. Experience in some other programming languages such as POWER BI, R, PYTHON, MATLAB or VBA would be an advantage
            


Applying for the role
 
To apply for this role please submit an application online via www.iworkfor.nsw.gov.au and attach an up to date resume along with a cover letter outlining how you meet the requirements
          and capabilities of this role. 
 Key Application Responses

As part of the application process, you will be asked to address two targeted questions based on the focus Capabilities for this role:
 

Please provide examples that demonstrates your experience in developing dashboards that supports organisations in understanding their performance against agreed desired outcomes

 

Please provide examples that demonstrate your experience working with stakeholders to drive, define and agree on measurable organisational KPIs

 
Contact: Vidhya Rao - vidhya.rao@justice.nsw.gov.au
 
Closing date:  11/02/19 (11.59pm)
 
A talent pool may be created for future ongoing and temporary roles and is valid for a period of up to 12 months.
 The Department of Justice is committed to building a workplace that values and supports diversity and inclusion. We actively promote the employment of women, people with a disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, LGBTI and people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds. 
The Department encourages applications from people with disability and will provide reasonable adjustments in our recruitment process and in the workplace. If you need an adjustment in the recruitment process, please call or email the contact person listed below, and also advise us of your preferred method of communication.

title: Senior Data Analyst, Performance and Analysis

templatetext:
One of Sydney's leading property funds wishes to appoint a data modelling specialist to join the growing finance team.Main responsibilities

Engaging with financial stakeholders to understand project requirements relating to residential property price and scorecards modelling.
Using Microsoft Office to generate and refine all documents for funds subscription, including Information Memorandum, Product Information Table and Product Disclosure Statement.
Gathering and manipulating data in excel (using pivot table and functions such as vlookup) to create the relevant data sets.
Making curve fitting (using excel graph) for residential property price.
Performing T-test, Regression and non-parametric test to optimize marketing and investment decisions (using SAS coding).
Presenting results back to financial stakeholders with recommendations on data validation decisions.
 Ideal profile*Property background*Modelling experienceCompetitive salary and bonus on offer.If you are interested in discussing further, please contact me on nhill@fourquarters.com.au
title: Data Analyst

salary: Great Base Salary + Super + Annual Bonus
templatetext:
ABOUT THE JOB
As our Cross-Border Data Analyst you have a fantastic opportunity to really help our business forecast accurately and make business decisions, based on your insights. You will be responsible for capturing the data, (including macro-economic trends;
          cross-border monitoring; social listening and platform monitoring, etc.), to analyse and draw insights from.
Your responsibilities will include (but are not limited to):

Capture, analyse, and draw insights from multiple data points which can help the business meet its goals
Nurture relationships with key stakeholders (domestically and internationally) to prioritise ongoing business needs
Become the ‘go to’ person for all Data and Market insights for our export/cross-border business
Co-create a data strategy which will support future data requirements
Support any ad-hoc reporting requests from our local and global community

ABOUT YOU
You are able to speak and read Mandarin and have experience in a similar Data Analyst role. Experience with e-commerce platforms such as Taobao; WeChat & Weibo will be highly beneficial as well as an understanding of the ANZ Daigou Channel
Ideally you will have:

Previous experience in a similar Data Analyst role
Able to speak and read Mandarin
Familiarity with various e-commerce platforms e.g Taobao; WeChat, Weibo etc.
Intermediate Excel skills – VLOOKUPS & Pivot Tables
Great communication and interpersonal skills

ABOUT US
Danone’s mission is Bringing health through food to as many people as possible and we want to invite people to join the movement for a healthier world. We recognize the power people have to impact the world through their daily choices. Each time
          we eat and drink, we vote for the world we want to live in. We believe a healthy body needs healthy food. And healthy food needs a healthy planet and this is what our new signature One Planet One Health embodies. (LINK TO YOUTUBE VIDEO: https://youtu.be/0wBhigOz_ic)
WE OFFER
As our Cross-border Data Analyst you will gain fantastic experience in an Export/cross-border market and be open to career opportunities locally and abroad. Additionally we have:

Onsite Gym and close to local café’s
Subsidised Health Insurance
Thank Danone it’s Friday – Finish at 3pm on Fridays!

We believe everyone has talent, something which comes natural to you. Your uniqueness is something which brings both excellence as well as energises you.
HOW TO APPLY
If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you to really make this role your own, please hit the APPLY button, but do so before the 15th of February 2019
 
*Unsuccessful candidates will be contacted following the closing date
**You must hold valid working rights to be considered for this role
title: Cross-Border Data Analyst

templatetext:
Energy Action is a leading national provider of innovative energy solutions to business and government clients, this includes; Energy Procurement, Contract Management, Energy Efficiency, Project Advisory Services and onsite energy
          generation services. We help clients understand and take control of their energy needs. We aim to reduce and optimise electricity and gas usage, saving businesses money on their energy bills and helping them to become more economically and environmentally
          sustainable.
We're looking for an experienced Junior Data Analyst to provide energy reporting outputs to our business clients & professional client query support. This role will be based in our  Parramatta
          head office on a full time basis.
In this role, you can expect to:

Provide regular and timely reports as per contractual requirements
Contribute to the growth of the business by assisting in the day to day service of existing and new clients
Be actively involved in process improvement to enhance system and service capabilities and efficiencies within the team and broader teams
Effectively communicate with internal and external stakeholders in person, by phone and via email correspondence
Get actively involved in Projects and User Acceptance Testing from time to time
Provide support to our clients. Manage client enquiries; provide energy market and contract information and assistance as required

So what's in it for you?

Work for an ASX listed company
Apply your client services skills and experience in the most talked about industry. Energy consumption is high on the agenda of business owners and consumers alike, this is a great opportunity to develop or build on your energy knowledge and
            experience
On the job training
Exposure to different areas of the business
Learn about energy management and the end to end solutions we deliver to our clients
Work with a collaborative team of energy professionals who have a great sense of humour

We're interested in hearing from you if you have:

Minimum 2 years' experience in a client centric environment
Analytical experience with high volume data
Can easily build rapport with team members, other teams, clients and service providers
Demonstrated experience and a strong commitment in providing outstanding client services both internally and externally
Exceptional organisational and time management skills
Intermediate proficiency in Microsoft suite of products
Sound knowledge of the energy sector (preferred but not essential)

If you're a self-motivated individual who thrives in a team environment, we'd love to hear from you.
Please include your resume and application letter.
Energy Action is an equal employment opportunity employer that supports diversity and an inclusive work environment.
title: Junior Data Analyst

templatetext:
Senior Data Analyst

Based in the heart of Canberra
Full-time permanent opportunity
Paying $86,723 - $91,157 + 17% Super
 THE ORGANISATION Based in Australia’s Capital city of Canberra, the Australian National University (ANU) is a globally recognised leader within the education sector. The University’s focus on excellence in research and
        education ensures their graduates are not only in demand the world-over, but also well-prepared to address complex contemporary challenges. Joining a team committed to excellence in research, education and public policy development, this
        position will sit within the Australian National University Advancement Office (ADV) which leads the development, management and coordination of advancement activities within the University. ADV supports the University’s objectives to deepen relationships
        with alumni and secure long-term philanthropic income. DUTIES OF THE ROLE The Senior Data Analyst is responsible for the technical design, implementation and continuous improvement of a comprehensive reporting suite
        for Advancement’s Client Relationships Management (CRM) system, Raiser’s Edge. Responsibilities include;

Engage and collaborate with ANU ADV staff and across ANU to understand technical data, segmentation and reporting needs. Design and deploy reports on the platform appropriate to the needs of various stakeholders. Conduct workshops, focus groups,
            deliver presentations and training based on the above functionality and knowledge
Undertake the development and delivery of a comprehensive reporting framework aligned to the CRM system. Contribute to the development of team processes and practices to ensure consistent quality of deliverables regarding provision of data and
            reports
Review, identify and recommend improvements to the system infrastructure and provide strategic and technical advice enabling effective data provision and reporting to all stakeholders. Contribute to the development, review and implementation
            of strategic planning, best practice policy development and decision-making process
Comply with all ANU policies and procedures, and in particular those relating to WH&S and equal opportunity
 ABOUT YOU The ideal candidate for this position will have great technical and organisational skills accompanied with an analytical mindset.

A University Degree within a relevant field and experience, reporting experience in an advancement setting would be an advantage and extensive experience within the Raiser’s Edge CRM
Proven experience in developing and managing CRMs and databases and associated reporting tools such as Cognos, SSRS or similar
Numerical, analytical and problem-solving skills, high attention to detail, ability to use initiative, great problem-solving skills, and the ability to collect, analyse, interpret and make recommendations based on data
The ability to work both autonomously and within a team
 CULTURE AND BENEFITS The culture within the Advancement team is values driven, leading to the unique history of the University. The benefits of working for the University are:

Professional and collaborative work environment
Excellent remuneration and benefit packages
17% superannuation contributions annual leave loading
Salary sacrificing options for cars, parking, technology, childcare and more
Christmas and New Year leave in addition to annual leave
Parking on campus that is less expensive than city parking
 HOW TO APPLY If this role is of interest, please submit your resume below. If you have any further questions about this role, please call Claire at 02 9279 2777.

title: Marketing Data Analyst

templatetext:
About Public Transport Victoria (PTV)
Public Transport Victoria (PTV) is a statutory authority that acts as a system authority for all public transport and an advocate for public transport users. We are a single contact point for customers wanting information on public transport services,
          fares, tickets and initiatives. PTV aims to improve public transport in Victoria by ensuring better coordination between modes, facilitating expansions to the network, auditing public transport assets, promoting public transport as an alternative
          to the car.
To put this in perspective:

We have a hand in over half a billion trips across the public transport network annually
We facilitate 1.6 million trips a day
We move hundreds of thousands of people around the state daily

In practical terms, we move people towards many of life's most meaningful experiences, whether it be work, education, social engagements, play, or Melbourne's key attractions (e.g. Australian open, AFL games, Royal Melbourne show... take your
          pick). When masses of people need to get from point A to point B - know that PTV has played a role. While our core business is public transport, we are also working toward a much bigger, longer-term and impactful agenda. We are contributing
          toward Victoria's liveability and economic development.
While we are continuing to learn and improve, we do in-fact pull off some pretty amazing things. So, if contributing toward Victoria's future excites you, take this ad as an invite to come and work with us. 
About the role

The PASS Assets Senior GIS Data Analyst is responsible for the maintenance of the data held within PASS Assets.
This role has a comprehensive knowledge of the PASS Assets data structures and maintenance procedures.
The PASS Assets Senior GIS Data Analyst will seek to proactively enhance the integrity of the PASS Assets data.
This will also include providing support to the Configuration Team in development and execution of initiatives as required.
What we're looking for
Essential (must have to be considered for the position)

Excellent and up to date knowledge of the PASS Assets application.
Experience with complex topologically structured network data.
Ability to cross reference multiple data sources to determine a clear understanding of data completeness and accuracy.
Experience with GE Smallworld, Mapinfo and Safesoftware FME

Desirable (will be well suited to the role)

Experience in the Rail or State Government.
Preferred experience with Atlassian JIRA, Microsoft SQL Server, ER Mapper, JPEG EXIF headers.
At least five years' experience maintaining large and complex spatial datasets.

Qualifications
Mandatory

A tertiary qualification in Geospatial Science or Information Technology.

How to apply
Please click the ‘Apply Now' button below.  Your application must include a cover letter and separate resume (MS Word compatible).  For further information about the role, please refer to the attached position description and capability
          framework documents. If you have any questions specific to the role, please email amy.tan@ptv.vic.gov.au
Applications close 11:59 P.M. on Sunday 10th February, 2019
Emailed applications will not be accepted.

Unsolicited recruitment agency applications will not be accepted.

Public Transport Victoria is committed to fostering a work environment that is inclusive and supports diversity and flexibility. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
