title: Senior Data Analyst

templatetext:
Kinetic IT is on the lookout for an Data Analyst to be part of a major expansion that sees us grow our footprint in new regions. This is a newly created position and a unique opportunity to join a mature organisation in a greenfield environment,
        while enjoying the challenge of an expansion with the support and backing of a large organisation behind you.  About us:  Kinetic IT has come a long way since opening its doors 20 years ago, growing to become one
        of Australia’s largest ICT managed service providers with over 1000 staff. With offices in all major capitals, we support customers with complex ICT infrastructures, critical data and multi layered environments - and we don’t limit ourselves to
        a single industry or sector.  It’s safe to say we’re not your typical IT outsourcer - we’re privately owned and make looking after our people and culture a priority. Every day our people come to Kinetic IT not just to work, but to be challenged,
        grow and be part of something bigger.  About you: You’ll be someone who can transform numbers into information that will enable the project team to operate resourcefully, make sound decisions and seek improvements.
        A systems thinker, you’ll have a mind for numbers and a knack for problem solving. Your ability to communicate complex analytical ideas and solutions will help create awareness and shared understanding. Most importantly, you’ll be curious and
        motivated - these traits will frame your mindset of constantly searching for ways that data can make our workplaces more efficient and better aligned to the needs of our customers.  Day to day your duties will include: 

Analysing processes and interpreting patterns to drive innovation
Data validation through analysis of records within Service Management tools
Identify trends and recommend improvements based on findings
Participating in requirements gathering workshops
Communicating findings from analysis and making recommendations
Creating and implementing new data collection and analysis processes
Sound like a role for you? You’ll need some of the following: 

Bachelor’s level degree in Mathematics, Computer Science or Analytics
Experience working with high volumes of data from disparate sources and creating cohesion
Experience in reporting and analysis platforms such as Microsoft SSRS, Power BI, or Excel
Intermediate skills in reading and writing code
High attention to detail and high standards of documentation
NV1 clearance is advantageous for this role
 In addition to the above requirements, you will also need to be an Australian Citizen.  What’s in it for you?  If you’ve ever had the desire to work in a greenfield environment, this is for you. No two days will
        be the same, you’ll be challenged to think outside the box and work on contemporary, enterprise IT solutions. You’ll enjoy working for one of Australia’s largest Managed Service Providers and will be on the front line of growth activities as our
        organisational footprint expands in new regions.  To express your interest in this role please click Apply Now. If you have any problems with the application form on this ad, you can also send your application directly to careers@kineticit.com.au.  Learn more at KineticIT.com.au, connect with us on LinkedIn or twitter.  We look forward to meeting all future members of the Kinetic IT team.

title: Data Analyst

templatetext:
Who are we?At illion (formerly Dun & Bradstreet), we are always seeking innovative and forward-thinking individuals to join us on our journey.  Our vision is to use data and analytics to solve problems for our customers,
          using our unique, extensive and expanding datasets.  We create unique business models that support our customers' decision-making processes when acquiring, on-boarding and managing their receivables.
Our culture is unique. It's fast, results-driven and dynamic. It's certainly not for everyone. But if you thrive in a high performing environment - Illion could be for you!
About the role:
In this role you will be taking the lead on ensuring all CRS data processes are working effectively and efficiently, whilst supporting release schedules, statistical reporting, liaising with the data management team and external clients, and leading
          relationships with existing and prospective external data suppliers related to consumer data.
As a Senior Consumer Data Analyst you will be required to: 


Lead identification and resolution of systemic issues in data quality and processes


Establish automated data monitoring to highlight any data issues that need to be addressed


Lead the preparation and execution of User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and Production Verification Testing (PVT) in support of the Consumer Credit Bureau (CCB) Release Schedule


Lead periodic statistical reports and analysis to internal clients


Lead initiatives and/or develop robust business cases to improve the consumer database quality, coverage and match rate performance


Lead the development of an end-to-end consumer data procedures and quality manual, and to actively pursue and recommend opportunities to improve efficiency in process and data quality


Support internal and external data and quality audits


Develop strong supplier and internal customer relationships.


The successful candidate will need to demonstrate excellence in communication, innovation and analytical skills. You must also be able to demonstrate an ability to remain results focused
          in a fast changing environment with the drive to successfully manage multiple initiatives with competing priorities.
The ideal candidate will have the following:
Essential


Minimum 5 years working in a data intensive environment


Advanced data and process analysis skills, especially investigative analysis of data or process issues to determine data quality problems and solutions


Exceptional abstract reasoning and attention to detail



Ability to code in SAS and SQL or Perl
Exceptional project management skills. Able to adapt and manage multiple projects and work under tight timelines
 Experience in extracting data from a number of different systems into MIS/Analytical software (Excel, Access Database, SAS, etc).

Desirable


Ability to code in R and Python


General understanding of how the credit or insurance sectors operate



Tertiary qualification in a business related field, risk, statistics or another numerically-based discipline is desirable.

If you believe you have the necessary skills and experience, we would love to hear from you!
title: Consumer Data Analyst

templatetext:

title: Data Analyst

templatetext:
Based south of the Perth CBD, our client is a national not-for-profit community organisation who works across urban and remote areas of Australia. A well-established, successful and respected organisation, their focus is helping youth and disadvantaged
          people to improve their chances at having the kind of lives that all people deserve. 
This is a kind and generous group of people, and the office environment reflects this; they are compassionate and friendly like a family, but at the same time, everyone is self-motivated and dedicated to achieving objectives. The offices are modern
          and refurbished, surrounded by parklands and gardens, close to a range of great amenities, and easily accessible by public transport. 
WHAT’S INVOLVED? 
They are currently undergoing the implementation of a new data management system, and your role will be to take the reigns after implementation. Reporting directly to the Chief Operations Officer, this role is primarily about managing and reporting
          data and information and maintain contract compliance. There will be a research component  to this job, and some administrative support for the COO such as compiling board papers. 
You can expect to be relied upon by the executive team; attending and minuting executive meetings, and preparing presentations and reports for a range of stakeholders (including Federal government agencies), based on the data that you collate
          and extrapolate. 
This is such a critical role in the organisation; without up-to-date, quality data reporting the organisation cannot grow and progress. In a not-for-profit environment, there is always the need to justify your funding and prove your worth – this
          role will be the key to ensuring they can keep doing the amazing work they are doing to help the community and make sure they focus on effective programs which have the most impact. A few of the things you will be involved in include:

Maintaining the (new) database system (and training new users as needed)
Research and source data from a range of sources, internal and external and analyse data
Consolidate data into reports for the executive team
Prepare a range of reports on a regular basis for internal and external use, including significant government agencies
Build relationships and liaise with government stakeholders
Co-ordinate regional management meetings, including logistics and agendas, and post-meeting duties including distributing minutes and following up on action items

DO YOU HAVE WHAT IT TAKES? 
This is a challenging role for someone who in that place in their career where they have the confidence and experience to make informed decisions. You will need to bee career-focused and committed to the cause. 
We want someone who genuinely loves working with data and finding meaning in data, and is able to communicate findings to a wide range of people in an interesting and engaging way. 
We need someone who is happy doing high-level reporting but just as comfortable doing basic database administration, or creating PowerPoint presentations; you need a service-mentality; the kind of person is comfortable saying “how can I help you?”
          In short; you must be an engaged, valuable, and active part of the team. 
You will also need these skills, attributes, qualifications and experience:

Advanced MS Word, PowerPoint and Excel skills (you should be an Excel superstar, in fact)
Demonstrated effective business case and report-writing skills, particularly liaising with government agencies
Experience in a compliance-focused environment
Ideally a tertiary qualification which has led to statistical analysis and research capabilities
Experience sourcing, analysing, managing and presenting relevant and useful data
Experience managing contractual compliance requirements
Experience providing support at an executive level
Intelligence that you can apply to solve problems
Good organisational skills, with outstanding attention to detail
The ability to think strategically and see the big picture – staying attentive to goals
Down-to-earth, easy-going, but able to focus and go the extra mile to get things done
Passionate about the work and loyal
Independent; able to use your initiative and self-motivated
Truly exceptional communication skills

THIS SOUNDS PERFECT! WHERE DO I SIGN UP? If this sounds like the role for you, click 'Apply' to submit your application now! 

Please include a cover letter outlining why you think you are the right person for this job (applications without a cover letter will not be considered).
Cover letters can be made attention to Amy Morgan.
Our preferred resume format is MS Word.

We might seem a little quirky... but we take your privacy very seriously. Your application is highly confidential and will not be discussed with anyone outside of Itch Recruitment without your permission. For more information
          about what we do with your information, please see the Itch Recruitment website. 
For interesting business, HR and employment news, our latest roles and some amusing pictures thrown in for good measure, find us on LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram and Twitter.

title: Data Analyst - BI

templatetext:
The opportunity
Work as a Senior Analyst for a Government organisation where you will analyse large amounts of economic data to influence the creation of key public policy. Get away from being stuck behind the computer screen and apply your curiosity and strategic
          mindset across the organisation and other ministries.
 
The role
Engage with stakeholders and carry out fit-for-purpose analysis to provide actionable insights and advice. You will proactively identify key analytical questions and tackle these using a range of statistical and econometric techniques. You also
          have the opportunity to use your mentoring skills by sharing knowledge and providing guidance to analysts in the team.
 
What you will bring to the table
To be successful in this role you will have strong commercial/government experience to draw from to allow you to choose the most fit-for-purpose analytical approach to a problem. Strong relationship-building skills are a must as you will be engaging
          across the organisation. You will be comfortable stepping away from the granular detail to be able to influence through big-picture data story-telling. On the technical-side you will be coming from a role where you are using analytical tools
          (SAS, R, Python, SQL) to conduct statistical analysis.
 
Like to know more?
For a confidential discussion, please contact Jamie Killick at Hudson on +64 9 977 9932. Alternatively click on the link below to apply.

templatetext:
The Data Reconciliation Senior Analyst will perform a quality assurance role working with the FOPATS - Future of Property and Tenancy Systems- selected supplier and the business stakeholders to ensure that
        either the solution’s data migration activity or the data within the reporting solution satisfies the business requirements and is compliant with the solution design. They will be responsible for delivery of data reconciliation documentation,
        including plans, scripts and reports derived from the approved business and technical requirements which are fit for purpose and meet the quality criteria within the agreed timeframe.  Job DetailsReporting to
        the FOPATS Data Management Manager, the successful candidate will: 

Based on the Detailed Design, Data Migration Technical Specs and Functional Specs for each release, and with guidance from the Data Lead; develop data reconciliation plans and reconciliation reports for SIT,UAT, and cut-over.
Assist in the verification and enhancement (as necessary) of requirements produced through the detailed design process particularly from data migration perspective.
Develop comprehensive Business Reconciliation Plans, Reconciliation Reports using SQL queries based on relevant requirements with a strong focus on the business data reconciliation.
Raise defects as required and actively be involved in the defect management process.
Support and mentor junior data analysts on data reconciliation activities with focus on mappings which are not one-to-one.
Provide input to the development of overall data reconciliation processes and artefacts.
Facilitating the Business Data Reconciliation, including seeking endorsements for Business Data Reconciliation Plans, executing plans and reporting results and managing the business representatives. 
 Mandatory Skills and Competencies

A high level of understanding or experience of data migration staging and ETL processes
Demonstrated experience in a role requiring liaising with the business representatives/subject matter experts, understanding of business processes and developing source and target reconciliation reports to enable business to reconcile migrated
            data
3 to 5 years’ experience with performing Data Validations and Data Reconciliations
Ability to understand and deconstruct complex data structures to determine a desired and efficient business focused outcome
Experience in working on large scale ICT projects, in particular major business transformational change projects involving system development and integration of multiple commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) solutions
Experience in working on systems with multiple internal and external interfaces
Experience working in Agile teams
Demonstrated experience in developing and executing business data reconciliation plans and reconciliation summary reports.
Experience in working closely with business representatives and business analysts to seek clarity on requirements and define test scenarios
Experience in conducting workshops with business and technical audience
Ability to liaise and maintain a professional relationship with technical staff, internal customers, program teams and the vendor team
Enthusiastic problem solver with excellent written and oral communication skills.
A team player – able to function without close supervision and mentor less technical personnel constructively
    Highly Desirable Skills and Competencies

Prior experience building and using SQL queries to source data for source and target reconciliation reports
Experience in using ALM and Microsoft Team Foundation Server or similar test management tools for test cases and defect management
Exposure to SAP migration projects
Experience with Public Housing Data.

templatetext:
BUSINESS ANALYST – DATA AND SYSTEMS – FULL TIME – Office Based in EIGHT MILE PLAINS 
We are seeking to appoint an experienced Business Analyst – Data and Systems to join our Shared Services team in Eight Mile Plains

Full Time, 37.5 hours p/w  
Based at our head office in Eight Mile Plains with secure onsite parking
 Salary Sacrifice options + 9.5% Superannuation

Key Assets - The Children’s Services Provider Australia (Not-For-Profit Agency)

An evolving Out of Home Care and children and family services (NGO) provider
Part of an international group of children’s services providers; operating in all Australian states, 
Committed to building a culturally diverse and inclusive workforce, AWEI Bronze Employer of Choice for 2015 & 2016, AWEI Gold Employer Award for 2017, AWEI Silver Employer Award for 2018, finalist for the Australian HR Awards 2017 
Key Assets is committed to working in partnership with Aboriginal communities to achieve good outcomes for children and families. 

 About the role
As the Business Analyst – Data and Systems you will take responsibility for the management and development of data and information systems across all Key Assets operations in the region.
 Key Components of the role:

To drive and improve reporting and analytical capability across divisions of the business
Implement, maintain and manage database systems, setting up new systems as required and training super users to act as local leads on these systems
Provide meaningful reporting to the business, as required, to inform strategic planning, business planning, trend analysis, decision making, services development, and other management demands
Scope systems across all areas of operations identifying improvements to ensure Key Assets has integrated data systems that fulfil internal and external data recording, storage and reporting requirements and maximises efficiency
To contribute to continuous service improvement processes. To create and evaluate performance data with analysis to raise awareness and understanding of performance and improvement opportunities across all service delivery
To provide commercial business information and market intelligence to assist with the strategic planning, reporting and decision making processes
And to adhere to business policies and procedures  
 Qualities, Experience and Skills Required

Hold a qualification, or substantial experience as a business analyst, systems or data role
Have knowledge in data management and office tools including advanced Excel and other data/reporting/querying experience
Demonstrated experience in the administration and maintenance of database and/or case management systems
Experience and or knowledge of working in the not- for-profit sector
Be able to think strategically, have excellent communication skills, written and verbal, know your audience
Demonstrate initiative and creativity and work to quality standards

Benefits

title: KA0021 - Business Analyst – Data and Systems - Full Time (Eight Mile Plains)

company: Datacom is one of Australasia’s largest professional IT services companies
templatetext:
Part-time Reporting Analyst – Melbourne  
 
This is a great Part-time opportunity working 20 hours per week, not to be missed! You will be joining a fantastic team in our extensive Operations business who support each other working collaboratively across locations locally and internationally.
          It is a chance to be a part of our business with a strong people and customer focus. The role would be perfect for someone who has excellent attention to detail, is seeking work/life balance and is strong in documentation, reporting and analysis.
 
The Role:
 
As a Reporting Analyst you will be managing and delivering customer and internal Performance Reporting in accordance with defined reporting commitments. The Reporting Analyst role is highly visible and requires an extensive level of co-ordination
          to successfully deliver reporting outcomes.
 
They key responsibilities for this role include performance reporting, producing and maintaining agreed internal and external reports, providing internal and external reporting and monthly service delivery reports. You’ll be innovative and drive
          ongoing improvement and solutions and ensure contract and SLA adherence. 
 
The Person: 
 
You’re a process person who has a great understanding of reporting best practice, a detailed understanding or reporting concepts and frameworks. You’re an ITIL guru and understand ITIL methodologies. You will have excellent attention to detail
          and experience working in similar environments. 
 
 As mentioned we are looking for someone who has strong customer service experience and understand that our people are really important to us.
 
The Company:
 
People may call us dreamers, but we envisage a world that is improved by technology and its ability to transform our communities both locally and globally. We are an aspirational organisation that employs people passionate about technology, our
          customers and ultimately making the world a better place through the work that we do. 
We’re privately owned, and proud of our collaborative and un-process bound internal culture. Working at Datacom sees you join a global family of 5300 employees, across NZ, Australia, South-East Asia, the UK and the US. We value our staff and our
          size and scale means there is career progression available for everyone, even across our multiple geographies.
 
If you can tick the boxes above and have that get-up-and-go attitude then don’t delay – we are keen to hear from you!
title: Reporting Analyst

templatetext:
6 Months contract with potential extension
Leading Banking organisation 
Location – Sydney CBD

Interpro has been building relational networks across the globe within enterprise, technology, and digital industries for over 27 years, re-inventing the way that we engage with talent across these specialisations. One of our clients is
              looking for a Technical Business Analyst to work with IT asset management software.
 
 
 Tasks and Responsibilities: 
 

The business analyst will be responsible for gathering requirements and reporting in an unstructured data centre environment across large sets of data.
In addition to this you will be responsible for vendor reviewing contracts and internal stakeholder engagement across the business and IT teams.

Excellent requirements gathering and documenting skills.
Experience with software management such as SCCM.
Reporting with SQL and advances excel.
Previous IT infrastructure or asset management experience.

Highly regarded aws, azure, and private cloud exposure.
title: Business Analyst

templatetext:
Fantastic opportunity to join this leading broadcasting company as a skilled Business Change Analyst
Initial 6-month contract with long term extension potential.
 What you will be doing

Take principal responsibility for the analysis of complex business scenarios to develop user business requirements and process designs 
Analyse user requirements with respect to technology capabilities, existing systems and integration methods to develop functional designs, data schemas and data flows for whole system solutions corresponding with business requirements
            and processes
Provide support for new and existing systems including defining support structures within and across divisions and sections
Work with Project Managers to identify and document the business impact for projects of transformation and change within the business
Facilitate workshops to elicit requirements, document as-is and to-be processes
Develop an agreed list of change management artefacts which will support a seamless delivery for the business
Identify, define and track the training needs required on the project
Facilitate change management meetings with clients, upon request
Preparing affected business areas for the transition to new ways of working
Helping to translate the new system functionality and business processes into a language that an end-user will understand to bring about change.

What you will ideally have 

Experienced IT Business Analyst, ideally with some exposure to functional analysis and project management methodologies
Demonstrated motivation and proactive approach combined with specialist leadership in business and/or systems analysis contributing to team goals with respect to technology and business strategies
Change management experience at large scale or within a large stream of change.
Proven ability to operate effectively across a broad range of technology programmes and business stakeholders
Excellent communication, influence and workshop skills 
Strong demonstrated stakeholder engagement skills
Exceptional attention to detail, time management and organisational skills

 
If this is the role for you apply today to be considered! Successful candidates will be called for more info 
 To be considered for the role click the 'Apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Coral Shankland on 0294645631. Please quote our job reference number: 200184898.
title: Business Analyst

templatetext:
One of Australia's premium businesses based in Sydney is looking for a highly experienced Senior Business Analyst. 
Accountabilities 

Identify key areas of data privacy risk in business processes and can assess impact and risk
Develop appropriate engagement, tracking and process documentation and communication, where necessary liaising with Change management resources
Keep electronic project artefacts up to date in an accurate, timely and versioned manner.
Re-use project templates from other streams where possible rather than creating customized ones.
Lead and facilitate stakeholders towards business and functional design decisions
Identify and resolve issues and engage with business and technical stakeholders on resolution
Provide support and participates in testing activities such as Acceptance Testing or Business Verification Testing
Act with appropriate initiative and autonomy when necessary to deliver high quality outcomes.
Take instruction and direction from your assigned Project Manager and contribute to overall team effectiveness.

Competencies 
To be considered for this opportunity, you will have 

Professional experience in finance, risk and compliance 
Data analysis
Understanding of unstructured data: collaboration, correspondence and file systems, spreadsheets, macros 
Understanding of data classification/ privacy (preferred)
Exposure to Wealth or funds management 
Knowledge of data, data structure, data classifications, privacy regulations.
Experience engaging, identifying and documenting business processes
Confidence in communicating, dealing with stakeholders at all levels of an organisation
Experience working on large, complex programs of work
Extensive delivery experience working in Agile, Waterfall and hybrid methodologies and producing the required outputs i.e. BRD, Process maps, User stories etc.
Possesses a positive attitude

Interested? Please send your CV to ellenor.terrado@modis.com OR contact Ellen on 02 8031 6259 o
Due to new privacy laws regarding the collection and handling of personal information, all applications must be submitted online. Once you click on the "apply for this job" button below you will be directed to our Online Centre where you will have the opportunity to read and agree to our Privacy and Consent statements and it will allow your details to be formally lodged and processed correctly.
Modis is a national professional services company with global capability. Our committed and talented professionals have delivered world class IT and business consulting services across a wide range of industries. As a member of global professional services group Adecco, we offer world-class employment opportunities.
Talented, committed, can-do individuals have always been the cornerstone of this dynamic business. It is expected that the successful candidate will bring energetic dynamics and a strong Business Analysis skill set to this organisation.
Modis is an Equal Opportunity employer, committed to all forms of workforce inclusion. We actively invite and encourage applications by candidates from diverse backgrounds

templatetext:
Your organisation – Mackay Hospital and Health Service:
Mackay Hospital and Health Service has eight hospitals, two multi-purpose health services and two additional community health services that employ more than 2,700 staff. The Mackay district covers an area of approximately 90,000km2 and provides
          services to approximately 182,000 people in Bowen, Cannonvale, Clermont, Collinsville, Dysart, Glenden, Mackay, Middlemount, Moranbah, Proserpine and Sarina.
Click here to find out more information about the Mackay HHS
Your role:
To provide high level data reporting and analysis to support operational and strategic plans by the Mackay Hospital and Health Service.
Your team:
The Finance Team provides routine and ad-hoc information, analysis and advice for various stakeholders such as the Executive, service directors, business managers and clinicians.
Why work for Mackay HHS?
Mackay HHS provides a working environment which embraces professional development, builds capabilities, provides roles with variety and flexibility, supports staff to maximise their health and wellbeing and encourages work/life balance. Some additional
          benefits include:

Competitive remuneration package
Up to 12.75% employer superannuation contribution
17.5% annual leave loading
Salary packaging
Employee Assistance Program
Wellbeing initiatives and programs

Conditions of employment:
In addition to any mandatory requirements specified on the Role Description, such as Professional Registration and Qualifications, and prior to being made an offer of employment, incumbents are required to demonstrate their immunity to all or
          some of the following Vaccine Preventable Diseases (VPD): Hepatitis B, Measles, Mumps, Rubella, Varicella (chicken pox), Pertussis (whooping cough).
Click here to find out more information about VPD
To apply for this exciting opportunity:

Before applying ensure that you download and read the Role Description and Information Package for Applicants.
Provide a short response (maximum 2 pages) outlining how your experience, abilities and knowledge will enable you to achieve the key responsibilities of the role. This is an opportunity to
            tell us about yourself, your professional career and why you are the right person for this job.
Attach your current resume/CV, including contact details of two referees, preferably your current/past supervisor, who can confirm/support your capabilities, work performance and conduct within the previous two years.

            degree of independence, with decision-making substantially dependent on their high-level judgement and consideration of wider departmental implications, with work being performed under the general guidance of senior managers. In performing
            a leadership role, the Data Analyst Manager drives innovation, changes in workplace practices and organises work in the context of competing priorities and strategic direction  Ability to:  • Think strategically and align operational
            activity accordingly  • lead and motivate staff to achieve quality outcomes  • manage, mentor and guide staff learning and development  • develop and manage a range of internal and external stakeholder relationships  • assess risks and implement mitigation strategies  • manage and resolve conflict using appropriate strategies  • grasp expectations and concerns and negotiate quality outcomes  • understand the audience and context

templatetext:
Big Wave Digital is pumped, why?  Because we have the pleasure of partnering with this
        fast-growing digital agency in Melbourne, who use data and cutting-edge technology to help their clients understand their competitive advantage in cut throat markets.   We are thrilled to be hiring their newest recruit Digital Marketing/Web Analyst        to support the team. This opportunity has presented through growth, and will be the sole analyst in the business, so you’ll have freedom to make this function of the business your own and provide a huge impact to the overall business strategy
        and digital assets across the entire business. The role is focusing heavily on data analysis and providing actionable insights back to the business, with the emphasis on shaping new websites from the group up based on your analytical findings. Key functions of the role:

Design and implement all associated online marketing programs, website and optimisation projects
Analyse website structures, marketing processes & company data
Provide analytics & performance reporting on the overall site(s) automated dashboards and consistent reporting to senior management
Conducting A/B or Multivariate testing to test conversion hypothesises
Data research, discovery, expansion; cleansing and validation.
 What you will need to be a success in this role:

Previous experience (3+yrs) in a similar analytics role, ideally analysing high traffic sites.
Data analytics, eDM and Google Analytics’ experience, plus Google Tag Manager (including writing custom tags).
Experience delivering technical information to staff, in easy to understand lingo
Thorough understanding of custom data reporting
Experience with Analytics & tracking tools, SE rankings, site auditing techniques, on & off-page optimisation, A/B testing, multivariate testing, optimisation & Link building.
Data modelling and visualisation experience (Tableau or Power BI)
Positive, self motivated, passionate, enthusiastic, a can-do attitude & dynamic, are a few key words that describe the best fit personality for this position. Oh, and an absolute passion for DATA.
 If you are looking for the opportunity to work in a fast-paced, dynamic and results driven business that recruits and retains talented people; plus have the aspirations to grow an analytics function and expand your career, apply NOW via the link below. Or
        send applications to Dayna Stewart | Head of Digital & Data Recruitment | Big Wave Digital | dayna@bigwavedigital.com.au | www.bigwavedigital.com.au Only Australian Permanent Residents and/or Australian Citizens will be considered for this role.
title: Digital Insights Analyst

templatetext:
As a global leader in car rentals, we operate in over 150 countries worldwide. Our goal is to be the very best at what we do by renting cars better than anyone else.
We’re looking for a customer focused, high performing Business Intelligence Reporting Analyst to join our exceptional teams and continue our success in the future of car rental. At Hertz, you’re in the driver’s seat to achieve your full potential and grow your career.
What is this role all about? 
The primary mission of the Business Intelligence Reporting Analyst is to provide the business with comprehensive in-depth analytics and business reporting that will lead to improvements in efficiencies, profitability and revenue generation across
          all business units and brands in the APAC region.
The incumbent supports the operational volume and revenue planning process and advises key stakeholders on market and business trends, risks and opportunities.
Analysis and Reporting

Prepares Daily, Weekly and Monthly Performance reporting for all business units and brands
Supports operational volume and revenue forecast process
Produces comprehensive ad-hoc business analysis and provide advice and business insights as required
Supports forecasting processes for all non-trading revenue lines and cost recovery lines
Advises business on market trends, risks and opportunities
Supports and advises on the development and implementation of new reports, dashboards and other visualisations
Ensures comprehensive KPI reporting on business performances and appropriate communication
Supports the financial ‘month end’ processes
Estimates revenue and business impact based on provided business scenarios and parameters

What do we need from you?

Minimum Diploma level or relevant qualification in Mathematics, Computer Science and/or Accountancy
Ability to analyse system deficiencies & inaccuracies and to devise solutions
Experience and ability to work efficiently in a global business culture and in an international matrix organisation.
Can work on a conceptual level (in terms of systems) and is also able to be pragmatic and results-oriented and perform hands-on change activities
Strong Excel and Microsoft Office skills
MS Access, Cognos, Cube development, SQL, Cars+ and Tableau / Power BI an advantage.

What do you get?
In return for your hard work and dedication, you will be rewarded with:

Career growth and development opportunities
A supportive team environment
Attractive staff benefits
Excellent organisational culture

This is a brilliant opportunity for an individual who is looking for a challenging role and the chance to work across and learn a variety of business functions.
To apply, please attach your CV with a letter detailing why you would be right for this role.
Please note: only short-listed candidates will be contacted. You must hold valid working rights. Hertz is committed to equal opportunity employment through fair recruitment practices.

title: Senior Data Analyst

templatetext:
Senior Data Analyst

Based in the heart of Canberra
Full-time permanent opportunity
Paying $86,723 - $91,157 + 17% Super
 THE ORGANISATION Based in Australia’s Capital city of Canberra, the Australian National University (ANU) is a globally recognised leader within the education sector. The University’s focus on excellence in research and
        education ensures their graduates are not only in demand the world-over, but also well-prepared to address complex contemporary challenges. Joining a team committed to excellence in research, education and public policy development, this
        position will sit within the Australian National University Advancement Office (ADV) which leads the development, management and coordination of advancement activities within the University. ADV supports the University’s objectives to deepen relationships
        with alumni and secure long-term philanthropic income. DUTIES OF THE ROLE The Senior Data Analyst is responsible for the technical design, implementation and continuous improvement of a comprehensive reporting suite
        for Advancement’s Client Relationships Management (CRM) system, Raiser’s Edge. Responsibilities include;

Engage and collaborate with ANU ADV staff and across ANU to understand technical data, segmentation and reporting needs. Design and deploy reports on the platform appropriate to the needs of various stakeholders. Conduct workshops, focus groups,
            deliver presentations and training based on the above functionality and knowledge
Undertake the development and delivery of a comprehensive reporting framework aligned to the CRM system. Contribute to the development of team processes and practices to ensure consistent quality of deliverables regarding provision of data and
            reports
Review, identify and recommend improvements to the system infrastructure and provide strategic and technical advice enabling effective data provision and reporting to all stakeholders. Contribute to the development, review and implementation
            of strategic planning, best practice policy development and decision-making process
Comply with all ANU policies and procedures, and in particular those relating to WH&S and equal opportunity
 ABOUT YOU The ideal candidate for this position will have great technical and organisational skills accompanied with an analytical mindset.

A University Degree within a relevant field and experience, reporting experience in an advancement setting would be an advantage and extensive experience within the Raiser’s Edge CRM
Proven experience in developing and managing CRMs and databases and associated reporting tools such as Cognos, SSRS or similar
Numerical, analytical and problem-solving skills, high attention to detail, ability to use initiative, great problem-solving skills, and the ability to collect, analyse, interpret and make recommendations based on data
The ability to work both autonomously and within a team
 CULTURE AND BENEFITS The culture within the Advancement team is values driven, leading to the unique history of the University. The benefits of working for the University are:

Professional and collaborative work environment
Excellent remuneration and benefit packages
17% superannuation contributions annual leave loading
Salary sacrificing options for cars, parking, technology, childcare and more
Christmas and New Year leave in addition to annual leave
Parking on campus that is less expensive than city parking
 HOW TO APPLY If this role is of interest, please submit your resume below. If you have any further questions about this role, please call Claire at 02 9279 2777.
title: Senior Data Analyst - Based in Canberra

templatetext:
Business Analyst

Exciting projects in line with our 2025 strategy for improvement
12 month Fixed Term - Competitive Salary and Benefits 
Vibrant campus life with a strong sense of community & inclusion

At UNSW, we pride ourselves on being a workplace where the best people come to do their best work.
UNSW Planning & Performance (UPP) provides management reports, business intelligence, analysis and strategic advice to multiple stakeholders across the University. Planning & Performance is a key
resource for the senior management of the University, providing data, management information and
analysis of performance reporting.
 
About the role
The Business Analyst is accountable for providing recommendations based on expertise and experience to support UNSW Planning & Performance operations and projects. The role involves methodically investigating and analysing documents and design
          wireframes for business functions and processes.
In addition, the Business Analyst supports the Delivery Lead in ensuring the successfully delivery of enhancements and improvements for key UNSW 2025 Data projects and business initiatives.

Tertiary degree or equivalent in a relevant discipline with at least 4 years’ experience; or an equivalent level of knowledge gained through any other combination of relevant education, training and/or experience
Knowledge and competency in the use of professional business analysis techniques and methods (e.g. Use Case Analysis, UML).
Demonstrated analytical skills for collecting, interpreting and evaluating both quantitative and qualitative information with the ability to successfully interpret business processes and design complete and effective process improvements.
Demonstrated successful time management skills including, the ability to effectively plan ahead, work under pressure, prioritise tasks whilst having high attention to detail and manage multiple initiatives
Excellent oral and written communication and interpersonal skills and a demonstrated ability to develop, build and maintain strong working relationships with staff at all levels.

title: Business Analyst- Technical Data Project

templatetext:
We currently have a requirement for a strong Data Analyst to work on a large Oil/Gas program.  As a Senior Data Analyst, you will work closely with the Information Architects, Information owners, Data stewards, Project Managers and
        key business and IT stakeholders to elicit, analyse, validate, specify and verify various data and information sets to identify trends and improve specific data & Information components that support the IG Information Governance standards
        and the outcomes of the project. We are looking for a Data Analyst who will have the ability to solicit the correct data and turn this into information and insight that support the outcomes of our business.Accountabilities;

Work with the relevant stakeholders to determine key information/data requirements.
Elicit information and data requirements using interview, document analysis, storyboards, surveys, site visits, task and workflow analysis.
Lead the analysis work required for data remediation
Provide guidance to other subordinates on improving data quality and best way for remediation
Option analysis, “As Is” analysis and recommendation of “To be” solution
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets
Develop data standards
Develop quality business rules and continuous improvement plan
Develop high level design document
Collecting, interpreting and analyse large data set
Perform data remediation activity
 Key Skills;

5+ years’ experience working as a Data Analyst or in a Business Analysis role relating specifically to data analysis, remediation or improvements or related role requiring strong data analytical skills.
Analytical mindset and inclination for problem-solving
Willingness to adopt different way of working to deliver outcome
Experience in data quality assessment, data models and reporting packages
Ability to analyse existing tools and data bases and provide recommendations.
Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases.
Strong understanding of conceptual data models, information standards and metadata standards.
Excellent listening skills to understand what stakeholders are saying and to detect what they might be hesitant to say
Strong interviewing and questioning skills to talk with the individuals and groups about their needs and ask the right questions to surface essential requirements information.
Proficiency in SQL, Excel, etc
Strong written communications skills demonstrating the ability to capture, and document business functional and non-functional requirements, coordinate and own system change requests from conception to implementation.
 If interested in being considered for this excellent contract opportunity, please send your CV to joe.pilling@reconsolutions.com.au for immediate review.
title: Data Analyst

templatetext:
This software company are seeking an experienced Business analysis to join their team on a permanent basis.
This role will see you bridging the gap between the company’s customer base and the development team.

My client is a government department looking for a health data analyst

Promote and contribute to the development of technical solutions to support and optimise the delivery of integrated safety and quality data and mechanisms
Identify issues and caveats relating to data sources and analytical methods
Promote and contribute to ongoing and new indicators for safety and quality monitoring at a local, jurisdictional and national level
Contribute to committee meetings, forums and workshops
Undertake other duties as required.

 
Skills and knowledge required

Highly developed technical expertise and experience in data systems, metadata, assessing information requirements, data extraction and analysis
Experience and understanding of a range of health datasets (MBS,PBS, Admitted Patient Care National Minimum Database)

Ability to work with multiple teams and take directions where required

Qualifications and experience

Tertiary qualifications in a relevant area
Highly developed knowledge and experience of the Australian healthcare system from a data and technical point of view
Experience in developing productive working relations with a wide variety of stakeholders including Commission staff, subject matter experts and technical specialists

        on mutuality, and our core values of passion, advocacy and sustainability). To be successful as a Business Analyst (BA) within TMBL you will need excellent stakeholder management skills that compliment your analytical mindset. The ability

templatetext:
Assetlink Group is an Australian owned integrated facilities services provider and global asset management technology company We provide both individual services and tailored integrated solutions through our two divisions, Assetlink Services and
          AssetFuture.
Our AssetFuture division is a global leader in asset optimization, using our leading edge asset condition and cost based technology, with a “Whole of Life Planning” approach that includes operation, maintenance, renewal and disposal. Our vision
          is to improve communities by enabling a range of organisations to make significant cost savings, enabling evidence based decision making and improvements to be made to the services they provide.
We are looking for building / construction industry data analysts to join our team on a full-time basis, for a 3 month contract with possibility for extension, to be data stewards as a pivotal, frontline role in the data governance framework. 
          This is an entry level position where the data analyst will be responsible for cleansing, transforming, validating or analysing data with the purpose of understanding or drawing conclusions from data to drive clinical and operational decision-making
          for clients and management.
With a firm grasp of the technology, the intention would be for the role to evolve into presenting data in charts, graphs and tables as well as designing and developing algorithms for relational databases to operate autonomously.
Analytical Skills: Data analysts work with large amounts of data: facts, figures and number crunching.
Communication Skills: Must communicate methodology and findings well with team members and ancillary resources.
Attention to Detail: The conclusions drawn from this data analysis will drive critical business decisions and recommendations.  Accuracy and attention to detail are paramount.
Math Skills: Understanding of basic statistical methods.
Programming Skills: This role requires an understanding of programming logic, although no experience with a specific programming language is required. Familiarity with SQL, Tableau will be an important part of the data analyst
          role.
Overall Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

Must be comfortable working with clients, team members, and other stakeholders in the organization
Have the ability to interpret their intent and application
Demonstrates the ability to handle a variety of responsibilities under pressure
Must be able to function independently
Demonstrates good communication skills
Background knowledge in building fabric and services preferable

If you're able to adapt on the run, execution driven individual with a commitment to improving society, please submit your cover letter and resume by clicking the 'Apply' button below.

templatetext:

You will be working in a dedicated BI team developing new data sets through the complex extraction and manipulation of the relevant data from the group systems (MS SQL, CRM's etc) and it's analysis using R and Tableau for visualisation.
You will work directly with the business units, project teams, IT and broader BI community to define and proto-type new solutions which will then undergo compliance for the regulatory reporting requirements.
To be considered for this role you will need:

Experience with relational database such as Teradata and SQL Server 
A critical thinker with an eye for detail
Ability to work to tight deadlines and short turnaround times
Experience within financial services highly desirable

title: MS Dynamics Business Analyst

templatetext:
Vix Technology provides products and services to "transform the way people connect and commute".  This helps people plan, manage, pay and navigate connected communities across a diverse range of communities, including: transit, sports, events,
          remote workers and students.
Vix Technology is currently seeking a highly motivated, well presented person with outstanding communication skills, that can drive data analysis and reporting to a new level. The ideal candidate will demonstrate and live Vix' values: Innovate,
          Excite, Expert, Compete, Deliver and Partner.
Summary of the Position
This is a great opportunity for someone with strong data analysis and interpretation skills. You will be given space to develop reports for automated delivery to internal and external customers within the public transport technology industry.
          You will work with a range of different data sources and have access to industry standard toolsets.
Summary of the role


Analyse, cleanse and visualise data from various sources using PowerBI


Build a data repository (mySQL) and develop SQL queries


Gather reporting requirements from multiple stakeholders


Work with non-technical stakeholders and translate findings


Implement automated reporting processes, to ensure that agreed KPI’s and SLAs are met and other key deliverables are achieved


Create daily, monthly, quarterly and annual reports


Create ad-hoc reports, as required


Experience expected


A minimum of 2 years in a similar role


Experience working within the public transport and/or technology industry is beneficial


Experience gathering requirements from technical and non-technical stakeholders


Proven communication skills, to translate requirements and findings


Experience working with SQL, MS Excel and PowerBI


Experience working with JIRA is desirable, but not essential


This role is expected to develop a data repository from multiple data sources, to enable accurate reports to be generated using PowerBI. The position involves communicating with various internal teams, stakeholders and customers.  
Your main duties will include (but not be limited to):


Gather reporting requirements from the business and implement a solution that meets these requirements.


Ensure that data quality is maintained.


Analyse data and escalate any anomalies to the attention of appropriate parties in a timely manner (both functional and hierarchical escalations).


Maintain the regional PowerBI dashboards, ensuring that this is accurately updated in a timely manner.


Generate reports (daily, weekly, monthly and yearly) and submit on time.


Ensure agreed SLAs are met and other key deliverables are achieved.


Contribute to service and process improvements.


Essential Criteria:


Strong communication skills (both written and verbal).


Self-motivated and enthusiastic.


Minimum of 2 years' experience in a similar position.


Familiarity with the public transport and/or technology industry.


Systematic approach to designing and implementing a reporting solution.


Good knowledge of source data to allow effective functional escalation.


Must have experience with SLA’s and KPI's


This is a full-time position (Monday to Friday) with start and finish times varying between 7.00am - 6.00pm with potential for overtime.
If you are ready to take the next move in your career, please forward your resume and covering letter
Please provide details on your current salary and benefits package, where applicable, and your expectations in your covering letter/email, along with the submission on your resume.
When submitting an application, please kindly confirm your eligibility to work in Australia and please provide details of any visa if applicable.
Vix Technology is an Equal Opportunities Employer that seek to employ a workforce which reflects the diverse communities we operate within. Please note, only successful applicants will be contacted.
 
STRICTLY NO AGENCIES

ACT Location
Perm and Contract roles available - Australian Citizenship required
Perform analysis & data manipulation of software
About the client:Our client is a services firm who provide a range of services across the realms of Asset Management including hardware and software. Their passion for delivering measurable financial value and tangible
        results goes hand in hand with their end-to-end management processes within large ICT environments.About the role:As an IT Specialist, you will work as a key member of our talented team, undertaking a range of
        analytical tasks associated with software, software packaging, licensing and usage reporting for key customers.This role leverages your data analysis and problem solving skills in the context of enterprise software deployed in complex
        environments. You have an eye for detail and will be able to learn and improve software discovery processes, analytical procedures and utilise technology tools to create unique business insights. Your sound knowledge of Microsoft Excel, coupled
        with your professional consulting manner and technical skills gained from IT, commerce or similar studies are a distinct advantage.In particular, you will:
        
Perform analysis and data manipulation of software identified on corporate networks to the clients high standards
Represent complex data and develop high quality reports using Excel and Word
Develop innovative methods to aggregate and report on licence usage data
Develop and execute repeatable, transparent processes for data manipulation, ensuring analysis is undertaken to the clients high levels of quality and accountability
Liaise with business users to assist the manual collection of software licence usage data
Identify and assist in the resolution of technical issues preventing accurate discovery or reporting of deployed software
Communicate effectively and engage with business areas to identify software usage patterns
Duties and Skills:

Demonstrated analytical abilities, problem solving skills and attention to detail
Experience in Microsoft Excel and Word for modelling and report preparation
Background in or knowledge of software packaging, licensing and analysis is an advantage
Understanding of technical aspects of ICT environments
Professional awareness and strong written and verbal communication skills
Demonstrated ability to work individually and also as part of a team to produce outcomes that are timely and of high quality
Ability to "learn on the job' and adapt as new information becomes available
It is a requirement that all applicants are Australian Citizens.  To apply for this opportunity, please contact Lauren Fyfe on 02 6285 3500 or lauren.fyfe@talentinternational.com or click the "APPLY NOW' button below.

Rate: $30- $35 per hour + super (3 - 6 month contract)Location: Sydney, CBD - close to public transportRole Benefits: Be part of a large and growing organisation; true ownership and
            support focus, play a pivotal role in shaping and developing the key projects.
Role Overview
Reporting to the Financial Controller, this Data Analyst will drive this data migration and cleansing project from start to finish. As the Data Analyst you will be pivotal in managing the internal database and assist in improving operational
            and administrative information. This Data Analyst role would suit someone who has previously implemented a system upgrade which involved a high level of analysis and data migration.
The Responsibilities

Provide insight led analytics for the business relating to the evaluation of data cleanliness and relevance.
Collate and extract relevant data from sources to provide insights and reports for improvements to the system
Due diligence process and development/implementation of improvements
Management of internal data system
The cleansing and collation of large data sets

You currently operate as a Data Analyst or you are a switched on Assistant Accountant with extensive analytical and data management experience with the ability to work with large volumes of data and extract data from multiple sources. You also
            have the ability to work with stakeholders are all levels and your aptitude to build relationships and influence is second to none. Your verbal and written communication skills are one of your key strengths.If you have been involved with
            a data migration project or system upgrade and understand the importance of accurate/up to date data then this role is for you.

templatetext:
This role is to support a large finance program, Financial Management & Performance Reporting (FMPR) therefore the candidates needs to have experience supporting financial programs.   Position OverviewThe Financial
        Management & Performance Reporting (FM&PR) response program has been established as part of a broader and fast-paced change agenda, to ensure the client meets or exceeds its financial targets in FY19 and beyond. This program includes this
        Data Analyst position within the Controls and Analysis Team as one of the key enablers for change. The Data Analyst supports the team by providing detail data extraction and data analysis support to identify and implement key controls
        and policies to cover all aspects of the Operating and Capital Expenditure framework. This also includes understanding the detailed data requirements and analysis of the forecasting and planning process with a significant contribution to Operating
        and Capital Expenditure performance, through detail expenditure variance analysis, deep dive reviews and analysis of Operating and Capital Expenditure providing recommendations and follow-up of implementation actions  Essential Requirements1.
        Strong experience with SQL2. Strong experience with SAP Financials, HR and Payroll3. Strong Excel experience4. Have hands-on experience of handling vast amounts of data5. Develop ad-hoc raw data reports as needed ensuring appropriately
        tested and fit-for-purpose6. Experience in dealing with large sums of data extraction and manipulation from source systems7. Ability to deep dive for data dissemination and data analysis to understand the quality of Expenditure data (OPEX
        & CAPEX), etc. and interpret results.8. Ability to identify the root causes of poor quality data and recommend controls to rectify the issues to improve the quality of expenditure data.9. Ability to address and meet focus capabilities
        as stated in the Position Description.

title: Data Analyst

templatetext:
The Friendly Society Private Hospital, affectionately known as The Friendlies, is a 142-bed acute care surgical and medical facility that provides the highest quality healthcare set in modern facilities with the latest technology.  Established
          as a not-for-profit medical facility in 1946, we have grown to become the leading hospital of choice for the people of Bundaberg and the Wide Bay regions having proudly cared for our community for more than 65 years.
The Area
Bundaberg is approximately a 4-hour drive or a short 45-minute flight from Brisbane.  The area lays claims to internationally renowned Southern Great Barrier Reef, Mon Repos Turtle Rookery, Bundaberg Rum and the famous aviator Bert Hinkler. 
Our notable features include fantastic climate, relaxed and inviting lifestyle, affordable living, modern shopping facilities, plentiful tourism destinations and diverse economic opportunities.
We also offer easy access to a wide variety of services including 3 major hospitals, public and private schools, major campuses of CQUniverstity and TAFE. 
The Position
We are seeking a candidate that is highly experienced with regards to Data Warehouse Analytics in particular a champion of BI (Tableau) / ETL & Data Analytics to work onsite and in collaboration with our Information Management team being responsible
          for the development of our Data Warehouse. This position is being offered as a fixed term 12 month contract with an anticipated commencement February 2019.
Data warehouse: Greenfield Project

Gathering technical requirements
In depth experience and knowledge in designing and developing a data warehouse to suit Financial and operational reporting.
Complex SQL queries to query data across multiple linked servers.
Query builder, Query optimisation, database tuning and other associated DBA activities.

ETL:

Extract and Transform data from disparate data sources to meet the specifications.
SSIS - Building new and maintaining, troubleshooting existing SSIS packages.

The Person
Key Selection Criteria for this position includes:

Experience with SQL Server 2016 or latest would be advantageous
Experience with MSBI stack would be advantageous
Qualifications in Data Analytics or Information Technology and/or equivalent work experience
Demonstrated experience working with Tableau Desktop and Tableau Service software
Eye for details and a strong understanding of interface designed principles
Experience in wire framing and prototyping dashboards
Previous experience in working with medical, finance and business data systems
Ability to recommend and share knowledge in a team environment
Commitment to our values of Courage, Diligence, Compassion, Wisdom and Friendliness

The Benefits
As a part of The Friendlies team, you will enjoy:

Attractive salary packaging options and a variety of additional discounts and benefits within our hospital and pharmacies
Career development opportunities and commitment to ongoing training, education and professional development
Family friendly work environment close to professional child care services
Find out more about why The Friendlies is a great place to work at https://thefriendlies.org.au

Vaccine Preventable Diseases (VPD) Requirements: It is recommended that as part of your employment for this role that you are vaccinated, and remain vaccinated, during your employment against the following vaccine
          preventable diseases such as Measles, Mumps, Rubella, Varicella (Chicken Pox), Pertussis (Whooping Cough), Hepatitis B.
Existing staff that were employed prior to 1 July 2017 are not subject to this condition of employment unless they apply for a role with VPD requirements.
How to Apply
To be considered for this position please submit the following two documents:

Cover letter including a statement of response addressing the Key Selection Criteria (maximum 150 words per criteria).
Copy of your Resume, including referees, outlining your skills and experience.
Submit your application on the FSPH website  https://thefriendlies.org.au/careers/

Applications close 11 January 2019.

Hume City Council is seeking a population data analyst to join our research and community engagement team.
Council is seeking specialist skills in relation to:

Social, economic and demographic analysis;
Customer experience and satisfaction research
Survey design and analysis and presentation of findings
Data analytics and visualisation of qualitative and quantitative information

Key Skills

Proficiency in the application of statistical analysis methods and techniques.
Ability to appraise information (both statistical and written) and succinctly and visually present written reports, presentations, data visualisations and thematic maps
Proficient knowledge of relevant computer software utilised for statistical and demographic analysis including Microsoft Excel and SPSS. Skills and experience utilising GIS-based demographic analysis tools such as MapInfo, QGIS and AnySite would
            be advantageous. The ability to use Tableau to present data is also advantageous.

Company ProfileHume City Council is a leader in local government and is recognised for its innovation, initiative, leadership, service, quality and support for its people.
Hume City is one of Australia's fastest-growing communities and with more people choosing to call Hume home, we're expected to welcome more than 57,000 new residents to our City over the next decade.
What We OfferWith our high level of employee engagement, Hume City Council offers a great working environment where you can develop your career. We offer flexible work arrangements and other benefits, such as study assistance

title: Research Analyst (100375)

templatetext:
GHD is one of the world's leading professional services companies operating in the global markets of water, energy and resources, environment, property and buildings, and transportation. With a global network of 10,000 professionals, we combine
          the benefit of local knowledge with an ability to access our people from anywhere, helping clients enjoy the rewards of a one GHD network.
 
We operate in an environment where the power of technology is advancing at an astonishing rate. Regardless of business size or industry, digital transformation is vital. Our digital services have been designed to help our clients reimagine their
          future business model, to improve the customer experience and reduce total cost of ownership of infrastructure assets. GHD Digital helps our clients to think differently, to embrace rapidly emerging digital advancements and to future-proof their
          businesses. Please visit our website for more information: www.ghd.com/en/services/digital.aspx.
 
The team:
 
Our Data and Analytics team understand that big data means nothing without intelligent insights. Using leading edge data analytics and business intelligence technology, we help clients see patterns in their data and find insights to improve the
          way the business operates. We work clients to help make better business decisions.  
 
The role:
 
Reporting to the Practice Director, Data & Analytics; as a Business Analyst, you will be working on external client facing projects and be responsible for defining detailed requirements, analysing business needs, and the validation of reporting
          solutions including the provision of dashboard solutions that will enable the achievement of the clients’ overall goals.
 
Key responsibilities include:


Reviews and collects business requirements related to data, business intelligence and analytics through workshops, interviews, document analysis, surveys, use cases, business process descriptions, and workflow analysis.


On-going analytical support through the utilisation of data management, modelling and technology. 


Identifies, analyses, and interprets trends and patterns in complex data sets, drawing insights that will aid the business in developing a suitable course of action.


Regularly audits system data in order to guarantee compliance, accuracy, and duplication management. 


Designing of targeted reports and dashboards that will provide insight and enable sound business decision-making.


Collaboration with the rest of the Data and Analytics team and broader Digital business


Identify process automation opportunities and functions that will streamline current and future data management and reporting for the business. 


Maintain a clear understanding of analytics, reporting, and technology and apply this knowledge to develop and recommend solutions that will further enhance the business’s competitive edge and place the business at an advantage over competition
              at all fronts in the market.


Desired Skills and Experience


3 to 8 years’ experience of relevant, data related business experience


Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Information Technology, Economics, Information Systems, Statistics, Applied Math, Business Administration, or any other related field

Strong analytical skills and the capacity to interpret quantitative and qualitative data
Strong problem solving skills
Strong visualisation skills with tools such as PowerBI, Tableau etc.
Intermediate to Advanced SQL skills
Strong inter-personal and communication skills
Proven team player, with the ability to develop and maintain internal and external relationships
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Excellent written and verbal communication
Proven team player, with the ability to develop and maintain internal and external relationships

Why work for GHD?

It is an exciting time to join GHD Digital as we are on the cusp of the new digital revolution;  
You will have exposure to interesting IOT asset data;

templatetext:
The Organisation:
Our client is responsible for national policies and programs that help Australians access quality and affordable education and training.
The Opportunity:
There are 2 positions available. The EL1 will be responsible for a small team of 4 which will include the APS6. 
The role is in the Data Integration and Analytics section that will be:  A) leading the development and implementation of the department’s data management strategy to support a culture of evidence-based policy.
B) showcasing the rigorous, strategic and empirical research on complex social problems affecting whole education systems that can be achieved through (longitudinal) data integration and cross-portfolio collaboration. 
The Role:
In this 6 month non ongoing position with a possible 6 month extension, you will lead the development and implementation of the department’s Data Management Strategy and represent the department at the Data Integration Partnership for Australia.
The program of work may involve reviewing data assets, working across the department to build a data management community of practice across the department, implementing new data policies, and undertaking complex statistical analysis for our
            clients such as multi-variate statistical analysis or causal inference testing.
In addition, you will support the general work of the Data Management and Analytics team by writing reports, briefs and managing staff and projects.
The Person:
You will come from a Data Analyst or Statistical background. You are likely to have technical experience delivering on quantitative research projects and possibly experience in using experimental design and casual inference statistical techniques.
            You will have demonstrated experience in communicating complex concepts or research findings to general audiences and you will be proficient in R, STATA or SAS
A baseline security clearance is desirable but not mandatory. However Australian Citizenship is a must.
The Salary/Rate:
APS6 $84,692- $93,132 + 15.4% Super EL1 $104,143- $115,100 + 15.4% Super
If this role is not quite right for you, but you are interested in other Data Analyst positions please contact me on the details below.
 To apply online, please click on the appropriate link. Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, please contact Lucas Walker on 02 6108 4878, quoting Ref No. 8420
title: EL1 & APS6 Data Analyst Positions

templatetext:
About Xero
 
Here at Xero we are all about people and building beautiful experiences for our customers. Join our passionate team who love to learn and get involved in the community. We focus on developing solutions to make it easier for small businesses to
          grow through beautiful accounting software. With us you have a chance to have an impact on the lives and businesses of people globally.
Working at Xero will provide you with a diverse and inclusive environment alongside people who will respect, challenge, support and mentor you to have fun while you do the best work of your life. We are a place where personal development, innovation,
          and change are not only inspired but also celebrated. We value our people and want them to enjoy and take pride in their work.
About the role
As a member of our product team, you will play a key role in how we understand and use our data to deliver amazing experiences in our product. You will achieve this through:
 

Analysing our current data gathering tools and processes to identify ways to make improvements - making it easier and quicker to collect, analyse, interpret and share data and findings

 

Using a range of simple and advanced analytical techniques and approaches to understand how our customers use our products, and collaborate with various teams across the business to help collect data and establish insights that inform product
            & roadmap decisions

 

Continually explore and analyse customer behaviour to identify patterns and drive improved conversion and retention, helping make our products better and our customers happier

About you
We are looking for someone with a passion for building great products and, just as important as the experience, is the ability to be #human and take ownership of your environment. We are so lucky to have excellent people to work with and offices
          to work in and we'd love you to be a part of it.
So for you to be successful as Xero’s next Product Data Analyst you'll ideally have some experience in:

A previous Analyst role where you were responsible for applying data driven insights to recommendations in commercial settings
Applying data modelling aggregation and visualisation techniques and methods
Working with analytics software and tagging tools to support a complex product or digital experience(s)
Applying programmatic statistical packages and libraries such as R, Python or similar
Driving insights and recommendations from A/B testing
SQL and proven ability wrangling data from multiple sources.
Creating, maintaining and improving clear and easy to understand documentation
Establishing relationships with a broad technical and non-technical stakeholder group and presenting your message in a concise and consistent manner
Building your own skill set in an ever changing, innovative, global environment.

Xero is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity, foster innovation and reward success.
If you want to come to work with friends every single day and help to make Xero even more special, please apply!
