templatetext:
Cannon Hill location
Permanent full-time position
Work for an amazing company who makes a difference!
Endeavour Foundation is a fast growing for-purpose national organisation with over 5,000 staff plus volunteers, providing support and services to people with a disability in over 300 locations nationally. The National Disability Insurance Scheme
          (NDIS) is being implemented and is a landmark time of transformation within our sector, providing an opportunity for you to be at the forefront of one of the biggest organisational change and people transformation journeys in Australia.
About The Role
The purpose of this role is to provide accurate data analysis and research to support the delivery of evidence based workforce intelligence to influence and advise optimal decision making. Duties will include:

Provide insights and informative data sets that support and inform actions and decision making
Develop and produce reports and dashboards to effectively communicate key information in a meaningful and relevant way to business stakeholders
Perform ad-hoc quantitative or qualitative analyses and monitor/provides updates to management regarding specific initiative progress. 
Identify patterns and trends in data, and provide professional written business commentary to influence and inform actions
Lead and influence the HR team to enter, maintain and use information in a manner that ensures data quality, data security and governance
Utilise attention to detail and your natural curiosity to identify and investigate data anomalies, pro-actively rectifying root causes, and continuously improving process and data reliability
Key contributor to enterprise data and reporting projects including HRIS optimisation, Enterprise BI application, and strategic reporting updates and activities.

About You

Data-driven professional with demonstrated success in developing and using workforce analysis, data and metrics to drive business decisions and influence outcomes.
Strong collaborative orientation, with excellent relationship-building, communication and persuasion skills and a track record of earning and demonstrating trust.
Strong proficiency with Excel, PowerPoint, and data analysis approaches and tools to drive business insight.
Demonstrates problem solving skills to successfully identify problems develop solutions and implement these using a logical and systematic approach.
Demonstrated communication skills to ensure clear and concise information is presented to the team, manager and customers.
Tertiary qualification in relevant discipline including; Business/HR/Commerce
Microsoft Power BI and Peoplesoft experience desirable

Before commencing with Endeavour Foundation you will be required to undertake a National Criminal History check and hold or be willing to obtain a positive notice from Disability Services (Yellow Card) and Working with Children Check (Blue card).
          
This is an exciting time for Endeavour, and a terrific opportunity for the right person!

          industry. This will be done by providing research analysis, extracting and manipulating complex data from multiple sources, writing summaries of statistical trends, data modelling and providing general analysis and reporting.
 
To be considered for this role you will have demonstrated experience in a similar Research Analyst position within the Media Industry; and possess high level experience in statistical compilation, data manipulation, data verification and proofing
          as well as setting up and running research projects. The successful candidate will have a mature and positive outlook, be detail oriented, highly organised in addition to possessing highly developed communication skills.

templatetext:
About us
Defence Health provides great value private health insurance to Australian Defence Force (ADF) families and the wider Defence community. As a Members Own Health Fund, we are not-for-profit and all for the benefit of our members. Our members really
          are like family to us, and our workforce actively lives and breathes our service culture and also our corporate values. Here at Defence Health we have a strong focus on staff engagement and creating a high performance culture. We recognise that
          a highly engaged and motivated workforce will not help us to retain fantastic people but will enable us to provide a great member experience.
Find out more at www.defencehealth.com.au
About the role
We are looking for enthusiastic candidates who have a true passion for analysis and delivering business insights. As the Business Intelligence Analyst you will be responsible for regular and ad-hoc reporting, collation and analysis of information,
          identification of trends and the provision of recommendations to the business.   
About you
To be successful in this role, you will have strong analytical, research and problem solving skills.  You will have the ability to communicate with all levels of the business and excellent time management skills. Collaboration is important
          at Defence Health so you will enjoy working within a team environment and engaging with multiple stakeholders. 
Additionally you will be able to demonstrate the following experience and competencies:

At least 3 years of experience in analytics and insights
Strong customer service skills, including the ability to communicate technical information to stakeholders
Demonstrated attention to detail
Intermediate to Advanced skills in Business Intelligence tool (Yellowfin, PowerBI).
Knowledge of SQL and statistical software packages (e.g. R, Python) is an advantage
Knowledge in database management is highly desirable.
Intermediate to Advanced Excel skills and a good knowledge of other MS office products, along with an eagerness to acquire new skills and knowledge

It can get pretty busy so during peak periods you will have the resilience to manage high workloads and the initiative to investigate problems and suggest solutions.
This is a fantastic opportunity to be part of a company that offers a great work/life balance and culture. We will value your experience and commitment by offering competitive remuneration, training, as well as a range of incentives such as free
          health insurance (seriously!) and a super active social club organising get togethers and social activities like Friday night drinks.
If this looks like the job for you, please apply now by submitting your resume and a cover letter outlining your suitability!

          and plan for further growth in both our retail and wholesale channels.

Experience in a master data, administration role
Exposure to FMCG environment highly regarded

Working knowledge of SAP highly regarded
Data and corporate systems literacy Business process orientation
High Level of organisational and time management skills

Minimum of 6-10 years' experience working on Informatica Data Quality (Informatica specialist in Data Quality certification desirable but not mandatory)
Must have clear understanding of Data Quality, Data Governance, Data Lakes and Master Data Management concepts.    
Understanding of software life cycle processes, experience of working in a large-scale program in Australia.
Informatica Data Quality and Informatica Master Data Management version 9.x, 10.x
Data Modelling, Advanced PL/SQL, Java SDK
Personal attributes: Problem solving skills, Team Spirit, Accountability and Responsibility
Other beneficial skills: Strong development and design background and people management.

What we can offer you?
Working at Capgemini you'll find the rewards are more than just financial. Not only will you work alongside inspiring colleagues with a world of experience but you will also have access to great benefits including, salary continuance insurance,
          paid parental leave, education assistance, salary packaging, the ability to purchase additional leave, as well as, discounts on entertainment, financial and wellbeing services, travel and shopping
About Capgemini
Capgemini is one of the world's foremost providers of consulting, technology, outsourcing services and local professional services. Present in over 40 countries with more than 180,000 people, the Capgemini Group helps its clients transform in
          order to improve their performance and competitive positioning.
Ranked among Ethisphere's 2018 Most Ethical Companies in the Word. Our seven values are at the heart of everything we do - Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Team Spirit, Freedom, Fun and Modesty.
If you believe you have "La Niaque" to go the extra mile, then apply by submitting your resume.
Want to know more? To learn more about Capgemini and find out about what makes our people unique, log ontowww.capgemini.com.au
title: Data Quality Analyst

templatetext:
Who we are
At IRESS, we believe technology should help people perform better every day. Since our beginning in 1993, people across financial services have trusted us to take their performance to the next level. From the world’s most established financial
          brands to new and disruptive players, we help improve every aspect of our clients’ businesses so that they can work better, every day.
IRESS is one of Australia’s largest technology companies and employs more than 1,900 people across Australia, United Kingdom, South Africa, Canada, New Zealand and Asia.  
The role
We are seeking a Data Business Analyst to sit within the Wealth Management Lumen team. This role requires strong data analysis and skills together with some technical ability. Knowledge of investment management and financial planning is expected
          to be developed on the job. Perhaps you are a BA that has a data background, or vice versa?
The role requires an aptitude for client engagement, support and an enquiring mind to seek innovative solutions to problems. The role will work on customer implementations and support for the IRESS LUMEN product, delivering data driven compliance
          monitoring and other analytics solutions to the financial advice industry. 
What you will be doing

Issue diagnosis and rectification of the Product KRI’s, Workflows and Dashboards together with the underlying core Configuration (Data errors and SQL config issues)
Design, develop & test the SQL data logic for new and enhanced Key Risk Indictors
Configure Dashboards to best show the insights client require from their data
Provide customer input to the product manager to enhance the Lumen Compliance Product.
Data mapping, reconciliation and testing for new clients and when existing client XPLAN configurations change
Recognize and meet competing priorities and deadlines

What you will need

High level of customer centricity and takes accountability for delivery
Identify and work comfortably within various software development methodologies
Experience working with and analysing data
Flexibility with an ability and passion to learn new technologies
Effective stakeholder management and communication
Understand the challenges of working in a cross-functional, dynamic and fast paced environments.

Why work with us


Competitive remuneration


Global opportunities


State-of-the-art offices


Casual dress, flexible work policy


Access to learning and development programs


3 days’ leave per year for charity initiatives


Global 36-hour hackathon


Table tennis, pool tables, meditation rooms


Subsidised Myki


Up to 26 weeks’ paid parental leave for primary carers (up to 4 weeks for secondary carers), and the ability to work part-time when returning to work.
title: Data Business Analyst

templatetext:
About the Role
A leading business in the education industry is looking to engage an experienced Technical Business Analyst with subject matter expertise in web APIs, SQL and data management.
Your primary responsibility is to map out data between two platforms for an integrated platform as a service (iPaaS) project, as part of a business-wide transformation underpinned by technology enablement that will support the continuation of
          the organisation's impressive growth trajectory.
Skills & Experience
Working as part of a high-calibre team, reporting to an impressive Business Transformation Leader and working closely with engineers and vendors, this business-critical role will see you decipher and analyse the AS-IS and define best-practice
          TO-BE standards. Strong documentation skills are essential, as is the ability to manage and prioritise your work.
Key requirements and experience:

Demonstrable experience with Data Warehouse environments, data migration mapping, iPaaS, Web API’s and SQL;
Formally trained in best-practice standards and able to articulate this to stakeholders, both orally and in writing. 
Experience working within complex and inter-cultural environments across multiple stakeholders and tight deadlines, both in-house and external teams.

How to Apply
For more information or a confidential discussion please call Laura Piplica at u&u on 02 8245 7910 quoting Job Reference 13072 or alternatively, click below to apply. We look forward to receiving
          your application and assisting you with your job search.
Please submit your resume in Word format only.
title: Technical Business Analyst - Data

templatetext:
Play a key role in the implementation of a new Enterprise Data Quality Tool within Macquarie.
We are currently looking to bring on a new Business Analyst to assist our Tooling Team with building out Enterprise Tools that are used to govern data across the organisation. You will support your peers with helping better understand and
          shape the data quality processes in our business divisions, documenting requirements needed in our Data Quality Tool to support the data quality process. You will also help the business teams to define and implement data quality rules and provide
          best practice guidelines in data quality.
Lastly, you will develop and deliver training material and templates to support on-boarding of the business community into our data quality tool.
We are looking for someone that has a good technical background in writing Data Quality and Business rules as well as strong working knowledge of Data Tools (Informatica, Alteryx, or Data stage will be highly regarded).
If you are someone that has a good understanding of data and how data quality is managed in a large enterprise and you are looking for your next career move, then please apply now.
Whilst this opportunity is initially a 6-month contract, there is opportunity to extend to a more permanent position down the track. 
Corporate Operations Group (COG) provides specialist professional services, human resources, workplace infrastructure, technology and market operations to Macquarie's businesses. The primary purpose of COG is to support and enhance the value of
          Macquarie through the creation of an efficient, scalable operating model. This is evident across the activities of each of the divisions which comprises of Business Improvement and Strategy Division (BIS), Business Services Division (BSD), COG
          Business Management, Human Resources Division (HR), Market Operations, Operational Risk Strategy and Support, Shared Services and Technology.
Find out more about Macquarie careers at www.macquarie.com/careers
Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common
          is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.
We facilitate a range of flexible working arrangements within our teams. Talk to us about what flexibility may be available.
title: Business Analyst – Data Quality - 6 month contract

templatetext:
This opportunity sits with a large IT services company based in Sydney CBD. They are going through a large program of work with an insurance company and needing an Analyst Programmer to assist with a Data Migration          projects.  
Essential Job Functions 

Codes, tests, debugs, implements, and documents programs. Assists in the modification of company products and/or customer/internal systems to meet the needs of the client and/or end-user. 
Gathers information from the system, analyzes program and time requirements, and prepares documentation to change existing programs. 
Researches and analyzes existing systems and program requirements, under periodic supervision. 
Designs programs for projects or enhancements to existing programs. 
Writes specifications for programs of low to moderate complexity. 
Assists in resolving production support problems. Develops and suggests alternative approaches to resolving problems. 
Develops test plans to verify logic of new or modified programs. Identifies issues as appropriate. 
Creates appropriate documentation in work assignments such as program code, and technical documentation. 
Conducts quality assurance activities such as peer reviews. 
Remains abreast of and researches industry technical trends and new development to maintain current skills and remain current with industry standards. 

Basic Qualifications 

Technology includes:  Cobol, Java, SQL, Scripting – need to have strong experience developing in this technologies
Experience working on Migration Projects is critical for these roles
Background in Life Insurance or General Insurance industries very highly regarded
Experience working with Life400 or Cloas or any other Insurance applications very highly regarded (ie, POLISY, Insure90)
Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience 
Bachelor's degree in computer science, mathematics or related field preferred 
Three or more years of experience in programming or testing 
Experience working with appropriate programming languages, operating systems and software 
Experience working with relational databases to facilitate programming software 

Other Qualifications 

Good personal computer and business solutions software skills 
Analytical and problem-solving skills for design, creation and testing of programs 
Interpersonal skills to interact with team members 
Communication skills to work effectively with team members, support personnel, and clients 
Ability to work independently and as part of a team 
To be considered for the role click the 'Apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Ozzi Fauzy on 02 94645685. Please quote our job reference number: 200181423.

title: Reporting and Data Analyst

templatetext:
At MinterEllison we take pride in being our clients' best partner, and enjoy working within teams of professionals who share their knowledge, respect our values and support each other to achieve our collective goals. We welcome people
          who want exciting careers in high performing teams.
Purpose of the role
The Business Information Team is part of the firm's Finance Systems team, and plays a critical role in managing the firm's data and reporting requirements to ensure one source of the truth, reusable data models, and the integrity of reporting
          outputs. The team is responsible for the collection, analysis and translation of the firm's reporting requirements into data or report specifications; working with the development team to perform systems testing; facilitating UAT, planning
          for a production roll out; and providing ongoing training and provision of expert user support.
Job description
In your role as a Senior Data and Reporting Analyst your duties will include:

Providing efficient, proactive, analytical, responsive, client focused, operational reporting support through delivery of reports and investigation, diagnosis and rectification of issues; including reports produced in Elite (ERP/PMS), BI
            tools and Excel
Peer reviewing data solutions, reports and data packs provided by other members of the Business Information team
Deciphering and translate business requirements, providing operational support, training and reporting within agreed SLA's
Analysing and critically evaluating business requirements to determine options for a value-add solution. Solutions must be designed within the BI framework:
            
Flexible and scalable
Consider standardisation of the data and presentation layer of the output
Consider business processes, KPIs and existing Data models
Take into account a holistic view of the firm's information needs whilst aligning with the Business Information strategy



More about you
On your first day we expect you to have:

Experience translating reporting requirements into technical specifications, which are easy to understand for the delivery of business information solutions
Experience in design and delivery of standardised data and reporting solutions, including reporting dashboards
Process expertise, including Business analytics, external and internal reporting, support and coordination of metrics and scorecards,
Experience querying relational data bases, preferably using SQL Server 2008/2012 and Microsoft excel
Experience with practice management systems, preferably Elite 3e

Who we are
We embrace flexibility and empower all our people to learn, grow and become truly extraordinary. We provide our future leaders with best practice learning and development programs to accelerate and grow their careers. We value diversity in the
          workplace and care about ensuring you balance your professional goals with your commitments and interests outside of work. We have a wide range of social, financial and health benefits to support your wellbeing.
How to Apply
We prefer to deal with you directly, so if you would like to be considered please submit your CV and cover letter via our online portal by clicking on the 'Apply' button below. If you would like further information, please contact Alyce Bennett
          at Alyce.Bennett@minterellison.com for a highly confidential discussion.
Please note that applications from agencies will not be considered at this time. To be eligible to apply for this role you must be legally permitted to work in Australia.

Job description

Providing efficient, proactive, analytical, responsive, client focused, operational reporting support through delivery of reports and investigation, diagnosis and rectification of issues; including reports produced in Elite (ERP/PMS), BI
            tools and Excel
Peer reviewing data solutions, reports and data packs provided by other members of the Business Information team
Deciphering and translate business requirements, providing operational support, training and reporting within agreed SLA's
Analysing and critically evaluating business requirements to determine options for a value-add solution. Solutions must be designed within the BI framework:
            
Flexible and scalable
Consider standardisation of the data and presentation layer of the output
Consider business processes, KPIs and existing Data models
Take into account a holistic view of the firm's information needs whilst aligning with the Business Information strategy



More about you
On your first day we expect you to have:

Experience translating reporting requirements into technical specifications, which are easy to understand for the delivery of business information solutions
Experience in design and delivery of standardised data and reporting solutions, including reporting dashboards
Process expertise, including Business analytics, external and internal reporting, support and coordination of metrics and scorecards,
Experience querying relational data bases, preferably using SQL Server 2008/2012 and Microsoft excel
Experience with practice management systems, preferably Elite 3e

Who we are
We embrace flexibility and empower all our people to learn, grow and become truly extraordinary. We provide our future leaders with best practice learning and development programs to accelerate and grow their careers. We value diversity in the
          workplace and care about ensuring you balance your professional goals with your commitments and interests outside of work. We have a wide range of social, financial and health benefits to support your wellbeing.
How to Apply
We prefer to deal with you directly, so if you would like to be considered please submit your CV and cover letter via our online portal by clicking on the 'Apply' button below. If you would like further information, please contact Alyce Bennett
          at Alyce.Bennett@minterellison.com for a highly confidential discussion.
Please note that applications from agencies will not be considered at this time. To be eligible to apply for this role you must be legally permitted to work in Australia.

The Business Information Team is part of the firm's Finance Systems team, and plays a critical role in managing the firm's data and reporting requirements to ensure one source of the truth, reusable data models, and the integrity of reporting

Regular ETL and support with existing data visualisation dashboards. Minimum 12 months experience in SQL and Alteryx. Experience in Tableau Desktop/Public or Power BI preferable. Primary purpose of the role:The
        Senior Analyst (Data Management) undertakes and/or coordinates the collection, formatting, analysis and interpretation of data and information to inform broader decision-making regarding the continuous improvement of service management
        processes. The role actively contributes to a high-performance team environment, provides excellent customer service and enables continual service improvement practices. Key accountabilities:

Manage the branch’s database technology and associated schemas to allow secure, efficient and effective access to the branch’s structured data 
Employ the use of data, appropriate methodologies, research and analysis to determine key findings from various sources to inform the preparation of briefings, submissions, policy papers and reports

templatetext:
COMPANY BACKGROUND As a result of a recent pivot in their strategy, this renowned consumer led group have expanded rapidly over recent years to become the market leader. Due to this growth, privacy has become an increasing focal
        point with plans to develop both the privacy team and architecture of their privacy strategy / systems to cope with the growth. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Work with both the privacy team and the business to ensure compliance to guidelines
Document privacy processes to ensure easy to follow procedures
Create hypothetical privacy related scenarios / incidents to test and improve current structure
Consume large data sets quickly looking for errors or anomalies
 SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE Our client is looking for a junior level privacy analyst (minimum 1 years’ experience) who ideally has worked within the privacy team for a large ASX or multi-national corporate. Experienced working with
        large sets of data, you will have solid analysis skills as well as a foundation level of privacy legislation knowledge. You will have bundles of energy and be keen to learn and contribute wherever possible.    CULTURE AND BENEFITS        This a great opportunity to work within one of the most established and fastest growing privacy groups in Australia. Based out of impressive offices in the western suburbs, you will be working with true leaders in the privacy field. Access to
        on-site parking, gym and other perks are available.

Our client is a leader within there field, they are known by there customers and the market to be innovative and very customer focused. Due to an increase in activity within the marketing/CRM team we require a Salesforce CRM analyst to join the
          team.

          on specific customer segmentation, campaign or behavioural changes. Marketing activities include emails, flyers, SMS etc.

Customer journey building

Data Analysis

This role is an initial 6 month contract with a view for permanency.
The organisation is based in the CBD a fantastic, friendly and growth orientated culture - they are really an awesome company.

templatetext:
A global organisation is seeking a Data Analyst who comes with an ability to produce insights by working with a diverse range of data.
Working closely with key stakeholders, your role will be focused on understanding a customer’s problem, performing deep data analysis, derive insights and build solutions in order to drive change in performance and profitability of the business.
          
This is a great opportunity to join a fast-paced environment and have an opportunity to make an impact on a growing business and assist in business performance.
Key Responsibilities

Investigating, interpreting and understanding complex unstructured data and translating that into value driven insight
Working with stakeholder to scope customers’ requirements and provide analytical solutions
Perform statistical analysis; predictive modelling, scoring, segmentation and provide strategic insights to improve performance
Data cleansing, performing integrity checks, working with raw data
Identify areas to be investigated and ensure they’re in line with the business wide data strategy


Communicate results of complex data, analysis and findings into meaningful and actionable insights for senior management and key stakeholders

Looking for Key Skills such as

3 + years within a commercial analytics environment ideally within credit risk
Proven experience providing insights to internal and external stakeholders
Ability to take complex data and take the customer on a journey adding value
Strong statistical programming skills using SAS/SQL/R/Python
Demonstrable experience presenting to customers
Knowledge of the full credit life cycle would be an advantage
Prior experience in data mining, analysis and reporting in a commercial environment
Tertiary qualification in a quantitative discipline such as mathematics, statistics, commerce, economics etc.
A passion for presenting valuable insights from complex data

This is an excellent opportunity to work in a fast paced growing environment, focused on developing solutions and enabling information to help drive the operational effectiveness of the organisation.
 To discuss this opportunity please contact Robyn Mew.

title: Data Analyst - Credit Risk

templatetext:
Were looking for a senior technical business analyst with experience in data analytics and data warehouse for a client of ours in Sydney CBD. The purpose of the role is act as a conduit between the business and technology teams advising on data
          warehouse design and process, and to act as the pivot or intermediary between end-users and IT to ensure that business/user requirements are delivered in Enterprise Data Hub solutions.  The Senior Business Analyst / Consultant. As a
          business analyst and internal consultant, meet with business users to gather and analyse business requirements. Proactively identify enhancement opportunities both in terms of system functionality and business process design. Analyse workflow
          to create process maps and isolate areas of potential improvement  Senior Data Analyst. Designing and maintaining conceptual corporate data, covering database design, data integration, data flow, metadata and semantics, required for
          business intelligence, reporting and analytics. Data modelling and data warehousing design to meet business strategic and operational reporting requirements and information analysis needs.  Qualifications & Experience

Tertiary degree in IT, business, or a relevant discipline
Proven subject matter expertise in BI application usages and capabilities, data modelling, visualisation methods and data warehouse design.
Experience with advanced analytic toolsets including Open Source tools (R, python, Scala etc.) an advantage
Experience with distributed computing (i.e. Hadoop Stack) and Cloud Based Infrastructures is an advantage
Sound general IT experience (applications and/or infrastructure) including systemic knowledge of IT development, operational and change management processes and methodologies.
Experience in management of third-party suppliers of application development and maintenance services.

For further information on this role or to confidentially apply, please contact Will Reemer on 02 8227 9200 or apply directly via the Apply for this job button.
          Only WORD FORMAT resumes will be accepted.
title: Senior Business Analyst

templatetext:
Green Light is one of Australia's most successful and fastest growing IT services businesses. We offer a wide range of IT services in Security, infrastructure and Systems Integration to a diverse customer base throughout Australia, New Zealand,
          SE Asia and Europe.ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES 

The main objective is to research and document telecom services and contract rates for audit, optimisation, and reporting purposes. The analyst will create and maintain a client’s telecom inventory based on carrier and client
            supplied data including vendor invoices, telecom orders, and customer service records (CSRs);
Perform analysis over various production-scale data sets to drive business decisions;
Assessing performance levels of system hardware and software to project future needs, and developing short- and long-terms plans for updating equipment, adding capabilities, enhancing existing systems and providing improved telecommunications
Use various methods to analyses, query and migrate data
Act as the technical SME while communicating with the project team, vendor, business and SME's to define the needs based on an understanding of business, information and technical constraints;
evaluating and procuring new products and services from vendors;
Identify risks, issues and escalate to the Project Manager for review;
We are looking for someone who is willing to support the team and undertake ad hoc tasks where required; which may include assisting in documenting market approaches for future HR systems, change management and transition out activities;
The successful candidate will work closely with the IT project team, vendor and business to help the project meet schedule, business and budget objectives. They will be expected to support the team to deliver successful outcomes and work closely
            with a variety of people.

SKILLS NEEDED:

Minimum of 5 years demonstrated experience working as a Technical/Systems/Data Analyst delivering multi-faceted artefacts for government programs and/or projects.
Minimum of 2 years working at Telco.
Demonstrated experience and skills in identifying 'as is' and 'to be' system and data requirement
Demonstrated experience with strong communication skills, including prioritizing, problem-solving and interpersonal relationship building
Strong engagement skills and ability to act as the technical SME while communicating with the project team, vendor, business and SME's to define the needs based on an understanding of business, information and technical constraints;
Demonstrated experience in technical writing, documenting guidelines and operational procedures
Demonstrated ability to understand various data extracts, transform and join for a successful data load as part of data migration
Ability to use various methods to analyses and query data under limited direction
Demonstrated understanding of technical principles and the ability to assist with configuration of system interfaces using API's.

If interested in the role, please apply now and submit resume and covering letter explaining how you meet the above requirements.

 Technical:

title: Business Analyst / Data Modeller

templatetext:
Business Analyst – Project Data Management 

Support global projects and studies to deliver systematic and consistent project data management practices
Standardise project data management processes across multiple product groups and commodities
Challenge yourself to think outside of the box  and contribute to innovating digital project delivery 
Located in Brisbane supporting projects and studies in various global locations

 
About the role
We are looking for a Business Analyst – Project Data Management to join our Project Data and Document Management team to provide analytical support to enhance the delivery of the global project data management
          function and drive change and innovation in digital project delivery. 
This role is a great opportunity to work with multiple global stakeholders to facilitate change and develop analytical toolsets to support decision making and process improvement within the project data management function. Reporting to the Manager
          Project Data and Document Management, you will be responsible for: 

Engaging with global stakeholders to define and document systematic project delivery
Facilitate workshops to define problem statements and demonstrate continuous improvement principles to enable the development and adoption of global standards in digital project delivery
Performing current state analysis on business process and defining the case for change
Liaising and negotiating with internal and external stakeholders to ensure buy in and compliance to project data and document management guidance as governed by Rio Tinto projects globally
Displaying time management skills to track and prioritise a large volume of projects
Drive the importance of continuous improvement in project data management
Facilitating transformational change in project data management practices

 
About you
To be successfully considered for this role, you will possess the following:

Proven experience in Business improvement, Continuous improvement, Process improvement or a related discipline
Experience of business process mapping and documentation
Experience dealing with multiple stakeholders to deliver on competing priorities 
The ability to analyse complex data, define a problem statement and build a reputable business case
Demonstrated communication skills, including an ability to build and maintain global relationships
Excellent writing skills, experience in business process mapping, developing value driver trees, leading and facilitating workshops, attention to detail and an ability to problem solve
Demonstrated experience in a similar role with a proven and applied understanding of continuous improvement methodology 

Highly regarded:

A tertiary qualification in Project Management, Information Management, Engineering or related discipline
Proven ability to deliver client outcomes in a consulting capacity, or similar
Demonstrated business and or commercial acumen in project delivery
Highly developed stakeholder management skills at a global level 

 
Where you will be working
The Growth & Innovation group operates through the entire life cycle of Rio Tinto’s mines and assets, creating value through exploration, project development and technical excellence. Working in close partnership with all product groups, it
          focuses on finding safer, smarter and more efficient ways to manage resources and operations.
About us 
As pioneers in mining and metals, we produce materials essential to human progress.
 
Our long history is filled with firsts. We’ve developed some of the world’s largest and best quality mines and operations, and our people work in around 35 countries across six continents. Aluminium and copper, diamonds, gold and industrial minerals,
          iron ore, coal and uranium: our materials make up the world around us. You’ll find then in smartphones, planes, cars, hospitals and throughout your home.
 
Creating an inclusive and diverse workforce
 
We are a diverse team of talented, enthusiastic individuals who foster a culture of inclusion. No matter how they may differ, our people share one thing in common. It’s a belief that work is more rewarding when we are accepted and valued for our
          differences, not judged by them. We all have something to contribute, and it’s this contribution that makes for a great organization and fulfilling career.
 
Apply today if you want to work with the latest technology and innovation, in an environment where we challenge you to drive positive change.
 
Please note, in order to be successfully considered for a role you must complete all pre-screening questions.
title: Business Analyst - Project Data Management

salary: Attractive salary and corporate benefits package
templatetext:
David Jones and the Country Road Group is Australasia’s largest department store and fashion retail group comprising of iconic brands such as David Jones, Country Road, POLITIX, Trenery, Witchery and MIMCO. Part of Woolworths Holding (SA) our
          values include being Customer Obsessed, Collaborative, Inspirational, Responsible and Dedicated to Quality. We are looking for highly motivated and passionate individuals to be part of the Group’s evolution and support each brand to realise
          their full potential.
Our Digital team play a crucial role in our long term evolution as an industry retailer. Producing and managing our online platforms, they ensure we continue to enhance our overall customer experience.
This role sits as part of a team of Data Insights Analysts who play a crucial role in shaping our direction based on their understanding of online/e-Commerce consumer behaviours. 
In this role you will:

Own and maintain all aspects of Google Analytics (GA) and Google Tag Manager (GTM) including tracking/tagging implementation, dashboards and custom reports across all brands
Provide weekly and quarterly Group website reports to all internal stakeholders
Provide data-driven insights into online user behaviour and customer journeys
Proactively identify growth opportunities and drive on-going improvements to increase the online conversion rate and enhance the customer experience
Collaborate with the  Regional Digital Operations and internal stakeholders on new projects, optimisation (A/B and/or multivariate testing) and personalisation activities, identifying anomalies and providing insights on specific aspects
            of the website operations to optimise the customer journey
Partner with and collaborate with the broader Digital and Analytics teams
Create workshops and learning opportunities for all of the teams to understand current systems and reporting frameworks

We are looking for that little bit extra, so join us if you:

Have extensive experience in digital data insights and analytics
Have proven experience in using Google Analytics (including RegEx), Google Tag Manager 
Have experience in Google Data Studio, JavaScript, Test and Learn approaches to conversion optimisation(Desired)
Have advanced knowledge of Excel and the use of pivot tables and statistical analysis
Have the ability to work in a multi-disciplinary, collaborative, fast-paced retail environment
Possess excellent communication skills, both written and spoken, with the ability to engage with a range of key stakeholders, both internal and external

We Offer:

A competitive remuneration package, including incentives.
Generous employee discounts across David Jones and Country Road Group.
A genuine, open and high performing culture.
Ongoing training and development to pursue individual ambitions and achieve excellence.
Career progression – there are always opportunities for those with aspirations.
The opportunity to become involved in our Corporate Social Responsibility program, by supporting our community partnerships

We are looking for digital professionals who want to make an impact in a fast paced, fun and team orientated environment.  If this you, we encourage you to apply now.
title: Digital Data Insights Analyst

·         Volume Data Processing
·         Procedure and documentation creation
 
Skills/ Qualifications/ Previous Experience
·         Tertiary Qualifications in Information Technology or Statistics or a related field
·         Advanced database and excel skills
·         High level of computer competency and typing speed
·         Direct and concise communication skills
·         Passion for learning and understanding new technology/ information
·         Knowledge of WHS incident reporting and procedures
·         Previous experience developing QMS systems including documentation creation
 
Previous experience within government analytical departments or positions will be highly regarded
title: Quality Assurance Administrator

templatetext:
AustralianSuper is for all Australians and businesses; we invest members’ money to help create the best possible retirement outcome. More than 2.2 million members trust us to invest more than $140 billion on their behalf. Our size has given us
          the ability to leverage significant investment opportunities for long term performance and lower fees that are passed onto our members.
We put members first in everything we do and are committed to the recruitment, development and support of a diverse workforce that share our values of Energy, Integrity, Generosity of Spirit and Excellent Outcomes.
Here’s where you come in…
To support the growth of AustralianSuper, we are seeking a Business Solutions Analyst who will be responsible for assessing the core data and infrastructure needs that will be required to support the Investment Department’s data management capability.
          Reporting to the Manager Data Solutions, this role represents an outstanding opportunity to help to provide subject matter expertise on the business requirements, technical design, development and implementation of investment data management
          solutions.
In this role, you will support the design and implementation of data management solutions including protocols, processes, rules and documentation.
You’ll need…
It is essential you have experience in and a deep knowledge of Investment data spanning a range of asset classes. Working knowledge and exposure to end-to-end investment lifecycle in a Superannuation/Asset management firm is definitely a plus.
          You will have experience working on system integration projects liaising with vendors in an agile environment.
A strong business analysis capability is paramount, with the ability to work with a range of stakeholders to gather requirements, as is the ability to work collaboratively to contribute across the broader program of work.
If you would like the opportunity to work in a challenging, growing and rapidly evolving environment to deliver outstanding results that benefit members, please apply now! Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.
Please note, this role is deemed to be an Access Person role. Disclosure and Personal Trading requirements apply to the successful candidate.
Agencies please note: this vacancy is being managed directly by AustralianSuper’s Recruitment team. We will contact our preferred agency partners should we require additional support. Thank you.

About Sunsuper...
Sunsuper is one of Australia’s largest and most awarded super funds. As an industry super fund, we’re run to benefit our members. That means no commission, no shareholders to pay and no over the top fees to pay. We’ve had some great returns over
          the long run and offer super benefits to our members.
 
To support our success we are currently seeking an Informatica Specialist to join the Data Management team in our Brisbane head office.
 
About the Role...
In this hands-on role, you will be responsible for supporting a multi-domain MDM and data integration solution using Informatica platform. Working closely with internal stakeholders you will provide administration across the master data management
          and integration platform that will meet current and future business objectives and design.
 
About You...
To ensure success you will possess:

Relevant tertiary qualification and/or significant experience in an ICT environment in a similar role or capacity.
More than 3 years’ experience in administering Informatica MDM.
More than 5 years’ experience in administering Informatica Power Centre.
Must have good understanding of Master Data Management (MDM) architectures and business processes.
Exposure to designing data models within MDM hub.
Knowledge of Data Integration concepts.
Understanding of ETL methodology using market standard tools including Informatica Power Centre and SSIS.
Experience in Microsoft SQL Server technologies.
Experience with Informatica Administration activities including upgrade and patching.
Good understanding of Informatica Powercenter and MDM Architecture.
Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills with extensive experience explaining complex technical concepts to business focused senior stakeholders.

How to Apply...
To apply for this position online please click APPLY NOW. You are welcome to include any certificates or licences in the education section to assist us in assessing your suitability for this role. Applications close Friday, 8
          February 2019.
 
Location: Brisbane, AU
 
If you’re interested and want to join the wave of success...
 
APPLY NOW!

templatetext:
Service NSWCustomer Insights AnalystLocation Sydney CBDEmployment Type: Full timeDuration: Temporary - June 2020
Our Culture:  Passion, teamwork & accountability At Service NSW our vision is to be recognised as the distinctive leader in the provision of government services. We aim to simplify the way customers
          do business with the NSW government.  The Role and Division  The Customer Insights Analyst plays a consultative role supporting the Easy to do Business (EtdB) Customer Experience team. The role is responsible
          for gathering, consolidating, preparing and modelling data, information and research to develop recommendations for the Customer Experience team.  The role will apply commercial and intuitive thinking to understand the problem and use logic
          and knowledge to identify and agree business requirements. The role is responsible for applying advanced analytics, data set mapping, modelling and interrogation to derive meaningful insights which will guide decision making, quantitative outputs
          and robust scenarios to inform strategic direction.

The person:  

Willing to go above and beyond: you take a hands-on approach to ensure the desired outcomes are achieved.
Collaborative: you make a conscious effort to build effective and supportive relationships in the team and across the organisation.
Engaging and inquisitive: you have a natural curiosity, ability to engage at all levels and positive approach.
Proactive: using your initiative you demonstrate a sense of urgency to get things done and you are confident in challenging the status quo.
Striving for knowledge: you thrive in an environment encouraging individual growth and development.
Passionate and energetic: you are driven, optimistic and thrive in an agile fast-paced environment.
A sense of humour isn’t essential but it certainly helps!The Other Stuff To find out more details about your next career opportunity please refer to the Role Description. Remuneration: The package includes a salary package up to $104,281, plus employer’s contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading.Please Provide:        A covering letter and a resume that details your experience and how you meet the capabilities of the role. How to apply: Applications can only be submitted electronically online through the NSW Government job site
        http://iworkfor.nsw.gov.au  Applications close  Friday 8th February [11:59PM] Additional information: Part of the assessment process includes additional online capability testing, skills testing or work samples in accordance with the Government Sector Employment Act 2013. A talent pool may be created for future ongoing and temporary roles and is valid for a period of up to 12 months. Employment to Service NSW is subject to a satisfactory national criminal record check. Service NSW is passionate about building a culture that values and supports diversity and inclusion. Service NSW encourages applications from people with disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, LGBTQI and people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds. If you are a person with disability and need adjustment in the recruitment process, please contact the Recruitment team via email on recruitment@service.nsw.gov.au For any technical assistance in submitting your application via ‘I work for NSW’ please call 1800 562 679 or email support@iworkfor.nsw.gov.au. Please note that your employment at Service NSW is subject to a Criminal Records Check.

CPM Recruitment Services is a division of CPM Australia providing specialist recruitment services to a range of clients in the areas of technology, consumer electronics, telecommunications, retail, FMCG and retail

          to their growth, currently they are looking for a 'Data Analyst' to work closely with the marketing team to drive business outcomes.
About the Position;
Working within the Central Marketing Organisation Division of Microsoft, your role will be to;

Provide data insight to support marketing campaigns across the company (85%)
Lead and implement a structured data hygiene programme across all marketing tools and systems (15%)

A solid understanding of marketing techniques, with B2B Marketing is essential

Has worked with CRM & database systems

Marketing automation understanding and experience highly desirable

        solutions to many different industry sectors in Sydney including financial services, gaming, telco, media and government. They have an energising, supportive and collaborative culture, are receptive to new ideas and innovation, and are looking

With new projects won and due to kick off in Q1 of 2019 the organisation needs to hire 2 Junior to Mid-Level Tableau Data Visualisation Analyst to join the team.       As a Tableau Data Visualisation Analyst (Junior / Mid-Level) the responsibilities of the role will involve but not be limited to:

templatetext:
Our client is a large ASX listed organisation based in the CBD whom are seeking a Master Data Specialist (PM and MM) to join their team on an ongoing contract basis.   The Role  This position plays a crucial
          role to maintain and improve the consistency and accuracy of the master data within the SAP system for assets and materials (inventory).  Working in a close knit team, the team closely collaborates with site engineering, operation and
          maintenance (O&M) staff to implement sound asset management principles and to strike the balance between improving performance, controlling costs and mitigating risks.  • Create, develop and maintain SAP master data standards for
          generating plant asset/materials master data. • Create, develop and maintain procedures and templates suitable for managing the change of SAP PM/MM data. • In control of SAP PM and MM master data governance • Analyse and recommend
          appropriate procedures to the business regarding SAP PM/MM data modifications. • Create and develop training material suitable for training personnel in the SAP asset/materials master data change processes and standards. • Audit and
          report SAP PM/MM data errors and omissions. • Advice and influence SAP end users to ensure all changes maintain the integrity and consistency of SAP master data. • Analyse and recommend SAP data requirements to Major projects to ensure
          master data supplied with new equipment and plant conforms to organisation standards.   The Ideal Candidate • MUST have a background of trades, inventory planners and/or Data Analyst. • Minimum of 5 years’
          experience in SAP System environment. • Extensive experience in creating and changing data of SAP PM technical objects, material cataloguing process within SAP System environments. Including SAP Material technical objects: Material Master
          and Material Specification • Strong working knowledge of SAP procurement functions (Outline agreements, Service Masters, Contracts) • Experience in using SAP LSMW and Winshuttle • Able to work autonomous and able to liaise across
          departments to assit with business needs. • Good decision making and problem-solving mindset     The Opportunity Immediate start Competitive hourly rate Large Organisation Fantastic team
          culture  You must have the right to live and work in Australia to apply for this role.  For more information on this role or a personal discussion please call Zoe Manifis at Programmed Professionals on 9263 9000.
title: Master Data Specialist (PM and MM)

title: Senior Data & BI Analyst

templatetext:
Working for a national healthcare market leader, we have a new opportunity available for an experienced BI Manager to join and manage an existing Business Intelligence team and work closely with senior business stakeholders. This
        is a well-established organization who are consistently shaping the future of Australian healthcare and are constantly evolving to better serve the need and demands within the industry.    You will be responsible for the leading
        a small dedicated team of BI Specialists responsible for running and maintaining the Data Warehouse, as well as extracting and providing crucial and sensitive reporting insights. There will be ongoing opportunities for growth within the organization,
        as you will help with the development of new and improved BI solutions as they continue the successful journey supporting business data requirements across the organization.       To be successful in this role, you will have the following:

Minimum of 5 years’ experience working as a BI Analyst / Consultant, Data Warehouse Specialist or ETL Developer.
Solid experience working with the Microsoft BI technology stack i.e SSIS, SSRS, SSAS.
Experience working with the Cognos BI suite i.e TM1 
Strong knowledge and experience working with Power BI.
Experience in database development i.e SQL, T-SQL, stored procedures, writing queries etc..
A strong background working on ETL and Data warehouse projects in Business Intelligence domains. 
Team Lead and mentoring experience with the ability to guide and support a small team of BI Specialists.
Experience with Object Orientated Programming languages (OOP).
Development / coding skills with R or Python.
A good understanding of Data Warehousing and Data modelling methodologies such as Kimball, Star Schema, Data Vault etc.
Experience working within the Medical / Healthcare domain will be highly regarded.
Demonstrated experience working with a diverse range of stakeholders from senior or mid-level
Excellent communication skills and a strong business acumen
 Please feel free to contact Matt Moran on (02) 9199 5602 for more information or to have a confidential discussion regarding this rewarding opportunity.
title: BI Manager - Microsoft BI stack - Healthcare industry

templatetext:
George Weston Foods make and supply some of Australia & New Zealand's favourite and most innovative brands and products, living our core purpose ‘to delight people every day with food they love'. GWF's product range is diverse and includes
          leading brands of breads, baked goods, smallgoods, flour, milled products and animal feed.  GWF's business units include: Tip Top, DON, MAURI, Yumis and Jasol.
GWF is one of Australia and New Zealand's largest food manufacturers employing around 6,000 people across 60 sites and is a wholly owned subsidiary of Associated British Foods plc (ABF), one of the world leading food companies.  ABF operates
          in four categories: grocery; primary food agriculture; ingredients; and retail.
Here at GWF we have implemented an innovative Business Analytics and Intelligence platform supporting our businesses.  We are currently seeking appoint a Data and Visualisation Specialist/Analyst who will work with and support
          the businesses to develop their data visualisation capabilities by providing and sharing best practice.  Our visualisation tool is Tableau.
Responsibilities:

Design build and support the production of data visualisations including storyboards and dashboards using Tableau
Train analysts and report builders in Tableau
Maintain, Administer and manage Tableau server environment.
Work with our data modeller to create efficient data views by understanding the data model
Develop and run Tableau enterprise wide training programme
Provide predictive modelling advice, thought leaderships and extend capability
Accountable for relevant process and change documentation
Communicate, present and collaborate with multiple stakeholders and external suppliers to drive delivery of BI initiatives
Partner with stakeholders to identify process improvement opportunities
Ensure compliance with health and safety policies and procedures

You will bring:                                               

Degree qualified in Business, Computer Science, IT or related field
Preference for Tableau qualification or certification (well regarded)
Extensive (minimum 5 years +) hands-on experience in data integration, business intelligence, reporting and analytics
Experience in SQL, R, Python or data-mining/visualisation languages/scripting (well regarded)
Recent experience working as a Developer/consultant with visualisation tools including Tableau or similar on large and complex data sets
Hands on experience in Tableau upgrades and server administration
Effective communication skills with the ability to collaborate well with stakeholders
Ability to influence and engage and build effective relationships at all levels internally and externally
Analytical mindset with strong problem-solving skills
Proven experience identifying and deploying process improvements

Our aim is to ensure our people can hit the ground running - so we provide company and site specific induction with a focus on understanding GWF's business, culture, values and behaviours as well as our number one priority - safety. We are passionate
          about our brand and live by our values, Accountability, Ambition and Collaboration. If this opportunity sounds like your ideal role, we would love to hear from you. 
What's on offer at GWF:
You'll join a passionate and supportive team, during an exciting period of change where you can really make a difference to our business.
Other benefits you will have access to include; annual bonus scheme, free bakery products daily, Income protection insurance through our default Super fund, discounted private health insurance, access to novated leasing, study assistance and company Paid Parental Leave.
To apply for this opportunity please submit your application by clicking on the ‘apply now' button.

title: Technical Business Analyst

templatetext:
We are looking for a talented and logical problem solver to join the Business Solutions Team. Working in a tight-knit and high performing team, your primary duty is to provide holistic system support and implement technical solutions for our
            advisers on the various FP systems including AdviceOS, Xplan and COIN. This includes (but not limited to) system configuration, template enhancements, managing datafeeds, data conversion and user support. This is where your FP System experience
            will be highly advantageous.Your knowledge of the financial planning processes will be invaluable as you develop and maintain relationships with key internal and external stakeholders with the core objective of enhancing and delivering
            innovative solutions through technology. There are many new and ongoing projects that you can get involved with ranging from small to large-scale projects. There will be many opportunities for you to collaborate and share ideas across the
            various areas of the organisation.This is a unique opportunity to join an exciting and talented team with a vision to be Australia’s premier leader in Digital Advice Solutions. The ideal candidate is someone who can think outside the
            box and would like to carve a career in the Digital Advice Solutions and Innovation space here at Findex - if this is you, we would love to hear from you!Business BackgroundThe Findex Group has built a reputation
            in the Financial Services industry for having a strong and proven strategy, thirst for innovation and a disruptive mindset. The business was recently recognised in BRW's 50 Most Innovative Companies list at #12 for the launch of its MOVO online
            advice portal. The Digital team acts as an incubator for innovation across the entire financial services group and its 225,000 Australian clients.The Findex Group is looking to recruit the right candidate who can help develop and deliver
            a portfolio of Financial Services technology that has global application using latest technologies and contemporary user interfaces. Located in both Sydney and Melbourne CBD offices, this position is a full-time, permanent role, offering the
            successful candidate a competitive remuneration package and real opportunities for career growth and advancement.Position Requirements

3-5 years’ experience in a Financial Planning environment
RG-146 or Diploma of Financial Planning qualifications highly desirable
Experiences in Paraplanning and Client Services is essential
Sound understanding of the Financial Planning advisory processes
Excellent working knowledge of Financial Planning technologies & frameworks
Extended experience working with Xplan, COIN or Midwinter is a must
Experienced working in various system innovation projects with a focus on delivery
Openness to learning and self-development via webinars and online training courses
A willingness to share ideas, working knowledge and business solutions
Well-developed verbal and written communication skills
Able to collaborate in a team or work autonomously with minimal supervision
Excellent time management skills with the ability to prioritise competing tasks
Natural ability to solve technical problems and a passion to help others
Innovative and entrepreneurial mind set is a key
Enthusiastic and self-motivated with a ‘can-do’ attitude
Experience supervising staff, providing instructions and guidance in completing daily work
Able to efficiently delegate and manage team workflow to meet Service Levels

Optional Extras

System configuration and coding of template documents
Experience with system upgrades and testing environments
Experience with Commpay and datafeed
Data conversion and migration experience
Data analysis and strong Excel skills
Proficiency in Python programming language

Sound like you - apply now!

title: Business Analyst

templatetext:
QBE is one of the top 20 global general insurers and is recognised as Australia's largest international insurance and Reinsurance Company, with operations in 37 countries around the world.
QBE is looking for a high calibre individual to join the Economic Capital Modelling team as a Senior Capital Modelling Analyst to provide valuable technical input into the business & second line risk management.
Working at QBE, we recognise the value of diversity and inclusion in the workplace and support a range of flexible work arrangements to promote a better family/life/work balance.
We offer you a dynamic workplace culture, one that values and leverages the unique ideas, capabilities and experiences you bring irrespective of where you are in the world. We believe this strengthens our ability to deliver on our business goals,
          particularly as it relates to innovation, growth and our focus on customers.
The opportunity                                                     

Ongoing calibration, validation & documentation of the QBE capital model;
Support the application of the core uses of the capital model in key business areas such as capital management, reinsurance purchasing, stress testing & portfolio performance.
Test and implement new uses of the ECM;
Support ongoing development of the capital model in collaboration with Group & Global divisional capital modelling teams;
Collaborate with stakeholders within the business and generate strong relationships to drive excellent outcomes.

What does success look like?

Experience in capital modelling is desirable, though applicants with background in actuarial & volatility modelling will also be considered;
Understanding of actuarial analysis & prudential capital requirements in a general insurance environment;
Understanding of insurance business planning;
Ability to understand commercial concepts and how they can be modelled in the capital model;
Experience in IGLOO or other capital modelling software will be viewed favourably.

Benefits?
At QBE, you will be provided with a competitive remuneration structure and benefits, in an environment that offers support, and encourages career development and learning.
We offer a range of benefits and discounts including:

Paid Parental leave (inclusive of paid superannuation during this time)
Secondment opportunities
Employee assistance programme
Paid volunteer leave
Purchased leave
Product discounts
Superannuation matching

Applicants will be required to provide evidence of their eligibility to work in Australia, and at a minimum be required to undertake police and basic credit checks as a condition of employment. If you are a QBE employee, please inform your Manager
          before applying.
For more information, click the APPLY button to submit your details.
Applications Close Friday 22 February 2019
title: Senior Capital Modelling Analyst

templatetext:
ABOUT US
The Perth Mint is an iconic Western Australian organization operating on a truly global scale.
Situated in East Perth for over 118 years, The Perth Mint is not only a top ranking tourist destination but is an award winning exporter and key player in the precious metals markets around the world. Our reputation is built on the outstanding
          quality of our products supported by outstanding customer service.
The Perth Mint provides an energetic and dynamic work environment and is dedicated to delivering the highest level of customer service to our diverse customer base.
ABOUT THE POSITION
An opportunity exists for a suitably experienced Business Analyst to join The Perth Mint. This is a full time permanent position with primary responsibility for systems implementation and ongoing support for a range of applications used throughout
          the business. Working with business users and/or vendors, the role will define scope, elicit and define business requirements, write functional specifications, create test documentation, co-ordinate testing, manage the production of training
          materials to achieve successful implementation of new functionality, and provide BAU support following implementation.
Main Duties & Responsibilities 

Developing business requirements, process flow diagrams, functional specifications, test plans and test scripts.
Co-ordinating the implementation or enhancement of applications.
Identifying and evaluating inefficiencies and recommending optimal business practises, system functionality and behaviour.
Running test programs to ensure acceptable quality and integrity of systems.
Developing relevant training material and user documentation. 

Skills and Experience 
The successful candidate must be able to demonstrate the following skills and experience: 

Tertiary qualification within IT/Business or Financial studies and/or equivalent industry experience
Significant experience in business analysis with demonstrated experience in analysing customer and business system needs, and developing concise business and technical requirements.
Strong analytical, research and problem solving skills.
Excellent planning and organisational skills.
Experience conducting workshops for requirements gathering.
Strong oral and written communication skills with an emphasis on stakeholder engagement, vendor management and building relationships across all levels of the organisation.
Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
Prior experience working on manufacturing processes and / or with ERP applications is desirable. 

Applications 
Candidates must have the right to work in Australia, have a valid Western Australian driver’s licence and pass our national security check.
Application Deadline 
Applications close on Monday 4th February 2019 at 5.00pm. The Perth Mint reserves the right to close applications prior to this date.

We have a new opportunity for a Business Analyst - Business Intelligence to join our Business Finance team. Based in our Macquarie Park office, this is a 12 month maximum term contract.Day to day, your key responsibilities will include:
