          and to help the firm meet its clients' needs and statutory requirements.As a member of the Business finance team, whether you are in core finance, taxation, treasury or projects, you’ll play a critical role in the firm's success.
title: Business Analyst - Business Intelligence

company: CHARTERED ACCOUNTANTS  AUSTRALIA AND NEW  ZEALAND
templatetext:
We are a professional membership body supporting 120 000+ diverse, talented and financially astute members. We employ over 350 people in 14 locations across Australia, New Zealand, UK and Asia. When you join us, you have an opportunity to
          develop great skills & strong networks and do something different and fresh with your career.
This role will be reporting to the Senior Project Manager, Education Compliance. You will be working on a multi-faceted compliance project, elements of which include the development of processes and policies, implementation of risk mitigation
          strategies and controls, as well as assisting in data collection and preparation. You will be required to work alongside business subject matter experts, HR, ICT, Risk and Compliance and other project related stakeholders.
Your responsibility will include:

Project Documentation: Developing clear, concise and organised project documentation. This includes reviewing, revising, developing and implementing requisite business processes and standard operating procedures to include appropriate controls
            on risk per scope of the project.
Risk and Controls Management: Engage with relevant stakeholders to prioritise identified risks and develop, implement and embed appropriate preventative and detective controls for the business.
Stakeholder Management: Identifying and proactively engage with stakeholder groups to understand, challenge and document complex business processes.
Embedding change: Assist the project team with embedding change in the business by developing appropriate communications and training materials as required
Project Support: Provide support to the project team, including developing presentation materials, communications, data analysis, peer reviewing documentation and undertaking ad hoc tasks on an as required basis

To be successful in this role, you will have: 

5+ years in a Business Analyst role
Relevant tertiary qualification (or relevant experience)
Working on business process improvement initiatives including mapping ‘as is’ and ‘to be’ process maps using Promap or other process documentation tools (e.g.) Visio
Eliciting high-level requirements from business stakeholders and documenting in best practice templates to enable business analysis
Working independently with geographically dispersed stakeholders, in an ambiguous and dynamic environment
Working on collaboratively as part of a project team within Agile or Waterfall methodologies
Risk and Compliance and/or Education experience are a strong plus

What’s in it for you 
We offer a competitive salary and have a strong commitment to flexible work and meaningful career development. We also recognise the value of an inclusive and diverse work environment and encourage applications from diverse candidates.
 
Reference BATESQA2
title: Business Analyst

templatetext:
Our client is looking for a Junior / Mid level Business Analyst to join the team. The position will be responsible for supporting the delivery of infrastructure services, solutions and projects that support the business' objectives. 
Essential Job Functions: 

Assist with low to moderate complexity infrastructure projects leveraging both internal and external resources
Provide rapid response to infrastructure related customer service escalations and proactively drive resolution, and root cause analysis with the appropriate service provider
Assist with developing, communicating and executing test plans related to operating system, browser and other PC and server related refresh and upgrade activities
Monitor data storage utilisation and proactively identify upgrade opportunities
Assist with planning, testing, and implementing data storage projects, acting as technical liaison between the business and service providers
Create and update infrastructure related documents, process flows and instructions; Identify and champion process improvement opportunities

Requirements:

Broad understanding of PC, Server, Networking and Storage concepts 
Strong communication skills; both written and oral 
Ability to work well independently or as part of a team 
Ability to develop and execute project plans 
Ability to manage and coordinate multiple streams of work simultaneously and effectively resolve issues and conflicts to insure timely delivery
Willingness to learn new technologies & take on new assignments and projects to grow experience 
ITIL Certifications desirable 

 
 
 
 To be considered for the role click the 'Apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact George Davies on 02 94645955. Please quote our job reference number: 200184988.
title: Infrastructure Business Analyst

templatetext:
Three positions in total, with one role being for a Lead Developer!  Get on board this new project, where you will be developing and unit testing project deliverables.  You will be providing technical guidance to other members of the team
        and supporting junior developers as well.  Primarily this team will be required to:  

Develop and unit test PL/SQL packages as described in technical specifications and to agreed and adhered to standards.
Draft technical specifications based upon data models and other input from data modellers and data analysts.
Assist with packaging and migration of code for deployments.
Support System and User Acceptance Testing preparation and defect resolution.
Support the Dev Lead in supervision of other developers in the team.
Provide technical guidance to junior developers
Provide detailed documentation for ongoing support and maintenance
   Additionally, for the Dev Lead… 

Supervise the technical work performed by all developers in the team.
Act as first point of escalation of technical issues in team.
Assist the Project Manager in planning and task allocation within the team.
   What you will need in this role:

Strong experience as an Oracle developer with particular expertise in PL/SQL.
Experience in preparing technical specifications.
Extensive experience in data warehouse or related technology projects.
Familiar with agile project environments.
Additionally, for the Dev Lead…
Experience in acting as lead of a small development team or similar supervisory experience. 
 Apply today for immediate consideration.
title: Senior BI Developer PL/SQL x3

company: Talent – Winner ‘Seek Large Recruitment Agency of the Year’ 3 consecutive years!
templatetext:
Our client is a leading telco provider seeking assistance in their migration to AWS cloud services.Your new role will see you responsible for the reverse engineer existing data assets (databases, ETL workflows, SQL scripts, designs and business
        rules) for migration purposes to AWS. Other responsibilities will include building data acquisition and ingestion routines by using existing design patterns built in python/windows scripts, and writing, testing and validating SQL-based data transformation
        routines.Skills and Experience:
        
Understanding and experience as developer/ data modeller/ data / business / technical analyst with strong understanding of data and structures within source systems to performance data discovery, mapping, transformation and analysis
Experience in business intelligence tools to extract, transform, load data from source systems using any of the technical competencies like IBM Netezza, MS SQL, Oracle SQL, MY SQL etc
Understanding and experience working with cloud based technologies e.g. AWS
Familiarity and basic understanding of visualisation & data transformation tools like Tableau and Alteryx
Scripting in common languages such as Python, windows environment
Our client is offering an initial 6 month contract with the view to extension working in the CBD.For more information feel free to contact Ben Austin on (03) 9236 7718 for a confidential discussion.
title: Data Engineer

templatetext:
The position: An exciting opportunity has become available for a data manager to join our global pharmaceutical company based out of Macquarie Park. The department has implemented a large data project and is requiring an experienced
          professional to support and lead this process. You will work with a data analyst to complete this project in a timely and effective manner. 
Daily Responsibilities: • Liaise with 3rd party vendors both local and international to implement business rules to streamline sales data • Map customers and products to a single customer/product in the system • Validate
          sales data and format to be loaded to CRM system • Manage elements of master data for the department 
To ensure your success you must possess: • 2+ years in a similar role • Extremely high attention to detail • Advanced Excel skills and knowledge • Experience using Salesforce, Veeva or other CRM systems • Advanced
          database experience • Good oral and written communication skills • Stakeholder management experience • Ability to work autonomously as well as part of a small team
About our client: Our client is a leading Pharmaceutical company with around 50,000 employees work to further develop technologies that improve and enhance life - from biopharmaceutical therapies to treat cancer or multiple
          sclerosis, cutting-edge systems for scientific research and production, to liquid crystals for smartphones and LCD televisions. Our client provides innovative medicines, vaccines, biologic therapies and animal health products to help improve
          health and well-being.
Our client is wanting to get someone onboard ASAP so please click ‘APPLY NOW’ or email your interest to savannah.lee-hong@au.manpowergroup.com
title: Data Manager

templatetext:
Immerse yourself in an inclusive, diverse and supportive culture
Outstanding opportunity to work with a high performing iron ore business
Perth Based

Roy Hill represents the next generation of integrated iron ore mine, rail and port ­­­operations in the Pilbara region of Western Australia. Situated approximately 340 kilometres south east of Port Hedland, our world-class operation is the only
          independent iron ore business with West Australian majority ownership. With a defined mineralisation of more than 2.4 billion tonnes of high grade iron ore, enough to sustain a mine life of more than 20 years, Roy Hill is introducing a new wave
          of innovation, technology and knowledge to Australia’s iron ore industry.  ‘The Real Us’  Roy Hill’s Perth-based integrated Corporate Headquarters and Remote Operations Centre          (ROC) provides end to end integration of our operations, marketing and corporate services functions.  Our Engineering Services leadership team is now seeking an Analyst GIS to join the team. The primary aspect of this
          position is to provide GIS analytical support to the business where needed. This will include the production of appropriate maps and analysis to aid in the decision-making process for the operation.  The Analyst GIS will analyse and
          provide appropriate commentary on spatial matters that relate to the operation. This will extend to relevant business drivers to assist in the evaluation of alternative business options and facilitate decision making to ensure maximum value
          for the business.  The role will also be involved in mapping and processing of GIS information for the operation and training of internal GIS users.  Accountabilities will include: -

Provide GIS and spatial analysis support to personnel
Creating analytical data or information from any original or derived source
Data analysis, manipulation and visualisation of GIS data
Generate and prepare professional maps, plans, and figures for presentations, permit or approval applications within required timeframes
Assists the line manager in scheduling and prioritising multiple tasks and projects to meet tight deadlines
Management and replication of the corporate spatial SQL database
Analyses and manipulates data through the 3D Analyst and Spatial Analyst programs with the aim of providing information to key stakeholders that will assist with making key business decisions
Support the management and effectiveness of the highly specialized computer software, namely ArcGIS and Geocortex
Drive innovation through implementing workflows, systems and processes using ArcGIS model builder, FME and scripting (e.g. python) to automate repetitive tasks or reduce the time spent on tasks

‘The Real You’  For you to achieve outstanding results in this position, you will be an experienced GIS Analyst along with the following: -

Bachelor’s Degree in Cartography or GIS
Strong analysis and reporting skills
Solid understanding and proficiency in the use of ArcGIS, Geocortex and exposure to 3D analyst and spatial analyst
Excellent mapping and presentation skills
Sound knowledge of mining and government reporting requirements
Demonstrated experience with GPS technology, field data collection techniques and data integration into a GIS system
Exposure to FME and Python scripting

‘The Real Offer’  Our people are the driving force behind the growth of the business and our success. We are committed to attracting and retaining people who have the right mix of skills, knowledge, leadership and motivation
          to operate one of Australia’s largest and most innovative integrated iron ore mining, rail and port operations.  Roy Hill offers rewarding careers, generous benefits, and a unique opportunity to join a dynamic workplace where collaboration,
          innovation, agility and personal leadership empowers you to perform at your best.  Roy Hill is an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourages indigenous Australians and females to apply. We promote cultural diversity, gender equality and
          non- discrimination. To be eligible to apply for this role you must be legally permitted to work permanently in Australia.  Please note that unsolicited applications from recruitment agencies will not be accepted.
title: Analyst GIS | Perth Based

company: The Department of Finance, Services and Innovation
templatetext:
High profile government agency
Temporary role up to 12 months based in Sydney The Rocks.
Salary package up to $160,189 per annum
 
About us: 
 
We deliver property solutions and great places for the people of NSW.
Property NSW is focused on excellence in property, infrastructure and places. We deliver continuous improvement and innovation. Our approach is to collaborate with stakeholders to deliver government objectives for the community. We manage the
          State's significant property portfolio and its places, which results in better visitor experiences and services for the people of NSW.
 
Property NSW remains part of the Department of Finance, Services and Innovation. The ICT team proactively supports the business in the delivery of innovative, digitally enabled property services. In partnership with external service providers,
          ICT’s purpose is to deliver best ​practice ICT services and advice as trusted advocates​​ of information​​​ technology.
 
About you: 

You will have experience in leading an organisation through the process of establishing and maintaining an effective and compliant data governance methodology.
You will be able to engage internal stakeholders at all levels to communicate and guide   
You will be able to develop a practical and sustainable framework to ensure that Property NSW continues to manage its data sets provide analysis and technical support to internal and external stakeholders.
Extensive experience in business improvement and organisational change initiatives

Key accountabilities:

Work collaboratively with internal stakeholders in developing processes for efficient and secure management of data.
Provide analysis, advice on information systems, architecture and governance pertaining to data management and recommend improvements
Identify gaps in existing architecture, processes and documentation in conjunction with other architects and develop a plan to remediate
In conjunction with the project team develop an overall delivery plan that will drive how the framework is implemented 
Participate in projects to support the delivery of business objectives and compliance with effective data governance.
Working with operational teams help to identify and resolve data quality and management  issues to facilitate the use, consumption and presentation of operational data 

Challenges:


Embedding sustainable frameworks and governance processes into normal day to day operations
Working with large data sets from a broad range of sources, both internal and external, taking into considerations data privacy, availability. integrity and integration



The Position:

This position is part of a team structure (Business Systems and Architecture) that will implement, alongside key business staff, an overall data governance framework across the business. You will work with existing architecture staff and all facets
          of the business to complete the architecture of all data sets, held both internally and with external service providers. The work is part of a coordinated approach under project management. At times you will be expected to work autonomously
          but also within a project reporting structure to develop a roadmap and structure to deliver a working model that underpin the management, analysis and reporting of property data on behalf of whole of government.  The position will be supplemented
          by an additional resource, a Senior Business/Data Analyst.

Join us: This is a unique opportunity to deliver quality outcomes for government that positively impact NSW.
 
Learn more: Please review the Role Description and visit us at Department of Finance, Services & Innovation or Property NSW.  For enquiries regarding this role,
          please contact Bob Millevoi – Senior Manager Business Systems and Architecture on 02 8276 8331 or bob.millevoi@property.nsw.gov.au.

Salary: Grade 11/12. Salary package up to $160,189. Package includes a base salary ($124,965 – $144,521) and employer’s contribution to superannuation.
 
Closing Date: 6 February 2019 (11.59PM). If you are interested in this role please apply online and include (in a maximum of 5 pages) your resume and a covering letter which clearly details your capabilities and experience relevant
          to this position. As well answer the two targeted questions below. Applicants invited for interview will be required to complete additional assessments. There are no selection criteria to be addressed.
 
Targeted Questions:
 
1.    Explain why data governance is important in an organisation and the part that data architecture plays in this.
2.    Provide details on how you would go about implementing a data governance framework and methodology in an organisation that has undergone a number of mergers over recent years.
 
 
Job Status: Temporary role for up to 12 months under the Government Sector Employment Act 2013.
 
Apply now: at  iworkforNSW Should you encounter any technical problems, please contact Iwork for NSW support desk on 1800 562 679. For any questions about making
          your application, please contact DFSI Recruitment Team 02 9372 8121.  If you require any assistance with technology, visual/hearing aids or location access for the interview process, please indicate within your application or contact
          the DFSI Recruitment team.
 
Job reference: 00006PZB
  
The Department of Finance, Services and Innovation is an EEO employer and welcomes applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people from diverse cultures and people with a disability. At DFSI, we endeavour to make roles flexible. While these roles are advertised as full time, we will consider requests to undertake flexible work arrangements including on a part-time or job share

title: Data Architect

templatetext:
Does being a part of helping clients go through digital transformations and moving to the cloud excite you?   Do you have a passion for helping organizations on their journey to the cloud, to secure, improve, move and govern their data capital
          assets both on-premise and on the cloud?   Does cutting through short term ambiguity for longer term vision come as second nature to you?  
If you answered ‘Yes’ to all of these questions then this could be you! Oracle has transformed the enterprise software market with cloud computing and data driven innovation. We've launched business apps and platforms that are as easy to use and
          have a differentiated advantage in being able to offer an identical portfolio of infrastructure and platforms services for end-to-end data management both on-premise and on-the-cloud.
As a Cloud Platform  Sales Rep, you will demonstrate this value by helping our database install base customers move not just their database, but targeting all their workloads, both Oracle and non-Oracle to the cloud.
This person will be instrumental in increasing Cloud (PaaS and IaaS) bookings as well as Database license revenues. They will work closely with enterprise clients in selling them new services, as well as bringing in net new business in their territory.
Responsibilities:

Define strategies and act to generate long term and short term customer success and business results.
To exceed quarterly sales targets by selling Oracle PaaS/IaaS and On-Premise Database into named accounts and/or within an assigned geographical or vertical market.
Manage the entire sales process to ensure delivery against key performance metrics, with a strong emphasis on new business sales, while expanding existing accounts.
Territory identification and research, to formalize a go to market territory strategy and create qualified target account list within 30 days.
Pipeline development through a combination of cold calling, email campaigns and market sector knowledge/intelligence. Adequate pipeline to ensure over-achievement within the designated territory
Engage with prospect organizations to position the Oracle solution through value based selling, business case definition, ROI analysis, references and analyst data.
Manage the end to end sales process through engagement of appropriate resources such as Pre Sales Consultants, Business Development Consultants, Oracle Consulting, Executives and Partners etc., and through effective utilization of selling tools
            such as Engineered selling process (ESPs), Customer 360, etc.
Daily update of the Oracle Sales Cloud system with accurate customer and pipeline data.
Accurate monthly forecasting and revenue delivery.


Continuous improvement in self-research, learning and readiness on the new product offerings
Working closely with customer success managers ensuring the PaaS/IaaS customers are deriving value from their investments and ensure very high subscription renewal rates.

 
Skills required

Minimum of 5years, ideally of relevant experience in selling enterprise software solutions or services preferred
 Successful history of net direct new business sales, with the ability to prove consistent over achievement against targets.
Ability to build reciprocal relationships with different parts of the business, partners and customers and identifies synergies across LOBs and acts on opportunities to integrate business, with credibility at all levels, including Lines of Business
            and CxO.


Solid understanding of the IT industry Cloud landscape and market


Sales experience with a Cloud vendor would be beneficial
Competencies in building value proposition and positioning strong proposals.
Strong interpersonal skills with proven ability to communicate across all levels and effectively adapts to varied situations
Be creative with strong problem solving skills and the ability to adapt and succeed in a fast paced and ambiguous environment.

templatetext:
About the Role

Based on the Detailed Design, Data Migration Technical Specs and Functional Specs for each release, and with guidance from the Data Lead; develop data reconciliation plans and reconciliation reports for SIT,UAT, and cut-over.
Assist in the verification and enhancement of requirements produced through the detailed design process particularly from data migration perspective.
Develop comprehensive Business Reconciliation Plans, Reconciliation Reports using SQL queries based on relevant requirements with a strong focus on the business data reconciliation.
Raise defects as required and actively be involved in the defect management process.
Support and mentor junior data analysts on data reconciliation activities with focus on mappings which are not one-to-one.
Provide input to the development of overall data reconciliation processes and artefacts.
Facilitating the Business Data Reconciliation, including seeking endorsements for Business Data Reconciliation Plans, executing plans and reporting results and managing the business representatives.
Mandatory Skills and Competencies

A high level of understanding or experience of data migration staging and ETL processes
Demonstrated experience in a role requiring liaising with the business representatives/subject matter experts, understanding of business processes and developing source and target reconciliation reports to enable business to reconcile migrated
            data
3 to 5 years’ experience with performing Data Validations and Data Reconciliations.
Ability to understand and deconstruct complex data structures to determine a desired and efficient business focused outcome.
Experience in working on large scale ICT projects, in particular major business transformational change projects involving system development and integration of multiple commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) solutions
Experience in working on systems with multiple internal and external interfaces.
Experience working in Agile teams.
Demonstrated experience in developing and executing business data reconciliation plans and reconciliation summary reports.
Experience in working closely with business representatives and business analysts to seek clarity on requirements and define test scenarios.
Experience in conducting workshops with business and technical audience.
Ability to liaise and maintain a professional relationship with technical staff, internal customers, program teams and the vendor team
Enthusiastic problem solver with excellent written and oral communication skills.
A team player – able to function without close supervision and mentor less technical personnel constructively
Highly Desirable Skills and Competencies

Prior experience building and using SQL queries to source data for source and target reconciliation reports
Experience in using ALM and Microsoft Team Foundation Server or similar test management tools for test cases and defect management
Exposure to SAP migration projects
To apply, click the link and upload your current resume in Microsoft Word format only (.doc or .docx). If you would like to have a confidential discussion, please contact Pooja Deshmukh on 07 3023 1078,
        quoting ref no. JO-1901-93270. Want to know more about Davidson? Visit us at www.davidsonwp.com

          performing a wide range of tasks to help better service delivery and provide detailed insights to stakeholders. Key Responsibilities: - Data cleansing, data transformation and data analysis- Building
          and maintaining performance dashboards in Tableau, ensuring the accuracy of the data outputs - Preparing documentation for both internal and external stakeholders to aid with decision making Essential skills required: -

templatetext:
Our client is seeking to fill the role of an experienced System Analyst, where they will consult technical stakeholders, gather functional and non-functional requirements, create and/or update high level and detailed design documents, and provide
          support to developers and testers throughout all stages of the SDLC. It requires working closely with two small teams supporting IODL and its web application layer, along with a Project Manager coordinating the work.  
Skills and experience:• Provide expert advice and analysis support for IT systems and/or process design and use technical expertise to contribute to the development of the companies IT strategic direction • Identify
          problems and assess their significance in the development of mid-range applications, tools and process automation that support the achievement of business outcomes • Consult and share information with clients, technical staff, management
          and others; share own expertise, guide and mentor less experienced employees and work collaboratively to achieve business outcomes • Recognise and seek to resolve issues impacting on database designs, application and database performance
          and make recommendations for solutions that meet operational needs and deliver on improvements • Lead the investigation of systems resource usage in various environments using performance testing and tuning methodologies, and apply
          audit and forecasting methodologies to the analysis to ensure minimal impact on business operations • Think about the future and consider the long term implications of application problems and take action within agreed time-frames and
          quality requirements • Liaise with internal and external stakeholders to analyse and understand system requirements and leverage expertise to solve complex problems • Lead user research activities, including testing phases
          to support quality assurance measures for the solution design • Understand and operate within the companies corporate project management and governance policies when undertaking project work in the identification and development of
          ideas to improve systems and/or processes • Manage a range of systems performance enhancements through the companies change process and be responsible for meeting service level targets • Documenting non-functional requirements
          for integrating Commercial Off The Shelf products with enterprise systems • Demonstrated experience working as part of an agile team is highly desirable. 
Candidates must have a baseline clearance to apply for this role. 
Job closes by COB 4th February.
Please call Fiona on 1300 WHIZDOM or email if you have any questions.

templatetext:
We’re a business in transition as we integrate two global companies, giving you unique exposure and challenges. This is an exciting opportunity to be highly involved in the migration of all brand websites to the global SFCC platform, as well as provide support and assistance in the legacy systems until migration completion. 
 
The Challenge
As the eCommerce Systems Analyst, you will be responsible for day to day operational support of the eCommerce websites for the APAC region including integrations to other systems. You will also work as part of a global team on the ongoing development
          and enhancement of the eCommerce systems and integrations, as well as Omnichannel initiatives and projects. You’ll provide a customer service function to a unique and dynamic business, so your interpersonal skills and ability to manage changing
          priorities will be key to your success.
 
The Reward
This is a business like no other. We’re a family of industry-leading brands, we wear the product to work, we work hard but take the time out to celebrate our success as a team. As a customer service function to the business the hard work you put
          in is truly appreciated. In a dynamic business environment you’ll be challenged and never bored!
 
Who are we looking for?
To be successful in this role you will have:

Previous experience in an eCommerce business analyst or systems support role is essential
Excellent knowledge of Ecommerce flows and ecosystem (POS,ERP,WMS)
Experience working with Demandware/Salesforce Commerce Cloud or similar is essential
Bachelor’s degree in computer science/information systems is beneficial
An understanding of business transformations, integrations and software development process
Must have the ability to work on multiple high visibility projects in parallel
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent Communication Skills
High levels of initiative, enthusiasm and an ability to share your knowledge to develop the technical skills of the team

This position will require some work outside of normal office hours and infrequent travel both nationally and internationally.
 
Apply today!
Send us your application today to find out more!
Thank you for your interest in working with us. Whilst we would love the chance to speak to every applicant unfortunately that's not always possible. If you have been selected for an interview you will hear back from us within 3 weeks. Good luck!

          a casual lifestyle for young‐minded people who are inspired by a passion for outdoor action sports. The Company’s Quiksilver, Billabong, Roxy, DC Shoes, RVCA, Element, VonZipper, Xcel, Kustom and Palmers brands have authentic roots and heritage
          in surf, snow and skate.

templatetext:
Wanted: A Driven Senior Information Analyst!
At Landgate, we’ll help you fulfil your career aspirations. We have a real appreciation of your energy, enthusiasm and willingness to make a difference.
We are on the lookout for data centric, technically skilled individual to join the Open Data Team within SPUR, to work with us to deliver the Data WA strategy. You will own a project from inception to delivery, take the lead to research and
            implement solutions. Your ability to collaborate will be highly valued as you work with the team, our stakeholders, users, software engineers and data analysts to enhance and build real, new technology solutions for our stakeholders across
            government and industry.
You will have exceptional people skills to build strong working relationships with our government stakeholders to identify and source data that is of value for business growth. We are focused on real outcomes for people using data and technology
            and you will need to have an interest in this area, so what you waiting for?
For more insight on the services we deliver, check out data.wa.gov.auand spur.wa.gov.au
You will be offered an initial 6-month opportunity, with the possibility of an extension.
To discuss the role, call Jenny Smith – Manager Analytics, on 0415 943 975 or email jenny.smith@landgate.wa.gov.au. Please don’t send your application here.
So, tell us, do you have what it takes? 

We are looking for people who not only have the technical expertise and interest required for the role but also create positive relationships with everyone they meet. You will need to show us the below to be successful:

Proven ability to work collaboratively through building productive relationships and developing strong networks with diverse stakeholders
Manage the timely delivery of discrete projects that involve coordination, multi stakeholder issues, data and service delivery using a flexible and adaptive approach
A lover of technical information with the expertise to back it up - think data sharing, metadata, standards, data management and processes
Extensive experience with data and data utilisation for example geospatial data and software, web mapping, data analysis, data integration and interoperability
Thorough understanding of digital developments and programming trends – like system architecture, cloud services, APIs, Python, FME, JavaScript, CKAN, and web languages.

There’s no JDF attached so use the information above to guide your application.
Our values are vitally important to how we do our business - you will need to be able to demonstrate you are the right cultural fit for our business. Check out our website,
            where you will find out more about Landgate, including our Values, and what we can offer you.
Does this sound like you (or who you want to be)?
Click Apply now below and you will be taken to JobsWA to complete your application
The recommended applicant will be required to provide a current National Police Clearance prior to offer of appointment that is less than six months old. It is the responsibility of the applicant to incur all costs associated with a Police Clearance.

templatetext:
Toyota Financial Services is the country's largest automotive financier. With over 30 years’ experience in the Australian market, an extensive network of regional offices and as a leader within the worldwide business group, we pride ourselves in
        understanding and listening to our guests.    We're well known in households and trusted by Australians and businesses to look after their financial needs, supporting them with vehicle finance and insurance, warranty solutions,
        fleet management services, commercial hire purchase and wholesale purchase.    Our unique culture, work approach and business practices make Toyota a successful, global company. We are about more than vehicles and vehicle finance
        – we are about achieving success in business the ‘right way’ through The Toyota Way philosophy, while continuing to support people and their communities.  Our commitment to Continuous Improvement and Respect for People mean
        our people support each other’s development and success to deliver our global vision of mobility for all.     The purpose of this role is to be responsible for managing all aspects of the Operational Reports for all teams
        reporting outputs and functions within agreed timelines and to a high quality. Your usual day in the office will include:

Overall responsibility for producing detailed dashboard reporting relating to productivity, adherence and key performance indicators for Operations Team
Analyse reports and provide insights and executive summary to Centre Management team including recommendations for Kaizen (process improvement) opportunities
Continually create new reports or adapt current reports to ensure appropriate metrics are being tracked and evaluated
Responsible for the analysis of all existing Operations data to determine suitability to meet business needs and provide recommendations to the management team on areas for improvement
Direct management of Workforce Planning team
Develop Workforce Planning capability.  Make recommendations to optimise operations
Confidently articulate and present reports to management team and members of the Senior Executive Team (SET)
Evaluate existing; or create new, technical solution designs to meet the ever-changing business/functional requirements
Build technical reporting processes that will enable the delivery of Operational reporting requirements into a consolidated format suitable for key stakeholders
Strong stakeholder management and focus to ensure alignment and consensus amongst working group
 You'll be successful in the role if you have:

5 years or more performing Data Analyst roles (Essential)
Tertiary qualifications in Business / Mathematics or similar discipline (Essential) 
Minimum 3 years experience working with BI Portal (preferably Power BI) (Essential)
Advanced technical skillset to support:

Interrogation of data using MS Access, SAS, SQL and Excel (Essential)

Strong analytical and problem solving skills (Essential)
Excellent communication skills from interpersonal and report writing to workshop facilitation (Essential)
Excellent MS Office Suite skills; in particular Excel and PowerPoint (Essential)
Ability to gather, analyse, and document requirements to meet the needs of the business and technical teams (Essential)
Ability to work with a variety of personality types and recognise issue urgency and need (Essential)
A professional approach and a willingness to work in a high performing team that values openness and transparency (Essential)
 At Toyota Financial Services we value the contribution you’ll deliver to our business; you’ll be offered a range of great benefits such as the MY-CAR suite of benefits to ensure you can drive a new Toyota for less, financial support for relevant
        study and support joining professional associations and networks, work-life balance initiatives including paid parental leave, health and wellness initiatives and a variety of offers and discounts from our partner networks. If you’re successful,
        you’ll undergo background verification checks before you start employment with us. If you’re keen to join an organisation that recognises the value you add to our business and this is the role you've been looking for, we'd love to hear
        from you.

templatetext:
$50k - 65K BASE + SUPER | GREAT OPPORTUNITY FOR PROGRESSION
GLOBAL BUSINESS AT THE FOREFRONT OF THEIR INDUSTRY
STRONG LEADERSHIP TEAM TO MENTOR YOU TOWARDS PERSONAL AND PROFESSIONAL GOALS
 
Company  This Business is one of Australia’s leading providers of total waste management solutions to all markets. They provide a complete solution for all forms environmental services, as well as construction, commercial,
          liquid and hazardous waste, as well as many other general waste management and eco-friendly services. They service the complete spectrum of sectors, including construction and commercial markets and through their sheer size and market presence
          they hold a formidable and very envious market share over their competitors.
The company truly exudes the true meaning of having a dynamic culture, all staff enjoy working for a company that creates first class working environments, where all employees genuinely feel part of a winning team.
Position  Due to a promotion within the team, the position of Sales Coordinator/ Business Analyst has now become available operating out of South East Melbourne office. The position will be primarily focussed on two main
          objections, explained below:

This role will act as the direct support to the Major Account Managers in the following capacity
            
Coordinating with account managers in the development and delivery of sales proposals and tenders
Generating proposals and tenders for new clients
Analysing customer data in order to provide Account Managers with meaningful recommendations
Generate reports to be supplied to internal teams


This role will also take on a data/ business analyst role providing the following contribution:
            
Compile and export raw data from client collections and historical databases
Export and analyse data in order to provide meaningful recommendations to Key Account Managers that will increase efficiency, cost effectiveness and overall service offering to clients.
Use your advanced Excel skills in order to produce reports specifically orientated towards major clients and their expenditure vs service provided



In addition to this and based on individual candidates background, additional responsibilities such as marketing, events coordination and internal sales are also a possibility.
 Candidate  In order to be considered for the position it is essential for all candidates to display an advanced understand of Excel and an ability to analytically interpret data. A tertiary education or degree in
          Business, Finance, Marketing or a related field, although not necessary would be beneficial. Prior roles in sales support or coordination with a focus on reporting would also be considered. The individual will be playing an intermediator between
          multiple internal stakeholders so, above all you must have a love for being part of a cohesive, dynamic and open team!
This great opportunity will be reserved for a dynamic professional looking to join the best in the market.  If you have the above criteria apply below, or phone Oliver on (07) 3172 1275 for more Information.

templatetext:
Opportunity to join as a TSA Specialist Developer with one of our major Telco Clients based in Melbourne CBD. This is technical role that supports the analysis, design and developments of data sources and data work flows to deliver operational data
        capability for NEO.This position is responsible for the development, implementation and maintenance of data pipelines and data models, including migration of existing datasets to new architectures.Key responsibilities include:
        
Executing on the development of data engineering work flows in line with agreed development, implementation and maintenance of data pipelines and data models, including migration of existing datasets to new architectures.
Taking ownership for streams of work (EPICs, Stories and Tasks) to rationalise complex data workflows into common, strategic data patterns.
Developing technical solution including data model design, understanding requirements, data workflow and system data mapping for operational performance data.
Taking ownership for enhancements, initiatives or technical improvements including scoping, data discovery, prototyping solutions, testing, data reconciliation and acceptance of final output by stakeholders.
Contributing the team's technical capability improvements and scalability providing expert knowledge of source system data, fields and calculations applicable.
The ideal candidate will have:
        
Extensive experience in Telecommunications or similar experience in large infrastructure systems.
Understanding and experience as developer, data modeller, data modeller, data / business / technical analyst with strong understanding of data and structures within source systems to performance data discovery, mapping, transformation and analysis.
Experience in business intelligence tools to extract, transform, load data from source systems using any of the technical competencies like IBM Netezza, MS SQL, Oracle SQL, MY SQL.
Basic understanding of visualisation and data transformation tools like Tableau and Alteryx.
Advanced SQL and data analysis skills
Experience in scripting in common languages such as Python, windows environment.
ContactPrachi Nawathey03 83999949
title: Application Developer

templatetext:
Company Profile:
BizCover is Australia number one Online Insurance Business.  Our aim is to give Small Businesses a fair go when buying their insurance by providing them with clear and competitive pricing.  As well as cutting out the complicated Insurance
          jargon.  Whilst we have been established for over ten years, we are still very much in start up mode and are constantly looking at new ways to improve our current business offering.
 
Reasons to Work with Us:
We are a Fintech Business that is constantly evolving and improving what we do.  We are established but not stagnant, so we offer all the fun of working for a start-up, without the risk.  Our Online Technology is an obvious factor as
          well.  Plus, you get to work with an incredible set of teammates – we are a truly diverse and global team.
 
What the role entails:
The key purpose of this role is to ensure there is data integrity so that the general ledger is reconciled with bank.
You will be involved in extensive data cleaning and data manipulation on SQL platform on daily basis.
It is essential that you have an accounting background, be fully capable of understanding how a general ledger works as well as having SQL knowledge and experience.
At all times you must be willing to roll up your sleeves to assist with any ad hoc queries that come your way.

Reviewing existing processes, make recommendations for improvement, document new processes, obtain buy-in from stakeholders and implement change successfully
Key resource in the design, development and implementation of reconciliation platform through the use of MS SQL databases and processes
Resolve any technical issues and test system changes that may need to be implemented across the organisation
Document detailed functional and technical requirements for successful implementation of any new solutions
Assist and manage ad hoc accounting functions including the monthly trust reconciliation process, accounts receivable and accounts payable and management reporting
Analysing, understanding, documenting and implementing solutions to integrate data to finance systems
Managing and working with the various teams to deliver solutions for integration of data to existing finance systems
Working with local finance teams on test scripts, testing and acceptance criteria
Drive process and system improvement across the group
Develop controls on master data to strengthen and optimise business analytics
Be the interface between Finance and IT department
Develop and improve financial modelling for fit for purpose reporting

 
What Experience or Skills you Need for this Position
Required

A minimum of 1-2 years commercial experience
Finance/IT experience/background
Experience in a Systems Accountant/Analyst or similar type role
Strong interpersonal and English communication skills – written and verbal
Eligibility to work full time in Australia
A Bachelor's degree in Accounting and or Technology or other relevant degree
Data cleaning and data manipulation know-how is essential
Knowledge of and experience with SQL Management Studio or similar relational database software
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills
Persistence and strong analytical and problem-solving skills 
A high attention to detail and ability to see the 'big picture'
Confidence to be pro-active and tackle challenges as they arise
Ability to multi task and use initiative
Have a positive attitude and exemplary work ethic
Strong organizational and time management skills
A high level of integrity and reliability
Accounting qualification or studying toward one is beneficial

 
What Kind of Person Works Well in our Business. 
Diversity of employees makes for a creative and fun workplace.  BizCover is a melting pot of cultures and personalities, but to constantly strive to be the best we can, we look for people who are -

Customer Fanatics – at the heart of everything we do the customer should come first
Do what we say we are going to do – Strategy is important, but execution is everything

If you would like to have a confidential chat about this opportunity, then please email shelleys@bizcover.com.au 
Thanks in advance for taking the time to apply and my apologies, only successful candidates will be contacted
Please no recruiters
title: Junior Data Systems Analyst

templatetext:
6+6 Month Contract 
Obtain your Baseline Security Clearance
Sydney or Canberra Office Location

Our client, a large, Federal Government Organisation, is Seeking the experience of a Technical Business Analyst for a 6 + 6 month contract, located in Canberra or Sydney CBD.
Working as part of a team of designers, developers and delivery managers, the primary duties of the Technical Business Analyst will be to conduct various research and data analysis tasks in the aims to establish
            the correct processes to design, develop and deliver world class government digital services services through an Agile methodology framework (including business analysis, performance, continuous integration, delivery). 
            You will then monitor and report on the progress using statistical products to communicate its performance to product users and key stakeholders.
To be considered for this Technical Business Analyst contract opportunity you must have:

A Baseline Security Clearance or the ability to obtain one (Australian Citizenship Mandatory);
A minimum of 5 years experience as a Business Analyst/Data Analyst or similar experience in technical operations management or related field;
Proven ability to engage effectively with stakeholders of both technical and non- technical backgrounds to develop shared solutions and providing advice to team members in their engagement responsibilities;
Extensive experience in managing product usage and leading the development of processes and business rules;
Proven ability to track and report on product performance and to communicate performance to product users and stakeholders.

To apply for this Technical Business Analyst contract opportunity please forward your resume to Ben Cousins at The Recruitment Hive by clicking the Apply for this Job button, or email your resume to Info at RecruitmentHive.com.au citing
            Job ID: 2660.  Alternatively you may call Ben on (02) 6299 1006.

title: Reporting Analyst

templatetext:
About the business
Open Universities Australia (OUA) is Australia's leading online education company. Owned by seven Australian public universities, OUA has been in existence since 1993.
OUA is transforming its business model from being an online reseller of higher education subjects and programs of university providers, to be the operator of a multi-sided platform in a digital marketplace. This role will enable an improved customer
          experience.
 
 
About the role
Are you passionate about education? Are you inspired by the idea of helping people to change their lives and those of their families and communities? Then we would like to hear from you. 
We are looking for a Content Strategist to develop, champion and execute the content strategy for a growing digital marketplace. Reporting to the Product Enablement Manager, this role operates in a newly-formed cross-functional team of content, UX and analytics experts that consult with product teams. Your influence stretches across the business, guiding cross-functional development teams in creating a seamless user experience.
The role will set digital content standards and success measures across the business, and act as a consultant on Sitecore CMS and content production. You'll develop plans for content testing, optimisation and personalisation. You'll run constant multivariate tests in Sitecore to test the effectiveness of content, design and functionality. You'll propose, prioritise and test new Sitecore CMS features to support your content strategy and the goals of the business.
You'll be responsible for OUA's content strategy, providing consultation to the business, and setting plans for delivery. You have oversight of information architecture and navigation of the website. You'll set standards for the style, structure and life cycle of digital content. You'll plan metadata, tagging and modularisation of content for omnichannel re-use. You'll own the digital style guide and mentor content authors in effective use of it and Sitecore CMS. You'll scope, estimate and schedule content production for product teams. 
Your work will be strategic, but also hands-on. You'll pair with data analysts, developers and UX designers to craft clever solutions to user problems. You'll write ad hoc copy and work directly in Sitecore CMS to update our live website. 
You'll lead a community of practice, actively contributing to the content strategy practice, sharing your knowledge and learning from others.
 
 
Benefits and perks
What is in it for you?
We are in an exciting phase of making OUA the most preferred destination for online study which makes working at OUA very exciting and fast paced. The Content Specialist plays a pivotal role is shaping our customer's experience.
We also provide Study Assistance through our provider universities, Employee Assistance Program, discounted health clubs and other benefits in addition to working in an innovative new office space and fantastic company values. 
 
 
Skills and experience
At OUA our values are at the heart of everything that we do. We act for our customers, take care of each other and we work to continuously improve.
We are looking for individuals who are committed to achieving results, able to work in an agile and changing environment, deliver service excellence, able to communicate openly and honestly and work effectively within a team.
Qualifications, practical and technical knowledge and experience and personal attributes that are required to be successful in this role:

5+ years' experience web content production, management and/or strategy.
Deep understanding and demonstrable experience of content strategy.
Experience in developing website taxonomy and information architecture.
Understanding of the role content plays in UX/UI. Experience in content design, working with designers and content prototyping.
Understanding of content testing, optimisation and personalisation techniques. Direct experience desirable.
Experience optimising websites for Search Engine Optimisation (SEO) to improve organic traffic.


Experience working with a Content Management System (CMS). Experience with Sitecore is highly desirable.
Excellent writing and editing skills for a variety of digital formats. A portfolio or examples of work will be required.
Outstanding collaboration skills, with the ability to devise innovative solutions to complex issues.
Experience working in Agile environments is desirable.
A graduate or postgraduate qualification in writing, communications, marketing, media or other relevant discipline.

Candidates need to hold working rights in order to apply.
Please note that we are not accepting third party applications currently.
title: Content Strategist

templatetext:
Wanted: A Driven Senior Information Analyst!
At Landgate, we’ll help you fulfil your career aspirations. We have a real appreciation of your energy, enthusiasm and willingness to make a difference.
We are on the lookout for data centric, technically skilled individual to join the Open Data Team within SPUR, to work with us to deliver the Data WA strategy. You will own a project from inception to delivery, take the lead to research and
            implement solutions. Your ability to collaborate will be highly valued as you work with the team, our stakeholders, users, software engineers and data analysts to enhance and build real, new technology solutions for our stakeholders across
            government and industry.
You will have exceptional people skills to build strong working relationships with our government stakeholders to identify and source data that is of value for business growth. We are focused on real outcomes for people using data and technology
            and you will need to have an interest in this area, so what you waiting for?
For more insight on the services we deliver, check out data.wa.gov.auand spur.wa.gov.au
You will be offered an initial 6-month opportunity, with the possibility of an extension.
To discuss the role, call Jenny Smith – Manager Analytics, on 0415 943 975 or email jenny.smith@landgate.wa.gov.au. Please don’t send your application here.
So, tell us, do you have what it takes? 

We are looking for people who not only have the technical expertise and interest required for the role but also create positive relationships with everyone they meet. You will need to show us the below to be successful:

Proven ability to work collaboratively through building productive relationships and developing strong networks with diverse stakeholders
Manage the timely delivery of discrete projects that involve coordination, multi stakeholder issues, data and service delivery using a flexible and adaptive approach
A lover of technical information with the expertise to back it up - think data sharing, metadata, standards, data management and processes
Extensive experience with data and data utilisation for example geospatial data and software, web mapping, data analysis, data integration and interoperability
Thorough understanding of digital developments and programming trends – like system architecture, cloud services, APIs, Python, FME, JavaScript, CKAN, and web languages.

There’s no JDF attached so use the information above to guide your application.
Our values are vitally important to how we do our business - you will need to be able to demonstrate you are the right cultural fit for our business. Check out our website,
            where you will find out more about Landgate, including our Values, and what we can offer you.
Does this sound like you (or who you want to be)?
Click Apply now below and you will be taken to JobsWA to complete your application
The recommended applicant will be required to provide a current National Police Clearance prior to offer of appointment that is less than six months old. It is the responsibility of the applicant to incur all costs associated with a Police Clearance.
title: Senior Information Analyst

templatetext:
6-month fixed term contract
Lead and manage a team of data analysts
Support the delivery of cleansed and analysed payroll data

 
 
About You
You are a process and detail driven creative thinker with exceptional communication, leadership and engagement skills. You are a SAP expert, with strong experience using data analysis to ensure improved state of data, resulting in an enhanced
          business process outcome. You are a respectful and professional person who demonstrates exceptional moral values in everything you do. 
 
About the Role
Reporting to the Workforce Management (WFM) Program Director, you will manage a team of data analysts supporting the delivery of cleansed and analysed data for the WFM Project, and focusing on the delivery of the end to end data cleanse process.
          You will lead the team in their provision of data governance and documentation, management reporting, remediation and insights and data integrity. You will develop robust, sustainable solutions to support ongoing best practice.
 
To be successful in this role, you will have:

The highest levels of personal integrity and ethical behaviour
Experience managing a team of data analysts
Significant experience in using SAP
SQL data mining expertise and experience
High level confidence in the use of Excel for data analysis

 
This is a position of trust and responsibility and to support this we will conduct a thorough probity assessment as an essential selection component for this role.
 
 
About Us
Within our Group Corporate teams, we collaborate and support the operational arms of Serco’s Asia Pacific division. We problem solve and innovate across a range of disciplines including Corporate Affairs, Finance, Information Technology, Legal,
          Sales and Bids.
 
At Serco, you’ll be part of a team of more than 50,000 people delivering essential services on behalf of governments and organisations around the world. We apply world's best practice, insights and technology across six key sectors: Citizen Services,
          Defence, Healthcare, Immigration, Justice and Transport. But no matter your role or where you’re based, we each share the same goal – to bring service to life to make a positive difference every day. To learn more please visit www.serco.com/aspac
 
Join Us
If you are inspired to make a positive difference and would like to be considered for this opportunity, please submit your cover letter and resume by clicking the 'Apply Now' button.
 
Serco values of Trust, Care, Innovation and Pride underpin everything we do.  We are curious, creative and collaborative. Our people help in ways that matter.
 
We are committed to diversity and we encourage people from different backgrounds including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, culturally and linguistically diverse and people with disabilities to apply.
title: Data Manager - Workforce Management

templatetext:
Fixed term opportunity until Dec 2020 for an experienced Information Architect to join our evolving team at Seqwater and help us shape the way we manage information to improve business performance.
Your new position
As Information Architect, you will create, maintain and develop key principles, methods, models and artefacts required for Information Architecture and ICT Strategy to enable the organisation to use data and analytics to improve business strategy,
          outcomes and decision making. You will capture and prioritise market and environmental trends, business strategies and objectives, and identify the business benefits of alternative strategies.
Reporting to Team Leader – Architecture and Security, you will develop standards and guiding principles necessary to define the business’ information assets, sources, structure, classification and associations, and govern the required evolution
          of systems and infrastructure to achieve predictable transition to the intended state.

Improve business performance by enhancing enterprise information models, solutions and capabilities, such as master data management, metadata management, analyst, content management, data integration, and related information management or information
            infrastructure components.
Partner with the business to maximize the value of information assets via their creation, access and use, through the rationalization of the information value chain.
Aid value creation through data exploitation and data-enabled strategies to achieve business outcomes through analytics, data and analytics governance, and enterprise information policy using the organisation’s data assets.
Enhance decision making by creating, managing and utilising business information models to provide future-state views of the information landscape for stakeholders at different levels of detail.
Assist in the management of information risk by creating and managing models that define of data classification and data zoning to support data security and protect Seqwater’s data assets.
Serve as a subject matter expert for architectural and ICT strategic frameworks, methods and tools. Act as coach to advise and assist consultants, analysts, technical specialists and architects in architecture disciplines.
Manage vendors, contractors or Seqwater resource to deliver packages of work as required.

This position is based at Ipswich head office however, Seqwater encourages flexible working options, this may be from our Brisbane office or some work from home may be an option for the suitable candidate.
 
About you
To see you succeed in this values-led organisation you will be a seasoned Enterprise Architect with niche skills and demonstrated experience in Information Architecture, as well as the following:

Tertiary qualification in computer science, information and systems management or business discipline is highly desirable.
Industry recognised qualifications and accreditations e.g. TOGAF qualifications
Demonstration of continued learning.
Demonstrable deep understanding of information architecture with an ability to undertake and perform complex analysis and process improvement tasks over the information architecture domain.
In-depth experience of stakeholder engagement leading to the design and implementation of information aware solutions.
Hands-on experience with implementing data and analytics management programs is preferred, with experience as a data analyst.
Experience with industry standard information models.
Experience with tools such as iServer or other information modeling tools and notations.

 
What’s great about Seqwater
We are committed to providing our people a dynamic work environment with a range of benefits including:

Competitive remuneration and benefits including up to 12.75% superannuation
Diversity of jobs and career progression opportunities
A team orientated work environment
A range of Health & Wellbeing services and initiatives for staff
Flexible working arrangements
Free parking close to our Ipswich head office 

 
To submit your application
Submit your cover letter and CV via the Apply button.
Applications close: Wednesday 6th February 2019 at 9am
 
For further information please contact Jess Barker on 0428 422 590
Integrity, respect, care and courage are at the heart of the way we work and interact with our colleagues, stakeholders, customers and the communities every day.
‘We are a safe, inclusive workplace that supports diversity and opportunity.  We invest in our people and empower them to make decisions and challenge the status quo’
 
For a list of all current vacancies (including position descriptions) visit careers.seqwater.com.

templatetext:
This is a great opportunity for someone with outgoing personality and technology background to join a growing IT solutions business in Parramatta. They are looking for a Service Delivery / Sales Consultant        to provide and improve customer experience and profitable revenue stream by leveraging sales from existing and new clients.As a Sales Consultant, you will be identifying sales opportunities        by analysts system data, winning and converting leads, into a manage pipeline and deliver accurate forecasts using HubSpot CRM.You will be responsible for preparation of quotes, proposals, and bids/ tenders,
        providing sales orders and end-to-end client management until delivery, providing process renewals of software licenses and hardware maintenance contracts, updating quoting/sales system with new products and services
        SKU’s and associated descriptions. You will also be responsible for planning, organising and implementing the process and systems for the sales division (CRM, etc) including the development of the sales pipeline/funnel.In
        this role, you will meet clients alongside a service delivery manager to engage opportunities and ensure that all requests are actioned and resolved efficiently.  You will be working closely with Managing director and provide monthly sales update and forecast reports.
          Skills and expertise required:

Minimum of 2 years’ experience working in a sales or business development type role.
Experience or knowledge within Technology, Support or Engineering
Knowledge of various technologies and sales methodologies.
Experience in sales processes and documentation
Driver’s license required (onsite parking provided).
   This is a permanent opportunity.If this sounds interesting, please click APPLY
title: Service Delivery/Sales Consultant

templatetext:
About the Company
Credit Corp is Australia's largest provider of sustainable financial services to the credit impaired consumer segment. We’re are an ASX200 listed company with over 1500 staff in multiple locations in Australia, USA and Philippines. We work closely
          with regulators to provide sustainable financial solutions with the objective of improving our customers’ circumstances as a pathway to mainstream financial inclusion.
The Role and the Team
The Workflow management team is a core business function that is instrumental in looking at the institutional debt we purchase and manage large datasets. Reporting directly to the workflow manager, you will be  cleansing and controlling customer
          data and providing relevant insights to key stakeholders. In addition your day to day tasks and responsibilities will include but not limited to;

Manage receipt and loading of data files
Creation of new action flows
Provide export files for all data washes and review and import results
Seek, obtain, monitor and analyse feedback from users to improve systems, processes and reporting.
Enhance & maintain data management processes that support workflow processes

 
In order to be successful in this role you will be:

Tertiary qualified in either finance, engineering or technology related disciplines
Having an IT background would be advantageous
Experience with database management and manipulation
Have exceptional attention to detail
Be able to work in a fast paced changing environment
Intermediate SQL or SAS skills

Working in a fairly flat management structure you will get the opportunity to work with senior stakeholders and make an impact with the work you will be doing. If you’re looking for an opportunity to work for a financial service organisation which
          offers growth and development and has a great culture, then this is the role for you.
Even though technical skills are important in this role, we value an individual with the right attitude and behaviours who is happy to take on any challenge and open to feedback and coaching.
To apply for this opportunity, please submit your CV and Cover Letter by pressing apply.
title: Data Analyst

templatetext:
Primary Position Objectives
As a member of the Business Improvement & Organisational Excellence reporting to the GM Business Improvement this role is accountable for analysis and risk assessment of data to develop a variety of strategies for business improvement and
          operational excellence. These strategies are targeted at increasing gross profit margin across the business by identifies areas for improvement, executing an agreed project plan and implementing new practices. This position is up to a 12 month contract.
Functional Responsibilities:

Assist in the S&OP rollout and embedding agreed process into business norms
Support strategy development for each major product category
Assist with development of margin improvement strategies by sales channel
Analyse data to review effectiveness of business process and use this analysis to develop recommendations for business improvement & operational excellence
Ensure that the results expected from each business area are attained, related to revenue management, cost and time frames. Work in continuous improvement, solving problems of the organization by using PDCA method.
Lead a project plan to address improvement areas by working collaboratively with teams
Implement new practices to reduce cost and improve productivity
Work with cross functional teams to implement and validate appropriate analytics against identified performance measurement frameworks
Source, collect and extract data that is accurate and fit for purpose, working with stakeholders 

Skills/Competencies:

Preferred 5-7 years’ experience in a similar role in a multisite fast paced smallgoods manufacturing environment
Experience supporting an S&OP process
Strong analytical skills
Strong Communicator with excellent listening and interaction skills
Quality focus
Structured and logical methodology
Attention to detail and accuracy
Ability to work well under deadlines and pressure
The ability to prioritise tasks and be able to manage several projects and tasks simultaneously; and the ability to interface with all levels of management 
Business Practices and Ethics
Approachable and enthusiastic
Flexible and adaptable
Able to work on own initiative and as a team player
Good organisational skills with cultural awareness and sensitivity
Good judgment and problem solving ability & is capable of understanding the impact of decision making on the business

Interested?
APPLY HERE: www.jbssa.com.au/jobs
title: Business Improvement Analyst

Join us and thrive!

templatetext:
Careers That Change Lives 
 
Be a part of a company that thinks differently to solve problems, make progress, and deliver meaningful innovations.  Join our Operations team as a Logistics Analyst to monitor and analyse Warehouse and Transport processes. You will
          make change recommendations to ensure that our customers achieve the highest quality of service by ensuring an  open flow of orders throughout Medtronic’s distribution network.
 
A Day in the Life
The Logistics Analyst will provide monitoring, analysis, interpretation, and actioning of the day-to-day operational aspects of our Warehouse and Transport related processes. The Logistics Analyst will also look to identify opportunities and communicate
          recommendations that will increase operational productivity and efficiency ensuring an open / error free flow of orders throughout Medtronic’s distribution network.
 
Key responsibilities include:
 

Support the Medtronic Logistics Supervisor by providing direction, instruction, and guidance to the 3PL in executing logistics projects and process improvements
Assist in the coordination of warehouse activities, such as escalation, prioritisation, and any special requirements
Assist in coordination activities with Medtronic and 3PL monthly meetings.
Monitor KPI’s and SLA’s for all logistics service providers and ensure deviations are investigated and rectified.
Contribute to Transport and 3PL Spend optimisation.
Support transport and be the backup for the coordination of all the transfer and return of products in the field in line with Medtronic standard processes:
            
Booking and following up product returns and transfers
Managing and liaising with external and internal Customers in relation to product returns and transfers


Generate and provide monthly reporting related to warehouse processes
Act as an escalation between Medtronic and 3PL’s regarding system and process alignment
Monitoring and Resolution for: STO’s, iDocs, Order completion rate
Replenishment / load management, EoD reconciliation, 3PL order wave management, Issues log, Order issues management.
Provide additional support to Medtronic and 3PL supply chain operations as needed
Work effectively and efficiently within a complex matrix organisation, in an environment where priority changes can occur. Behave as an ambassador for Medtronic in general and ANZ Supply Chain specifically, according to ethical standards, Medtronic
            business code of conduct and Leadership Expectations
Be compliant with the Quality and Regulatory procedures, standard Medtronic policies, Environment Health Safety & Security guidelines
Document reporting processes and systems to comply with audit and regulatory requirements.
Additional duties upon request

Must Have:

Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Strong analytical skills.
An ability to lead process improvement initiatives and projects across functions and with external service providers.
The ability to work effectively in a global matrix organisation across geographic and functional boundaries.
A strong work ethic and an exceptional customer service focus
The ability to multi-task and manage complexity
A solution focused approach
The ability to work within a team or independently unsupervised
Self-awareness – Confident, resilient, persistent and self-motivated, yet flexible and comfortable with fast paced and changing environments
An energetic, outgoing and friendly and team-oriented approach
Good attention to detail
Commercial awareness
Effective organisational and time management skills
Experience in supply chain and customer service process
Demonstrated experience in SAP R3, APO, & BW (preferred)
Advanced MS Excel Skills
Experience in the Healthcare Industry (Preferable)
Proficient planning skills

 
About Medtronic 
 
Together, we can change healthcare worldwide.  At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life.  We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. 
          It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.
 
We can accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations – but we will only succeed with the right people on our team.  Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives.  Help us
          shape the future.
