templatetext:
The Organisation
Airservices is a government-owned organisation providing safe, secure, efficient and environmentally responsible air navigation and aviation rescue fire-fighting services to the aviation industry.
The Air Navigation Services (ANS) Group is responsible for Australia’s airspace management, aeronautical information, aviation communications, and radio navigation aids services.
Airservices has two major operating centres at Melbourne and Brisbane airports and a corporate office in Canberra. We operate 29 air traffic control towers at international and regional airports, and provide aviation rescue fire fighting services
          at 26 Australian airports.
The Role
The Portfolio Management Office Unit has responsibility for the development and governance of the ANS Portfolio Investment Plan and Portfolio Delivery Plan, as well as the implementation and adherence to the P3M Framework.  This includes
          the management of ANS investment demand and all associated governance.
Work with the Portfolio Investment Manager, to analyse and inform capital investment planning for Air Navigation Services. Collaborate with other service and business areas to inform the organisational investment activity.
Additionally, you will also contribute to the development and maintenance of key portfolio level documentation such as the Portfolio Investment Plan, Portfolio Delivery Plan and Portfolio Work Plan.
The Person
The role offers a high level of variety and requires a person who:

has a strong appreciation of the need to be responsive to stakeholder expectations, and is able to manage changing priorities and demands with professionalism and sensitivity.
has experience in portfolio investment analysis, within a government owned critical infrastructure service delivery organisation like Airservices.
has demonstrated ability to analyse complex information, distil into simple form and then present and communicate to a range of portfolio senior management, as required.

You will have demonstrated ability to identify and analyse key issues, recommend and where required, drive acceptable solutions.
You will have a high level of interpersonal and communications skills to establish, develop and maintain effective working relationships with staff in related stakeholder groups within Airservices.
Team Culture
You will be an integral part of the Portfolio Management Office which comprises a dynamic and multi-disciplined team providing a range of investment planning, governance & assurance, and reporting services for the ANS portfolio.  The
          environment we operate in is highly dynamic and we are currently on an improvement program to improve our support capability and adding value to the business.
Our diverse team are passionate about growth, innovation and collaboration and are committed to maintaining an inclusive workplace.  Collaboration, teamwork and customer focus are key themes that inspire the team to acquit their routine responsibilities
          and respond to emerging issues.
The successful applicant will have opportunities to expand their skillset and gain subject matter expertise across several domains.
Skills and Experience
The successful applicant will:

have business, commerce or finance qualifications, with complementary experience in asset and capital investment planning.
provide portfolio investment management analysis and support for the portfolio’s projects.
effectively work and perform in a complex and changing environment.
meet deadlines across a range of portfolio and corporate reporting requirements, while maintaining a high level of attention to detail.
demonstrate strong interpersonal skills with an ability to build rapport and confidence with stakeholders at all levels.
have well-developed writing & presentation skills, with an aptitude to analyse complex information, and distil into simple form.
have demonstrated Microsoft Office skills - Word, Excel, Powerpoint.
Understanding of the P3M methodology.

Diversity of experience across the private and public sectors is desirable.
Please see the link below to view the full Position Description:
 Portfolio Investment Demand Specialist_PD.pdf
Should you require any further information please contact Tom Wodzinski at thomas.wodzinski@airservicesaustralia.com or (02) 6268 4151.
How to Apply
To apply for this position please lodge an application online via the “apply link” attaching your resume and a cover letter outlining your skills and experience and how they relate to this role.
Applications close 11.55 pm (AEST) Sunday 10th February 2019.
Please refer to the security check requirements successful applicants will be required to undertake as part of the recruitment process.
Airservices values social and cultural diversity and is committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and the provision of a safe and healthy work environment. 
In the interests of safety, we test for alcohol and other drugs.

templatetext:
Working with the Enterprise Risk processes to ensure that agreed controls are working and action is taken to address any breakdowns or gaps
Working for AMP Working for AMP means being part of a company that values diverse thinking, encourages collaboration and promotes innovation. It’s an environment that offers challenging and exciting work as well as opportunities
          for professional growth. We’re flexible enough to allow you to make the most of your life, both professionally and personally.
We are looking for those that have the courage and agility to navigate changing and complex environments so that we can deliver the best solutions for our customers. We value people with integrity, an innate willingness to help others and an eagerness
          to perform to the best of their abilities.
We’re transforming our business, and we need people like you to join us on this journey.
Description of department/divisionThe Channel Performance & Growth team ‘s role is to grow and protect the value of the practices in our network, in service of our customers, advisers and shareholders. The Commercial Risk
          team’s main functions are:• Monitoring correct operation of controls in business processes relating to commercial agreements with practices, the transfer of customer registers, and payments to practices,• Commercial oversight on payments
          to practices by licensees as per our remuneration agreements and terms;• Investigations as required into breakdowns in these controls including “look back” reviews in support of regulatory or internal risk activities,• Exception management
          for commercial decisions under the Advice Delegations of Authority • Review, test and improve end-end process controls in formally agreed business processes,
Purpose of the roleEnsuring that agreed controls are working and that action is taken as per our Enterprise Risk processes to correct any breakdowns or gaps in controls. Investigations as required to quantify financial and
          consequential impacts of control breakdowns in support of corrective actions.The role includes formal reporting on operation of controls, identified risks and incidents and driving corrective actions as required by our policies, strategy
          and Risk Management framework;
Main focus areas• Delivery of allocated monitoring programs, control testing and improvement projects for identified risks including:o contracted commercial requirements (e.g. payments, conditions);o transfers of registers
          (e.g. ongoing fee and service arrangements);o the structure of and payments to our unadvised client pools;o GST registrations of practices;o Automated and manual remuneration payments to practices;o Exception approval conditions;o
          BOLR and related termination payments.
• Investigations as required into the impact of control breakdowns on payments to practices, register transfers or commercial agreements;• Working with line managers to ensure corrections have been made to defective controls;• Reporting
          and participation as required for Governance and other Risk Management forums on commercial risks including AFRCC.
Role specific capabilities• Business process design, review and assessment including control design and testing;• Governance and risk management processes including incident management, control results reporting, exception
          process management;• Co-operative engagement with line managers and stakeholder teams to improve controls;• Case management of investigations;• Implementation and support of monitoring program changes;• Self-directed learning•
          Data analysis and dashboard style reporting
Skills & Experience • RG146 or equalivalent via 5 years experience in working within compliance or advice related functions in financial planning industry• Familiarity with risk management practices including incident
          management and control assessments• Demonstrated AMP Practices• Leading initiatives• Collaboration and influence to drive outcomes across teams• Data analysis and reporting using Excel / Power BI• Sharepoint and collaboration
          tools• AMP product, commission or data systems (Salesforce, MyBI, IDMS, AMS, EDW)• Stakeholder engagement and influence
Wellbeing & Benefits As a company that values wellbeing, we offer a range of great benefits to support you financially, professionally and personally. These include access to a wide range of flexible working options including
          the ability to purchase extra leave, retail discounts, onsite wellbeing centre including a gym (Sydney Office), Employee Assistance Program, competitive home loan rates, leading superannuation contribution, discounted financial advice and personal
          insurance.
Inclusion & DiversityAMP recognises individual differences and welcomes people from a variety of life and work experiences. The diversity of our people is core to our ability to innovate, grow and to fulfill our collective
          aspiration of helping people to own their tomorrow. A natural curiosity, a respect for differences and a growth mindset are valued at AMP
title: Monitoring Analyst

templatetext:
About Us
Western Health manages three acute public hospitals: Footscray, Sunshine and Williamstown Hospital. It also operates the Sunbury Day Hospital, Transition Care at Hazeldean and a range of community based services along with a large Drug and Alcohol
          Service. We care for a culturally diverse population of more than 800,000 people. We have more than 6,700 employees who are driven by our values of ‘Compassion, Accountability, Respect, Excellence and Safety’ (CARES).
Our continued growth will see the completion of a new purpose built, multi-storey Joan Kirner Women's and Children's Hospital.
About the Role
An exciting opportunity for a Senior Business Analyst is available within the Financial Planning & Analysis team at Western Health. This position is based at the Sunshine and Footscray Hospital.
Reporting to the Manager of Financial Planning & Analysis, you will provide business planning, performance reporting and financial analysis services to support key stakeholders across various business units within the organisation. Specifically
          to understand business needs, assessing the financial impact of operational initiatives, capturing, analysing and documenting requirements and then supporting the communication and delivery of those requirements with relevant parties.
Your excellent verbal and written communication skills will enable you to effectively present business ideas, financial data and performance analysis to a wide range of audiences. Your superior stakeholder management and interpersonal skills will
          allow you to work seamlessly with the finance team, operation mangers, divisional directors and executive directors of WH. You must have extensive knowledge of business management including budget development, forecasting, costing, analysis,
          and reporting. Your positive, and “can do” attitude will ensure you are well fit into the energetic and productive FP&A team.
Essential Criteria
To meet the requirements of the role you must hold tertiary qualifications in accounting, commerce or other finance disciplines with CPA or CA designation preferred. Experience at senior levels within health services would be an advantage but
          not necessary.
Benefits
We offer a wide range of benefits such as:

Work-life balance 
Professional development and career advancement opportunities 
Salary packaging including novated vehicle leasing 
Onsite fitness clubs 
Culturally safe and respectful environment 
Access to an Employee Assistance Program 

Culture
At Western Health, we value our employees and provide them the opportunity to grow and develop.  Our teams are friendly and supportive, ensuring we deliver a safe, person-centred and connected patient experience. Western Health is an equal
          opportunity employer committed to attracting and retaining diversity in our workforce. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.
Western Health is committed to providing a safe environment for the children and young people who are involved in our services, sites and operations. We follow and abide by all legislative requirements to keep children and young people safe.
All appointments are made subject to a satisfactory Police Record Check, an Immunisation status clearance and (if applicable) a working with children’s check.
Western Health do not accept unsolicited resumes/applications from Recruitment AgenciesEnquiries: Jennilyn BaquiranPh: 83457820Position Ref: 34065Applications Close:        07/02/2019To view the position description or submit your application, please click the 'Apply for this job' button below.
title: Senior Business Analyst

templatetext:
The Solution Designer is responsible for understanding problems and coordinating solutions for Sage Products and Services.  The role requires key business analysis skills, including stakeholder management, requirements engineering and problem
          solving as well as a sufficient level of technical and domain knowledge to allow them to operate as a facilitating ‘hub’ for the whole project team.  The Solution Designer will create accurate and unambiguous artefacts, ensuring that all
          issues are raised and managed to completion.  They will establish and maintain strong links with all stakeholders in order to ensure both that stakeholder needs are properly understood and that stakeholders themselves properly understand
          the solution that is proposed and its implications.  The Solution Designer will have an eye for detail and be quality focussed; resulting in thorough and well-organized analysis across all projects they work on.  The Solution Designer
          must be able to both define careful, incremental improvements to existing solutions and to bring radical and challenging approaches to bear, constantly asking why things are as they are and whether new ideas may not be more effective. 
          In order to determine what kind of approach is the best in a specific situation the Solution Designer will always use the test of asking “How will this benefit the customer?” as their most important guide.
The Solution Designer will have experience of at least one domain or area of the business, though may not yet be considered a domain expert.  Where working with technical functions such as Development, QA, Support or LSM, the Solution Designer
          will be able to communicate at a technical level, understanding at a high level key technologies and patterns and – in particular – the opportunities and constraints they represent.  When appropriate – and where it is most efficient to
          do so - a solution designer may be directly involved in producing artefacts that could form part of a delivery – for example, defining a specific report by creating it or configuring custom metadata to implement specific business rules. 
          Prior to a formal QA process, the Solution Designer will also be responsible for validating that an implemented solution solves the original problem and does what was intended.
Responsibilities
 

Delivering an extraordinary customer experience through best in class products and services.
Executing problem definition, requirements engineering, risk escalation, solution design, coordination of communication
Planning, estimate tracking and progress reporting for own work and that of relevant team members.
Manage the functional and system testing process
Work with the test engineers to develop test plans, procedures, cases and scripts
Provide 2nd level support to clients (internal and external)

Background

Knowledgeable in Payroll, HR product or similar
Knowledgeable in technical architecture around web integrations
Experienced in designing and implementing Business Analysis artefacts
Experienced in delivering Web Api integrated products
Experience of working with software development teams
Experienced in offering challenges and new
title: Solution Designer

templatetext:
The Opportunity - Full Time
Analytics at Greenstone is a key central function which drives business decision making and we are looking for a Data/ Actuarial Analyst to support on existing and new initiatives.
These include:

Development and maintenance of actuarial valuation models
Analysis and modelling across marketing and operational activities to drive performance
Interrogation of a wide range of internal data assets (e.g. transactional, text)
Work closely with stakeholders to implement analytics insights and models
Supporting stakeholders with ad hoc analysis, reporting and dashboards

Benefits
The successful candidate will be provided with hands on training and the opportunity to work across a variety of areas and analytics projects. Study support for actuarial exams is available.Essential skills & experience

Tertiary qualification in Actuarial Studies, Mathematics, Engineering or Statistics discipline
Up to 3 years experience in a similar insight driven data analytics area
Some experience in a coding language such as SQL / R / Python / SAS / VBA / Matlab
Comprehensive understanding of MS Excel and other applications within the MS Office suite
Strong conceptual, problem solving and analytical skills
Strong communication and stakeholder management
Excellent written and verbal communication skills 

 Desirable

Understanding of actuarial valuation and pricing techniques
Understanding of modelling techniques such as generalised linear models, gradient boosted models, or neural networks

What's in it for you?

templatetext:
The Star Entertainment Group is a leading owner and operator of integrated resorts and casinos in Sydney, Brisbane and the Gold Coast.  Our Group is experiencing an exciting time of growth and targeted investment across all our properties.
Our industry is fast paced, highly competitive and our operations are broad and dynamic.  We operate across culturally diverse segments within local and international markets.  Our commitment is that every one of our guests enjoys a
          thrilling experience and that reflects a local pride in everything we do. We understand that true teamwork drives outstanding outcomes for both our team members and for our guests.
A fantastic opportunity to join a high performing team and fantastic culture!
Reporting to the Linux Team Leader you will provide a star quality service to your internal stakeholders and ensure that performance obligations of Casino systems and infrastructure are met. This includes planning, developing, installing, configuring,
          maintaining, supporting and /or optimising server and storage software and hardware infrastructure, network software and communication links.
A dynamic and fast paced role where you hold the cards
Central to the success of the role you will manage and administer Linux operating systems, support Development staff, Operations Analysts and end users to define systems goals, and identify and resolve system issues. You will coordinate and perform
          in-depth tests, including end user reviews for modified and new infrastructure. You will proactively generate and compile reports based on findings, complete with probable causes and possible solutions to systems availability and performance
          issues. Showcase your experience and bring your security and risk skills to our organisation; deploy and maintain hardware and perform all host security activities. Plan and implement for contingencies across our operating systems, databases,
          networks, servers and software applications.
Key Skills and Experience

Minimum of 3yrs Red Hat Linux Experience
Experience in support a Puppet configuration environment (basic Ruby understanding) 
Confidence in scripting languages (Bash/Shell)
Exposure to web services Apache/PHP (LAMP)
Solid exposure cloud platforms including Amazon and Azure 

 
Other key deliverables in this position will include:

Analyse day to day functions and processes of software and database resources to ensure they are performing within pre-determined guidelines
Provide recommendations that address existing potential trouble areas in infrastructure across casinos Property and provide on call technical support.
Ensure compliance is met in line with all policies for The Star Entertainment Group
Performing all other related/ project duties as required
General knowledge of virtualisation platform - VMware
General knowledge of machine data analytics - Splunk
General knowledge of Version control system - GIT
General knowledge of Database environments – MSSQL, MySQL Oracle, DB2
Able to work under pressure in a fast pace environment.

We are seeking a candidate that possesses strong research skills into system issues and products. You will have excellent analytical and communication skills and able to deliver ideas to a variety of audiences. You will possess technical knowledge
          of network, platform operating systems and associated hardware infrastructure.
Working at Star Entertainment brings some great benefits, including generous discounts at our hotels, bars & restaurants, lunch provided daily, discounted city parking plus much more! It's your move, own it!

The Australian Financial Security Authority (AFSA) is responsible for managing the application of bankruptcy and personal property securities laws through the delivery of personal insolvency and trustee, regulation and enforcement and personal
            property securities services.

The Enterprise Data Warehouse Developer will provide trusted advice on business intelligence and visual analytics. The Developer will work as part of a small business intelligence and reporting team to deliver quality self-service data and visual
            analytics products to AFSA’s business areas, supporting the achievement of strategic objectives set out in AFSA’s ICT Strategy 2017-2020 and Data Strategy 2020. The team plays a critical role in data literacy, visualisation and analytics capability
            development across the agency, supporting evidence-based decision-making and risk-based regulatory work.    
These are critical roles for AFSA as they:

provide technical expertise in a business critical function
support effective and efficient service delivery through enhanced data analysis and evidence-based decision making

exceptional communication and analytical skills, with a track record of successfully communicating technical concepts to non-technical audiences

AFSA supports a family-friendly work environment with on-site childcare and parenting facilities, and access to a range of facilities and activities to support wellbeing.  
AFSA actively promotes workplace flexibility, with various working options to support your family commitments and personal interests.

Our Transformation Division is seeking a dynamic Change Analyst to support the successful implementation of Salesforce - MEX (Member Experience).
Reporting to the Change Lead, you will support the assessment of current/future state changes and impacts along with the implementation of change management strategies and plans.
This is an exciting time to join a diverse company and talented team. The role will be challenging and rewarding, with plenty of opportunities to further develop your already change analyst and project management capabilities.
About You
You will have a sound experience as a Change Analyst for change initiatives and genuine passion for people focused service delivery.  Also, you will have experience working in an Agile environment; conducting stakeholder engagement needs
          and business readiness assessments, whilst contributing to a vibrant environment by being energetic, enthusiastic and engaged in everything you do.
About the role
You will provide assistance in running and co-ordinating change workshops, support the development of comprehensive training needs analysis and develop training delivery plans.  Your role will include:

Conduct change analysis and change impact assessments and develop and support the delivery of effective change plans and change reporting.
Undertake current and future state gap analyses and assess changes and impacts to ensure that transformation strategy and transition planning meet program objectives.
Document change impact assessment outcomes to determine the scale of change and associated business readiness activities required for successful change.
Provide the analytics and intelligence to validate and guide the change approach and to provide key measurement analytics for the change impacts and effort.
Support the alignment of change and training activities to operating environment changes to facilitate the realisation of identified benefits and to address associated risk. Support, and where relevant, deliver key communication and training
            activity for the project and business.
Work collaboratively with all operational business groups to understand current and future state and to ensure business requirements are translated into documentation.
Build and maintain strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders to enhance business relationships and project delivery.
Manage and implement change activities for one or more streams within the Program to support the Change Lead and to ensure successful implementation of the program. Identify and manage related issues and risks and report to the Change Lead on
            the overall performance.
Manage stakeholder expectations about the program, generating buy-in to the solution, ensuring organisational alignment to deliver business engagement and change readiness.

The preferred candidates may have Prosci Change Management certification or equivalent demonstrated experience in change management.  Exceptional verbal and written communications is essential.
If you bring with you the experience and capabilities, we are looking for... please apply now!

templatetext:
THE ROLE 
The successful candidate will process some of the below experience and will service cross functional management systems within this company. This is a fantastic opportunity for someone to broaden their skillset and work in a process orientated
          environment. It is an 6 Month contract with option to be extended looking for an immediate start. 
Essential Skills/Experience:
 
 

Support the Data Stream Lead in improving data capture and data quality to ensure Interest Rate Risk in the Banking Book (IRRBB) delivers its internal modelling and external reporting requirements
Engage with business unit data producers including product owners, data quality teams and finance to implement data requirements by undertaking key data analysis activities such as:
Identify data gaps, analyze and document data patterns
Propose and amend data quality validations
Proactively resolve data issues and raise related change requests based on findings during the business engagement
Maintain data requirement artefacts
Liaise with Corporate Data Quality and Technology teams to drive data implementation in accordance with milestones
Support both the business analyst and solution architect by translating data requirements into the technical build and design
Undertake and support end-to-end testing of releases
Communicate and coordinate critical data elements with Enterprise Data Management to capture data lineage and controls

 
 
- BA with exp as a Data Analyst - more on the business side than the technical side
- Someone who can analyze data patterns, investigate data quality issues, work with business units to remediate any issues with data they are sending through etc.
- Experience in Interest Rate or Market Risk
 
 
 
 
 
 
A SUITABLE CANDIDATE? 
 
 
*Please note, full permanent Australian working rights are required to be considered for this position and successful applicants will be contacted.
 
Apply Today
Please send your resume by clicking on the apply button to attention of Jamie Weir. Your application will be assessed within 3 working days. Please note only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
Learn more about our Sydney recruitment services: https://www.roberthalf.com.au/sydney

templatetext:
Where you’ll be working:This is a unique opportunity to join an iconic Australian brand as a Data Engineer. You will be working within a high performing data team that uses cutting edge
        technology to understand its customers and improve their digital products performance.The digital products created by this company are used by millions of customers across Australia!This organisation is undergoing a huge digital transformation        with many on-going projects that look to take advantage of large scale data processing. You will work in a collaborative team environment across the latest technology stacks including AWS, Python and SQL.We
        are looking for people with a passion for big data and thrive on working with some of the most talented people in the industry.  What you’ll be doing:

Work with state-of-the-art data processing frameworks, technologies, and platforms
Create data integration pipelines to extract, cleanse, and integrate data, from a variety of sources and formats, to support BI and reporting, data science, and machine learning
Design and develop scalable and re-usable solutions that support both real-time and/or batch-based data processing
AWS technologies – Redshift, S3, EC2 - large-scale data warehousing and analytics projects
Work with other software engineers, data analysts, data scientists, and decision-makers, such as product owners, to build solutions and gain novel insights.
Essential Skills:

At least 2yrs + experience working as a Data Engineer
Essential: AWS - Redshift, S3, EC2
Essential: Able to code in either: Python or Spark
Knowledge of Advanced SQL and a programming language
Strong ETL skills (e.g. AirFlow/Talend etc)
Strong Communication Skills
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, related technical field, or equivalent work experience.
 What’s in it for you?This is a rare chance to take your career to the next level with a company that is really pushing the boundaries in 2019! You will work with other likeminded people in a fun and social environment!        There is an attractive salary, cutting edge technology and cool offices! If this sounds like the perfect job role for you, please apply within or contact Adam on 0299931072.
        We will contact you if you are successfully shortlisted.
title: Data Engineer – AWS / PYTHON - Household Name Company!

templatetext:
Our client is a high profile government agency. They have an exciting portfolio of work, as they embark on a significant modernisation of many of their IT systems 
This position is based in Parramatta and may involve occasional travel to Ashfield and Liverpool
Role description:

Working closely with the PMO Reporting Manager to identify data trends in the effective documentation and delivery of ICT projects.
Exercise accuracy, integrity and accountability in providing reports detailing project status.
The information reported will form the basis of tracking whether projects are satisfactorily delivering against the initial schedule and whether appropriate documentation has been followed and if amendments and changes have been initiated
              and implemented.
The PMO Reporting Manager and the PMO Analyst will provide suggestions and timelines to remediate any anomalies prior to possible escalation. 
The PMO Analyst will also serve as the project tool system administrator (Principal Toolbox), responsible for maintaining and training on the entry and updating of project information.

Skills and Experience:

Minimum of 3 years PMO Analyst experience on large, complex IT programs
Well versed in Project Management and PMO methodology with knowledge of PMO best practice and PMO tools
Formal project methodology certification such as Prince 2 or PMBOK an advantage 
Experience with preparing a range of project related documents including status updates, reports, budgets and discussion papers.
Proven ability to ensure data quality compliance, including the adherence to compliance guidelines. 
Experience with gathering, validating, storing, retrieving, filtering and disseminating project information to key stakeholders within agreed procedures to assist in effective and efficient decision making.
Relevant tertiary qualifications preferred

To apply please email a copy of your CV in MS Word format
Keywords: Prince 2 methodology, PMBOK, PMO Analyst, Project Management, Program Management, risk and issues, change management, change register, document register,  project office, Principal Toolbox


 
Angelo Rozosangelo@aarconsultinggroup.com.au  





www.aarconsultinggroup.com.au
title: PMO Analyst

templatetext:
At AKQA, we believe in the imaginative application of art and science to create beautiful ideas, products and services. With an entrepreneurial and collaborative approach, we design adaptive digital services and applications that capture the imagination,
          delivering impressive returns for our clients.
We’re looking for a Senior UX Researcher who can inform design strategy by providing insights about user needs, goals and behaviours. The UX Researcher is a highly skilled research practitioner with passion and experience in UX research processes.
          Not only will you develop research plans, facilitate user tests and communicate research findings to internal and external stakeholders, but you’ll also be the advocate for the voice of the user.
At AKQA, you'll work in a meritocratic culture surrounded by some of the brightest minds in their fields. You'll have the opportunity to learn and grow, with access to ongoing personal and professional development. At AKQA, we're committed to
          your career growth, as well as your work/life balance.
 
ROLE REQUIREMENTS

Drive a user-centred design process for projects, working closely with XD designers, strategists and data analysts.
Take the lead and initiative on research projects, offering support and guidance to others including mentoring more junior UX research practitioners.
Demonstrate subject matter expertise in web and mobile/cross platform user experience.
Develop research strategies throughout the project lifecycle, from conception to launch and ongoing optimisation.
Plan and execute large-scale research and user sessions.
Source external parties to plan and execute large-scale research.
Conduct research using a variety of qualitative and quantitative methods including surveys, interviews and testing.
Collaborate with the XD design team to implement research findings.
Explore and adapt new research methodologies as appropriate.
Moderate and facilitate user research sessions, in person and remotely.
Clearly communicate and report user problems and user needs in a way that easily translates insights into actionable solutions.

 
QUALITIES AND CHARACTERISTICS

4+ years’ experience in a dedicated research role.
Experience with qualitative behavioural and attitudinal research techniques.
Experience with third-party or secondary research.
Experience with card sorting, diary studies and user interviews.
Experience with analytics data, A/B testing and other quantitative sources is desirable.

 
AKQA is an Equal Opportunities Employer, we believe that diversity is vital to AKQA’s ability to provide our clients with the best recommendations and are committed to fostering a varied and inclusive work environment. Your race, colour, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability or veteran status have no bearing on our hiring decisions. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.
title: Senior User Experience (UX) Researcher

templatetext:
See yourself in our team
Retail Banking Services (RBS) is the public face of CommBank, delivering a seamless banking experience for the future, to our 10 million + personal and small business customers. We offer market-leading products and services, supported by some
          of the world’s best systems and processes.
This role sits within Risk Management in the Credit Cards team within Credit Strategy and Portfolio Oversight.
Reporting to the Senior Manager RBS Credit Cards Originations Oversight, this role will see you responsible for ensuring that RBS Risk management has a strong and effective line 2 function to effectively discharge its responsibilities.
On any given day you will

Support in setting RBS credit risk appetite in Credit Cards by providing technical analysis and insight
Support the development of Risk Event playbooks to enable insight into portfolio performance under different scenarios
Assist in development of forward looking risk metrics and analytics on the Credit Card Portfolio
Provide support for development of initiatives that support sustainability of earnings
Perform deep dive analysis into credit risks within the portfolio and identify emerging risks
Provide subject matter expertise in credit risk analytics and collaborate with your peers to improve techniques and execution of activities in this domain across the RBS Risk Management function

We’re interested in hearing from people who possess

Strong quantitative analysis, data analysis, and problem solving skills
Deep knowledge of risk management principles/measures
Tertiary qualifications in Business / Finance / Statistics / Economics or other related area
Demonstrated experience in analytics and/or business intelligence
Proficient computer skills (SQL, Excel, Tableau, etc)
Experience in credit risk management will be highly regarded 

At CommBank, we’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce reflecting the customers, businesses and communities we serve. As a value’s driven organisation, we nurture and support our people; through focusing on skill and talent development, collaboration, flexibility and internal promotion. With service in mind at every touch point, we take accountability for the role we play in securing and enhancing the financial wellbeing of people, businesses and communities. At CommBank you can be you.
title: Senior Portfolio Analyst, RBS Credit Cards

templatetext:
The life of a recruiter is fast-paced, people-oriented and all about improving lives. With Morgan McKinley you will be given the tools and training you need to be successful, and the opportunity to work in a great environment with genuine flexibility.
          If this sounds good then read more about what we can offer you…
 
The role and teams Due to ongoing business growth, we are continuously looking for new talent to join our Sydney business, and currently specifically within the below areas:

Strategy & Innovation
Analytics
Government
Risk & Compliance
Business Analysis
Projects & Change

 
How we will set you up for success

We have a high-performing culture including consultants who made their own career change to join us, as well as others who have 10+ years’ experience in the industry, meaning we can provide fantastic mentors            to learn from in your first recruitment role.
You will join an established business with a vast number of existing (and strong!) relationships and accounts for you to work with, meaning you will find success quickly. You will also have huge opportunity            to develop your own relationships and bring new clients on board.
You will partner with our key accounts across Financial Services and Commerce and Industry and you will leverage Morgan McKinley’s brand and position as a tier 1 supplier to the majority of the ASX 20.
Industry-leading training and development, structured to develop you through to experienced consultant, with a genuine career path tailored to your strengths and aspirations.

 
What can Morgan McKinley offer?

Exciting and dynamic role with more time out meeting people than sat behind a desk
Work for a multiple-award winning agency with an enviable global brand reputation, and established and impressive leadership team
A competitive base salary along with a lucrative, transparent and monthly commission structure; be rewarded for the work you put in!
Long-standing preferred supplier relationships with high-profile companies across financial services, government and commerce
Go Beyond trips overseas to Bali and Queenstown
Additional leave days and regular incentives such as high performer’s lunches, 4 hour Fridays and travel vouchers
Monthly /quarterly team nights out, fresh fruit in the office, beer and wine in the fridge
Support and encouragement to give something back to the community, through our award-winning Corporate Social Responsibility program
Hear it from one of our own career changers: https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/so-how-did-you-end-up-recruitment-ruby-yeats/

 
What are we looking for? We are looking for career changers who can draw upon their transferable skills and build a rewarding career in a relationship focused industry.
We have a number of our highest performers who have joined us from broad backgrounds and we are interested in talking to you if you have excellent relationship building qualities and the drive and ambition to launch a recruitment career.
We are particularly interested in backgrounds including sales, lawyers, real estate, or the roles that we recruit into (including Strategy Consultants, Business & Data Analysts, Change Managers, IT Developers etc).
 
To find out more Apply now with your resume and cover letter, or for a confidential discussion please contact Steph Newth on +61(0)2 8986 3102.
 
The Company
Morgan McKinley is a global professional staffing and talent management company. Boasting year on year growth for 11 years and led by the Founding MDs, our Sydney business has a passion for people and our core purpose is improving lives.
Morgan McKinley prides itself on exceptional levels of service, an in-depth knowledge of our markets, a determination to be the best and above all a proven track record of success.
title: Recruitment Consultant

templatetext:
A leading Financial Services institution, with a strong presence in their respective market, is currently looking for a Data Analyst with hands-on experience in building predictive models. 
You will be reporting to the Head of Analytics and working in a fast-paced environment with a team of high-performing data analysts. 
Your role will be focused on understanding the business requirements, manipulate and analyse large and complex data sets, build predictive models and identify meaningful and actionable insights for key decision-makers. 
 
Key Responsibilities

Investigating, interpreting and understanding complex unstructured data and translating that into value driven insight
Working with stakeholders to scope requirements and provide analytical solutions
Perform statistical analysis and predictive model building
Source data from multiple channels


Communicate results of complex data, analysis and findings into meaningful and actionable insights for senior management and key stakeholders
Use SAS to build predictive models 
Manipulate, clean and conduct data integrity checks

 
Skills Required

Hands-on commercial experience building predictive models
Proven experience providing insights to internal and external stakeholders
Ability to analyse large and complex data sets
Skills in SAS and SQL is mandatory
Skills in R and/or Python will be highly regarded
Tertiary qualification in a quantitative discipline such as mathematics, statistics, commerce, economics etc.
A passion for presenting valuable insights from complex data
Proven experience working with raw/unstructured data

 
This is an excellent opportunity to work in a fast paced growing environment, focused on developing solutions and enabling information to help drive the operational effectiveness of the organisation.
 
If you would like to be considered for this role please click 'apply' or call Corrin on 03 8330 5003 for more details.

templatetext:
About the Company: Established in 2001, Australian owned and operation DX Solutions is one of Sydney’s leading end to end ICT Service Providers having built a reputation for innovation, insight and leadership in the professional
        services industry.  As a rapidly growing business, DX was listed in BRW’s Fast100 in 2014 and 2015 consecutively acknowledging the drive and commitment of our team of over 200 employees.    About the Role:            We are looking for a highly motivated and hard-working graduate resourcing specialist to join our busy team. You will be directly responsible for identifying resources and talent across the IT- Telecommunications practice and
        also stakeholder management across a variety of different clients. As a growth-role, this provides a great opportunity for a self-starting and aspirational graduate to develop the skills and connections needed to thrive and excel in their careers.
        The types of opportunities you will be aligned with will be mainly within following competencies, but not limited to:  - Automation and Manual Test Analysts, Evangelists, SMEs and Market Leaders - Change Professionals  - Business
        Analysts  - System / Database Analysts  - BI/Data Warehouse SME's - Network Engineers, Architects, Support Consultants  - Agile Coaches, Product Owners and Scrum Masters - Dev-ops Specialists, Automation (RPA)
        and Anchor Engineers  - Technical, Production and Application SMEs      Main Responsibilities:  

Reporting directly to our Head of IT- Telecommunications practice.
Meeting KPI’s set by the Telecommunications practice.
Resourcing candidates using a variety of different means.
Liaising with internal and external stakeholders.
Communicating with potential consultants through phone, email and interviews.
Writing, posting and management of job ads.
You will play a major role in ensuring the development of the IT- telecommunications practice.
          Main Skills:     

Experience in CRM platforms such as Bullhorn, JobAdder or LinkedIn recruiter are beneficial
Previous experience with IT Sales/Resourcing is favourable.
A resilient and vibrant mindset.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal with a clear phone manner.
Strong relationship and stakeholder management skills.
Good organisational skills and attention to detail.
Ability to work in a high-pressure environment and meet tight deadlines.
Being a motivated, self-starter with a good attitude is a must.
Previous experience in IT would be a bonus.
title: Graduate Resourcing Specialist

templatetext:
• Excellent opportunity working on high-profile projects  • Contributie to research enabling robots to traverse novel terrains  • Help shape the future at Data61, Australia's leading data innovation group  The opportunity CSIRO Postdoctoral Fellowships help facilitate the recruitment and development of our potential leaders. They provide valuable opportunities for scientists and engineers to launch their careers,
          extend professional networks and enhance their career prospects.   As the CSIRO Postdoctoral Fellow in Machine Learning for Robotic Mobility with CSIRO’s Data61, you will undertake research enabling mobile robots to
          traverse novel environments/terrains. You are an experience-based learner who can pick up new concepts and skills quickly, and you are able to generalise that experience in extended missions. This may involve creating novel mappings from sensors
          to learned metric-spaces, and using a robot’s experience (e.g. hitting a rock) to generalize and avoid related situations (rocks or stumps in road). You will be hands on with legged and wheeled vehicles; developing new robotic behaviours, and
          working within larger teams developing these platforms.   The Robotics and Autonomous Systems group is competing in the systems track of the DARPA SubT Challenge and it is expected that this Postdoctoral Fellow will contribute to this
          Challenge project. Join our team and be part of this exciting initiative involving the creation of fast capable robots traversing novel complex terrain.
 
You will:  • Create novel software models and algorithms.  • Produce papers for publication and presentation.  • Contribute to innovative concepts and
          ideas for further research.    Location: Queensland Centre for Advanced Technologies (QCAT)  Pullenvale (Brisbane) Queensland, Australia  Salary: AU $85k - AU $93k per annum, plus
          up to 15.4% superannuation   Tenure: 3 year term   Reference No.: 58909
   To be considered you will need:  • A doctorate in a relevant discipline area, such as computer science, robotics, electrical, mechanical or mechatronic engineering.  •          Less than three years of relevant research experience since completing your PhD.  • The ability to communicate well both verbally and in writing, and a history of professional behaviours.  •          A record of applying machine learning to perception or robotics problems, or published fundamental contributions in machine learning  • At least, a strong desire to work hands-on with robotic systems.  •          The ability to work well in a team environment, as well as autonomously.  • A record of science innovation and creativity.    To see all the criteria required for success in this role, click on the ‘Position
          Details’ link below. Apply today!
 
 
Position Details 
 
To be eligible for this postdoctoral fellowship, you will have less than 3 years (or part-time equivalent) of relevant research experience since gaining your PhD.

 
About CSIRO  At CSIRO you can be part of helping to solve big, complex problems that make a real difference to our future. We spark off each other, learn from each other, trust each other and collaborate to achieve more
          than we could individually in a supportive, rewarding, inclusive and truly flexible environment.    CSIRO’s Commitment to Diversity  We’re working hard to recruit diverse people and ensure all our people
          feel supported to do their best work and empowered to let their ideas flourish.    Flexible Working Arrangements  We work flexibly at CSIRO, offering a range of options for how, when and where you work. Talk
          to us about how this role could be flexible for you. Balance    Apply Online  To apply online, please provide a CV
          and cover letter outlining your suitability and motivation for the role.
  Applications will remain open until filled
title: CSIRO Postdoc - Machine Learning for Robotic Mobility

templatetext:
This successful and growing technology company is looking to add to their talented Sydney based team a Senior Java Software Engineer.
Established in Sydney nearly 20 years ago, this company now has thousands of customers in more than 70 countries around the world using their products, which employ machine learning technology (amongst other things). Their products are highly
          regarded and market leading, and the company currently employs around 500 staff globally.
The Senior Engineer will work within an Agile team to delivery high-quality software and products.
The role will involve

Gaining and maintaining a deep understanding of one or more products, as well as a general understanding of all the company's products.
Engage in hands-on, in-depth analysis, review and design of software, including technical review and analysis gathering.
Deliver scalable and high quality solutions as part of an Agile team.
Collaborate across teams to achieve seamless integrations.
Involvement in macro scale architecture of the software technology.
Work with multiple development teams to ensure the technologies interoperate with or connect to each other.
Work towards acting as a technical expert advising engineering on one or more specific problem domains - e.g. machine learning.
Actively monitor technology trends that may create opportunities for the company.

Skills, Knowledge and Experience

At least 6 years' relevant programming experience, and a demonstrable track record of providing technical solutions to complex problems.
A strong knowledge of computer science (data structures, patterns, system design).
Experience building Core Java applications (Java SE), not just web frameworks.
Solid knowledge of multi threading and messaging concepts.
Good knowledge of Unix, Scripting and Networking fundamentals.
Strong Java knowledge, including familiarity with Java 8 and/or 9.
Knowledge of Spring and Spring Boot.
Experience with Javascript. Knowledge of Python or Ruby is desirable, but not essential.
Whilst the role leans more towards Back End development, any experience with Front End development is desirable, preferably React JS, and perhaps other Javascript frameworks such as Angular.
Experience with Cloud / AWS services: EC2, CloudFront, RDS. Some knowledge of Kubernetes is desirable.
Good knowledge of modern Java web applications (e.g. Spring Boot backend, on Tomcat, with reach FE), although the role will spend significant time on other products (desktop applications - Java SE with Swing FE).
Experienced in troubleshooting and debugging problems.
Ability to accurately estimate development and testing effort.

Behavioural Skills and Characteristics

Ability to collaborate and communicate effectively across multiple teams.
A strong team player.

Qualifications

Degree, or equivalent, in a relevant field such as computer science / engineering, software engineering, machine learning, mathematics etc.

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a growing, global company which is fostering a high-quality environment in which to work and learn.
The package is attractive for the right person.

templatetext:
I am recruiting multiple Java engineering roles (mid and senior) for a Tier one bank in Melbourne to work on a new project in fraud and financial crime surveillance. The team is building a new system based on machine learning which will
        be ingesting and analyzing large sets of data in real-time. The platform is also to be hosted in AWS and you will be supported in gaining your certifications within the role if you don't already have them.  We’re looking for someone with:

java development, experience with building APIs (kong) and micro services.
Exposure to distributed big data stacks e.g. Spark, PySpark, Kafka, Hive, Flume, Hue & Sqoop.
An understanding and/or experience developing data analytics platforms like SAS, SPSS, Tableau, etc.
Able to work with different data types e.g. streaming, real-time, file based, RDMS, unstructured data, etc.
Experience working in cloud deployment and management (especially AWS).
A strong understanding of CI/CD practices.
An open mindset and proven ability to innovate and influence.
A passion for learning (tell us about the self-learning courses and certifications you have done - Coursera, Udacity, AWS, etc.)
 If interested please APPLY NOW are call Will McGreal for more info on 03 8637 7304.
title: Java software engineer - Machine Learning

templatetext:
Leading AI & Machine Learning Solutions OrganisationMy client is a high growth RegTech innovator focused on AI & Machine Learning solutions for Financial Services Legal & Compliance. They help legal &
          compliance teams operating in financial services by giving them access to the power of artificial intelligence and machine learning based automated risk detection capability.The RoleThe Business Development &
          Partnerships Manager who will lead the sales of our products which is a software as a service (SaaS) solution that automates the review of digital marketing against regulatory and business rules. This role is for a high achiever who is focused
          on client acquisition and client development and takes initiative to find the most optimal solution to achieve the outcomes required for the business. A keen sense of ownership, quality, the customer, speedy execution, and hustle is a must.What you’ll be doing

Drive the Sales Pipeline to Revenue: Develop and manage the pipeline with a variety of opportunity and account sizes, with clients direct and through our partners. Own the client and the sale until revenue is realised.
Deliver growth: Demonstrated ability to build a growth plan and execute on that through closing deals with clients and realising revenue quickly.
Build partnerships: Drive our partners to ensure they and we are successful in growing our businesses together through value added solutions to clients.
Client management: Own and develop the relationships with the clients, setting expectations and delivering on them.
Stakeholder management: Build and foster strong relationships with clients, Rules Consultants, Engineering Teams and Research Teams to ensure consistent delivery against sales strategy and resolution of issues that arise in a timely manner.
Contribute to Business Outcomes: Significant contribution to the growth of Red Marker’s products through driving strong client sales.
Go to Market: managing the successful commercial growth by creating a scalable sales/partnership process and documentation

What are they looking for? 

Proven record in selling enterprise software solutions to a wide range of industries.
Proven record in developing and driving successful channel distribution partners.
A comprehensive understanding of sales techniques and marketing principles.
Experience in Information Technology, Software Solutions
Qualifications and/or training in sales and marketing essential (e.g. Millar Heiman)
An understanding of IT with experience in selling solutions at the enterprise level, preferably with Software as a Service exposure, directly and through partners.
High level of integrity.
Ability to set and execute both long- and short-term goals
Some travel (mainly domestic) may be required (trade shows and clients).
Comfortable in high level and the detail of doing

 
To discuss this opportunity in more detail, please contact Tom Field at Bluefin Resources on 02 9270 2614. Alternatively, please apply with a current copy of your Resume .
IMPORTANT: By submitting your email address and any other personal information when you APPLY to a job, you consent to such information being collected, held, used and disclosed in accordance with our COLLECTIONS NOTICE and PRIVACY POLICY.
http://www.bluefinresources.com.au/privacy-policy
title: Senior Business Development - AI SaaS Solution

templatetext:
Machine Learning Engineer (MLET) - Manager Level x two position  Responsibilities: • Works with delivery stakeholders to define scope • Help BA to define complex problems and break down problem
          into solvable parts using known and accepted algorithms • Developing innovative ideas to solve problems and enable better decisions through advanced math, statistics and natural language processing. • Provides guidance to development
          team in coding and producing relevant unit tests with data • Works with external developers to integrate solution • Participates in and contributes to all Agile team activities and events  Deliverable: •
          Develop advanced technology solutions for complex requirements with techniques such as Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing (includes estimates and coverage) • statistical/mathematical models as part of accepted solution          • Agile: Acceptance Criteria and Acceptance Tests  Basic Skills: • An understanding of major types of machine learning algorithms (e.g. regression, time-series, classification, clustering, etc.), and their mathematical
          fundamentals • An understanding of Natural Language Processing and various algorithms used for different problems • Proficiency in Python programming and reviewing python code • 5 years+ relevant work experience • Qualifications
          in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Applied Maths or related disciplines. • Experience with agile testing methodologies including unit test • Good analytical skills • Good communication skills • A challenging and enquiring
          mind • Attention to detail and tenacity • Team player and contributor • Ability to develop and deliver autonomously
• Must be a resident of Australia.  Desirable Skills: • Proficiency in R programming • Strong statistical knowledge • Strong degree of curiosity for new technologies • Strong desire to deliver an excellent
          customer experience • Enjoy understanding how breaking things and finding bugs is key to a successful product • Track record of building and maintaining excellent working relationships with peers • Meets/exceeds Deloitte’s functional/technical
          depth and complexity for this role
title: Machine Learning Engineer (MLET) - Manager- Melbourne

templatetext:
(HEO5) $69,262 - $77,057 per annum plus an employer contribution of 17% will apply.
Full time, continuing role available immediately 
A trade-based job with a difference.
Your role as a fabricator in the Infrastructure & Technical Services Team (I&TS) is to assist in the design and manufacture of the students Final Year Projects and research projects.
This is an opportunity to play a key part in the education of our engineers of the future in a dynamic work environment that supports a broad variety of challenging work.
Your skills will be ideally based in the welding and metal fabrication industry (MIG, TIG and Oxy Acetylene) with an additional ability of fitting and turning. Additional skills in one or more of the following disciplines will be looked upon favourably
          are experience with composite materials, CNC mill and lathe and associated programs and 3D Printing.
You must have a trade based background or proven equivalent years’ experience as defined by The University of Adelaide Enterprise Bargaining Agreement 2017 – 2021.
To be successful you will need:

Demonstrated knowledge of technical services and principles associated with working within a customer focused fabrication workshop.
Demonstrated experience in engineering trade based manufacturing and maintenance.
Demonstrated high level of computer literacy, knowledge and hands-on experience in use of specialised engineering software for design and manufacturing.
Excellent understanding of Work Health and Safety requirements in relation to mechanical workshop environment.
High level organisational skills and an ability to work well under pressure to meet deadlines, and the ability to priorities’ tasks and assignments.
Ability to work with general supervision, think creatively and laterally and exercise initiative as appropriate to achieve a standard of excellence and monitor on-going performance.
Proven communication expertise with a diverse client groups and stakeholders and the ability to work collaboratively within a team.

Enjoy an outstanding career environment
The University of Adelaide is a uniquely rewarding workplace. The size, breadth and quality of our education and research programs—including significant industry, government and community collaborations—offers you vast scope and opportunity for
          a long, fulfilling career.
It also enables us to attract high-calibre people in all facets of our operations, ensuring you will be surrounded by talented colleagues, many world-leading. And our work’s cutting-edge nature—not just in your own area, but across virtually the
          full spectrum of human endeavour—provides a constant source of inspiration.
Our core values are honesty, respect, fairness, discovery and excellence. And our culture is one that welcomes all and embraces diversity. We are firm believers that our people are our most valuable asset, so we work to grow and diversify the
          skills of our staff.
In addition, we offer a wide range of attractive staff benefits. These include: salary packaging; flexible work arrangements; high-quality professional development programs and activities; and an on-campus health clinic, gym and other fitness
          facilities.
Learn more at: adelaide.edu.au/jobs
Your faculty’s broader role
The Faculty of Engineering, Computer and Mathematical Sciences is a thriving centre of learning, teaching and research in a vast range of engineering disciplines, computer science - including machine learning - and high-level mathematics. Many
          of its academic staff are work leaders in their fields and graduates are highly regarded by employers.
Learn more about the Faculty of Engineering, Computer and Mathematical Sciences at: ecms.adelaide.edu.au
If you want to change tomorrow, act today
Click the link to the online application form below and address and upload your responses to all selection criteria. Applications close Sunday the 11.55pm, 17 February 2019.
For further information
For a confidential discussion regarding this position, contact:
Scott LettonWorkshop Operations CoordinatorE: scott.letton@adelaide.edu.au
You’ll find a full position description and/or selection criteria below: (If no links appear, try viewing on another device)
To obtain a copy of the Position Description/Selection Criteria, please visit the University of Adelaide Job opportunities page via this link: http://careers.adelaide.edu.au/cw/en/job/501815/technician-fabrication
The University of Adelaide is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Women and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people who meet the requirements of this position are strongly encouraged to apply.

templatetext:
Classification: ANU Officer 7 (Research)Salary package:  $86,723 - $91,157 per annum plus 17% superannuation
Terms: Full time, Fixed term (12 months)


Algorithm and software development in mathematical optimisation and machine learning, supporting a cutting-edge university-industry research partnership.
Fixed term position for 1 year.


College overview
The ANU College of Engineering and Computer Science (CECS) is dedicated to contributing to The Australian National University’s reputation for excellence in research and research-led education, bringing together expertise across a range of areas
          to reimagine the role of engineering and computing for future generations. CECS is a diverse and vibrant community dedicated to discovery and to making knowledge matter. Our academics and students are engaged in ground-breaking, cutting-edge
          research, in exciting areas such as renewable energy, robotics, telecommunications, biomaterials, human-machine interaction, and artificial intelligence.
Position overview
The ANU Research School of Computer Science is seeking a skilled algorithm and software developer to support research and development and to contribute to delivering the mathematical optimisation and machine learning software components of a novel
          system being built in collaboration with colleagues from the Research School of Physics and Engineering to our industry partner. The role also supports research and development.
To enquire about this position, please contact Dr Patrik Haslum patrik.haslum@anu.edu.au or Dr Hanna Suominen hanna.suominen@anu.edu.au 
Closing date: 18 February 2019
Position description: ANUO7 software developer.pdf
ANU values diversity and inclusion and believes employment opportunities must not be limited by socio-economic background, race, religion or gender. The University actively encourages applications from women, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander
          people and candidates from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds. Furthermore, it is the policy of the ANU College of Engineering and Computer Science to require selection panels to seek gender balance when compiling shortlists of
          candidates for interview. For more information about staff equity at ANU, visit https://services.anu.edu.au/human-resources/respect-inclusion 
The ANU provides attractive benefits and excellent support to maintain a healthy work/life balance and offers generous remuneration benefits, including four weeks paid vacation per year, assistance with relocation expenses and 17% employer contribution
          to superannuation. This also includes generous parental leave, the possibility of flexible and part time working arrangements, a parental and aged care support program, dual career hire programs, ANU school holiday programs, and childcare facilities
          on campus. For more information, please visit http://hr.anu.edu.au/employment-at-anu.
Application information
In order to apply for this role please make sure that you upload the following documents:


A statement addressing the selection criteria.


A current curriculum vitae (CV) which includes the names and contact details of at least three referees (preferably including a current or previous supervisor). If your CV does not include referees you can complete these online when prompted
              in the application form.


Applications which do not address the selection criteria may not be considered for the position.
Please note: The successful applicant must have rights to live and work in this country.
title: Software Developer

title: Software Developer

templatetext:
A bit about us…
We're a bank, but we're not like the big banks. Our proud history is built on a philosophy of building healthy communities that are financially, socially and environmentally sustainable. This is what guides the work we do everyday.
For more than forty years we have been a member owned bank, servicing the people Victorians rely on - police, health, emergency services and public sectors.  With over 112,000 members and $1.78 billion in assets we are big enough to matter,
          but we are small enough to care about the financial wellbeing of each and every one of our members.We are on a unique journey with a dynamic vision for the future and we're looking for exceptional people to jump on board. If you have
          innovative ideas, a passion to make a difference and believe you can contribute to creating an extraordinary member experience then we want to hear from you.
About this role…
Reporting to the Head of IT Delivery you will join a brand new team in our Technology business area to support the implementation of the strategic IT architecture and roadmap and deliver on premise and cloud based capabilities. This role will
          see you assisting the Head of IT Delivery, Head of IT Operations and Head of Business Intelligence and Data Analytics in their respective roles. You will provide technical support for Database and other IT systems including liaising with external
          vendors, in particular our Managed Service Providers and Core Banking System Vendor. Above all you will contribute to the effective and efficient management of the IT infrastructure and application environments to enable BankVic to provide quality
          financial services to all members, in order to achieve maximum member satisfaction and goodwill.
This is where you come in…
A born problem solver! You’re a bit of a tech nut, analytically and solutions focused you have a solid understanding of programming best practices with a focus on performance tuning and optimisation. Your platform knowledge in the DBA on premise
          and cloud space is supported by full life cycle database deployment, power shell scripting and universal query language proficiencies. You are a strong communicator both written and verbal with a flare for influencing and partnering with key
          stakeholders across the business. You pride yourself on your timely and efficient organisation skills and enjoy working in a fast paced environment. You thrive in an innovative, agile and collaborative team environment where your expertise to
          directly influence will be valued.
You in a nutshell

You bring tertiary qualifications in a Science/ Computer Science or Maths specialisation with 3+ years experience in database administration/support (MCDBA certification preferred)
You have excellent database management technical skills combined with a good knowledge of T-SQL, how APIs work, and cloud based environments.
You have experience in designing, developing and supporting database driven solutions with good understanding of PowerBI, Microsoft Azure Cloud services, and database security.
Your middle name is DataOps and you have strong experience deploying SSIS packages, SSRS reports and SSAS cubes
You are passionate about ensuring your databases are rock solid and always available, no data-loss on your watch!
You have strong stakeholder engagement skills and are used to collaborating in an agile environment
You understand that data is important but it is just a tool that can be used to unleash understanding and insight to create great member products, services and experiences
You want to use that data and work with the team to drive new Machine Learning, AI and robotics capabilities and opportunities

So why BankVic then?
We may be a little biased but we love where we work and we think that’s really important, after all life’s too short not to love what you do everyday. At BankVic we are all about helping our amazing member’s because we truly care about them. What
          makes us different is our people – while we come from diverse backgrounds we are passionate, innovative, collaborative and we are always looking at how we can do things better. We’re not the big guys in banking but that just means there are
          plenty of opportunities to make a real difference. No matter what your background, experience or passion BankVic can offer you rewarding opportunities to develop your career while providing a supportive, close knit and fun culture where you
          get to enjoy where you work and who you work with everyday!
Now the good stuff - we offer competitive salary, attractive perks, banking and insurance discounts, corporate discounts, monthly united social get-together’s, annual flu-shots, paid parental leave, annual volunteer days, community events, reward
          and recognition incentives, flexible work options and genuine career development training opportunities for people who really want to soar. We value reward and recognition and we like to have fun together – so having a great work culture really
          matters to us here.
Role: Permanent - Full-time
Location: CBD Location
To apply for this amazing opportunity please click on the button below.
title: Database & Systems Administrator

Work closely with the engineering team to ensure the highest standards of design, implementation, performance, and security are met.

 What you will need:

Solid software writing skills.
Broad data integration knowledge.

Ability to test and debug code.
Tertiary qualification in a relevant technical subject.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, both oral and written.
