Kubernetes and/OR Go experience would be highly regarded.
 If interested please APPLY NOW or call Will McGreal on 03 8637 7304 for more info
title: Lead Software Engineer

templatetext:
Role TitleEngineers - Reg and Compliance – Institutional – Sydney based
        roles 

 There are 3 positions available in Sydney
  First a bit about ANZAt ANZ, everything we do boils down to ‘why’ – our purpose – to shape a world where people and communities thrive. We're just as focused on seeing
        our people thrive as well as our customers. We'll give you every opportunity to develop your career.We are responding faster to changing customer requirements, focusing on the things that matter the most, energising our people, eliminating
        waste and reducing bureaucracy.ANZ has started to move to a new way of working, leveraging agile practices. To understand more about this new way of working and if this role is right for you, we strongly encourage you to take a look at The ANZ Way vimeo channel        where you’ll find ‘The ANZ Way’ animation and the ‘New Ways of Working’ animation. At ANZ we aim to create an inclusive environment where employee differences such as gender, age, culture, disability, sexual orientation, family and
        caring responsibilities and religion are valued.  Role OverviewInstitutionalThe Institutional domain will deliver full end-to-end world class products and services
        to our global Institutional, Corporate and Commercial and Retail customers across Asia. It will incorporate capabilities across areas of Investment Banking, Trading and Sales, Cash Management, Wholesale Lending and Trade Finance and with a single
        view of a customer to better integrate business and technology in creating a seamless customer experience.The domain will lead digital transformation in areas such as trade and supply chain management to create a seamless customer experience. Regulatory and ComplianceProvide
        and maintain regulatory reporting, surveillance and compliance support services to enable ANZ to comply with its regulatory obligations. Engineer design, build, test and support applications and / or underlying bank infrastructure.
        They work closely with squad members to ensure outcomes meet customer expectations. What does a 'day in the life' look like

 Enables continuous delivery practices to increase delivery speed
 Works in collaborative teams to build innovative solutions
 Utilises tools and practices to build, verify and deploy solutions in the most efficient ways, enhancing tech division capabilities
 Implements a culture within the Tribe and the Chapter, encouraging best practices around reviews, quality and documentation
 Contributes to Engineering communities, meetups and conferences to promote technology development culture and practices
 Provide ongoing support for platforms as required e.g. problem and incident management
 Current ProjectsThe G20 commitment to improve transparency and robustness of OTC markets is leading to a series of market reforms being proposed globally – led by Dodd Frank & Volcker in the
        US and MiFID II in Europe. The regulatory landscape is ever changing. Therefore, it requires seasoned full stack / server-side engineers to critically support the ANZ Institutional business in a fast-paced environment to fulfil their regulatory
        obligations in areas of regulatory reporting, collateral management and trade surveillance. All these will be delivered in an Agile/Scrum fashion with the best possible devops tooling to assist us to move fast safely. The engineers
        will play a big part in our technology roadmapping and be a champion to continuously uplift our technology stack to help solve our ongoing challenging problems in a smarter way. The engineers will also have opportunities to partake initiatives
        to move our systems into Cloud e.g. AWS.  Role Skills and ResponsibilitiesWhat will be in your toolkit

 Have a thirst and willingness to expand knowledge with new technologies bringing benefits into the Tribe
 Experienced in one or more roles previously eg: Front/Back end Engineer, Operations Engineer, Integration Engineer, Infrastructure Engineer, Security Engineer, Service Desk etc
 Ability to triage and diagnose defects/issues 
 Experienced working with operations and architecture groups developing scalable and supportable solutions (desired but not mandatory)
 Understand customer needs to make sound judgments
 Pays attention to the detail and demonstrates problem solving capability to develop and deliver quality solutions
 Understanding of current state landscape and relevant technologies
 Has a broad understanding of how to apply New Ways of Working to their role
  Specialised SkillsCore Skills

 Fluency in at least 2 programming languages including but not limited to Java 8, C#, Python, Javascript, Typescript, Scala, Groovy.
 Deep understanding and experience in distributed computing and building highly performant , secured, event-driven microservices.
 Strong understanding of Design Patterns and ability to build reusable, scalable, decoupled, maintainable, clean & testable code.
 Self-starter and ability to work collaboratively in a highly autonomous squad team environment delivering values & wins to our customers at speed.
 Extensive experience and knowledge of:

 Spring Boot, Spring Framework, Hibernate
 Event streaming/ middleware / big data solutions (Kafka/ Spark/ Hadoop)
 TDD and Testing frameworks (Junit/ Cucumber/ JMeter/ Mockito/ EasyMock/ Selenium) 
 RESTful API and GraphQL.
 CI/CD (Bamboo / Jenkins / Maven / Gradle) 
 Agile methodologies (Scrum / Kanban / XP)
 Infrastructure as code – experienced with containerisation, config and orchestration tools (Kubernetes/ Ansible/ Chef/ Puppet)

 Highly Desirable Skills and Experience

 Industry exposure and experience with public cloud offerings (AWS, GCP, Azure)
 Ability to build responsive, user centric, testable webapps
 Java and Javascript / Typescript/ AngularJS / ReactJS/ NodeJs / JQuery/ CSS3 / HTML5
 DevOps tooling (Ansible, Puppet, Docker….)
 Capital Markets / Investment Banking development experience
 Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
 Familiar with the financial regulatory landscape (MiFID, Dodd-Frank, Volker, EMIR etc)
  Things in The Squad Member ToolkitThings that I am (or strive to be)

 A team player – I know we only win if we all win. I recognise and value the different perspectives and skills my squad mates bring. It is not about being a hero but jumping in and contributing to the successful delivery of our mission
 The customer’s biggest fan – I demonstrate a thirst for better understanding the customer and define the problem and develop solutions through their eyes
 A collaboration champion – I work closely with my colleagues to ensure alignment and champion the sharing of learning across teams
 Comfortable being uncomfortable – I am comfortable with uncertainty and have the ability to effectively manage myself through ambiguity by making meaning, building relationships and creating clarity with my peers
 Continuous improvement junkie – I constructively challenge the status quo, I look fo r better ways of doing things and passionately advocate continuous improvement
 Committed to my own and other’s growth – I strive to stretch and grow myself and others by identifying my own development areas, seeking feedback and providing feedback to others to help them learn and grow everyday
 A problem solver – I am energised by tackling complex problems. I use my critical thinking, network, skills, knowledge, and available data to drive better outcomes for our customers and the bank
 Commercially and Tech curious – I have a wide-angled lens. I am curious about what’s happening in the external market and in emerging trends and innovations (technological and otherwise) and how we use this information to better inform our decisions
            and actions.
 Risk savvy – I build sustainable solutions that protect stakeholders and customers and proactively address risks by role-modelling improvements in the bank’s overall risk and control environment.
  How I contribute to the ANZ culture (New Ways of Leading)

 Be Curious - I create a learning environment by modelling, encouraging and rewarding curiosity and purposeful experimentation
 Create Shared Clarity – I bring people on the journey, creating a shared understanding of our context, purpose, goals and progress. Even when it’s ambiguous, I create focus and enough certainty to deliver and succeed.
 Connect with Empathy - I listen to, care about and connect personally with people, striving to put myself in their shoes. I have courageous conversations with empathy, which help everyone move forward.
 Empower People – I give people the space and confidence to think, decide
 and act with autonomy, and trust that they can deliver exceptional things with support and encouragement. 
 Grow People Selflessly –I help others to see their potential, grow and be ready for a future that is constantly changing. I challenge myself to do the same.
 ANZ Values

 Integrity – we are honest and fair
 Collaboration – we work together for the customer
 Accountability – we take ownership and get things done
 Respect – we care for all we serve
 Excellence – we challenge ourselves to be better
  Additional InformationVisit our ANZ Life page for more information on how we work at ANZ We’ve also got some great information about what it’s like to work in ‘Data@ANZ’ on our LinkedIn Life
        page We’ve also got some great information about what it’s like to work in ‘Engineering@ANZ’ on our LinkedIn Life page  We work flexibly at ANZ. Talk to us and let us know how this role can be flexible for you. #G4.3-4.2
title: Engineers - Institutional - Sydney

templatetext:
Data Engineer required to build applications to support data science techniques for a digital business. As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for:

partnering with Engineers, Product Managers and Data Scientists to build tools to support the implementation of predictive modelling and ML techniques
assisting with the transition of the business from on-premise to Cloud-based infrastructure
 Required skills:

strong R and Python programming skills, as well as solid experience around databases and web services
experience building data applications, particularly in a Cloud (AWS) environment
experience with AI and ML techniques
 If you have the required skills and experience, click on the 'Apply' button or call Sabina Ahuja on (03)99828478
title: Data Scientist - Machine Learning Engineer

Proficient in C# and SQL

Good team player and open to new ideas

Machine learning, R, Python

Enthusiastic, self-motivated and willing to learn
title: C# Developer - Front Office Trading

templatetext:
2020 Graduate Development Program at the RBA in Information Technology
The 2020 Graduate Development Program in IT at the RBA is designed to support the development of emerging professional talent. RBA IT embraces innovation and works closely with the banking industry, Commonwealth government and foreign central
          banks.
At the RBA our IT Graduates work with leading-edge technologies aligned with industry frameworks. Each IT Graduate is supported through their career exploration by the RBA IT Senior Leadership Team. Our graduate program provides you with four
          rotations in areas including:

Project management and business analysis
Strategy, enterprise architecture and technology innovation management
IT Security – analytical, testing and consulting
Network engineering
Software development – .NET
Mobile Technologies (iOS and Android)
Infrastructure and Operations
Business intelligence – architecture, development and analysis
Collaboration platform development

At the end of the graduate program there are ample opportunities for ongoing employment within these areas.
Our IT Graduates contribute on rotation to major initiatives with impacts for all Australians, including:

the New Payments Platform (NPP), providing real time payments nationwide;
the RBA Business Intelligence platform, holding data to inform economic analysis; and
high profile information security initiatives leveraging machine learning, leading threat intelligence and internal technical expertise to protect our services.

Our recent IT Graduates have also played important roles in the Interbank Innovation Project with the Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco, and our internal innovation events (RBA CodeFest).
2019 IT Graduate applicants must hold or be completing a degree with strong academic achievement in information technology, information systems, computer science, or a closely related discipline. All applicants must be Australian permanent residents
          or citizenship, or New Zealand citizenship. 
The Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) pursues national economic policy objectives and undertakes associated activities in financial markets and banking. It also issues Australia's banknotes and operates infrastructure critical to the payments system.
The Reserve Bank of Australia is an equal opportunity employer.  We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace and encourage applications from experienced candidates seeking workplace flexibility.

templatetext:
The role:
Our client, a Global Mining Company are seeking a Project Manager to plan and execute a number of automation technology projects particularly relating to remote sensing platforms such as unmanned aerial vehicles (drones). Reporting to the Principal
          Advisor for Mining Automation, you will create value for internal customers through the delivery of remote sensing technology and data post processing capabilities.
The skills:

Knowledge and understanding of remote sensing technologies such as drones, underwater or terrestrial platforms.
Ability to work collaboratively with other team members and internal and external stakeholders.
Technical project management and excellent stakeholder engagement skills.
Experience in one or more data post processing techniques for remote sensing applications including photogrammetry, LIDAR analysis or modern machine learning tools
A degree qualification of at least Bachelor’s level in any field or similar experience.

 
If this sounds like you then we would love to hear from you. Apply Now! Or contact Rachael Byrnes or Donna Prince on 07 3319 7537 to hear more.
title: Technical Project Manager - Remote Sensing Platforms (Drones)

templatetext:
Is this you?
 
Experience leading technology and a team?
 
Working with Javascript Technologies and AWS in Enterprise SaaS environments?
 
Time to make your impact, not only in your career but the world around you?
 
If you answered YES to any one of these questions then I want to hear from you!
 
I have here a role here that could make your 2019 and many years to come!
 
The Role:
The role itself is working for an exciting new tech-startup based in the leafy suburb of Surry Hills in close proximity to Central Station.
Now before you go and run and hide thinking not another start-up these guys have done things right! 
 
This is NOT a back bedroom/wishful thinking business idea. 

This is a 5 years in the making R&D process business. 
This is a well funded with both VC and private money business. 
This business has a CEO with a track record taking products from idea to development to building huge market traction around them in this specific arena. 
This is a business who has used Machine Learning to positively transform the medical industry

 
What it all boils down to is this:
This is an ethical business providing solutions for a better world using predictive and Machine Learning technology. 
 
You'll need:

Strong familiarity with Javascript fundamentals 
Extensive experience building Single Page Applications using Javascript frameworks such as Angular.js, React.js, Vue.js 
Knowledge/ understanding of Vue.js 
Experience with AWS (deploy and built environment) 
Experience of leading a small team in Agile Scrum environment 

 
Interested in learning more? Hit apply/connect with me/send me a message!
title: Lead / Senior Software Engineer | Javascript Vue.js | AWS
Data Warehouse Architect
Marketing and Brand Manager - FT/PT - Sydney, AU

templatetext:
Leading government agency seeking the services of a talented Data Architect, the ideal Data Architect will have the responsibility for the Architecture, Design and oversight of Data exchange & integration, data warehouse and
          mining, BI and data analytic solutions.  The role will assist in the delivery of analytics platforms and solutions to meet critical business needs.
The ideal Data Architect will have advanced knowledge of MS BI Toolset is required including: rdbms SQL Server, reporting and analytical services MS SSRS and SSAS, data integration with MS SSIS, Qlik / Qlik Sense and analytic
          tools such as R Studio.
Some exposure to AWS or Microsoft Azure analytics and associated services are desirable as are combinations of the following: AWS S3 / Object Storage, Spark,  Scala, Kafka, ElasticSearch, NOSQL, Machine Learning, Streaming and advanced software
          development skills including Python, C++ and Java


Minimum of seven years of experience in Data Warehouse, Business Intelligence and Analytics.
Knowledge of enterprise grade data and information
Advanced knowledge of MS Data/BI Toolset is required including: rdbms SQL Server, reporting and analytical services MS SSRS and SSAS, data integration with MS SSIS.


Experience with Qlik /Qlik Sense.
Exceptional SQL skills and exposure to other data query and manipulation programing/scripting languages.
Some exposure to AWS or Microsoft Azure analytics and associated services are desirable as are combinations of the following: AWS S3 / Object Storage, Spark,  Scala, Kafka, ElasticSearch, NOSQL, Machine Learning, Streaming and advanced
            software development skills including Python, C++ and Java.
Extensive experience in information and data modelling in a medium to large enterprise.
Assess existing business level information models (conceptual / logical)
Understand legacy environments, particularly Lotus Notes and ADABAS – by working with internal specialists.
Understand Microsoft platforms – Microsoft Dynamics CRM, SharePoint, SQL Server.
Understand Evidence processing platforms NUIX and Ringtail
Develop enterprise models that ensure these new platforms are configured in a manner that enables enterprise wide deployment supporting reuse of business process and data patterns.
An ability to quickly develop a detailed knowledge of our clients application, infrastructure and test environment.
Business Acumen, Issue Resolution, and Critical Thinking.


 
# Data Architect
If you meet the requirements - I would love to hear from you - APPLY NOWTo be considered for the role click the 'Apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Kiernan McNeill on 02 9464 5573.
        Please quote our job reference number: 200184994.

title: Data Architect

templatetext:
Role PurposeMy client is looking for an experienced PM to join their team, to deliver a new data analytics platform. This will enable the business to make more data driven decisions and to permit machine learning, artificial
        intelligence and predictive analysis.   Responsibilities

Manage and deliver concurrent projects, within a program whose capabilities cover: a new data warehouse, data lake, integrations, API gateways, business intelligence, artificial intelligence and machine learning. 
Project initiation - from scope defining to business case development.
End to end project delivery from inception through to the handover to BAU.
 Experience:

5+ years experience managing concurrent projects on an end to end basis. 
Proven experience, successfully delivering: digital, data and analytics projects. 
Used to working across IT, on complex programs of work.
Outstanding communication skills - written and verbal.
Commercial acumen, able to negotiate and manage outcomes with both internal and external parties.
Stakeholder engagement - build buy in and trust.
Understanding of project/program financials - from estimation to costings and actuals.
Proven leadership skills as well as working effectively as part of a broader team.
title: Project Manager - Digital Business Platform

templatetext:
About the Role As an Analyst / Senior Analyst, you’ll support the Advisory business by providing operational excellence and process improvement solutions. You will work with stakeholders across the business to understand and
          document requirements, acceptance criteria, and develop and deliver solutions through RPA, machine learning, and other technical solutions, while developing PowerPoint decks, user guides, process flows, wireframes and newsletters. In providing
          services to our clients you will work collaboratively within teams to solve problems and deliver tailored “and Different” solutions. You’ll also be responsible for:

Assisting the product owner in leading, directing, and reviewing all activities associated with delivering technology solutions
Product quality, project timeliness, and customer satisfaction
Conducting design thinking sessions to gain insights into end user and customer needs
Managing the delivery timelines, working with the product owner to prioritise requirements, define and manage scope and sprints for projects, and communicating any identified project risks and issues
Provides operational support to practitioners and firm clients
Configuring features in production and non-production environments
Engaging with various teams to resolve problems as they arise
Architect, design, build, test and deployment of the RPA and / or machine learning solutions

 Our Deloitte Managed Solutions (DMS) team forms part of our Governance, Regulatory and Conduct Advisory business. DMS focus in managing large scale operational programs, delivering customised operational and technology solutions to our clients.
          In addition, the team provides advisory and consulting on governance, regulatory compliance and retail conduct risks predominantly in Wealth Management, Banking, Credit, Superannuation and Insurance industries.  Qualifications

BA or BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Business Administration, Finance, Accounting, or relevant educational or professional experience
Three (3) years of related experience in a related field
Experience in process design and process improvement
Advanced written, verbal analytical and communication skills
Working knowledge of analytics, data management, statistics, accounting, and computer applications
Strong interpersonal and relationship skills
Ability to coordinate and effectively work with teammates, end-users and leadership
Ability to complete work in an acceptable timeframe, manage a variety of detailed tasks and responsibilities simultaneously. Complete all tasks with accuracy to meet deadlines
Familiarity with agile project methodology

 
Preferred

Experience working on engagements that have incorporated Robotic Process Automation (RPA) with one of the market leading RPA platforms: Automation Anywhere, Blue Prism, and / or UI Path, etc.
Data analysis, reporting, and management languages: SQL, Excel, etc.
Scripting languages: VBA, Python, Perl etc.
Relevant Business Process/Domain Knowledge (Insurance, Banking, Wealth Management, Financial Advice etc.)

About us We pride ourselves on our team of diverse, high performing Deloitte professionals who are talented, supportive, inclusive and social - and who are at the heart of our success. Our aim is to ensure that all our people
          feel comfortable to bring their whole selves to work, and as a result, build a workplace that encourages the true spirit of “making an impact that matters.” Deloitte has received numerous awards for design, innovation and employability,
          including being recognised as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality. From day one at our firm you’ll be considered part of the global Deloitte community and our development and career progression framework will help you develop the skills
          and capabilities that will set you up to succeed - in every sense of the word.  Next Steps If this sounds like an exciting opportunity that aligns with your experience and career goals, we want to hear from you.
          Click “Apply” below and submit your application. The minimum salary requirement for this position is $55 000 inclusive of 9.5% superannuation.
title: LMT Robotic Process Automation Analyst

templatetext:
Experienced Analyst - Professional Services Tech Risk Advisor  We are hiring in Sydney for:  A tech-savvy professional passionate about their personal growth and professional development
          and that of the world’s largest professional services firm. Someone who understands the principles of technology, both core and upcoming, and how these can affect the risk profile of a firm that’s always pushing the envelope as it seeks to make
          an impact that matters.  How, for example, should we respond to and/or be affected by Robot Process Automation, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence and Blockchain? How do we deliver quality in 24x7 managed service context?  Put yourself in the shoes of the teams you are here to assist and advise, understand the myriad decisions they’re having to make, and help them make those decisions with the appropriate quality, uncertainty, and ethical considerations in
          mind.
About The Opportunity Diversity of thought, passion and perspective are incredibly important to us, which is why we’re seeking a type of drive rather than a traditional CV or particular educational background.
 You will join a team of like-minded professionals whose commitment, drive and professionalism will amplify your own; people who excel in their roles because they match their passions. You will be coached and mentored every step of the way,
          get to advise on high profile client projects, learn what there is to know about advisory at the leading edge of the professional world, while also learning to be an advisor in your own right.  You will assist engagement teams as they
          manage reputation, quality, regulatory and risk matters, either directly or in support of a Director. You will support all areas of the Risk Advisory business, but with a growing focus on our Cyber Risk, Data Analytics and technology-driven
          managed service businesses. 
About our team  Risk Advisory helps our clients identify, manage and elevate their preparedness for risk, driving the risk agenda across key areas of the Australian economy.  We work with our clients to offer insights
          and perspective on pivotal issues that impact risk across cyber security and resilience, information technology, data analytics, forensic response, fraud protection, bribery and corruption, workplace health and safety, sustainability, business
          continuity management, project risk, contract risk, major capital projects and more.  Within Risk Advisory, the Quality & Risk function is a team of experienced risk professionals providing commercial solutions to engagement teams
          to manage the risks of doing business and maintain our quality standards.  About The Work  As an Experienced Analyst, you will get to:

Provide advice to help teams and Risk Advisory’s leadership balance practice protection with commercial and competitive requirements.
Engage with teams to build their risk intelligence and quality mindset, while helping to encourage a culture of risk awareness and ownership.
Continuously develop your understanding of the Advisory businesses, risk intelligence, upcoming technologies and the changing nature of professional services.
Supporting a Director in working with teams as they develop new products and services, assisting to identify the key factors for consideration and implement pragmatic steps to address these.
Assist in identifying and mitigating risks to business objectives, including common challenges encountered, new and emergent risks and identifying common areas for improvement.
Support the business in relation to day-to-day professional and service delivery related queries.
Work with our internal specialist teams to identify and manage legal, independence, confidentiality and other key commercial considerations.
About You  You’ll be a perpetually curious person who loves meeting, networking with and learning from people, and who is seeking new challenges.  You’ll also be:

Someone with an insatiable appetite to learn - you stay on top of the news and current affairs, particularly around technology and its application, risk principles and the nature of professional services.
Articulate and confident in your ability to express your ideas clearly.
A quick learner who can easily apply new knowledge and skills in a commercial and pragmatic way.
Keen to develop your understanding of risk management and its practical application.
Proactive and have exceptional problem-solving and investigative skills.
Resilient and able to cope with ambiguity and competing priorities whilst still performing at your best.
Someone who seeks to understand underlying principles rather than overarching process.
Tertiary qualified with relevant work experience.
About us: Deloitte Culture  We pride ourselves on our team of diverse, high performing Deloitte Professionals who are talented, supportive, inclusive and social - and who are at the heart of our success. Our aim is to
          ensure that all our people feel comfortable to bring their whole selves to work, and as a result, create a workplace that encourages the true spirit of 'And different'.  From day one at our firm you’ll be considered part of the Deloitte
          community and our development and career progression framework will help you develop the skills and capabilities you need to succeed - in every sense of the word.  By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global
          Talent Standards. We have designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent & exceptional Deloitte experience globally.  Summary So does our Experienced Analyst role sound like the type of
          opportunity you are after? If so, apply now!

title: IT Business Information Lead

templatetext:
CONTEXT
Aligned to wider functional (HR & Finance) transformation drives and the reduction in core systems diversity across the Group, Shared Services will deliver an increasing footprint of globally harmonised services that are standardised across
          BUs and Functions enabled by critical capabilities including Automation.
PURPOSE
The Automation Superintendent, works with service delivery teams to lead the design, development and implementation of automation solutions including but not limited to native ERP automation, Robotic Process Automation (RPA), Artificial Intelligent
          (AI), Interactive Voice Response (IVR), Chatbots, Optical Character Recognition (OCR), Mobile and Business Process Management (BPM) to drive greater efficiency and quality in the respective processes.
The Automation Superintendent, plays a key role in defining the engagement approach, managing business relationships and is accountable for the execution of automation initiatives; including conducting research and analysis, generating ideas,
          process mapping and building solutions.
WORK OF ROLE (INCLUDING AUTHORITIES AND OUTPUTS)This role will be responsible for executing and maintaining sustainable and scalable Automation programs, including but not limited to the identification and prioritization
          of a range of automation use cases leveraging different but complimentary technologies, the development and deployment thereof as well as maintenance and monitoring of automation solutions. Lead the design, development and implementation
          of automation solutions that meet business objectives, this includes:

Participating in information gathering interviews, brainstorming sessions and workshops with key stakeholders to document current and future state business process and identify appropriate automation use cases and opportunities
Improving current business processes and then applying strategic automation solutions (RPA, AI, BPM)
Overseeing design, development, testing and deployment, working with IM and other appropriate stakeholders to successfully implement and demonstrably improve the process.
Building high quality automation solutions that are intuitive, simple to maintain and drive business outcomes.
Report and track success metrics on a regular cadence.
Ensuring appropriate risk management practices are designed and implemented in automation lifecycle
Design and Implementation of effective preventative and detective controls in the automation lifecycle

Executes initiatives in line with the GSS strategy and direction:

Educates business partners on the strategy by effectively communicating the approach, methodology and benefits
Builds automation solutions to facilitate integration across Regions
Champions the adoption of automation tools with Operational teams
Assists internal and external stakeholders with the embedding and management of change

In partnership with the Digital Operations Manager, manages key relationships with partners to build a strong foundation based on reliable delivery and trust:

Ensures successful transition of solutions to the business for on-going maintenance, operational management and continued improvement
Acts as a key partner and conduit between business and IM

Accountable for the quality of the solution, documentation and adherence to approval processes.
GENERIC TASKS
Health, Safety & Environment:

Demonstrate behaviour in line with health, safety and environmental standards and with the Group’s values
Set the health, safety and environmental expectations for your team and monitor behaviour so that it meets the required standards
Participate in relevant safety audits, inspections and observations, and address issues as part of demonstrating safety leadership

People / Leadership:
Lead the Automation team to ensure that staff are provided with ongoing opportunities for development of skills and knowledge required to perform effectively.
EXPERIENCE

Possesses a university degree in business/commerce, data sciences, engineering, computer science, finance and/or mathematics (graduate level degrees preferred) and/or 3 to 5 years of experience in process design, programming, analytics, finance
            and/or consulting
Experience in programming concepts, particularly in the fields of Robotic Process Automation, cognitive computing and machine learning
Experience with Robotics tools is an asset, e.g. WorkFusion, Automation Anywhere, Blue Prism
Possess knowledge of design and analysis methodologies to work in an agile development environment
Experience working and contributing to project blueprint, building schedules, managing issues/risks, establishing communication plans and stakeholder management

CLOSING DATE: 5 FEBRUARY 2019
Please note the location of this role before applying as this role will be filled on a local employment contract basis with local terms and conditions. Any offer wold be conditional upon the successful candidate having the required work permit issued by the regulatory authority of the country where the role is based.
title: Automation Superintendent

templatetext:
The forth Industrial Revolution will change global societies, industries and economies forever. It will blur the lines between the physical, digital, and biological spheres, advancing technology in areas like robotics, artificial intelligence, machine-based
        learning, nanotechnology & quantum computing.  We’re building solutions that will help shape the fourth Industrial Revolution in Australia and here’s your chance to get involved, join our practice as a Technical Solution
        Architect and leave your legacy!   The Role:   Affix is currently helping a tech startup from within one of the world’s most established and prominent global consultancies scale their practice.
        We have x3 Technical Solution Architect roles available across different locations - Melbourne, Sydney and Canberra.  You will have the opportunity to work across every sector imaginable. Concepting, presenting
        and architecting groundbreaking solutions that will affect the very core of how businesses progress and thrive in the future.  You’ll be working end-to-end across healthcare, public sector, defence, industry & commerce, taking
        ownership of the architecture and design of technology components that form solutions for clients. The solutions in this consultancy typically involve a combination of data engineering, analytics, automated decisioning, integration, cloud and digital channel technology componentisation. So, previous experience in these areas is essential for success in this role.   Who’s the right fit for these roles?   Well loosely, our practice falls into three
        core areas; Digital, Automation & Cloud and Data Analytics. We’re looking for Technical Solution Architects that have a deep knowledge in at least one of these core areas, but an interest in all three.  Ideally, we’re looking
        for people who have architected solutions like advanced data analytics platforms, AI and ML chatbots, virtual agents, real-time web applications and designed cloud solutions in AWS or Azure from scratch. Essential to the role is expertise
        in the following areas:

A solid understanding of digital technologies and data analytics, automation, information management and business process based solutions.
Clear evidence of the ability to architecturally design and deliver ‘leading edge’ data-driven solutions to significant business problems.
Demonstrated knowledge of analytical concepts, including complex data structures
Designing and delivering solutions containing elements of real-time architectures and decisioning (real-time, web, mobile application channels), business process design and orchestration and business rules engines.
Operationalising analytics design, business rules engines and, real-time architectures and decisioning 
One or more of the following: analytical models, data mining and complex queries, predictive analytics, mathematical models, optimisation techniques, statistical analysis, customer analytics, real-time decisioning, event-based communications
            and marketing and business optimisation.
Demonstrated understanding of CI/CD, Testing frameworks and Agile ceremonies
Experience with a range of vendors and tools, namely: IBM Campaign and Interact, Adobe Campaign and Experience Manager, Teradata, Oracle Exadata, Hadoop, IBM InfoSphere Information Server, Revolution R, SAS, Mulesoft, AngularJS, IBM ODM
 What’s in it for you? This is the opportunity to join one of the world’s most influential global business’s but work with the pace and freedom of a start-up. These guys are a super high achieving team and so you’ll be surrounded
        by some of the best people in their field, who all care deeply about the work they’re curating.Of course, there’s so much more to tell you about this role, so if you’re interested to learn more, please get in touch with Sam Rice on sam.rice@affix.com.au
title: Technical Solution Architect - Data Engineering, AI/ML, Cloud (AWS/Azure)

templatetext:
The role
Deakin University is home to three of the country’s leading IT strategic research centres that includes the Pattern Recognition and Data Analytics (PRaDA) Research Centre. The recent Academic Ranking of World Universities placed Deakin in the
          top 1 percent worldwide for Computer Science.
As an Associate Research / Research Fellow, you will be actively involved in the research by contributing to the publications, research project management, research supervision of doctoral/masters students and dissemination through public seminars.
This is a 2 year fixed term contract and will be based in Geelong, Waurn Ponds campus.
To be successful, you will have:

PhD in Computer Science or equivalent qualification
0-5 years of postdoctoral research experience in the area of Machine Learning, which has resulted in publications, conference papers, reports, or professional or technical contributions
a research track record in Machine Learning with a demonstrated ability to plan, initiate and conduct high quality research
experience in contributing to the supervision of undergraduate honours and / or research higher degree students
excellent oral, written communication and presentation skills
strong skills in mathematical optimisation

Your key responsibilities will be to:

conduct research either as a member of a team, or independently (where appropriate), to achieve the objectives of research project(s) which may be assigned from time to time
prepare and develop grant applications relating to the project(s), and contribute to the preparation of research proposal submissions to external funding bodies.
supervise and guide the research effort of junior colleagues
undertake experimental design and operation of advanced laboratory and technical equipment or conduct of advanced research procedures
be involved in professional activities, including (subject to availability of funds) attendance at conferences and seminars in their field of expertise

Culture 
Deakin University is proud to be recognised as an organisation that offers a friendly, supportive and challenging working environment. Our staff are committed to making a genuine difference to people’s lives through excellence in education and
          research.
We acknowledge the importance of providing a dynamic and diverse working environment and offer variety in day-to-day roles as well as professional development opportunities to assist staff to grow and progress their careers.
Deakin University staff have the opportunity to interact with colleagues from a diverse range of cultures and professional backgrounds, all of whom share a common interest in lifelong learning.
Benefits 
We value our staff and understand that they are more than just their jobs, that's why we offer benefits that enhance work life. Some of Deakin’s workplace benefits include:

17% superannuation
flexible work arrangements
discounts with third party suppliers for health insurance, car rentals IT and more

About us 
The flexible learning options we provide our students and our diverse team of professionals and academic experts has enabled us to achieve a 5-star rating by the prestigious university ranking organisation Quacquarelli Symonds. For eight consecutive
          years, we've achieved the highest level of overall student satisfaction among Victorian universities.
The Centre for Pattern Recognition and Data Analytics (PRaDA) focuses on advancing the state-of-the-art in machine learning. PRaDA currently have 24 staff and 21 PhD students. We have projects in areas as diverse as surveillance, advanced manufacturing,
          pervasive health, early intervention therapies, and social media. In the last 5 years the centre has published more than 214 research papers including regular successes in top-tier venues e.g. NIPS, ICML, AISTATS, KDD, ICDM etc. The centre has
          launched/incubated 3 start-ups during the same period. The centre is well-funded from various agencies including ARC, NHMRC, AISRF, ADF etc. For details please visit: https://svethav.github.io/ 
          492382 - Associate Research Fellow.pdf 492382 - Research Fellow.pdf
At Deakin we value diversity, embrace difference and nurture a connected, safe and respectful community.  We recognise that our academic workforce is increasingly diverse with a variety of backgrounds, experiences and responsibilities. In many cases, academic careers can be put on hold through career breaks or part-time work arrangements to take on caring duties, gain experience in other industries, for medical reasons or other personal circumstances.  
Achievement relative to opportunity places more emphasis on the quality as opposed to the quantity of research outputs. In your application, we encourage you to comment on your achievements relative to opportunity.
All applicants must address the Key Selection Criteria and submit a Cover Letter along with the Resume.
Job closes 8 February 2019
For further information, please contact Pallavi on 03 9244 5490

title: Account Executive

templatetext:
Our people are our brand, and they play an active role in shaping and driving our brand with clients and each other every day. In this role, you'll be joining a team of innovative and passionate thinkers and executors.  About our team          Deloitte Assurance and Advisory (A&A) is a national practice that offers assurance, accounting technical, regulatory compliance, treasury services, investment operation and advisory services to some of Australia's largest listed global multinational,
          national and government clients in the market. We are a team of over 1,000 professionals who work collaboratively with our clients to address their needs. We take the time to understand our clients' businesses and the sectors in which they operate
          and to identify major risks and opportunities beyond the traditional financial reporting function.  The Quantitative Finance Solutions is part of Deloitte’s Treasury and Capital Markets Team. The team is dedicated to assisting corporations
          and financial institutions with their challenges related to financial instruments (including derivatives), financial risk management and regulations and bespoke finance/treasury related issues. Quantitative Finance Solutions has a specific
          focus on financial risk management, valuations and quantification of financial consequences. To facilitate and empower the clients to solve the issues, we also design, develop or validate ad hoc tools for them.  About the role          We have an exciting opportunity for a talented tool developer to join our Quantitative Finance Solutions team in Sydney or Melbourne. In this role, we will leverage your knowledge and technical skills to understand client needs, design and develop
          ad hoc tools to provide better solutions to the client.  Key responsibilities:In general, tasks across roles may include:

Design and develop complex and user-friendly models and tools independently
Collaborate with the team to overcome challenges and meet our commitments to the client
Manage stakeholder’s expectation, including communicating with and reporting to internal and external stakeholders
Research and benchmark between options for an optimal solution
This is an excellent opportunity to join a team of intellectually curious and collaborative quantitative professionals. You will be mentored by senior staff members who are directly invested in your development and offer fast-tracked career
            for high performers - promotion is based on performance not on years of service.

About you You are an intellectually curious professional with experience in solution architecture design, machine learning, or user interface development. Any experience in financial services or treasury related field may
          be useful, but isn’t essential. Your strong technical skills with solution design and development coupled with your investigative techniques, analytical and problem-solving mindset and holistic view will set you up for success in this role.
          In addition you will require:

Bachelor or higher degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering/IT or a related field
Demonstrate knowledge of financial markets and financial instruments
Strong quantitative programming skills, including the capability to design and develop sophisticated tools for, such as, data extraction and visualisation, machine learning / optimisation, predicative modelling.
Sound knowledge and experience of two or three programming languages include but not limited to C#, R, Python, MATLAB, SAS, SQL, JavaScript, PHP and VBA.
Sound knowledge and experience of one business intelligence software include but not limited to Power BI, Tableau and QlikView.
Understanding of the professional services and external business environment
General knowledge of business processes, systems, operations and cycle controls and implications on the client and advisory process
Excellent report writing, written and verbal communication skills

Next step If this role sounds like an exciting opportunity to take the next step in your career, we want to hear from you. Click ‘Apply’ and submit your application.  Deloitte culture We pride
          ourselves on our team of diverse, high performing Deloitte Professionals who are talented, supportive, inclusive and social - and who are at the heart of our success. Our aim is to ensure that all our people feel comfortable to bring their whole
          selves to work, and as a result, create a workplace that encourages the true spirit of 'And different'.  From day one at our firm you’ll be considered part of the Deloitte community and our development and career progression framework
          will help you develop the skills and capabilities you need to succeed - in every sense of the word.
title: Quantative Finance Solutions -  Senior Analyst

templatetext:
Classification: Level B/CSalary package: Level B: $98,009-$111,365 plus 17% superannuation Level C: $118,044-$131,402 plus 17% superannuationTerm: Full time, Fixed Term 3 years,
          with a possibility of extension to 5 years and consideration for a tenure-track or continuing position in exceptional circumstances.

Be part of a high-performing project team of 20 academics attacking the challenge of Moral AI
ANU, the place to be: #1 in Australia and in the World's Top 25
Live in one of the cities with the highest quality of life and one
            of the most enjoyable to visit

Position overview
The ANU is launching a major new project on Humanising Machine Intelligence, uniting computer scientists, philosophers, and social scientists in the pursuit of a more ethical future for AI and Machine Learning.
Machine intelligence is already used in innumerable applications that, while not explicitly morally-loaded, have clear and profound social implications, from facial recognition, to the distribution of online attention. It is also used to support
          decisions that have explicit moral dimensions, for example about how to allocate welfare resources, and whom to grant bail or parole. And the application of MI in fully autonomous decision-making systems (robotic and otherwise) is picking up
          pace. Self-driving vehicles, autonomous weapons systems, and companion robots are the first wave of such systems; many more are on the way. Many companies and governments are also heavily invested in developing more general, multipurpose forms
          of AI. All of these autonomous systems must be able to make morally-loaded decisions by themselves.
In each of these fields inadequate attention to ethics in the design of MI systems will predictably have negative social consequences, some of which could be catastrophic. The goal of the HMI project is to forestall those risks, and help to realise
          the tremendous social benefits promised by MI. The project has three components: (1) Discovery: formulate the design problem by identifying the social risks and opportunities of widespread reliance on MI. (2) Foundations: identify and answer
          the fundamental theoretical questions on which progress towards ethical MI depends. (3) Design: develop ethical algorithms and broader MI systems in partnership with industry and government.
The HMI project chief investigators are: Associate Professors Seth Lazar (Project Leader), Colin Klein and Katie Steele (Philosophy), Professors Marcus Hutter, Sylvie Thiébaux, Bob Williamson and Lexing Xie (Computer Science), Dr. Jenny Davis
          (Sociology), Associate Professor Idione Meneghel (Economics), and Professor Toni Erskine (Political Science).
We are looking for up to eight talented academics to help us humanise machine intelligence. Our primary criterion is demonstrated research excellence in a discipline area relevant to the project, and the clear potential to be research leaders
          in their disciplines and in the field of moral AI. An interdisciplinary background is not required, but successful applicants will be ready and equipped to engage with scholars from other disciplines and are expected to work actively with scholars
          from at least two of the project’s discipline areas.
Three of these new academics will be based in the Research School of Computer Science. Within this discipline, we strongly encourage researchers with a wide range of technical backgrounds, including but not limited to computational social choice
          and game theory, decision theory, information theory, logic and automated reasoning, general artificial intelligence, machine learning, optimisation, planning & scheduling, reasoning about constraints & preferences, and reinforcement
          learning. Though these positions will be housed in the Research School of Computer Science, we strongly encourage anyone who meets the selection criteria to apply, regardless of disciplinary background.
Successful applicants will help us design the next generation of more ethical MI systems, in part through publishing internationally influential research in the leading peer-reviewed venues (as suited to their discipline). We expect them to become
          leaders in academia, industry or government. As well as conducting research at the highest level, they will help build the HMI community at ANU and globally, through convening a regular seminar series and international workshops. They will also
          contribute, at a reduced intensity, to the education and outreach agendas of the School, in a manner appropriate to the level of appointment.
Positions are available at academic Level B (Research Fellow) and C (Senior Fellow) and are for an initial fixed-term duration of 3 years with the potential for extension to 5 years following a mid-term project review. For candidates who currently
          hold tenure-track or permanent appointments at universities, industry or government and in other exceptional circumstances, a tenure-track or continuing appointment may be considered.
Candidates who meet the selection criteria for this position may also submit applications to the other postdoctoral positions advertised here and here.
To enquire about these positions please contact Professors Sylvie Thiebaux (Sylvie.Thiebaux@anu.edu.au) or Lexing Xie (Lexing.Xie@anu.edu.au)
Closing Date: 15 February 2019
Position Description:  HMI_CECS Research Fellow_PD.pdf
ANU values diversity and inclusion and believes employment opportunities must not be limited by socio-economic background, race, religion or gender. The University actively encourages applications from women, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander
          people and candidates from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds. Furthermore, it is policy in the ANU College of Engineering and Computer Science to require selection panels to seek a gender balance when compiling shortlists of
          candidates for interview. For more information about staff equity at ANU, visit https://services.anu.edu.au/human-resources/respect-inclusion  
The ANU provides attractive benefits and excellent support to maintain a healthy work/life balance and offers generous remuneration benefits, including four weeks paid vacation per year, assistance with relocation expenses and 17% employer contribution
          to superannuation. This also includes generous parental leave, the possibility of flexible and part time working arrangements, a parental and aged care support program, dual career hire programs, ANU school holiday programs, and childcare facilities
          on campus. For more information, please visit https://services.anu.edu.au/human-resources
Application information
Applicants must apply online via the ANU recruitment portal and should upload the following separate documents:

A detailed curriculum vitae including a full publication list and the names and contact details of at least three referees (preferably including a current or previous supervisor). If your CV does not include referees you can complete these online
            when prompted in the application form.
A statement addressing the selection criteria.
A 1-2 page statement outlining your approach to coursework education and student project supervision.
A 1-2 page statement outlining your research objectives for the next 3 years if appointed.
title: Research Fellow/Fellow

          pace. Self-driving vehicles, autonomous weapons systems, and companion robots are the first wave of such systems; many more are on the way. Many companies and governments are also heavily invested in developing more general, multipurpose forms
          of AI. All of these autonomous systems must be able to make morally-loaded decisions by themselves.
In each of these fields inadequate attention to ethics in the design of MI systems will predictably have negative social consequences, some of which could be catastrophic. The goal of the HMI project is to forestall those risks, and help to realise
          the tremendous social benefits promised by MI. The project has three components: (1) Discovery: formulate the design problem by identifying the social risks and opportunities of widespread reliance on MI. (2) Foundations: identify and answer
          the fundamental theoretical questions on which progress towards ethical MI depends. (3) Design: develop ethical algorithms and broader MI systems in partnership with industry and government.
The HMI project chief investigators are: Associate Professors Seth Lazar (Project Leader), Colin Klein and Katie Steele (Philosophy), Professors Marcus Hutter, Sylvie Thiébaux, Bob Williamson and Lexing Xie (Computer Science), Dr. Jenny Davis
          (Sociology), Associate Professor Idione Meneghel (Economics), and Professor Toni Erskine (Political Science).
We are looking for up to eight talented academics to help us humanise machine intelligence. Our primary criterion is demonstrated research excellence in a discipline area relevant to the project, and the clear potential to be research leaders
          in their disciplines and in the field of moral AI. An interdisciplinary background is not required, but successful applicants will be ready and equipped to engage with scholars from other disciplines and are expected to work actively with scholars
          from at least two of the project’s discipline areas.
Three of these new academics will be based in the Research School of Computer Science. Within this discipline, we strongly encourage researchers with a wide range of technical backgrounds, including but not limited to computational social choice
          and game theory, decision theory, information theory, logic and automated reasoning, general artificial intelligence, machine learning, optimisation, planning & scheduling, reasoning about constraints & preferences, and reinforcement
          learning. Though these positions will be housed in the Research School of Computer Science, we strongly encourage anyone who meets the selection criteria to apply, regardless of disciplinary background.
Successful applicants will help us design the next generation of more ethical MI systems, in part through publishing internationally influential research in the leading peer-reviewed venues (as suited to their discipline). We expect them to become
          leaders in academia, industry or government. As well as conducting research at the highest level, they will help build the HMI community at ANU and globally, through convening a regular seminar series and international workshops. They will also
          contribute, at a reduced intensity, to the education and outreach agendas of the School, in a manner appropriate to the level of appointment.
Positions are available at academic Level B (Research Fellow) and C (Senior Fellow) and are for an initial fixed-term duration of 3 years with the potential for extension to 5 years following a mid-term project review. For candidates who currently
          hold tenure-track or permanent appointments at universities, industry or government and in other exceptional circumstances, a tenure-track or continuing appointment may be considered.
Candidates who meet the selection criteria for this position may also submit applications to the other postdoctoral positions advertised here and here.
To enquire about these positions please contact Professors Sylvie Thiebaux (Sylvie.Thiebaux@anu.edu.au) or Lexing Xie (Lexing.Xie@anu.edu.au)
Closing Date: 15 February 2019
Position Description:  HMI_CECS Research Fellow_PD.pdf
ANU values diversity and inclusion and believes employment opportunities must not be limited by socio-economic background, race, religion or gender. The University actively encourages applications from women, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander
          people and candidates from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds. Furthermore, it is policy in the ANU College of Engineering and Computer Science to require selection panels to seek a gender balance when compiling shortlists of
          candidates for interview. For more information about staff equity at ANU, visit https://services.anu.edu.au/human-resources/respect-inclusion  
The ANU provides attractive benefits and excellent support to maintain a healthy work/life balance and offers generous remuneration benefits, including four weeks paid vacation per year, assistance with relocation expenses and 17% employer contribution
          to superannuation. This also includes generous parental leave, the possibility of flexible and part time working arrangements, a parental and aged care support program, dual career hire programs, ANU school holiday programs, and childcare facilities
          on campus. For more information, please visit https://services.anu.edu.au/human-resources
Application information
Applicants must apply online via the ANU recruitment portal and should upload the following separate documents:

A detailed curriculum vitae including a full publication list and the names and contact details of at least three referees (preferably including a current or previous supervisor). If your CV does not include referees you can complete these online
            when prompted in the application form.
A statement addressing the selection criteria.
A 1-2 page statement outlining your approach to coursework education and student project supervision.
A 1-2 page statement outlining your research objectives for the next 3 years if appointed.
title: Research Fellow/Fellow

templatetext:
Lead Data Scientist - ConsultingCloud-Based AI & Machine Learning 
        
Cognitive Science & Artificial Intelligence division of a management consultancy
Tackle complex business problems across a range of industries
Support senior leadership team as well as manage junior colleagues

This is a new role at a global advisory practice whose focus is transforming the capabilities & performance of enterprises by implementing cognitive technologies and AI.  They are continuously innovating in the use of emerging technology
        and looking at how they can apply/use this technology in the context of business issues.They are now hiring a Lead Data Scientist with a solid technical background who can work closely with the leadership team as well as manage more junior
        data scientists in order to achieve the best results. Responsibilities: 
        
Work closely with internal teams to identify and answer important questions
Set up, maintain, and scale the data analytics infrastructure
Build dashboards that will guide day-to-day operations, planning, and strategic decision-making
Apply statistical models to identify root causes and predict the future performance of tasks, users, and products
Design, run, and analyse experiments
Build machine-learning models that power core operations
You 
        
You have a PhD in a quantitative discipline and/or years of experience as a data scientist
You have deep expertise in applied statistics and/or machine learning
You're proficient in Python, R and/or SQL
Experience working with any of: Spark, Jupyter, Redshift/Hive, Athena/Presto, GPUs/TPUs, deep learning
Experience with setting up and deploying machine learning models in the cloud
The ideal candidate

Has 7+ years of work experience
Is resourceful and a fast learner
Excited to be working in a fast-paced environment with a small and talented team
Experience in large-scale, data-rich environments
Line management experience
To apply or for further information, please contact Zoe Crouch at Talent International: zoe.crouch@talentinternational.com.
title: Lead Data Scientist - Consulting

templatetext:
A global organisation is seeking an autonomous Technical Project Manager to oversee the delivery of automation technology projects. The ideal candidate will have an understanding of remote sensing technologies (eg. drones, underwater or terrestial
          platforms, etc.).
This is an initial 6 month contract opportunity, with a possible extension, based in Brisbane CBD.
Key Responsibilities:

Plan and execute automation technology projects particularly related to remote sensing platforms such as unmanned aerial vehicles (drones).
Create value for internal customers through delivery of remote sensing technology and data post processing capabilities.

Key Selection Criteria:

Able to evidence knowledge and demonstrate an understanding of automation technologies with skills in technology development, technical project management and execution.
A degree qualification of at least Bachelor’s level in any field or similar experience.
End user or developer of remote sensing technologies such as drones, underwater or terrestrial platforms.
Experience in one or more data post processing techniques for remote sensing applications including photogrammetry, LIDAR analysis or modern machine learning tools.
Office 365 skills.
Self-directed (i.e. can decide on a course of action to achieve objectives, without needing step-by-step instruction).
Seeks clarity of tasks, asks questions, knows what is expected of them; energetically approaches challenges.
Written and verbal communication that is clear and concise.
Demonstrates a friendly and engaging interpersonal style.

How to Apply:
To submit your application, in strict confidence, please apply online using the appropriate link. Should you wish to discuss, please contact Kylie Graham on (07) 3258 8380 quoting Reference No. 4A/21727.
Your interest in this opportunity will be treated in the strictest of confidence.
title: Technical Project Manager - Remote Sensing Technologies

templatetext:
This role is based at our office on Austinmer Beach, NSW 
Must have graduated University with a relevant degree (listed below) within the past 2 years 
Intermediate level programming skills in either Python or C++ mandatory 
Competitive graduate salary & attractive benefits on offer 
Successful candidates to commence employment in February 2020

 
About the role:At Tibra you will become an integral part of our team creating and evolving strategies that will trade across the globe. Our quants develop and optimize our world leading algorithms, analyse large volumes of
          real world financial and price information, support our live software, and develop back-testing systems for the optimization and maximization of trading profit.Who/what are we looking for?

People who back themselves to the best and are passionate about global financial markets
Quick thinkers who can work under pressure
Team players and problem solvers
Recent graduates (2 years of completing University) with a degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, Statistics, Mathematics and familiar with software engineering principles & SDLC
Distinction average or higher University grades (WAM/GPA)
Intermediate programming skills in C++, Python or similar
Basic knowledge in quantitative areas (numerical solution techniques, basic signal processing or machine learning, basic knowledge of options pricing, quantitative models, probability theory and stochastic processes) are ideal but not essential
Experience with systematic/automated trading strategies will also be well regarded but is not essential  

Learning and growing:We will give you all the support and training you need to grow and be the best at what you do. In fact Tibra Uni – our in house training program – has been specifically designed and created to facilitate
          knowledge and information sharing. At Tibra, you will have the opportunity to learn in detail about the international financial markets and receive on-the-job training to assist you to develop state-of-the-art applications for our securities
          trading and related businesses.Rewarded for what you contribute:We reward those who successfully deliver against the objectives set for them. Aside from a competitive starting salary our remuneration packages
          also incorporate a number of other really cool benefits that become available after a successful qualifying period. 
Application process:To apply for our 2020 Graduate Program please submit your profile via the link, this must include:

Resume (include past/expected University graduation dates) 
University academic transcript including current WAM/GPA (can be noted on resume) 
Residency status (can be noted on resume) 

*ONLY applicants who have submitted complete applications will be contacted

templatetext:
The CompanyA leading global provider of industrial automation and information products,predominantly to the to the Mining, O&G,Manufacturing and F&B industries.Their offerings include - control systems, industrial
          control components, information software, motor control devices, sensing devices, network technology, safety technology, and industrial security.The RoleThis is a senior role with the succession plan of stepping into the shoes of the Regional Sales Head - APAC. Hence don't be misled by the title

Diverse opportunities can be expected, including engagement in long sales pursuits ranging from US$100K to US$10MM in total value.   
You will be responsible for direct sales that achieve revenue projections for the company's Information Software Solutions business, enabling the company’s comprehensive connected enterprise vision.  
This includes but is not limited to selling scalable analytics and execution and IIOT platform, across Australia. 
Development and execution of the software sales strategy and all sales activities associated with sales opportunities
Collaboration with the Global Sales & Marketing sales teams

The Ideal Candidate Must have prior experience in selling enterprise software subscription sales - IIOT, Analytics | Machine Learning | Enterprise Account Management | Enterprise Agreement Management Candidates with experience in selling to the Mining and O&G industries will be highly regarded 

Bachelor or Master’s Degree in engineering, supply chain, computer science, manufacturing information technology or related discipline preferred; equivalent experience considered
5+ years pre-sales, direct sales or consulting experience
Familiarity with customer centric selling, social selling or equivalent solutions sales processes for selling Software
Familiarity with supply chain concepts, logistics, manufacturing flow and interaction with IT and Manufacturing systems.
Proven technical presentation and interaction skills

What's on offer - Besides being one of the most reputed and leading brands , they are also one of the best pay masters in the industry.This is a senior role with the succession plan of stepping into the shoes of the regional sales head - APAC. Hence don't be misled by the title. If you are a senior professional heading a business who wants to move to a pure high paced sales role, you are welcome to apply. Base salaries in the range of $150K to $200K + Super (14%) + Uncapped commissions + Car  For
          this role and similar roles in the industrial automation / IIOT / MES space, please contact Sachin Satish on sachins@austcorpexecutive.com.au 

To apply please send your CV to Sachin Satish by clicking the 'Apply Now' button below. (Reference Number )AustCorp provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment in accordance with federal and state laws.

Our clients development environment is based around a Java technology stack, utilising Gitlab, Python, RESTful APIs, microservices, Kafka, Cassandra, Postgres, SparkSQL and Tableau.
Development work will range from design and development of RESTful APIs, through the utilisation and enhancement of cutting edge machine learning models to development of streaming services (data pipelines) processing millions of records per day.
          Emphasis on global scaling, robustness and owning the solution from design through to andincluding deployment is paramount.
Essential Skills & Experience:

Experience designing APIs and data-processing intensive services, and an openness to explore multiple programming languages, choosing the right tool for the job.
Writing code for the server and client, leveraging the open source community, and maybe even contributing some code yourself.
Active participation in developing collaborative software engineering and design practices which focus on continuously delivering high quality products (e.g. automated build & release pipelines, pairing, code reviews)
Strong desire to influence the user experience by creating simple, elegant products.

Desirable:

Experience deploying and supporting applications on cloud platforms (AWS preferred)
Exposure to large scale, high traffic online business
Microservices architecture
Ability to troubleshoot and solve complex technical issues

This role will pay $900-950AU/day and has a strong chance of extending past the initial contract period.  If you would like to discuss further, please apply and we will contact you asap!

templatetext:
I am currently recruiting for one of the most interesting clients I have in Australia. A Software House who are solving Cyber Security challenges through the build of complex AI they are currently looking to expand their product development team.
          For that reason I am looking for applications from talented Software Engineers who have fluent coding skills, first class problem solving skills and the ability to deal with complex challenges that often represent a ‘first’ in terms of them
          being unique or not encountered before.    Candidates can be from any level of experience (from recent graduate through to Lead Software Engineer), the common theme with any successful applicant will be the fact that Software
          Development isn’t just your job but more a vocation/passion, something that interests you beyond the hours of your work. You will be joining a team of top quality Engineers so you will have a strong peer network to help contribute to solutions
          and will be led by an experienced Development Manager who specialises in building high performing teams of Software Engineers and who will support you in terms of improving your capability and productivity as an Software Engineer.             Although you will be working on Cyber Security/ AI related projects, commercial experience in either field is not necessary (would be beneficial but is not a mandatory requirement) – what is essential that you have fluency in a programming language
          like Python, Ruby or C++ etc. and have in your work have gone further to gain a more in-depth understanding of the language. My client’s product is largely written in Python but prior experience with Python isn’t essential if you can show the
          ability to learn a new language quickly.    Working on an extremely sophisticated product my clients development environment is Agile and you need to be able to write good clean code that can be integrated with existing CI
          processes and given the data related component of the product then any experience with Machine Learning would be highly desirable as you will both work with and build machine learning algorithms in this role. The ability to think laterally and
          creatively and look at problems through a different lens is crucial as creative problem solving is a key to this role.    It is expected you will have a relevant degree but if you have superb work experience and a track record
          in a related field then you will also be considered. Due to the nature of the work you have to be an Australian Citizen AND be eligible for security clearance.    Based in the heart of Canberra, my client is easily accessed
          by road and rail links, these roles are some of the best you will find in Australia as a Software Engineer. Interviews happening now, start date can be negotiated (early 2019 is fine) and what a way to start 2019! If you are looking to start
          the new year with a challenging new role that will take your skills to the next level then look no further. Apply now to declan.oboyle@indmand.com.au or apply online or call Declan on 0452 411 968 for a confidential discussion.

templatetext:
Software Engineer - UAV Computer Vision x 2 Job Summary: Perform software engineering and computer vision algorithm development on unmanned air, sea, and underwater vehicles. 
        Perform full lifecycle software development in a small team environment.  Duties would include concept development for unmanned vehicle applications, algorithm development, software engineering and field testing.   Duties:

Software and Algorithm development for computer vision, image processing, Machine learning, and data fusion on unmanned air, ground, and sea platforms to enable navigation/sensing in challenging environments. 
Document algorithmic approaches, test results, prepare technical reports, present results, and demonstrate system capabilities to peer review groups, partners, working groups, and sponsors.
    Required Qualifications: 

Prior experience with Computer Vision and/or Machine Learning applications for UAV's (Unmanned Arial Vehicles)
Experience in C/C++ Low Level Algorithms - Autonomous vehicles (Obstacle avoidance)
Experience with 3D reconstruction, Aerial Mapping, SLAM, Pose estimation is essential
