Randstad is currently seeking experienced Blow Mould Technician/ Fitters to work for one of our leading Clients in the Plastics Industry.
Due to business expansion and lots of upgrades our client located in the south eastern suburbs of Melbourne is seeking three blow mould technicians/fitters.
 
 
Day, Afternoon and Night shift
 
Your role will include:

Fitting blow mould dies in machines
Learning basic plastic processing skills to enable a start-up of a blow mould machine that has been changed
Assisting and conducting troubleshooting, fault finding, preventative and corrective maintenance
Learning quality requirements
Keeping machines in a clean condition and reporting faults

 
To be successful for this role you will require:

Mechanical aptitude with previous experience in a hand tool type role (eg. Fitter & Turner, Mechanic or Machine Setter etc)
Previous experience in plastics manufacturing environment
Use of hand tools
Willingness to listen and learn
A willingness to be available for 5 days per week ongoing with occasional weekend work

 
Company Benefits

Very Clean Manufacturing
Tools Provided
Be a part of growing company
Long Term Employment Opportunity
Overtime available
Weekend Work available
Salary Negotiable upon experience ($65-$85k)

 
If you believe you are the perfect candidate for this exciting and rewarding opportunity, hit the APPLY button now! Alternatively, please submit your resume to Diana.mendesduarte@randstad.com.au or Call 9590 2251
At Randstad, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background.

templatetext:
My client delivers next-generation security management technology that enables organizations to protect their most valuable information. My client's Security Management Platform combines unlimited log data collection, advanced behavioral analytics,
          and automated incident response, all supported by a patented Smart Timelines technology that uses machine learning to track identity and behavior over time. The company’s recent industry accolades include Forbes Cloud 100, Inc. 500, and SC Awards
          Europe, among many other distinctions. Position OverviewThis is a very dynamic role where you will provide technical assistance, troubleshoot and resolve customer problems, interface with engineering on various product issues,
          and contribute to projects revolving around tools, knowledge management, our growing market place of solutions, and more.
Within the company you will be given the tools to grow and succeed. Along with delivering success you’ll work within a team of highly skilled engineers with extensive security expertise and will be given the chance to learn Cyber Security, Linux,
          Scripting, Machine Learning and how the enterprise software business works.
Responsibilities



Oversee systems incidents underway to ensure they progress expeditiously
Work continuously towards the improvement of technical and client interactions
The ability to be the principal connection between Customer Success, Engineering and Product Management for ongoing issues and long-term solutions.
Effectively communicate with third parties such as partners and customers regarding technical issues and customers service inquiries, both orally and in writing.
Tackle technical challenges involving CentOS, Docker, ELK stack, virtualization



Qualifications



Experience with Linux is a must
Understanding of regular expressions (Regex) and Python scripting
Knowledge in the following areas is a plus: Perl and shell scripting, Docker, ELK, Hadoop
Ability to isolate problems between hardware and software and provide information to appropriate development team(s)
Highly developed, process-oriented skills for troubleshooting, problem solving, and problem resolution
Superior written and verbal communication skills are a must
Must be able to work in a fast-paced technical environment and sophisticated cyber-security products with frequent product releases and updates
BS/MS in Computer Science or related technical discipline.
Self-motivated with a strong desire to reach your potential and grow your career within this industry leading company while workings towards further opportunities.
title: Success Manager | Cyber Security | Linux | Sydney | Full-Time

templatetext:
Job No.: 587333
Location: Clayton campus
Employment Type: Full-time
Duration: 3 year fixed-term appointment
Remuneration: $86,025 - $92,343 pa Level A PhD (plus 17% employer superannuation)

Be inspired, every day
Drive your own learning at one of the world’s top 80 universities
Take your career in exciting, rewarding directions

Everyone needs a platform to launch a satisfying career. At Monash, we give you the space and support to take your career in all kinds of exciting new directions. You’ll have access to quality research, infrastructure and learning facilities,
          opportunities to collaborate internationally, as well as the grants you’ll need to publish your work. We’re a university full of energetic and enthusiastic minds, driven to challenge what’s expected, expand what we know, and learn from other
          inspiring, empowering thinkers.
The Opportunity
2 Postdoctoral positions are available immediately, to join the newly formed Gastrointestinal Genetics Research Group directed by Prof Mauro D’Amato at the School of Biological Sciences, Monash University. Our team combines genomic, computational
          and pre-clinical expertise to elucidate the pathogenetic mechanisms predisposing to gastrointestinal (GI) disease. The druggable genome, nutrigenetics and host (genome) - microbiota interactions are also new research lines within the group.
          We take advantage of an extremely vast network of international collaboration with academic, clinical and pharma partners worlwide; the ultimate goal of our studies is their translational application for therapeutic precision in gastroenterology.
The Candidate's Responsibilities:
We are seeking a bioinformatician/computational biologist for large-scale genetic, metagenomic and multi-omics research projects, focused on the genetic causes of inflammatory bowel disease, irritable bowel syndrome, microscopic colitis and other
          GI conditions. The successful candidate will be mainly responsible for project(s) involving large-scale data analysis (genomics, (epi)genetics, transcriptomics, metagenomics etc), the intrepretation of results and their communication in scientific
          journals and at international meetings.
The Candidate's Attributes:

PhD in computer science, bioinformatics, biostatistics, genetics, biology or related field, with experience in analysis of large datasets (previous experience of working with large-scale biobank data is considered a special merit)
Experienced user of R/Bioconductor, Python and programming languages. Unix environments and high-performance computing clusters
Demonstrated knowledge of bioinformatic and computational approaches to the study of human genetic diseases, and good understanding of the “biology” behind scientific questions
Computational skills associated with genome-wide analyses (GWAS, EWAS, NGS, miRNA, transcriptomics, metagenomics etc), multivariate analyses, meta-analyses
Additional background in mathematics, statistics, and machine learning is a plus
Team-work attitude, impeccable organizational skills, and previous participation in international research activities/projects/publications
Excellent spoken and written English

This role is a full-time position; however, flexible working arrangements may be negotiated.
At Monash University, we are committed to being a Child Safe organisation. Some positions at the University will require the incumbent to hold a valid Working with Children Check.
Your application must address the selection criteria. Please refer to "How to apply for Monash Jobs".
Enquiries
Prof Mauro D’Amato, School of Biological Sciences, mauro.damato@monash.edu
Position Description
Research Fellow
Closing Date
Thursday 21 February 2019, 11:55 pm AEDT

templatetext:
Full-time, 2 Year Contract
At the South Australian Health and Medical Research Institute (SAHMRI), we are committed to achieving innovative, ground-breaking health and medical research that fundamentally improves the quality of life for all people.
The Lynn EMBL Australia Group at the South Australian Health and Medical Research Institute (SAHMRI) in Adelaide, Australia is now seeking applications for a bioinformatics/computational biology researcher to work on a variety of projects in the
          cancer systems biology and systems immunology areas. Prior experience in at least some of the following areas is essential: analysis of next generation sequencing (NGS) data; network and pathway biology; cancer systems biology; machine learning
          methods and experience in biomarker discovery and validation. Active collaboration and the ability to manage multiple difference projects simultaneously is essential. An initial 2 year full-time contract is available, potentially renewable.
SAHMRI: is a $250 million state-of-the-art medical research facility with excellent core facilities and services, including a high-performance computing cluster. SAHMRI is located in the new $3+ billion biomedical precinct
          in the Adelaide central business district, close to all the amenities of the city. Adelaide boasts a Mediterranean climate, beautiful beaches and is within an hour’s drive of world-class wine regions including the Barossa Valley.
The Lynn EMBL Australia Group: The successful candidate will work as part of a multi-disciplinary team that is equally divided between computational and experimental systems biology. The group is headed by Associate Prof. David
          Lynn, who also heads the SAHMRI Computational and Systems Biology Program, one of 16 research programs at the institute. The group is currently funded by EMBL Australia Group Leader funding, The NHMRC, Cancer Australia, as well as several smaller
          grants and consists of five senior postdoctoral researchers, two research officers as well as PhD and honours students, who employ in vitro and in vivo experimental and clinical models coupled with systems biology approaches
          to investigate cancer and the immune system. On the bioinformatics side, the group leads the development of a wide range of bioinformatics applications including InnateDB.com, an internationally recognised systems biology platform. David has
          also led the computational biology aspects of €12 million European Commission funded cancer systems biology project, which is currently being finalised for publication.
About the Role

Develop new computational methods/approach/software to enable cancer systems biology and/or systems immunology.
Implement and develop efficient pipelines for the analysis of a wide range of multi-omics data and where necessary develop new custom bioinformatics methods and/or pipelines.
Implement machine learning based approaches to identify novel biomarkers of disease.
Provide collaborative support to others in the group/theme with bioinformatics components of their projects.
Lead the writing of publications relating to the projects.
Assist in the smooth running of projects and the wider group (e.g. some light sys admin work).
Contribute to development of competitive funding applications.

About You

A strong track record in bioinformatics as evidenced by prior publications in high impact journals in the field.
Advanced programming skills in several of the following: Python, R, C++, Perl, SQL, Java.
Experience in developing methods for systems biology – particularly in the network biology area.
Prior experience working in genomics/NGS bioinformatics
Demonstrated experience in the downstream integrative analysis of omics data (e.g. pathway, network analyses).
Prior experience working in a high-performance computing environment.
Demonstrated problem solving and communication skills.
Must be highly collaborative, be a strong team player and be able to manage multiple ongoing projects.

Everything we do is underpinned by our core values and our institute is dedicated to grow a culture that pursues, enables and demands research excellence. We are proud of the work we do and work hard as a team to make a positive difference to
          the community.  Our values of Excellence, innovation, courage, integrity and teamwork are what help us achieve our goals. If these are also your values and goals, apply today.
For a copy of the position description and information relating to living in Adelaide, please  click here.
For more information, please contact David Lynn, EMBL Group Australia Leader at David.Lynn@sahmri.com.
Applications close: 5pm, Saturday 9 February 2019
Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are strongly encouraged to apply
SAHMRI is a member of the Athena SWAN Science in Australia Gender Equity program

templatetext:
Together, we can make tomorrow better




5 years fixed term - Optus Chair position including continuing Professor Teaching & Research position
A competitive salary will be offered plus 17% superannuation
Relocation provided for you and your immediate family

Curtin University is ranked in the top 1% universities worldwide (ARWU 2018 and QS World University Rankings 2019), and is placed 20th in the world for universities less than 50 years old (QS Top 50 Under 50 2019). Curtin is WA’s most preferred university, with highly engaged industry-facing partners. Curtin University is a major global player, with well-integrated campuses in Singapore, Malaysia, Mauritius and Dubai. 
Curtin University and Optus Business 
Curtin University and Optus Business have recently formed an alliance to collaborate in research in the Artificial Intelligence field. The focus of the collaboration will be in the impact of artificial intelligence on regional telecommunications,
                higher education and the urban environment. 

The five-year alliance will develop an artificial intelligence research group embedded in the School of Electrical Engineering, Computing and Mathematical Sciences at Curtin University, with strong links to the Curtin Institute for Computation.
                  The alliance will leverage synergies between Curtin’s excellent research, teaching and learning capabilities, and Optus’ market-leading technology and infrastructure capabilities.
Your new role
As the Optus Chair/Professor in Artificial Intelligence, you will play a leading role in leading a team of three Optus Research Fellows, and HDR students focusing on applying artificial intelligence technologies in the key areas. 
Your role is to build algorithms, models and large scale systems that solve problems including but not limited to telco management, transportation, urban planning, real time crowd management, retail intelligence etc. using telco and other
                  data sources. 
You will be involved in the recruitment of the Fellows and Students.
Please review the Candidate Information Booklet.
You will bring to this 


Doctoral qualification in electrical engineering, computer science or relevant discipline to this position. 
Demonstrated leadership of integrated research activity both within and across groups in academic and/or applied research.
Proven record of world-leading research in artificial intelligence, in particular machine learning, including ground-breaking research in internationally visible research projects.
Strong cooperation skills and ability to work in a team; successful candidates are expected to collaborate with colleagues from around the University on applying AI to other disciplines.
An excellent record of obtaining research income, including competitive research grants, industry funding, or other R&D support mechanisms.
An established and significant record of publication in high quality peer-reviewed journals, consistent with leadership in the field, including recent leadership of high impact publications.
Evidence of a leading international reputation and profile, and significant citation indices or equivalent esteem measures, as appropriate to the field.
Proven leadership and mentoring of academic staff in relation to professional development, and significant experience of providing supervision to Higher Degree by Research students.


What we offer you
Curtin University offers a competitive remuneration and benefits package, a friendly and collaborative work environment, generous leave entitlements, flexible working arrangements, a relocation allowance, generous superannuation, salary-packaging
                  arrangements including childcare, and the potential to support dual-career arrangements.
What we need from you
You are encouraged to respond specifically to the selection criteria.
Application close: Apply now to be considered
Please note, screening and interviews may take place prior to the advertised close date.
Valuing Diversity and Inclusion
At Curtin, we are committed to Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander reconciliation, diversity and social justice and aim to create an inclusive environment where our staff and students are valued and inspired. This includes a supportive
                  recruitment process should you require any access assistance.
Curtin University has a bold vision to be one of the leading institutions in the Asia-Pacific region. Curtin is now entering an exciting phase as it focuses on further building its research capacity, and improving its already strong reputation for innovation in learning and teaching.
Explore some more 
https://scieng.curtin.edu.au/schools/electrical-eng-computing-maths/
https://computation.curtin.edu.au/ 

Contact details
To apply complete the application form below, or for more information contact:
Lily Dewse - People Capability Consultant, Faculty Science and Engineering. 
Phone:  +61 8 9266 4774
Email:   lily.dewse@curtin.edu.au
Please do not send your resume via email, apply only via the attached link.
Disclaimer
Curtin reserves the right at its sole discretion to withdraw from the recruitment process, not to make an appointment, or to appoint by invitation, at any time.
title: OPTUS Chair/Professor – Artificial Intelligence

Our client is a fast growing Australian innovative IT consultancy. They develop and deploy automation solutions that radically reduces the time to get their clients products and services to the market.
They offer a full-stack IT consulting service, everything from hardware to the business operations.
This is a new role whose focus is transforming the capabilities & performance of enterprises by implementing AI technologies. They are continuously innovating in the use of emerging technology and looking at how they can apply/use this technology
            in the context of business issues.  They are now hiring an AI - ML lead with a solid technical background who can work closely with the leadership team as well as manage 3 or so engineers in order to achieve the best results.  Duties and Responsibilities:

Need to be familiar with current technologies, concepts and business use-cases.
Hands on enough to build POC (proof of concept) and talk to clients about the relevance of this technology to their environment/industry requirements. 
You will be leading a small existing team of 3 or so engineers who are working in the data platforming side of things and building a practice around this AI and ML for our client. 
With your consulting experience you will be able to build business cases for their clients.
Through and with current trends, help them to identify potential clients and business opportunities
Work closely with internal teams to identify and answer important questions


Design, run, and analyse experiments
Build machine-learning models and present accordingly

 The ideal candidate

Has 7+ years of work experience in the AI and ML fields
Is resourceful and a fast learner
Excited to be working in a fast-paced environment with a small and talented team

Line management experience

In this role you will leverage large amounts of transactional data to drive optimal portfolio initiatives across the entire credit lifecycle. This would include the use of this data to improve the customer experience and manage the credit and
          regulatory risks across the retail bank.

title: Senior Analyst, Portfolio Risk | Sydney | Melbourne

templatetext:
As the world grapples with impacts of road and traffic accidents, increased air travel and the emergence of automated vehicle technology, Seeing Machines enhances safety with camera-based driver monitoring technology. We are seeking the brightest
          minds to help us continue to create and deliver technologically advanced solutions.
About the opportunity
As a key member of our Software Engineering team, you will be responsible for the verification and validation of state-of-the-art Driver Monitoring technology. You will develop testing strategies for computer vision and machine learning algorithms,
          and guide the continuous improvement of automotive-grade testing processes. You will collaborate with world-class Scientists, Engineers, and the world's leading car makers - as we work together to shape the future of
          automotive technology. 
We are seeking people with proven experience to:

write test code in C and C++, running on SoCs and automotive-grade operating systems.
devise testing strategies for complex algorithms
identify, develop and execute manual test cases where automated tests are not appropriate
improve and maintain a sophisticated Continuous Integration system that automates builds, packaging, testing, static analysis, and algorithmic performance analysis
debug and troubleshoot software issues
collaborate on code reviews

 
About you
We value the breadth and depth of experience that our people bring to their work. We are seeking people with a good mix of technical competency and personal capability. 
Specifically, we are looking for people with:

commercial experience developing and testing production-quality C and C++ code
experience developing and testing both low-level and high-level code, from device drivers to high-level applications
competence with Python
experience with ASPICE, CMMI, or equivalent industry standard
an aptitude for solving complex technical issues
well-developed communication skills
a commitment to quality and strong attention to detail 

Our environment
You will work in an innovative environment utilising:

C and C++
Python
FPGA
cross-platform development for Linux, Windows, Green Hills, QNX, Intel, ARM
agile software development using SCRUM
Atlassian engineering tools (JIRA, Confluence, Crucible)
a sophisticated Continuous Integration system that automates builds, packaging, testing, static analysis, and algorithmic performance analysis

 How to apply
To apply, please include an updated resume and a cover letter outlining your interest in the role and how you could make a difference at Seeing Machines.
About us
Seeing Machines is a world leader in driver-machine interaction. We harness human factors science to create artificial intelligence (AI) technology that observes the driver's attention - reliably, unobtrusively, and in real time - and intervenes
          seamlessly when necessary.
Specialised computer vision algorithms underpin Seeing Machines' core camera-based driver monitoring technology. Algorithms allow us to precisely track eye gaze, head position and pupil size while our state-of-the-art AI technology analyses the
          data to quickly and accurately detect driver drowsiness, distraction and microsleep levels. We work with some of the world's leading brands to deliver this technology, helping keep drivers and operators engaged across commercial transport and
          logistics, automotive, aviation, rail and mining industries.
The WHY of our technology
• According to the World Health Organisation, over 1.3 million people die in road accidents, globally. 
• The American Automobile Association says that 1 in every 10 auto accidents in the US is fatigue related and that 25% of US car accidents are caused by distraction. 
• European Commission recommends that camera-based driver monitoring technology be mandated to enhance safety in cars, vans, trucks and buses from 2022. 
• Air traffic is set to double over 15 years and the world's aviation fleet is set to double in 20 years. This creates a huge demand for more pilots and air traffic management which increases pressure on training and safety frameworks for the
          aviation industry, globally. 
• Seeing Machines' Guardian technology for commercial fleets has been scientifically proven to reduce fatigue related driver events by more than 90%.
title: Software Engineer (Test)

templatetext:
This award-winning Consultancy and MS Gold Partner with state-of-the-art offices in the Sydney CBD is seeking the services of a highly experienced BI Consultant to join their exceptional team.  
The successful Principal BI Consultant will use both their design and development skills to manage small-medium sized teams of BI professionals in the implementation of Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence projects across multiple blue-chip
            clients.   
To be considered for this exciting career-growth opportunity, you must possess the following skills/experience.


A degree in IT (Computer Science/Engineering) or similar
Microsoft Certified in Business Intelligence - MCSA / MCSE
1+ years experience in Microsoft Data and Analytics Suite of products, both on-prem and Azure
Previous experience designing and developing ETL processes - use of ETL frameworks
Ideally you will have hands-on experience with Azure SQL Database, Azure Data Lakes
Previous experience with data modelling - Kimball, Data Vault or 3NF
Previous experience working with Tabular cubes, reports and dashboards

templatetext:
UNSW Canberra is a campus of the University of New South Wales located at the Australian Defence Force Academy in Canberra. UNSW Canberra endeavours to offer staff a rewarding experience and offers many opportunities and attractive benefits, including:

One of Australia’s leading research and teaching universities
Australian bush land setting with FREE parking
FREE Onsite GYM, pool and Indoor Sports Centre
A strong commitment to staff development and learning
A strong commitment to work life and family balance
Generous superannuation and salary packaging opportunities
Location: Canberra, Australia

At UNSW, we pride ourselves on being a workplace where the best people come to do their best work
The School of Engineering and Information Technology (SEIT) offers a flexible, friendly working environment that is well-resourced and delivers research-informed education as part of its accredited, globally recognised engineering and computing
        degrees to its undergraduate students. The School offers programs in electrical, mechanical, aeronautical, and civil engineering as well as in aviation, information technology and cyber security to graduates and professionals who will be Australia’s
        future technology decision makers.
About the role

Level A - $91,743 (+9.5% super and leave loading)
Fixed term (12 months)
Full-time

UNSW Canberra has an opportunity for a Research Associate – Trusted Autonomy. You will conduct basic-research in Learning and Reasoning in Swarm robotics at The Trusted Autonomy Lab, University of New South Wales, Canberra Campus,
        Australia. The appointment initially will be for 1 year with performance-based extension up to 3 years.
About the successful applicant
To be successful in this role you will need to have:

A PhD in computer science, electrical engineering, or a relevant discipline.
Published in at least one of the following areas: Reinforcement Learning, Neural Networks, Context Free Grammar, and Grammar Guided Genetic Programming.
Knowledge in Swarm Intelligence, Multi-agent Systems and/or Distributed Ontology.
A demonstrated understanding of physics and calculus.
Good communication skills and ability to interact with a diverse range of students and staff
Demonstrated ability to work in a team, collaborate across disciplines and build effective relationships
Ability and capacity to implement required UNSW health and safety and knowledge of equal opportunity principles

Position Description:  Research Associate - Trusted Autonomy_PD_494671.pdf
You should systematically address the selection criteria listed within the position description in your application. Please apply online - applications will not be accepted if sent to the contact listed.

Prof. Hussein Abbass
E: h.abbass@adfa.edu.au
Applications close: 11:30 pm (AEST), 8th February 2019

        of the Cloud Platforms.    If you are an individual who is skilled in both cloud, specifically Google Cloud Platform (GCP) with a skill set in database (SQL or Oracle), who can bring a unique mix of passion, big-picture thinking,
        practical execution and excellent people skills then please keep reading.      The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 9-12 months GCP administration experience, with the following Pre Requisites:-

Experience of working within a Complex Environment utilising Google Cloud Platform is mandatory

        technologies such as AI and Machine learning. Using your existing Google Cloud Platform and AWS skills to maintain the multi-cloud platform hosting the data lake infrastructure, you will:

templatetext:
Living Guideline Program Manager  Classification HS6  Cochran Australia, School of Public Health and Preventative Medicine  Research Methods  Monash University and Alfred Health  Cochrane Australia          is one of 45 centres worldwide that coordinate the activities of Cochrane at national and regional levels. Cochrane Australia promotes the use of evidence in healthcare decision-making and supports contributors to Cochrane who want to produce
          independent high quality evidence in the form of Cochrane systematic reviews. Cochrane’s principal output is the Cochrane Library which contains a database of over 7500 systematic reviews of healthcare interventions.  The Living Guidelines Program Manager          is responsible for overseeing the delivery of high-quality living systematic reviews and guidelines in support of the new Australian Living Evidence Consortium led by Cochrane Australia. This collaboration is developing a new approach to health
          system performance underpinned by living systematic reviews and living guideline recommendations. The initial members of the Consortium work in the areas of stroke, diabetes, kidney disease and musculoskeletal health.  The Program Manager
          supervises staff and coordinates a range of significant and complex projects that design, produce and maintain living systematic reviews and guideline processes that lead to development of living recommendations.  The Program Manager
          and their team are responsible for delivering evidence synthesis and guideline recommendation outputs for national guidelines, including systematic review protocols; literature searches; incorporation of machine learning classifiers; evidence
          synthesis; development of GRADE evidence decision frameworks; presenting results to multi-stakeholder guideline groups; liaising with stakeholders for expertise and advice; and drafting and finalising reports.  The Program Manager is
          an expert in systematic review methods and evidence-based guideline development. They have expertise in national-scale evidence synthesis and guideline program management, including strategic planning, partnership development and program execution.  Enquiries: A/Prof Julian Elliott M: 0405 704 795  Applications close: 7th Feb 2019
title: Living Guidelines Program Manager

templatetext:
About the Team
 
Our Business Automation team helps clients transform customer experience and operations leveraging Workflow, Robotic Process Automation, Virtual Assistants, Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence. Complemented by our strong digital transformation
          advisory services, we help companies adapt and respond effectively to the challenges of a constantly changing world.
 
About the Role
 
We are looking for exceptional RPA Developers with experience in Blueprism RPA Platform. You will be part of the Automation technical team delivering successful end-to-end automation projects in our strategic customer
          base.
 
What you'll do
 
You will work in Agile teams designing, developing, testing and implementing Robotic Process Automations. You will also assist in assessing automation opportunities, estimating projects and training our clients in managing automations in their
          environments.
 
Desired Skills and Experience
 
You will have the following profile:
 

Project delivery experience using the Blueprism RPA Platform
Structured programming languages eg, .NET/VB/VC++/C++
Experience in Java, Javascript, Python or Pearl desirable
Experience in Agile delivery
Strong communication skills
Degree in Computer Science or Information Technology

 
You must be eligible to work in Australia.
 
What we can offer you?
 
With the support from our global Innovation network, connectivity, end-to-end digital transformation capability and a great team, you will have the unique opportunity to shape & grow with the Capgemini Automation capability, stretching yourselves
          into other RPA Platforms as well as AI and Machine Learning to provide comprehensive solutions for our clients.
 
About Capgemini
 
Capgemini is one of the world's foremost providers of consulting, technology, outsourcing services and local professional services. Present in over 40 countries with more than 180,000 people, the Capgemini Group helps its clients transform in
          order to improve their performance and competitive positioning.
 
Ranked among Ethisphere's 2018 Most Ethical Companies in the Word. Our seven values are at the heart of everything we do - Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Team Spirit, Freedom, Fun and Modesty. If you believe you have "La Niaque" to go the extra mile,
          then apply by submitting your resume and cover letter.
 
Want to know more? To learn more about Capgemini and find out about what makes our people unique, log onto www.capgemini.com.au
 
Proof of work entitlements and visa status will be required prior or at offer time. Successful applicants will be required to complete a Criminal Record and Reference checks prior to commencement of employment.

Develop and maintain code to support infrastructure as a Service in multiple public clouds
Contribute to continuous improvement inc optimisation of Cloud Infrastructure
Provide operational support of cloud infrastructure in multiple public clouds
Lead activity related database design, optimisation and radiation.
    If you are a passionate about taking ownership, enjoy building relationships and are a keen contributor who can work under pressure, then please apply now! You will work in an exciting, continually evolving and changing environment,
        delivering tangible improvements as part of a forward thinking team. URGENT Role. Interviews available this week / immediately.
title: Cloud Solutions Engineer / Architect. Google & AWS

templatetext:
Software Engineer (V&V) - Contract
 
Why ResMed?
Imagine what you could accomplish if you could drive positive change every single day. At ResMed, you can find out. 
ResMed (NYSE:RMD) is a world-leading connected health company with more than 5 million cloud-connected devices for daily remote patient monitoring, changing lives with every breath. As a global leader in connected care, ResMed’s award-winning
          devices and software solutions help treat and manage sleep apnea, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease and other respiratory conditions. Our 6,000-strong team is committed to creating the world’s best tech-driven medical device company - improving
          quality of life, reducing the impact of chronic disease, and saving healthcare costs in more than 120 countries.
We are currently seeking applications for the role of Software Engineer to work as part of our Verification and Validation team located at Bella Vista, Sydney for 12 months’ contract.
Let’s talk about the team and you:
Our DHT V&V team is inspirational. Our mission is to deliver software on time; however, we value quality even more. When things go well we celebrate, when encounter challenges, we learn, we overcome and we improve. We love technology, writing
          codes and training machine to automate our tasks. We focus on delivering new products of the highest quality to our customers and also we love working within global cross functional teams to share our passion. We believe that it’s not just about
          delivering new product to the market; it’s about changing the world and improving people’s lives.
This role is responsible for performing software development, design and testing to support the verification and validation activities in the Digital Health Technology (DHT) web, mobile and cloud applications. It also encompasses working with
          global Product Development (PD) teams in Sydney, San Diego and Halifax. Those applications are designed for clinicians involved in the care and management of patients with obstructive sleep apnea.
Let’s talk about responsibilities:
Reporting directly to Verification and Validation (V&V) - DHT Manager, you will be a natural problem solver with a passion to drive quality of the DHT products. As a Software Engineer with Machine Learning (ML) knowledge, you will be an enthusiastic
          self-starter who can think outside the box and possess the mental agility to make an impact within your role quickly. You will be able to show the ability to learn fast and to work effectively within the team environment.
To succeed in this role, you will have demonstrable experience in performing the following responsibilities in a fast paced environment:

Apply software development skills/techniques and Machine Learning knowledge to the design process for developing high quality and scalable test automation solutions.
Enhance tools/applications for the current test automation framework by applying innovative state-of-the-art software development frameworks and data science solutions.
Propose, define and implement processes and solutions for improved software development.
Resolve complex problems with efficient designs and implementations.
Contribute to the collaborative design reviews and perform test code inspections leading to optimisations.
Collaborate within teams, across business and participate in functional and technical discussions.
Foster the best coding practices within the team, write tutorials, articles and be involved in technical presentations.
Formulate hypotheses, conduct experiments, and propose recommendations for continuous advancements of the test automation framework.
Maintain technical skills and awareness of the state-of-the-art technical advancements.
Willingness to help other engineers, contribute in sharing knowledge and open-minded in learning new technologies/methodologies.
Attention to details and a commitment for excellence.

Let’s talk about Qualifications and Experience:

You will have an Engineering or Science degree such as Software, Computer Science or equivalent.
You will have excellent knowledge and experience of core Java language, Spring framework, micro services and web APIs. 
Exposure to Angular, Spring Boot, JBoss and relational & non-relational databases (preferably MongoDB and SQL Server) is highly desirable. 
Programing experience using Swift, Python or R is a bonus. 
Knowledge in Machine Learning methodologies with hands on experience, such as, classifications, regressions, forecasts and unsupervised learning is highly regarded. 
Experience with cloud services, such as, Google Cloud AI and AWS is desirable. 
Experience with MatLab, Jupyter Notebook, OpenCV (Java) or Deeplearning4J is highly regarded.

OK, so what next?
Joining ResMed is more than saying “yes” to making the world a healthier place. It’s discovering a career that’s challenging, supportive and inspiring. Where a culture driven by excellence helps you not only meet your goals, but also create new
          ones. We focus on creating a diverse and inclusive culture, encouraging individual expression in the workplace and thrive on the innovative ideas this generates. Our hope is that each day you’ll uncover a new reason to love what you do. If this
          sounds like the workplace for you, apply now! 
 
** Please note unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or other third parties will not be considered. ResMed is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all applicants must be legally entitled to work in the country the role is based out of.

Knowledge in Machine Learning methodologies with hands on experience, such as, classifications, regressions, forecasts and unsupervised learning is highly regarded. 
Experience with cloud services, such as, Google Cloud AI and AWS is desirable. 
Experience with MatLab, Jupyter Notebook, OpenCV (Java) or Deeplearning4J is highly regarded.

OK, so what next?
Joining ResMed is more than saying “yes” to making the world a healthier place. It’s discovering a career that’s challenging, supportive and inspiring. Where a culture driven by excellence helps you not only meet your goals, but also create new
          ones. We focus on creating a diverse and inclusive culture, encouraging individual expression in the workplace and thrive on the innovative ideas this generates. Our hope is that each day you’ll uncover a new reason to love what you do. If this
          sounds like the workplace for you, apply now! 
 
** Please note unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or other third parties will not be considered. ResMed is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all applicants must be legally entitled to work in the country the role is based out of.
 
#LI-MC1
title: Vertica Sales Represetative South Pac

templatetext:
Software Engineer (V&V) - Contract
 
Why ResMed?
Imagine what you could accomplish if you could drive positive change every single day. At ResMed, you can find out. 
ResMed (NYSE:RMD) is a world-leading connected health company with more than 5 million cloud-connected devices for daily remote patient monitoring, changing lives with every breath. As a global leader in connected care, ResMed’s award-winning
          devices and software solutions help treat and manage sleep apnea, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease and other respiratory conditions. Our 6,000-strong team is committed to creating the world’s best tech-driven medical device company - improving
          quality of life, reducing the impact of chronic disease, and saving healthcare costs in more than 120 countries.
We are currently seeking applications for the role of Software Engineer to work as part of our Verification and Validation team located at Bella Vista, Sydney for 12 months’ contract.
Let’s talk about the team and you:
Our DHT V&V team is inspirational. Our mission is to deliver software on time; however, we value quality even more. When things go well we celebrate, when encounter challenges, we learn, we overcome and we improve. We love technology, writing
          codes and training machine to automate our tasks. We focus on delivering new products of the highest quality to our customers and also we love working within global cross functional teams to share our passion. We believe that it’s not just about
          delivering new product to the market; it’s about changing the world and improving people’s lives.
This role is responsible for performing software development, design and testing to support the verification and validation activities in the Digital Health Technology (DHT) web, mobile and cloud applications. It also encompasses working with
          global Product Development (PD) teams in Sydney, San Diego and Halifax. Those applications are designed for clinicians involved in the care and management of patients with obstructive sleep apnea.
Let’s talk about responsibilities:
Reporting directly to Verification and Validation (V&V) - DHT Manager, you will be a natural problem solver with a passion to drive quality of the DHT products. As a Software Engineer with Machine Learning (ML) knowledge, you will be an enthusiastic
          self-starter who can think outside the box and possess the mental agility to make an impact within your role quickly. You will be able to show the ability to learn fast and to work effectively within the team environment.
To succeed in this role, you will have demonstrable experience in performing the following responsibilities in a fast paced environment:

Apply software development skills/techniques and Machine Learning knowledge to the design process for developing high quality and scalable test automation solutions.
Enhance tools/applications for the current test automation framework by applying innovative state-of-the-art software development frameworks and data science solutions.
Propose, define and implement processes and solutions for improved software development.
Resolve complex problems with efficient designs and implementations.
Contribute to the collaborative design reviews and perform test code inspections leading to optimisations.
Collaborate within teams, across business and participate in functional and technical discussions.
Foster the best coding practices within the team, write tutorials, articles and be involved in technical presentations.
Formulate hypotheses, conduct experiments, and propose recommendations for continuous advancements of the test automation framework.
Maintain technical skills and awareness of the state-of-the-art technical advancements.
Willingness to help other engineers, contribute in sharing knowledge and open-minded in learning new technologies/methodologies.
Attention to details and a commitment for excellence.

Let’s talk about Qualifications and Experience:

You will have an Engineering or Science degree such as Software, Computer Science or equivalent.
You will have excellent knowledge and experience of core Java language, Spring framework, micro services and web APIs. 
Exposure to Angular, Spring Boot, JBoss and relational & non-relational databases (preferably MongoDB and SQL Server) is highly desirable. 
Programing experience using Swift, Python or R is a bonus. 
Knowledge in Machine Learning methodologies with hands on experience, such as, classifications, regressions, forecasts and unsupervised learning is highly regarded. 
Experience with cloud services, such as, Google Cloud AI and AWS is desirable. 
Experience with MatLab, Jupyter Notebook, OpenCV (Java) or Deeplearning4J is highly regarded.

OK, so what next?
Joining ResMed is more than saying “yes” to making the world a healthier place. It’s discovering a career that’s challenging, supportive and inspiring. Where a culture driven by excellence helps you not only meet your goals, but also create new
          ones. We focus on creating a diverse and inclusive culture, encouraging individual expression in the workplace and thrive on the innovative ideas this generates. Our hope is that each day you’ll uncover a new reason to love what you do. If this
          sounds like the workplace for you, apply now! 
 
** Please note unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or other third parties will not be considered. ResMed is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all applicants must be legally entitled to work in the country the role is based out of.

title: Front End Developer :: React

templatetext:
One of Australia's largest telcos is looking for a Big Data DevOps lead to help them deliver a number of initiatives. The role is a 6 months initial contract, based up in Macquarie Park.
Responsibilities:

Be responsible for managing and delivering Big Data DevOps for all Initiatives
Lead a team of Big Data Specialists, Data Engineers, Designers and Administrators
Manage & Build Big Data Pipelines for Development, Enhancements and improvements projects & initiatives
Be responsible for managing and implementing a pipeline of agile projects. Participate as lead in delivery, deployment, transition, operations and platform management 
Take responsibility for the Big Data Platform and Applications operations support & management, in alignment with application and platform specific SLAs
Work with Business & IT Teams for an effective delivery of Big Data Development and Operations
Enable effective transition of existing and new Big Data & associated skills with in team
Regular review and improvement in Big Data DevOps Processes and quality

Requirements:

Overall 8+ Years of experience in Data Warehousing, Data Management and Big Data
2+ years experience in DevOps Management
2+ years of hands-on experience as lead designer specialising in Big Data related solutions and 2+ years of hands-on experience in Big Data tools such as Scala, Spark, Python and others
Experience with Visualization tools and building of analytical models
Excellent communication skills


To apply please click apply or call Elise Verhoeye on 02 82893256 for a confidential discussion.
title: Big Data DevOps Lead
Principal Consultant - Big Data and Analytics

company: Sirius Technology Sydney part of Sirius People Pty Ltd
templatetext:
Opportunity to work with latest technologies in Big data
A well-defined career path for the right candidate
Great location in the Sydney CBD

We are currently looking for a couple of Senior Big Data Engineers for a team which is rapidly growing. You will get to experience working through projects with great brands and Tier 1 organisation. Innovation is key to the culture; hence we are
          looking for candidates who are innovative and not afraid to change the norm.  Key Responsibilities:

Design and implement data pipelines to facilitate data flow, storage and transformation
Work closely with project teams to understand requirements and contribute at every development stage
Develop, maintain, test and evaluate all big data solutions
Continuous research on providing a robust and reliable management of data for every projects

Essential Skills:

Minimum 5 years’ experience in software engineering role
Extensive experience in Big Data: Spark, Hadoop, Flint, Storm etc.
Hands on experience in AWS: Lambda, Redshift, EMR etc.
Database design and management: Postgres, SQL Server, NoSQL
Solid experience with large data warehouse and data set
Python, NodeJS, Clojure, Haskell
Collaborative and agile environment is a must
Strong problem solving and analytical skillset
Excellent communication skills - both verbal and written

If you are ready for more hands-on role, APPLY now. Call / Email for a confidential chat: Fei 02 9270 5292 / fwong@siriustechnology.com.au
title: Senior Big Data Engineer [2 roles]

salary: Melb CBD, Multiple L/T Contract roles, New Team
templatetext:
NEW YEAR = NEW OPPORTUNITY:  Join a newly established & high caliber Data Engineering team focused on delivering Real-Time Data & Big Data Engineering services across the organisation. Currently we have
        a Multiple (L/T Contract) Big Data Engineer roles available that will see you work in a leading Hadoop environment, building jobs in Python (or Scala). As a Python or Scala Expert you
        will build the connectivity to the data source. You will build jobs to get the data in on a real-time basis. You will be responsible for performance tuning. You will build the tunnel that can cope with Big Data Models.This
        is an End to End Software / Data Engineering role that will see you responsible for Development, Deployment and Testing.You will require deep software Engineering ability and a passion for problem solving & continual
        learning.Essential Skills & Experience:

Very Strong Python / PySpark Software Engineering experience, able to build jobs in Python.
Or Very Strong Scala (on Spark) Software Engineering experience
Spark Streaming Experience
Real Time Data Streaming Exp (Highly Desirable)
Gitlab , Github or Jenkins experience.
Deep Hadoop platform experience.
CI/CD Deployment Experience
End to end Big Data Engineering Exp
Excellent communication & collaboration skills
Experience working in a Agile Environment
Angular.js and DevOps experience will be highly regarded
 This is great opportunity - To apply, please submit your CV via the portal by clicking the APPLY NOW button below.  You can also contact Charlie directly at: cmolino@nbridgeit.com  Charlie
        Molino 0450 253 077 Northbridge IT Recruitment 9-13 Young Street, Circular Quay,  Sydney, NSW, 2000 For this and other opportunities please visit:  www.northbridgerecruitment.com  “We
        encourage people with disabilities and from other diverse backgrounds to apply. We do not discriminate based on disability.”
title: Big Data Engineer, Python or Scala, Spark Streaming, Hadoop

Big Data Engineer
6 months contract
Melbourne CBD location

Design and implement ingest, process and curate solution using Big data technologies

Using big data analytics techniques provide data and analytics output as required to the broader community including business partners in a manner they can understand to ensure communication and buy in.

title: Big Data Engineer
BA with Telecom and Big Data Experience - Melbourne

templatetext:
My client is a global firm undergoing who have a growing data/ information architecture practice. This BU has won son significant programs which need to delivered. They are in need of a high performing Big Data Architect. This role is a permanent
          role and is Melbourne based.  This is a key role for this practice and this person will need to support the BU in their sales activities. This is a high profile role, where you will be a key individual on essential parts of
          a wider program of a serious program of work with one client worth well in excess of $100m AUS. So I looking for Senior, Lead/Principal Consultants, who have a proven track record in high level client/C suite engagement, strategy/management
          consulting, have a proven track record in large transformation projects with a significant Big Data component and have the gravitas and credibility to engage, deliver and provide thought leadership. From an industry perspective
          I am open to applicants from various industries (eg Telco, Retail, Financial Services, Oil and Gas although Government or Utilities would be ideal) as the size and complexity of the projects and programs you have worked on is of more importance.
          Given the senior nature of the role it is expected you have experience with Big Data Architecture and ideally across a range of industries.    Key accountabilities:

Guiding client on the adoption and application of Big Data/Big Data Analytics
Expertise with Hadoop and Big Data Technologies - the role involves coming up with the Big Data Analytics Architecture and Solution Roadmap for clients.
Big Data Distribution technology (e.g. Cloudera) is strongly preferred
Datawarehousing technology (ideally Teradata) expertise
Become a key player in supporting Sales activities and Leading Delivery Engagements
Lead complex consulting engagements
Experience in Informatica / Informatica BDM - Advantage
ting engagements
Build Senior (Board Level) stakeholder relationships
Thorough Understanding of BI/DW broader and specific capabilities, engage with the business to understand their tactical and strategic demands to ensure a culture of quality customer service. 
Develop the techno/functional road-map relating to information and data to ensure business expectations and current and future needs are met. 
 Some skills which are mandatory to have include:

Data Integration, Data Governance, Data Catalog/Lineage 
BI Platforms
Knowledge in one or more of following – MongoDb, Cassandra, Hadoop, NOSQL, Apache Hadoop, Spark, Hive etc
Experience with AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, IBM cloud based Big Data implementations
Enterprise Datawarehouse (EDW) Experience
Several successful SAP BI implementations.
Telco Experience 
 If you are a true Senior in the world of Big Data/ Big Data Analytics where managing programs of work, responsible for revenue, margins and profit as well as people is a key element of your role then look no further. This is the role for you. If
          this sounds like you, please give Declan a call on 0452411968 to have a confidential chat or apply online.

title: Lead Big Data Architect - Tier 1 Consultancy - Sydney c$160-190K Neg

templatetext:
Leading boutique consumer strategy agency mirrors that of a management consultancy and their unique application quantitative analytics means they are growing strong.
They provide powerful insights on how to unlock insights that drive growth for key clients across the FMCG, Telco, Auto, Finance & Retail space.
Variety is the key to this role, where you will have the opportunity to work across a mix of projects - innovation, shopper research, segmentation, value analysis, pricing and new product development. You will be supported by a team that has
            no egos and hands-on leadership.
Quantitative Consultant: 
As a Quantitative Consultant you will manage small accounts end-to-end, managing suppliers, writing questionnaires, data analysis, insights generation, reporting and presenting. You get a kick out of solving meaty client problems and will benefit
            from high-level training, mentorship and fast-tracked career progression.  
Benefits: 

Brilliant team with a great culture
Open planned office – sleek, bright and welcoming
Tailored personal development plans
Flexible working hours
Opportunity to have input into the direction on the business
Great location – good transport links, restaurants & bars
Annual team trips & social trips

To apply, you must have: 

Solid market research /insights/ consumer insights experience (client facing)
Strong qualitative skills – SPSS, Q and excel
A natural ability to solve problems & turn complex data into clear ideas
Passion, smarts, creativeness and a willingness to get stuck into

If you are interested, please send your CV to Emily Moser, emoser@resourcesgroup.com or call me on +61 02 9258 1120.
title: Senior Consultant - Analytics & Big Data

templatetext:
Shape Macquarie’s Big Data Platform
You will join the Data & Analytics team supporting Macquarie’s institutional businesses and work on a variety of Big Data projects.
Your work will be wide ranging covering end to end solution design, development of PoCs, performance tuning of Spark jobs and Hive/Impala queries as well as providing technical guidance to developers.
You will play a key role in defining the technology roadmaps and development standards for the platform.
To excel in this role, you will be:

highly proficient in architecting Big Data solutions
hands on and able to develop Spark jobs, troubleshoot performance issues and perform code reviews
highly proficient in Hadoop and related technologies including Yarn, HDFS, Spark and Hive
proactive and have great communication skills
experienced with AWS (including EC2, S3 and IAM) and Linux
experienced with CI/CD

Some experience with ElasticSearch, Cloudera and reporting tools such as PowerBI would be a plus.
If this role sounds like the right opportunity to further your career, please apply via the link.
The Corporate Operations Group (COG) brings together specialist support services including workplace, human resources, market operations and technology. COG's purpose is to drive operational excellence through business-aligned services with a
          focus on quality, cost and risk. COG comprises the following divisions: Business Improvement and Strategy, Business Services, Human Resources, Market Operations, and Technology.
Find out more about Macquarie careers at www.macquarie.com/careers 
Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common
          is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.
We facilitate a range of flexible working arrangements within our teams. Talk to us about what flexibility may be available.
Our Technology Returner program is an opportunity for you to re-integrate yourself into the workforce following an extended professional career break. Find out more and apply at https://www.macquarie.com/au/about/careers/jobs/returner-program

About Cognizant
Cognizant (NASDAQ: CTSH) is a leading provider of information technology, consulting, and business process services, dedicated to helping the world's leading companies build stronger businesses. Headquartered in Teaneck, New Jersey (U.S.), Cognizant
          combines a passion for client satisfaction, technology innovation, deep industry and business process expertise, and a global, collaborative workforce that embodies the future of work. Cognizant is a member of the NASDAQ-100, the S&P 500,
          the Forbes Global 2000, and the Fortune 500 and is ranked among the top performing and fastest growing companies in the world.
Our Culture
Your passion, integrity and experience are integral to Cognizant's success. You will be welcomed into a dynamic and expanding global leader in IT and Business consultancy where you will be valued for who you are. We take pride in our partnership
          with our clients, so your ability to add value and provide exceptional service to our clients are fundamental to your success. In return, you will be empowered with opportunities and support to develop your career and collaborate with people
          focused on innovation and ideas.
Cognizant is hiring Big Data Tester for Melbourne/ Sydney/ Perth.

Responsible for the various testing process (SIT, Regression and automation) carried out in the Projects.
Hands on testing experience in Bigdata technologies
Participate in the Requirement Understand meetings with Client, Business Analysts, Business Users and Developers.
Preparing and Reviewing the Test Plan and Test Strategy Documents.

Performing defects Analysis, Defects Reporting and driving Defect Triage calls.

Leading the offshore counterparts to identify and fix the issues and to make sure there is no slippage in the deliverables.

Review the test scenarios/Test cases with the client team and ensuring business approval.
Communicate timelines, progress and delivery updates to the client.

Next Steps

title: Big Data Engineer / Architect

templatetext:
CompanyOur Client is a leading proprietary trading firm that is renowned for hiring some of the best technologists in the world to capture financial markets opportunities. They provide google style working conditions
          with the financial benefits of working in financial markets. Due to ongoing growth they require a Big Data Systems Engineer with experience managing Apache Hadoop (Cloudera distribution ideal), strong Linux engineering and scripting skills (Python,
          Java, Bash).  
TeamWorking closely with other Systems Engineers whose remits span Infra, DevOps, Big Data and Integration you'll bring your expertise to bare in a very innovative and agile environment. This "group" are responsible
          for maintaining and enhancing performant, low latency systems in what is a highly automated environment with an emphasis on high availability and tuning of complex trading platforms and related systems. 
Role / Responsibilities:

Analysing and managing Big Data infrastructure.
Developing and extending in-house data tool-kits based in Python and Java.
Consulting and educating internal users on Hadoop technologies and assist them in finding and effectively utilizing the best solutions for their problem space.
Improving the performance of financial analytics platforms built around the Hadoop ecosystem.

 
Requirements:

3+ years of experience managing Apache Hadoop Administration  (Cloudera distribution ideal).
Strong Understanding of Apache Spark and managing/tuning spark application.
Administrative/development experience with Cassandra (or HBASE)
Strong understanding and experience in managing Apache Kafka cluster (10+ nodes)
Experience working with Hadoop SQL interfaces including Hive and Impala.
Ability to design, setup, and maintain highly available systems (including monitoring, security, backup, and performance tuning)
Strong Linux admin skill across multiple distributions with an emphasis on RPM based distros (centos, fedora).
Basic understanding of Docker and Kubernetes a plus.
Java or Python development skills will be beneficial
Unix scripting experience (bash, tcsh, zsh, python, etc)
Experience with DevOps tools such as SALT and Puppet as part of a CI/CD development and deployment process. An industry relevant degree or diploma.

 
#BigData #Apache #Hadoop #Cloudera #Spark #Cassandra #HBase #Kafka #Kubernetes #Linux #Automation #Docker #Python #Java #Puppet #SaltStack #TradingSystems #Performance

templatetext:
Our client, a university, are continuing to develop their capabilities around how they use data. As part of this initiative the university is implementing Big Data and Real-time analytics to ensure that they can use data to solve important business
          problems and enable them to remain as a top-ranking university.
As part of this program they require a Big Data Engineer, who will report to the Senior Applications Programmer in a permanent role. The successful data engineer will develop solutions, platforms and tools to ensure that the university meets its
          strategic agenda by supporting the gathering, processing and managing of large sets of fast, complex data. Developing and delivering a large scale data platform, you will provide technical services to resolve incidents while being involved in
          a variety of IT projects.
 
Key responsibilities:

Design, develop, deliver and support the enterprise’s data driven environment
Design, develop and maintain software and database architectures for large scale processing systems
Identify and implement opportunities for data acquisition
Develop reusable code, libraries, patterns and frameworks so that data produced can be consumed
Perform ETL operations to integrate data from across different systems
Develop processing pipelines for the creation of models, metrics and dimensions to supports business requirements
Work with a variety of stakeholders from across technology and the business to ensure business needs are being met

Key Requirements:

Have a post graduate qualification in Computer Science, Technology, Econometrics or Mathematics, complemented by experience in a Big Data role
Have extensive experience in software development and scripting languages in data processing relevant languages such as Java, SQL, Python or equivalent
Experience consuming data from APIs
Have Nifi experience, having worked in a Hadoop environment previously

 
If you meet these requirements and want to work in a business that vales data and its part in decision making, where you can influence business change through your insights and be at the forefront of how data is used, then please contact me now.
 
For more information please contact Janelle Kelly on +61 3 9949 8102 or forward your details to jkelly@projectresourcepartners.com.au quoting Ref. No AOUL420105
title: Big Data Engineer

templatetext:
The Team and Company
Our client is a Sydney-based technology consultancy with a big focus on People-First culture. Their missions cover the spectrum of consulting, design and delivery, and range from enterprise transformations to startup greenfield development. You
          get to choose your own mission and internal specialisation, and be deployed as a team. You'll be joining a team that feels more like family than work colleagues, as they're equally as passionate about their social activities as their work. 
For these they were awarded Greatest Place to Work in 2018. 
 
Who will a great addition to the company?
Technically, their core strengths are in web full-stack development (JVM technologies), Big Data Processing and DevOps. They are looking to hire T-shape engineering consultants who enjoy being hands-on in the design and implementation of end-to-end
          solutions. You’ll be a great addition to the team if you’re curious in emerging technologies and know how to leverage them to solve complex challenges in enterprise environments. Consulting experience is not a must as long as you have strong
          communication and stakeholder management skills.
 
*Preferred profiles *
Demonstrated in-depth technical ability in one or more of:

JVM related technologies e.g. Java and Scala
Big data architecture and processing technologies
Expertise in containerisation and cloud deployment (Docker, Kubernetes)
DevOps (with strong software development background)

- Strong communication skills and stakeholder management
- Adaptability in different environments (full immersion in client environment)
- Have mentoring interest / ability and a team player (no individual contributors here)
- Application of good engineering practices (e.g. TDD, BDD, proper decoupling)
- Enjoy a challenge
 
Perks

"People-first” means you get to take time off to focus on your professional development
Monthly sharing events, social activities, and annual expedition (as a team!)
Attractive compensation package
Flexible and passionate environment

 
About us | MitchelLake Group
MitchelLake Group has been advising early stage and mature organisations experiencing rapid growth and transformation for over a decade. We believe innovation is at the heart of our future. That is why we provide specialist talent for start-ups and companies in the high-tech space.
MitchelLake Consulting are working on a retained basis and are responsible for all pre-screening of candidates. If this role seems of interest and you believe you have the right skill set, please apply today.

title: Big Data Engineer

templatetext:
Deloitte is the world’s largest professional service firm, with one of the largest and most experienced Analytics and Information Management (AIM) practice We have 400+ specialised consultants in Australia and more than 6,000 practitioners in
          the Deloitte global network. With the ever increasing complexity and volume of data, the rise of in-memory, high performance computing, data discovery and visualisation solutions and the convergence of Big Data and Advanced Analytics,
          organisations are faced with increasing number of choices to ensure they are able to leverage their data assets for maximum advantage. Deloitte is able to draw from its vast global experience delivering complex BI/DW solutions for our clients
          across the full spectrum of technology and business domains to provide the right strategic advice to help an organisation respond effectively to these changes - as well as partner with our clients to execute on our recommendations. About the Role Do you want to be a part of how we help companies utilise their valuable data resources through effective use of the right technology, backed by a clear vision and strong executive sponsorship. This is an opportunity to harness emerging
          technologies and analytical methodologies to solve real world problems. You will be part of a close, collaborative team that identifies and builds solutions that are practical as well as visionary, and that make an impact that matters.
As a Senior Consultant, you will be part of designing and implementing Business Intelligence (Inc. BI & Information strategy, Enterprise BI & analytics solutions and BI organisational design) and Data Management (Inc.
          data architecture & data management, master data management, data modelling, data warehousing, data governance and data quality) solutions for our key clients. You will be responsible for:

Data preparation, transformation and presentation using SQL on several different database platforms - Teradata, Oracle, DB2, Hadoop/similar platforms
Working with the wider business to influence the strategies, architecture & design.
Delivering insights through a range of corporate data sources through the application of analytics, data mining, ETL, Big Data or dashboards and real-time decision making techniques and applications using Tableau/Qlikview/Power BI/Similar
              Tools.
Supporting clients defining their strategy and building internal data governance framework- testing, security, accuracy and consistency.
Provide analysis and consultation on data quality issues for clients, and manage projects for changes to data supply and data quality from conception to completion

 About You You will have:

Experience with Data Warehousing techniques and technologies, with advanced SQL, stored procedures and ETL scripting skills such as Microsoft BI stack, Talend, Alteryx etc.
Fast learner with a real passion for BI technologies who stays current about technology and delivering solutions in integrated data environments.
Exposure to analytics, machine learning, and streaming applications development environment both on premises and in the cloud
Solid experience in BI and Data Management Delivery
Experience of working within a structured project delivery environment, perhaps where AGILE techniques are used.
Experience with Data Warehousing techniques and technologies, with advanced SQL skills
Proven experience with scripting data visualisations with an enterprise BI tool such as Tableau, Qlik, Power BI etc.
Experience of cloud solutions (AWS, Cloudera, Google Analytics/Similar Solutions) which support the transformation of business services provided will be preferred.
Experience of explaining and presenting technical information to non-technical stakeholders.Tertiary qualification in a technical or quantitative discipline.

This is an excellent role for an experienced professional who is looking for an opportunity to build best in class data frameworks and be a part of one of the fastest growing teams in Queensland. About Us: Deloitte Culture  Join a high performing culture of talented people, who are highly motivated and passionate about delivering impactful analytics solutions and insight. We are innovative and different because YOU are… we pride ourselves on our team of
            diverse, high performing Deloitte Professionals who are talented, supportive, inclusive and social - and who are at the heart of our success. Our aim is to ensure that all our people feel comfortable to bring their whole selves to work, and
            as a result, build a workplace that encourages the true spirit of 'And different'. From day one at our firm you’ll be considered part of the Deloitte community and our development and career progression framework will help you develop
            the skills and capabilities that will set you up to succeed - in every sense of the word. At Deloitte, we assume that you perform other roles within your life…you could be a student, a teacher, a passionate hobbyist and a caring family member.
            We recognise the importance of balance and embrace agility, understanding that this means different things to each and every one of our employees. If you have questions regarding this role, the Talent Acquisition Team is available
            to have a confidential discussion. Please contact Aditi Aggarwal via the Our Recruiters section on our careers website.
title: Senior Consultant- Big Data

templatetext:
My client is a global firm undergoing who have a growing data/ information architecture practice. This BU has won son significant programs which need to delivered. They are in need of a high performing Big Data Architect. This role is a permanent
          role and is Sydney based.  This is a key role for this practice and this person will need to support the BU in their sales activities. This is a high profile role, where you will be a key individual on essential parts of a
          wider program of a serious program of work with one client worth well in excess of $100m AUS. So I looking for Senior, Lead/Principal Consultants, who have a proven track record in high level client/C suite engagement, strategy/management consulting,
          have a proven track record in large transformation projects with a significant Big Data component and have the gravitas and credibility to engage, deliver and provide thought leadership. From an industry perspective I am open to
          applicants from various industries (eg Telco, Retail, Financial Services, Oil and Gas although Government or Utilities would be ideal) as the size and complexity of the projects and programs you have worked on is of more importance. Given the
          senior nature of the role it is expected you have experience with Big Data Architecture and ideally across a range of industries.    Key accountabilities:

Guiding client on the adoption and application of Big Data/Big Data Analytics
Expertise with Hadoop and Big Data Technologies - the role involves coming up with the Big Data Analytics Architecture and Solution Roadmap for clients.
Big Data Distribution technology (e.g. Cloudera) is strongly preferred
Datawarehousing technology (ideally Teradata) expertise
Become a key player in supporting Sales activities and Leading Delivery Engagements
Lead complex consulting engagements
Experience in Informatica / Informatica BDM - Advantage
ting engagements
Build Senior (Board Level) stakeholder relationships
Thorough Understanding of BI/DW broader and specific capabilities, engage with the business to understand their tactical and strategic demands to ensure a culture of quality customer service. 
Develop the techno/functional road-map relating to information and data to ensure business expectations and current and future needs are met. 
 Some skills which are mandatory to have include:

Data Integration, Data Governance, Data Catalog/Lineage 
BI Platforms
Knowledge in one or more of following – MongoDb, Cassandra, Hadoop, NOSQL, Apache Hadoop, Spark, Hive etc
Experience with AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, IBM cloud based Big Data implementations
Enterprise Datawarehouse (EDW) Experience
Several successful SAP BI implementations.
Telco Experience 
 If you are a true Senior in the world of Big Data/ Big Data Analytics where managing programs of work, responsible for revenue, margins and profit as well as people is a key element of your role then look no further. This is the role for you. If
          this sounds like you, please give Declan a call on 0452411968 to have a confidential chat or apply online.

Marketing Platform
Lots of Employee Perks
Functional Programming

          is part of a team and works in the midst of it - from trainees through to management.ABOUT THE ROLE

You are responsible for the optimisation and development of the existing stream-event processing solutions.
You will provide data from various sources for user analyses and at the same time ensure that high quality data is provided.

In addition to development, you are also responsible for the deployment, monitoring and operation of software solutions.
You will use the gained knowledge to develop more robust existing and new data flows.
The already existing complex structures do not deter you, but attract you.

You have several years of professional experience as a big data engineer.
