You are using AWS or other cloud-based services and have already modeled solutions for big data services.
You can connect concrete topics with terms like Hive, Hadoop or S3.
You have the ability and willingness to integrate in existing complex structures and to develop these further.
You have a university degree in the field of computer science or a comparable qualification.

Health and wellness initiatives
Employee Share Scheme
Technology allowance
Company end of quarter training and events
Staff awards program

templatetext:
Our client is a global SaaS platform with a large focus Big Data Solutions with some of the best technologies available on the market. Due to a significant growth across their Sydney team, they now require a senior resource to step
        into a key position as Senior Big Data Engineer to help deliver cutting-edge Big Data solutions. This role will see you work through a range of programming language experiences including Clojure, Haskell, NodeJS and Python as the
        business applies cutting-edge technologies to various problems we are looking to solve.You also should have worked in an agile environment and are familiar with agile methodologies like Scrum, Kanban etc.To be considered we are looking
        for people with the following skills and experience: Must have qualifications:

5 years of relevant commercial software experience
Bachelor's degree, equivalent experience or demonstrable aptitude.
A keen interest in the latest software engineering technologies.
Relational database design and management; SQL Server, Postgres, and/or AWS Redshift.
extensive hands-on experience with AWS services such as (Kinesis streams, Lambda, EMR, Redshift) big data processing technologies like Apache Spark, Apache Beam, Storm, Flink and Hadoop.
Knowledge of alternative data store systems ("NoSQL")
Strong background working on large scale Data Warehousing and Data processing solutions.
Strong experience in Big data processing technologies like Apache Spark, Apache beam, Storm, Flink or Hadoop map reduce.
Functional programming experience would be viewed favorably, but is not a requirement.
Comfortable in a pair programming and collaborative engineering environment.
Ability to anticipate the future requirements of a system and possible failure states.
Experience with Amazon Web Services.
Clear communicator of complex ideas.
Experience working in an agile environment.
 BENEFITS

Working alongside some of the best and brightest software engineers
Competitive Salary
Health and wellness initiatives
Employee Share Scheme, which means all employees have a financial stake in the business
Technology allowance
Company end of quarter training and global events 4 times a year
Staff awards program
Generous staff referral program
Job-related training in-house and allowance for external training applications/contributions
title: Senior Software Engineer - BIG DATA

templatetext:
Showcase your Data Analytics skills to derive critical insights that further enhance the running of our SaaS Software
Push outside your comfort zone and join a team of talented senior technical experts designing, building and supporting world class SaaS
With 14 offices in six countries, more than 1000 employees, 14 software products and a comprehensive range of preconfigured solutions, it's easy to see why TechnologyOne is a leading ERP software provider



How you'll make a difference...

As a SaaS Data Analyst you’ll be responsible for driving the delivery of analysis & intelligence on our SaaS operations and business. From this you will derive pivotal insights that our Senior Leaders will use to make critical decisions, whilst
          enabling operational teams to exceed established SLAs for customers. 


What you'll be doing...



Providing advanced business intelligence and analysis that informs stakeholders across operations, finance and executive leadership, focusing on cost, capacity and optimisation
Exploring and evaluating new technologies and solutions to push our capabilities forward
Working with and educating all cloud teams to demonstrate the value SaaS data analytics provides in supporting them to deliver an awesome service
Collaborating with senior stakeholders and architects



Your talents…




Strong background in data analytics or business intelligence, ideally with knowledge and experience in AWS and big data including EMR, Insights and data pipeline
Advanced skills in Tableau, Excel, and R/Python or similar 
An ability to look at seemingly disparate and unrelated data and drawing it together to deliver amazing business intelligence
Exceptional communication skills and a continual desire to be an active contributor; you're not afraid to stand up and share your ideas


Who we are...

TechnologyOne (ASX:TNE) is Australia's largest enterprise software company and one of Australia's top 150 ASX-listed companies, with offices across six countries. We create solutions that transform business and make life simple for our customers.
          We do this by providing powerful, deeply integrated enterprise software that is incredibly easy to use. Over 1,000 leading corporations, government departments and statutory authorities are powered by our software
We pride ourselves on providing our people with earned recognition through career progression, competitive salaries and a supportive environment. We double in size approximately every 5 years so career opportunities abound. Everything is about
          to change. Are you ready?
 
For more information on this opportunity; contact Adam Petterson +61 7 3167 7981
 
We value creativity, innovation and people with an entrepreneurial spirit. See us in action at Hack Day.

*Please note you must hold permanent working rights for Australia to be eligible to apply for this position.

company: Cognizant Technology Solutions Australia Pty Ltd
templatetext:
About Cognizant
Cognizant (NASDAQ: CTSH) is a leading provider of information technology, consulting, and business process services, dedicated to helping the world's leading companies build stronger businesses. Headquartered in Teaneck, New Jersey (U.S.), Cognizant
          combines a passion for client satisfaction, technology innovation, deep industry and business process expertise, and a global, collaborative workforce that embodies the future of work. Cognizant is a member of the NASDAQ-100, the S&P 500,
          the Forbes Global 2000, and the Fortune 500 and is ranked among the top performing and fastest growing companies in the world.
Our Culture
Your passion, integrity and experience are integral to Cognizant's success. You will be welcomed into a dynamic and expanding global leader in IT and Business consultancy where you will be valued for who you are. We take pride in our partnership
          with our clients, so your ability to add value and provide exceptional service to our clients are fundamental to your success. In return, you will be empowered with opportunities and support to develop your career and collaborate with people
          focused on innovation and ideas.
Mandatory Skills:

Excellent communication skills and ability to interact with all levels of end users and technical resources
Strong technical and analytic skills to solve complex big data problems
Experienced with Spark software stack, Prior experience in working on Spark and PySpark based Big data implementations
Experience in Java Technologies
Worked hands on Python, Scala, PySpark, Spark core, Spark SQL, and Spark Streaming
Experience with technologies including – Hadoop, HBase, Hive, Flume, Kafka, Nifi and Analytics
Desirable to have hands-on with Analytics algorithms like Bayesian Algorithm, decision trees, regressions, random forest, neural networks, genetic algorithms etc and knowledge of R, Python, SAS and Spark ML.
Should have experience of using working on NoSQL data stores like HBase, Cassandra, and MongoDB etc.
Good understanding of map reduce type programming.
Familiar with Cloud deployments
Knowledge/Proficiency with BI and advanced visualization tools

Duties and Responsibilities:

Will be responsible for leading full lifecycle of a big data solution from requirements to deployment i.e. requirements analysis, platform selection, technical architecture design, application design and development, testing, and deployment
Mentoring/coaching team members on design and technical skills

Qualifications & Certifications:

10 + years’ experience with 2+ years in executing Big Data projects
Bachelors or Masters in Engineering or equivalent
Cloudera certified Hadoop Developer or Horton Works certified Spark Developer

Next Steps
If you would like to express interest in role, please click on the APPLY button now. Due to a high number of applicants, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for a further discussion within 3-5 business days. We thank you for taking interest
          in this opportunity with us. For a complete list of opportunities with Cognizant visit http://www.cognizant.com/careers.
Cognizant is committed to providing Equal Employment Opportunities. Successful candidate will be required to undergo a background check.

templatetext:
One of our government clients based in Canberra is looking for a highly experienced and committed Senior Data Engineer. 
About the role:
The role of the Data Engineer will be to develop the code and processes to ingest data into the data lake and transform it into useable, conformed data sets ready for analysis and reporting. 
Key skills/experience: 

Demonstrated expertise building and optimising big data pipelines, architecture and data sets.
Demonstrated successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large and disconnected data sets.
Significant technical and/or analytical knowledge and experience using contemporary data analytical tools including Power BI, Spark, MapR, Jupyter notebook, Streamsets and Python.
Experience and ability to work within an agile and/or DevOps team environment.
Ability to work with minimal supervision
Utilise contemporary tools and platforms (such as SQL, Python, R, Hadoop, Spark, or Apache Drill) to deliver products for data and statistical analysis.

How to apply
Due to new privacy laws regarding the collection and handling of personal information, all applications must be submitted online. Once you click on the “apply for this job” button below you will be directed to our Online Centre
          where you will have the opportunity to read and agree to our Privacy and Collection statements and it will allow your details to be formally lodged and processed correctly.
Please note: Only Australian Citizens or Permanent residents will be considered for this role.
Alternatively, if you would like more information on the role, please contact Ankit on 02 6103 1803 or via email on Ankit.Trikha@modis.com
 
Modis is a national professional services company with global capability. Our committed and talented professionals have delivered world class IT and business consulting services across a wide range of industries. As a member of
          global professional services group Adecco, we offer world-class employment opportunities.
 
Modis is committed to all forms of workforce diversity and we invite and encourage applications from women and indigenous Australians.
title: Data Engineer (Big Data Specialist)

templatetext:
Ideal opportunity for a Big Data Designer in the Cyber-security industry. Permanent and North Sydney based, the Big Data Designer will be working with cutting edge technologies to provide the most innovative and creative big data solutions on
          Hadoop platforms. 
A passion for all things data in as absolute must as well as a strong interest for Cyber-security.
Main responsibilities:

Provide design input into further developing the employer's principal advanced security platforms and offerings.
Up skill team members in the domain of Big Data platforms and development.
Act as a thought leader and provide input on Big Data architecture and design across the business.
Provide input into data management design.
Run customer workshops
Constant maintenance of Hadoop knowledge, data handling technique, cyber telemetry, intelligence platforms, log feeds and emerging technologies
Maintain knowledge and awareness of current threat trends and security technologies.

Requirements:

Deep understanding of the various open source projects that constitute a comprehensive big data platform.
Extensive experience with supporting large production Hadoop platforms - not only end using
Commercial use of Spark and a great understanding of its functionality
Experience with the Elastic stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash and Kibana)
Experience designing, creating, optimising and troubleshooting batch ETL processes.
Experience building and supporting high velocity streaming ingestion frameworks.
Experience with SQL-based datastores (experience with NoSQL is a bonus)
The ability to architect and design both streaming and batch use cases in a big data platform.


To apply please click apply or call Camille Vachon on +61 2 82893158 for a confidential discussion.

title: Big Data Engineer

templatetext:
Deloitte is the world’s largest professional service firm, with one of the largest and most experienced Analytics and Information Management (AIM) practices. We have 400+ specialised consultants in Australia and more than 6,000 practitioners in
          the Deloitte global network. With the ever increasing complexity and volume of data, the rise of in-memory, high performance computing, data discovery and visualisation solutions and the convergence of Big Data and Advanced Analytics,
          organisations are faced with increasing number of choices to ensure they are able to exploit their data assets for maximum advantage. Deloitte is able to draw from its vast global experience delivering complex BI/DW solutions for our clients
          across the full spectrum of technology and business domains to provide the right strategic advice to help an organisation respond effectively to these changes - as well as partner with our clients to execute on our recommendations. About the Role Do you want to be a part of how we help companies utilise their valuable data resources through effective use of the right technology, backed by a clear vision and strong executive sponsorship. As a Big Data Director, you will play
          the role of a domain expert in data transformation, working with senior client stakeholders and able to provide strategy and transformation consultancy to clients across diverse industries and domains. You will be responsible for designing
          and implementing Business Intelligence (Inc. BI & Information strategy, Enterprise BI & analytics solutions and BI organisational design) and Data Management (Inc. data architecture & data management, master data management, data
          modelling, data warehousing, data governance and data quality) solutions for our key clients.  You will be responsible for:

Play an evangelist role on how to leverage data engineering and business intelligence for our clients by using cutting edge data science applications across industries
Work with clients to define their strategy and building internal data governance framework- testing, security, accuracy and consistency
Manage teams responsible for Data preparation, transformation and presentation using SQL on several different database platforms - Teradata, Oracle, DB2, Hadoop/similar platform
Working with the wider business to influence the strategies, architecture & design.
Delivering insights through a range of corporate data sources through the application of analytics, data mining, ETL, Big Data or dashboards and real-time decision making techniques and applications using Tableau/Qlikview/Power BI/Similar Tools.
Provide analysis and consultation on data quality issues for clients, and manage projects for changes to data supply and data quality from conception to completion

About You You will have:

Solid experience in BI and Big Data Management Delivery
Business Development and client management experience.
Must have managed mid to large data teams.
Experience of working within a structured project delivery environment, perhaps where AGILE techniques are used.
Experience with Data Warehousing techniques and technologies, with advanced SQL skills
Proven experience with scripting data visualisations with an enterprise BI tool such as Tableau, Qlik, Power BI etc.
Experience of cloud solutions (AWS, Cloudera, Google Analytics/Similar Solutions) which support the transformation of business services provided will be preferred.
Experience of explaining and presenting technical information to non-technical stakeholders.
Tertiary qualification in a technical or quantitative discipline.

This is an excellent role for an experienced professional who is looking for an opportunity to build best in class data frameworks and be a part of one of the fastest growing teams in Queensland.  About Us: Deloitte Culture          Join a high performing culture of talented people, who are highly motivated and passionate about delivering impactful analytics solutions and insight. We are innovative and different because YOU are… we pride ourselves on our team of diverse,
          high performing Deloitte Professionals who are talented, supportive, inclusive and social - and who are at the heart of our success. Our aim is to ensure that all our people feel comfortable to bring their whole selves to work, and as a result,
          build a workplace that encourages the true spirit of 'And different'.  From day one at our firm you’ll be considered part of the Deloitte community and our development and career progression framework will help you develop the skills
          and capabilities that will set you up to succeed - in every sense of the word. At Deloitte, we assume that you perform other roles within your life…you could be a student, a teacher, a passionate hobbyist and a caring family member. We recognise
          the importance of balance and embrace agility, understanding that this means different things to each and every one of our employees.  If you have questions regarding this role, the Talent Acquisition Team is available to have a confidential
          discussion. Please contact Aditi Aggarwal via the Our Recruiters section on our careers website.

title: Senior Big data Developer

templatetext:
Join Australia’s most progressive technology-led Investment Bank and lead the transition into next generation data platform and analytics.
As an experienced Lead Data Engineer with excellent problem-solving and leadership abilities, you will bring your expertise in large scale data analytics, with a keen interest in Financial Services.
You will work alongside and lead a group of dynamic technologists that are responsible for developing and maintaining data warehouses and play an integral role in our long-term data strategy. These components are used by our business and integrate
          with downstream processes that need our data.
You will provide technical leadership to a team that runs the existing data warehouse solutions and leads an effort to migrate those systems to a modern data platform. Working closely with business users to understand and implement their data
          requirements, you will be working in a fast-paced agile environment. Our strong geographically-dispersed data management and analytics team will provide expertise in existing platforms and supported businesses.
Key to your success in this role will be your experience with new data technologies and willingness to mentor and cross-train staff. We anticipate that to excel in this role you will have strong leadership and communication capabilities as well
          as hands on development experience in:

Scala and/or Java or Python
data intensive development techniques will be invaluable. (e.g. streaming, complex event processing, map reduce etc.).
data processing technologies like Spark, Flink, Beam
data visualisation and data wrangling tools (Power BI, Alteryx etc.).
experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Openshift, GCP)
whilst an understanding of Financial Services industry domain, with exposure to Trading or front-to-back banking processes, is a nice to have, it is not a requirement of the role
experience with Microsoft Business Intelligence Stack (SSAS, SSIS, SSRS) is also beneficial.

If you have the drive and experience to lead a highly dynamic and diverse group apply now or contact Leandro.Casas@macquarie.com for more information.
The Corporate Operations Group (COG) brings together specialist support services including workplace, human resources, market operations and technology. COG's purpose is to drive operational excellence through business-aligned services with a
          focus on quality, cost and risk. COG comprises the following divisions: Business Improvement and Strategy, Business Services, Human Resources, Market Operations, and Technology.

title: Data Engineer

templatetext:
Data Engineer Objectives and ScopeThe objective of this project is to operationalise environmental data (some of it collected in near real-time) to support decision making at a range of operational
        and strategic levels within Government and key external stakeholders. This work involves the rapid ingestion of environmental data (rainfall, streamflow, water quality) in near real-time, and developing work flows to inform and support decision
        makers. Key program outputs include flash flood warning capability within ESA, early alert to conditions conducive to blue-green algae outbreaks and catchment modelling to inform land planning. You will work between multiple business units, data
        providers and other stakeholders to achieve completion of deliverables within tight timeframes.The core tasks for a Data Engineer would be as follows:   DMS tasks

Ingest data from multiple data sources across the Territory into the Data Lake (dependent on access becoming available).
Develop dashboards to provide basic visualisation of the data for end users, and provide accessibility (download) of data
Develop an interface to allow the aligning of datasets by space and time to support end user data analysis
Develop an automated annual report of water resources in the ACT (Jupyter).
 Linking DMS to catchment model tasks

Ingestion of key datasets that are fundamental to Source model operation (eg. Digital Elevation Model, landuse data)
Work in collaboration with eWater Ltd to establish the SOURCE model on a cloud-based infrastructure
Work in collaboration with eWater Ltd to establish model version control (Git-LFS)
Work in collaboration with eWater and CoDE to establish data pipelines from the Data Lake to the SOURCE model (APIs)
Ingest results from the SOURCE model into the DMS via APIs
Create, in collaboration with eWater Ltd, dashboards for displaying results of the SOURCE model
Create automated reports using data from within the Data Lake using Jupyter notebook
Interact and engage with key stakeholders (eg. strategic planning, EPA) in the design and implementation of data visualisation and access tools.
 Duty Statement/Position DescriptionThe role of the Data Engineer will be to develop the code and processes to ingest data into the Data Lake and transform it into useable, conformed data sets ready for analysis and reporting. 
        We will trust you to:

Develop, maintain and test infrastructures for data generation including optimising data pipeline architecture, data flows, data storage and access.
Design and develop scalable code for the extraction, transformation and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using contemporary big data technologies (such as StreamSets, Talend, Spark or Scoop).
Keep data separated and secure across multiple clusters in accordance with agreed data governance practices.
Utilise contemporary tools and platforms (such as SQL, Python, R, Hadoop, Spark, or Apache Drill) to deliver products for data and statistical analysis.
Maintain appropriate open source and internal source code repositories, such as TFS Git and GitHub.
 We are targeting candidates with:

Demonstrated expertise building and optimising big data pipelines, architecture and data sets.
Demonstrated successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large and disconnected data sets.
Significant technical and/or analytical knowledge and experience using contemporary data analytical tools including Power BI, Spark, MapR, Jupyter notebook, Streamsets and Python.
Evidence of ability to collaborate with multiple partners in delivering a project (end users, eWater, Water policy and Catchment Management).
Experience and ability to work within an agile and/or DevOps team environment.
Ability to work with minimal supervision
 You need to have:The ability to work legally in Australia without visa sponsorship now or in the future.  If this sounds like you:Apply! Or drop me a line on rnour@infopeople.com.au.
        If we believe you're a good match, we'll get in touch with you to let you know the next steps!Infopeople - Rajaa Nour

enterprise data modelling

Established in 2004, Catapult BI, a subsidiary of Dialog Information Technology, is one of Australia’s leading Business Insight consultancy firms specialising in data warehousing, data management, data integration,

Catapult BI’s experienced practitioners are passionate about data and empowering organisations to maximise the business value of their corporate data assets and information holdings.  Catapult BI employees
          have a balance of understanding in both business and technical aspects of data management.
Together with competitive salary and benefits package, Catapult BI offers career development through diverse projects and training/mentoring within a team environment where communication, learning and knowledge are shared and
          prized.

templatetext:
At nib, we support our people to be extraordinary and do extraordinary things. We admire diversity of thought and seek out people with an intrinsic need to make the world a better place. We offer a range of awesome employee benefits including
          discounted health insurance and corporate gym memberships. 
Our Business Intelligence division promotes a culture driven by innovation and leading edge technology, along with the opportunity to work on some major cloud based transformation projects and initiatives allowing you to play a key role in the
          team’s ongoing success.
This position will be instrumental in providing relevant, efficient and governed data services using data warehousing and other information storage techniques to support nib in making informed data-driven business decisions.
What you'll do

Partner with business stakeholders to assess and understand business needs
Extract, transform and load data into data warehouse structures suitable for storage, reporting and analysis
Design and develop tailored data structures that enable fast access to data, ensuring minimal impact on the business
Ensure that data warehouse environments contain timely and accurate data and are operating at optimal efficiency
Monitor the performance and contribute to the optimisation of data warehouse processes and technologies
Utilise automation technologies to ensure that regular data warehouse processes require minimal manual intervention
Support business users, including analysts, to access data through documented data structures and assist with query design

About you

Relevant degree qualification in Information Technology or Computer Science
Broad Business Intelligence and Data Warehousing knowledge (across customer facing and technical delivery)
Experience implementing ETL technologies in an enterprise environment
IBM DataStage experience along with any experience with ‘big data’ tools and cloud technologies
Understanding of data structures and query languages
Advanced SQL query development, MS SQL Server and/or IBM Informix (ideal)
Advanced data warehouse design and development and MS SQL Server (ideal)

Interested to join our team? 
Submit your interest by submitting your resume and a cover letter telling us a little more about you.
nib is an EEO employer and promotes diversity in the work place.

You'll be joining a team that feels more like family than work colleagues, as they're equally as passionate about their social activities as their work.  They were awarded Greatest Place to Work in 2018.   
Who will a great addition to the company?
Technically, their core strengths are in web full-stack development (JVM technologies), Big Data Processing and DevOps. They are looking to hire T-shape engineering consultants who enjoy being hands-on in the design and implementation of end-to-end
          solutions. You’ll be a great addition to the team if you’re curious in emerging technologies and know how to leverage them to solve complex challenges in enterprise environments. Consulting experience is not a must as long as you have strong
          communication and stakeholder management skills.    *Preferred profiles *  Demonstrated in-depth technical ability in one or more of: 

JVM related technologies e.g. Java and Scala
Big data architecture and processing technologies
Expertise in containerisation and cloud deployment (Docker, Kubernetes)
DevOps (with strong software development background)


Strong communication skills and stakeholder management 
Adaptability in different environments (full immersion in client environment) 
Have mentoring interest / ability and a team player (no individual contributors here) 
Application of good engineering practices (e.g. TDD, BDD, proper decoupling) 
Enjoy a challenge 

Perks

"People-first” means you get to take time off to focus on your professional development
Monthly sharing events, social activities, and annual expedition (as a team!)
Attractive compensation package
Flexible and passionate environment

   
About us | MitchelLake Group
MitchelLake Group has been advising early stage and mature organisations experiencing rapid growth and transformation for over a decade. We believe innovation is at the heart of our future. That is why we provide specialist talent for start-ups and companies in the high-tech space.
MitchelLake Consulting are working on a retained basis and are responsible for all pre-screening of candidates. If this role seems of interest and you believe you have the right skill set, please apply today.

To be successful in this role, you will have strong skills and experience in the following:

templatetext:
Full Time Permanent Opportunity
Description
This diverse and challenging role has a focus on providing financial and commercial insights to Sales and Marketing. This involves market share analysis and projections, long-range volume forecasts, competitor analysis, and annual budget planning.
Function Overview  
The Strategy & Analystics team are Dyson’s internal consultancy and are fundamental to the ongoing success of the business: shaping strategy, tactical operational performance and delivering a competitive advantage through actionable insights.
          The team’s focus is on the external market, our competition and our future plans. As business partners to key stakeholders the team supports the short, medium and long term strategy and forward looking planning process. They also provide value-adding,
          timely and high-quality decision-support information, actionable analysis and advice to all levels of the organisation.
Accountabilities      

Support planning and decision-making through analysis and actionable insights
Evaluate consumer and market trends to support formulating short and long term strategies
Present market insights on specific categories at the monthly market review meeting
Work with marketing team to understand the monthly long range plans for volume and marketing spend for specific categories        
Automate data extraction and loading from various sources into Google Cloud Platform to minimise manual interaction
Support the development of new organisational capabilities and drive the Analytics and Big Data agenda within the business
Work closely with the Leadership Team members to provide analytical support for their respective functions

Skills / Experience required
In this role you need:

Experience with SQL, R, Python and Tableau is essential
Advanced MS Excel skills
Minimum four years of analytical experience in financial, strategic and general business management in medium sized or large multi-divisional organization
Ideally with some retail or consumer product industry experience

Benefits Overview    
Dyson Australia monitors the market to ensure competitive salaries. Beyond that, you’ll enjoy an annual bonus. But financial rewards are just the start of a Dyson career. Rapid professional growth, leadership development and new opportunities
          abound, driven by regular reviews and dynamic workshops. And with a vibrant culture, the latest devices and a relaxed dress code reflecting our creative engineering spirit, it’s an exciting team environment geared to fuelling and realising ambition

title: BI Architect

templatetext:
Deloitte is the world’s largest professional service firm, with one of the largest and most experienced Analytics and Information Management (AIM) practices. We have 400+ specialised consultants in Australia and more than 6,000 practitioners in
          the Deloitte global network. With the ever increasing complexity and volume of data, the rise of in-memory, high performance computing, data discovery and visualisation solutions and the convergence of Big Data and Advanced Analytics,
          organisations are faced with increasing number of choices to ensure they are able to exploit their data assets for maximum advantage. Deloitte is able to draw from its vast global experience delivering complex BI/DW solutions for our clients
          across the full spectrum of technology and business domains to provide the right strategic advice to help an organisation respond effectively to these changes - as well as partner with our clients to execute on our recommendations.  About the Role Do you want to be a part of how we help companies utilise their valuable data resources through effective use of the right technology, backed by a clear vision and strong executive sponsorship.           This is an opportunity to harness emerging technologies and analytical methodologies to solve real world problems. You will be part of a close, collaborative team that identifies and builds solutions that are practical as well as visionary,
          and that make an impact that matters.  As a Business Intelligence Consultant, you will assist in designing and implementing Data Management solutions for our key clients, You will be responsible for:

Managing, transforming and querying data to generate real value for the business.
Designing and building MSBI solutions across on-premises and cloud platforms
Delivering insights through a range of corporate data sources through the application of analytics, data mining, ETL, Big Data or dashboards and real-time decision making techniques and applications using Tableau/Qlikview/Power BI/Similar Tools.
Provide analysis and consultation on data quality issues for clients, and manage projects for changes to data supply and data quality from conception to completion

About You  You will have:

Proven experience in BI and Data Management Delivery with strong focus of Microsoft BI.
Experience with Data Warehousing techniques and technologies, with advanced SQL skills
Proven experience with scripting data visualisations with an enterprise BI tool such as Tableau, Qlik, Power BI etc.
Experience of cloud solutions (AWS, Cloudera, Google Analytics/Similar Solutions) which support the transformation of business services provided will be preferred.
Experience of explaining and presenting technical information to non-technical stakeholders.
Tertiary qualification in a technical or quantitative discipline

 About Us: Deloitte Culture  Join a high performing culture of talented people, who are highly motivated and passionate about delivering impactful analytics solutions and insight. We are innovative and different because
          YOU are… we pride ourselves on our team of diverse, high performing Deloitte Professionals who are talented, supportive, inclusive and social - and who are at the heart of our success. Our aim is to ensure that all our people feel comfortable
          to bring their whole selves to work, and as a result, build a workplace that encourages the true spirit of 'And different'.  From day one at our firm you’ll be considered part of the Deloitte community and our development and career
          progression framework will help you develop the skills and capabilities that will set you up to succeed - in every sense of the word. At Deloitte, we assume that you perform other roles within your life…you could be a student, a teacher, a passionate
          hobbyist and a caring family member. We recognise the importance of balance and embrace agility, understanding that this means different things to each and every one of our employees. If you have questions regarding this role, the Talent
          Acquisition Team is available to have a confidential discussion. Please contact Aditi Aggarwal via the Our Recruiters section on our careers website.

templatetext:
The Company
This is a fantastic opportunity for a Manager, Project Consolidation to join one of the biggest banks in the Sydney CBD. 
 
The Role
You will be joining an existing experienced team, supporting the Head of Finance Portfolio & Expense Allocations and the Senior Manager of Project Consolidation and the Project Management Office with regular analysis, forecasting and reporting
          and governance around the ~30 Projects being undertaken by the company. 
 
You will:
Stakeholders Engagement:

Lead and work with project managers and business stakeholders to provide robust project financial profiles, forecasts and insights that support decision making. 
Engage with key stakeholders (e.g. HOF, Head of COO and CFO) to provide regular project financial updates and forward looking insights to call out any early risks/issues and opportunities.
Establish and maintain strong working relationships with stakeholders: business unit finance teams, project/ program managers, Enterprise Investment Services team, and wider stakeholder groups (other relevant business units).

 
Project Consolidation - Reporting and Forecasting:

Prepare timely and accurate finance performance reports, used by senior management across the organisation.
Analysis of financial results leading to actionable advice, identification of opportunities and risk, and maximum benefit realisation
Complete month end activities ensuring compliance and consistency with accounting policies and project guidelines. 
Review balance sheet and fixed asset registers to understand future amortisation/depreciation impacts.
Complete the quarterly finance forecast, co-ordinating with EPF to deliver expected results against tight deadlines.
Prepare half yearly and annual project information for inclusion in the results pack/presentations. 

 
Project Accounting & Support

Support the project streams, and wider BTFG finance times in all project activities as required.
Track actual spend, opex and benefits against target and forecast; identify and communicate any risks/ issues/ opportunities to the financial target/ forecast.

 
Expense Allocations

Support the team during forecast and target setting period to understand the allocation of Group Costs and how those costs are allocated down to business units. Articulate any changes or impacts to the relevant stakeholders. 
Assist team with the input of methodologies in to the Profit Line Allocation tool (PLA) for Group Allocation costs and Business unit to Business unit allocations. 
Support Business Unit teams to understand the drivers of their allocations and how they can directly support in reducing expenses. 
Educate the teams around the use of the PLA tool and work with them through monthly reporting, and quarterly forecasting processes.

 
Continuous Improvement

Actively participate in continuously improving processes, information gathering and advice of the team.

 
Who you are
You will have the following skills and experience:

5+ years’ experience in financial management, preferably in project Finance or financial services.
Strong MS Excel skills essential 
Proven ability to apply knowledge of accounting systems & methodologies.
Excellent relationship management skills with a proven ability to build partnerships with key stakeholders
Understands priorities and key issues for projects
Experience using TM1 and Powerpoint and Clarity

What’s on offer?

Large, well known organisation
Great work culture
6 month contract

templatetext:
·         Opportunity to work in a world class organization 
·         Exposure to global operations, processes and stakeholders 
·         Work in a collaborative and fast paced environment 
·         Based in Brisbane 

About the role
We are looking for a Specialist Analytics Platform Developer to work closely with the IDP Product Manager and Business Analysts and Collaborate within a Development, Security and Operations (DevSecOps) framework to develop and
          deliver quality, performant and rapid-to-market improvements and feature enhancements to the Integrated Data Platform and AWS based cloud applications.
This role is a great opportunity to be at the forefront of the deployment of cloud-based, enterprise-scale data integration and analytics platform for one of the world’s iconic resources companies. Reporting to the Principal Advisor – Analytics
          Enablement, you will:
 

Analysis and assessment of technical requirements, and assessment of compatibility with technical architecture
Design, develop and evolve the technical components of the platforms
Complete the necessary documentation to support the STS process
Ensure escalations of issues, risks and defects are handled appropriately


About you
To be successfully considered for this role, you will have:

3+ years’ experience in an AWS centric technical environment.
Experience with infrastructure as code on AWS
Experience building solutions around AWS PaaS technologies
Knowledge of Agile principles (Scrum, Kanban, XP)
Experience with architectural patterns including microservices, message-based architecture, and event-based architecture
Experience in Big Data platform development (Hive, Python, R, REST) and AWS Services (S3, Kinesis, DynamoDB, RDS, Lambda, EMR, Redshift)
Experience in Visualisation Tools (PowerBI, Tableau, Kibana/Grafana)
Demonstrated Expertise with most of Java, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, YAML, CloudFormation, JSON, SQL, .Net and Python
Experience with test automation frameworks such as PyUnit, Mocha, JUnit, xUnit, and nUnit


Where you will be working
Rio Tinto Information Systems and Technology (IS&T) operates to enable better alignment with customer priorities, end-to-end accountability and flexibility to prioritise critical work. The function provides solutions that are aligned with
          current and future business requirements through the development and ongoing delivery of IT strategy and solution roadmaps. Through appropriate governance, consultative processes, and the use of industry best practices, IS&T also ensures
          that emerging technologies and innovative ideas are constantly evaluated, considered, and adopted, to provide easy-to-use, best-in-class solutions and services.

About us
As pioneers in mining and metals, we produce materials essential to human progress.
Our long history is filled with firsts. We’ve developed some of the world’s largest and best quality mines and operations, and our people work in around 35 countries across six continents. Aluminium and copper, diamonds, gold and industrial minerals,
          iron ore, coal and uranium: our materials make up the world around us. You’ll find them in smartphones, planes, cars, hospitals and throughout your home.
Creating an inclusive and diverse workforce
We are a diverse team of talented, enthusiastic individuals who foster a culture of inclusion. No matter how they may differ, our people share one thing in common. It’s a belief that work is more rewarding when we are accepted and valued for our
          differences, not judged by them. We all have something to contribute, and it’s this contribution that makes for a great organization and fulfilling career.
Apply today if you want to work with the latest technology and innovation, in an environment where we challenge you to drive positive change.  Please note, in order to be successfully considered for this role you must
          complete all pre-screening questions.
 
 “Rio Tinto reserves the right to remove job postings prior to the stated closing date, therefore, if you are interested in applying for this vacancy please submit your application as soon as possible.”
title: Specialist Analytics Platform Developer

templatetext:
About the Company The role will be working with a leading Data & Analytics organisation based in the CBD who are aimed at using Data to drive efficiencies and solutions within the Health-care sector.
          They are heavily research-based, focused on delivering quality over quantity. Working with critical information from within the health-care industry they are aligned to their mission of making the Health industry better within
          Australia. They have multiple products out in the market from Information Management Systems, Payment Solutions and also offer consulting services to clients. You will work internally on a number of their existing systems as
          well as looking for additional services and solutions that can be provided from their data.  About the role In this role, you will work alongside a high performing team of Engineers as well as roles
          across the business such as Data Scientists, Health-care SME's and a team of motivated stakeholders who are trying to improve the Health-care industry using data to drive solutions. They have a number of products used
          across the Health-care sector covering Government, Health Insurance, Private Hospitals, and many other health providers. Their products allow huge amounts of data-sets to be review and identify errors and efficiency improvements for
          Australia. You will have strong core Java skills, experience working in the backend with Cloud environments such as AWS. This will require a "strong engineer" able to solve complex issues and deep dive into issues learning in the
          role. The company has a partnership with many research organisations and is well funded to explore new techniques, in this role you will be able to leverage internal connections to solve problems and use the power of a large support

          proceses, utilising Microsoft's Azure Business Intelligence tools. Key duties will include:

Designing standards, methods and tools, consistent with agreed enterprise and solution architectures.
Design and develop intuitive reports, dashboards, and graphs using Azure Business Intelligence, Data Warehouse and Big Data analytics.
Review and analyze complex, integrated data, models and information from various business systems and Big Data sources using Azure Data Lake, Azure Analysis Services and Power BI Service.
Evaluate new BI Platform software and tools ensuring that software is fit for purpose and aligns with agreed enterprise and solution architectures.

Senior level of expertise and software development experience, designing, developing and supporting various BI products including MS SQL Server 2016, Visual Studio 2016, SSAS - multi-dimensional & tabular and SSIS.
Senior level of MS Azure cloud expertise, designing, developing and supporting various MS products including Azure Data Factory, Azure Blob Storage, Azure Databricks, Azure SQL DB, PowerBI.com.
Senior level of expertise/technical leadership and business skills in the provision of effective Enterprise Data Warehouse environments including systems and database management and support services.
Senior level of expertise and experience using data modelling methodologies such as Kimball; Inmon and Data Vault.

In return our client can offer a professional yet friendly team environment and access to leading edge cloud technologies. For more information, please 'APPLY NOW' quoting reference 4A/21674 or contact Tim Smith on 07 325 88453 for a confidential
          discussion.
title: Principal BI Solution Architect

templatetext:
Opportunity to work on a high impact transformation 
Great team environment  
Sydney CBD Location 

We are currently looking for an Enterprise Data Architect with a demonstrated track record of leading enterprise-wide data architecture initiatives in financial services or government organisations. The primary responsibility of this newly created
          role within the Enterprise Data Management Office is to define and oversee the implementation of the enterprise data architecture. You will assess current state of platforms and processes, analyse key business requirements and data domains,
          formulate data designs, best practices and technical solutions consistent with our technology strategy, data governance framework and architecture roadmap. You will also:

Create and maintain data architecture standards and patterns, conceptual, logical and physical models, interface agreements and design documents.
Design and maintain data structures, models and methods which support business data needs and align data patterns across platforms to the data domain model.
Review new and existing projects for compliance to target data architecture and guide solutions in relation to data integration and data storage architectures.
Define technical information, such as format, structure, residing system and technical rule calculations for data assets across the Bank.
Design and provide support for data storage platforms.

Skills and Experience 

Relevant university degree.
TOGAF or similar accreditation is highly desirable.
DMBOK or equivalent accreditation – highly desirable.
Advanced knowledge of data modelling techniques, including 3NF, dimensional and Data Vault.
Strong understanding of data warehousing concepts and practices.
Proven experience in delivering data management solutions using data warehousing and business intelligence technologies.
Strong understanding of and proven experience with data governance, metadata management, master data management, data quality assessment.
Understanding of MS SQL Server (including SSIS, SSAS, SSRS), IBM Infosphere (DataStage, QualityStage, Information Analyzer, Information Governance Catalog), Hadoop and Big Data tools.
Broad experience in solution architecture design, systems analysis, software development, problem management, data management, database design, infrastructure, integration, network and data security.
Skills and experience collaborating with business and technical stakeholders.

What’s on offer? 

Work for an organisation that truly makes a difference to the Australian people.
Develop your career in a collaborative environment.
Access to a wide-range of benefits.
Exposure to executives and senior stakeholders.

About the RBA
The Reserve Bank of Australia pursues national economic policy objectives and undertakes a range of associated activities in financial markets and banking. It also issues Australia's banknotes and operates infrastructure critical to the payments
          system.
How to Apply
Your application should include a resume detailing your experience and qualifications.  A supporting statement addressing the selection criteria would also be welcomed.
The Reserve Bank of Australia is an equal opportunity employer.  We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace and encourage applications from experienced candidates seeking workplace flexibility.

title: Data Engineer

templatetext:
About the business
We are an Australian founded purpose driven consultancy that puts our people at the heart of our strategy. We help customers challenge the status quo by working with them on implementing new and emerging technologies whilst enabling our consultants
          to continue to learn and acquire new skills.
 
 
About the role
As a Senior Data Consultant, you'll have a major impact on the growth and direction of Servian's future. You'll lead major Data projects in a diverse array of industries. You'll manage and mentor more junior consultants helping them grow their
          careers. You'll join a consulting firm that offers a variety of projects and a structured learning and development path.
 
 
Benefits and perks

Learning & Development: as a naturally curious individual, you will have many opportunities to develop your technical and consulting skills as well as train and guide others. We run internal training on a weekly basis (knowledge
            sharing sessions, focus groups and our own Toastmasters Club!) as well as encourage and sponsor certifications.
Variety of projects: as a consultant, you will have the opportunity to work across multiple projects across our client base significantly increasing your skills and exposure in the industry.
Career progression: as a consulting firm, our leadership team is continually looking for technologists who want to develop their careers as people leaders and as senior advisors. You will have an opportunity to build your consulting
            skills as part of our team.

Alongside the above, we also provide employees with Life and Salary Insurance and a sociable workplace that values its diversity. A Friday evening in our offices consists of a variety of board games, pool playing, music listening and a high level
          of entertaining and thought-provoking conversations.
 
 
Skills and experience

Impressive general domain knowledge in Information Management and Data Warehouse including but not limited to Data Governance, Data visualisation, Business Intelligence, ETL
Mastery of SQL
Experienced with ETL Tools (Talend, Informatica etc..)
Accomplished with traditional DWH software (Netezza, Teradata)
You've led major projects before in a tech lead capacity. You've also managed and mentored teams before.

Prior experience in any of the following is advantageous:

Cloud services particularly PaaS DWH (AWS Redshift, Snowflake, GCP BigQuery)
Big Data (Hadoop ecosystem)
Machine Learning (Python, ML models)
title: Senior Data Consultant

templatetext:
In this position you will lead a team of Software Engineers who are engaged in a large scale effort to design, develop, implement, and support java based applications.
You will be responsible for the implementation of robust web applications. You will be expected to maintain awareness of internet trends, technologies and best practices.
The client is also looking for proven experience with various big data and BI technologies. Hadoop / AWS stack.
Responsibilities Include:

Provide strong technical leadership and lead a team of dynamic software developers to build and maintain customer facing applications.
Contribute to technical architecture decisions and lead efforts to build and maintain a highly scalable software platform.
Seek opportunities to continuously improve quality and development processes.
Provide estimates and initial assessment for proposed development tasks.
Track and report progress of the project against key milestones.
Plan releases and schedule development.
Balance resources with task assignments.
Ensure on-time and high quality delivery of the project.
Coordinate projects that span multiple teams.
Assist direct reports with career growth and personal development.
Keep stakeholders updated throughout the development cycle.

Qualifications:

More than 10 years’ experience building commercial software.
More than 4 years relevant experience leading engineering teams.
Experience with Java/J2EE, Spring and Java-based Service Oriented Architecture (SOA).
Experience with Web development technologies, including HTML5, JavaScript , AngularJs and CSS3.
Wider knowledge across Web and Development technologies, including but not limited to JQuery, XML, RESTful Services, JSON, JBoss, Maven, Docker, Veracode etc.
Hadoop, AWS stack.
Ability to maintain resource allocation, timely communications and meeting deadlines for high profile projects.
Demonstrated success in working with team members, including senior architects, analysts, and project managers, to design and estimate system implementation timelines and costs.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Please understand due to number of applications only suitable candidates with working rights will be contacted.
At Randstad, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background.
title: Software Development Manager

templatetext:
About us
With over 200 stores and 7,000 employees across Australia and New Zealand, JB Hi-Fi is one of Australasia’s largest and most trusted retailers. Specialising in consumer electronics, home entertainment, small appliances and white goods, JB Hi-Fi
          strives to deliver the most extensive range, cheapest prices and genuine service to customers every day.
The heart of our business is our people and we are proud of a culture that fosters teamwork, nurtures talent, encourages individuality and embraces diversity.
About the position
We are looking for a Big Data Engineer who has a passion and interest to help the business leverage its wealth of existing data and ready it for the future. You will assist in increasing business performance by ingesting, transforming and
          analysing large volumes of multi structured and unstructured data.
With a demonstrated knowledge of data methodologies, architectures and transformations you will work both independently and as part of the team. This role will allow you to engage in all phases of data management from data extraction through
          transformation to ingestion and value provision.
Key responsibilities 

Optimize queries and structures for distributed execution
Help define company-wide relevant data sources to drive the collection of new data
End to end solution integrity (including design, build, test and deploy)
Help define the common data architecture asset including framework, principle, guideline and template
Conduct research from which we will develop prototypes and proof of concepts
Offer methods of data pre-processing, cleansing, and related Extract Transform Load (ETL) tasks
Improve the quality of the authoritative data store used in our analytical solutions

About our ideal candidate

Demonstrable experience of Hadoop technologies e.g. PySpark, SparkSQL and Hive
Highly proficient in Python (including within Jupyter notebooks)
Ability to write and optimize complex queries using both SQL and NoSQL.
Prior experience in MSSQL CDC and SSIS
Experience working with, and configuring AWS services (such as S3, Redshift, EMR, and Kinesis), preferably in a production environment.
Strong understanding of data ETL and data processing concepts
Works well in a team environment
Help shape the teams output to improve the overall business performance
A high attention to detail 
Via creative thinking, solve complex problems and discover the best solution path

Our Benefits

Generous staff discounts
Access to training and development
Collaborative work environment
Fantastic career opportunities across the broader JB Hi-Fi and The Good Guys Group
6 weeks paid maternity leave
Employee Assistance Program

How to apply
All applications are strictly confidential. If you are interested in this exciting role, please click apply and submit your resume online.
title: Data Engineer

templatetext:
We are seeking an IT engineer to join our team in our Sydney office. This is a dynamic role with ample opportunity to develop and grow in a variety of technologies and industries.
Servian Managed Services provides full stack support to our clients and internal teams. We are seeking a Senior member to join us as we continue our expansion into new clients and technologies.
This roll is both internal and external facing.
Based in the main office, the role will encompass:

Day-to-day management of the Office IT infrastructure.
User management and provisioning.
Helpdesk duties for Managed Services clients.
Assisting the Managed Services team with all client operations.
Assisting with internal projects and development activities.

The ideal candidate will:

be a dynamic individual with a passion for IT and a willingness to learn
have a strong technical background
be a self-starter
be able to work within the constraints of process, whilst also thinking outside the box
have strong communications skills have experience working within DevOpsSec and the ITIL framework.

Overall, the core skill sets required within the overall Managed Service environment are shown below.  The successful candidate will have a broad coverage of these components and will have a drive to self-educate and grow their knowledge
          and experience. 

a sound technical background, ideally with multiple technologies and platforms.

OSX usage and administration

An ability to work under pressure and time constraints
A calm under pressure approach to their work.

If you want to join a leading Australian Consultancy and be exposed to diverse roles and responsibilities, whilst constantly having the opportunity to learn new skills, the please apply NOW!
title: Systems Engineer - Linux and the Cloud

templatetext:
About Us
At the University of Newcastle, our staff are curious. We think big, see opportunity and are open to ideas and ask why. We share wisdom and partner with colleagues in Australia and around the globe to create an enduring impact. And we're courageous
          - bold thinkers who have the confidence to take risks and to inspire change. We attract, foster and retain remarkable professional staff who actively contribute to our reputation. Responding to the changing needs of the business, the Financial
          Services provide tangible and measureable value to The University of Newcastle. The role is located on the leafy Callaghan campus where you can find open spaces and great coffee.
Is NEW for you? 
In this role you will be responsible for analysing the procurement spend and provide meaningful and efficient reporting to support management decision making to deliver The University’s strategic plan. We offer a rare opportunity to join this
          hardworking, collegiate team where you will be mentored and provided career development opportunities.
What will you do? 

Collaborate with Category Managers to analyse internal and external spend;
Assist in the development of Category Profiles and coordinate improvement initiatives;
Prepare assessment studies, reports including findings and provide recommendations;
Work closely with stakeholders, engage and connect by delivering compelling analysis.

About you 

A degree, with at least 4 years subsequent relevant experience, in business, accounting or other relevant discipline or extensive experience and management expertise in technical or administrative fields; or an equivalent combination of relevant
            experience and/or education/training
Demonstrated experience within a procurement function with expertise in data analysis, interpretation and presentation of information, with high level of numeracy
Demonstrated ability to articulate complex data themes in a way that is easily understood by third parties of varying backgrounds, levels of knowledge and seniority
Proven ability to assess a market for required goods or services, grasping the commercial drivers and extracting key information
High level interpersonal and communication skills, including an ability to communicate technical matters to non technical people

For a full job description visit https://www.newcastle.edu.au/about-uon/jobs-at-uon/job-vacancies
Applications for this position will only be accepted from those with Australian residency or a valid work permit.
Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants are encouraged to apply.
What NEW can offer?
From a flexible working environment to discounts in private health insurance and gym memberships, we offer access to a wide range of employee benefits including salary packaging. You can learn more about these at https://www.newcastle.edu.au/about-uon/jobs-at-uon/benefits-at-a-glance
We provide opportunities for all people regardless of their background and experience, and this philosophy is reflected across all that we do.
The remuneration is from $85,996 - $96,745 + 17% super and is commensurate with experience
Your next steps
Click on 'Apply for this job'. Your application will be assessed on selection criteria. Read all information about the role so you understand what is required. In addition:

Follow all directions and complete all necessary fields of the application; and
In your selection criteria demonstrate clearly how your skills and experience meet each point and should be a maximum of four pages.
title: Procurement Analyst

templatetext:
ABOUT US Headquartered in Sydney Australia, the Pureprofile group is a an ASX listed global leader in data insights, programmatic media, big data, quantitative research and consumer lead generation.
We have approximately 200 employees in locations across the world including Melbourne, Sydney, London, Mumbai and Greece.
The Trading team in Pureprofile specialises in data fuelled programmatic media buying across display, mobile, social, video, native and rich media. We take the customer journey as a starting point of our strategies and work across branding,
            prospecting and performance.
THE OPPORTUNITYWe are looking for a superstar trading guru to join our trading team as a Digital Media Trader at our Sydney HQ office.
As the Digital Media Trader, you will be responsible for the end to end management of programmatic campaigns including implementation, optimisation and generating meaningful insights for clients.
This is what you can expect to see on your to-do list:

Creation of campaign strategies
Overseeing the creation of campaigns in DSP’s
Managing the creation, implementation & management of pixels
Creation of client side dashboards to analyse and visualise data
Managing, optimising and pacing 50 to 200 digital advertising campaigns
Providing ongoing updates and recommendations to account managers and clients on existing campaigns
Specialised performance marketing through Facebook and Google
Creating post campaign reports with analytical insights for clients working closely with the Client Services team
Educating stakeholders on latest technologies and changes in the industry
Mentoring and coaching team members

THE IDEAL CANDIDATEWe are looking for a commercially minded Digital Media Trader who is a strong communicator and is hungry to develop their career.
The ideal candidate will need to demonstrate:

Deep knowledge of media trading with a few years experience in a media trading role
Strong knowledge and experience in SEM campaigns
Strong communication skills with a flair for talking to people and building solid working relationships
Analytical to spot trends and commercially savvy to seize opportunities
Out of the box thinking and can-do attitude
A natural ability to deliver on promises
Thrives under pressure and loves a good challenge
Solutions orientated with the ability to navigate around blockers to deliver solutions

WHAT'S NEXT?If you feel you’re the one we’re searching for, send us your resume with a cover letter telling us why you’d like us to consider you.
title: Digital Media Trader

templatetext:
Senior Security Operations Centre (SOC) Specialist - Circa $150k + SuperThe Client:This is a truly market leading company with an incredibly high NPS that is reflected by their dominance in the market,
          especially within the Government sector. They pride themselves on giving the best customer experience and a reliable and most of all, highly secure service. The Gig: The purpose of the Senior SOC Engineer position
          is to detect, contain, remediate and prevent security incidents affecting my clients Secure Internet Gateway and Government Infrastructure that operates within my clients Datacentres. This role is a central point of coordination for major
          security incidents, management of all incidents and following the incident management process.This covers the two key Service Assurance areas: continuous proactive service monitoring/incident identification and technical resolution for the
          issues logged by the clients.What you bring to the table:

Existing Australian Citizenship - AN ESSENTIAL MUST HAVE!! 
Respond to security incidents & resolve/mitigate them within agreed thresholds and with appropriate sense of urgency
Pro-actively use cyber threat information, skills and intuition to explore vast amount of data to detect security threats
Implement preventive and corrective counter-measures against cyber-threat;
Escalate problems as required
Troubleshoot IP, Firewall& Internet networks
Evaluate impact of security bulletins & alerts including, AUSCert, SANS, ASD, vendors etc.
Data search programming languages, such as Python ; RUST ; SLQ ; Splunk SPL and others.
Understanding of cyber security issues such as computer intrusions, malicious code, phishing and SPAM
 Additional Skills / What is nice to have:

Familiarity with ASD Information Security Manual
Hands-on experience with at least one major SIEM technology in creation of use cases
Ability to automate mundane tasks using scripting languages such as Bash, python and Ruby

templatetext:
About Us
GE Healthcare is the $19 billion healthcare business of GE (NYSE: GE). As a leading provider of medical imaging, monitoring, biomanufacturing, and cell and gene therapy technologies, GE Healthcare enables precision health in diagnostics, therapeutics
            and monitoring through intelligent devices, data analytics, applications and services. With over 100 years of experience in the healthcare industry and more than 50,000 employees globally, the company helps improve outcomes more efficiently
            for patients, healthcare providers, researchers and life sciences companies around the world.
About the Role
This role sits in our Commercial Excellence team in the A&NZ region. It involves working across all of our Healthcare businesses where you will partner with our ComEx leader to nuance our framework to local market conditions to achieve relevance
            and higher impact. 
They key component of this role will be to lead and conduct data analysis using Salesforce (SFDC) and Excel to provide meaningful insights to our sales teams and leaders. 
You will drive overall productivity and growth of the sales teams through various projects that will include analysing incentive plans, supporting the learning and development of Salesforce, conceptualising and executing sales promotion
            programs and rolling out the commercial excellence framework. 
About You
Ideally, you will have previous experience in marketing and or business analytics (in a cross functional role), as well strong skills with MS Excel and PowerPoint.
You have knowledge of a CRM tool (Salesforce / SFDC is preferred) and have the ability to present data in a manner that makes sense. 
Your communication skills are exceptional - you are a polished speaker and can influence to drive outcomes. Pitching to leadership and interacting at C-level is something you feel entirely comfortable with. 
A combination of analytical and business skills will ensure your success. 
What Do We Offer?
This is a fantastic career step if you are looking for a really nice foundation for bigger roles in marketing and sales down the track. 
We all live and talk big data and artificial intelligence (AI) but this role will enable you to make sense of that data at ground level, whilst you continually learn about business performance. 
Our team is flat and agile, and you will have a manager who is a huge promoter of giving you exposure, ensuring you have lots of learning opportunities, and is happy to talk about flexible working arrangements (we will make what works for you,
            work for us!). For us, it's about the big picture, taking ownership, and driving results. We clear the path for your success. 
Our benefits also include:

5 weeks annual leave (after your first 6 months of service)
Modern, agile offices in multiple locations across the country
A generous & contemporary paid parental leave policy
Extensive professional development opportunities
Long term career opportunities (locally and globally)
Generous discounts for goods & services via our employee benefits program (think travel, entertainment & shopping!)

If you are passionate about working for an organization that imagines things others don’t, builds things others can’t, and delivers outcomes that make the world better, we would love to hear from you.
Please note that to be considered you must have working rights for Australia, and be prepared to undergo a background check which includes a police check.
title: Commercial Excellence Specialist - GE Healthcare

templatetext:
This is a great opportunity for you to join our dynamic Financial Planning & Analysis team in a Business Intelligence role.  
You’ll be a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst or Developer ready to embark on our journey to transform Macquarie’s Financial Planning and Analysis function. This is an excellent opportunity to join a growing Business Intelligence centre of excellence
          with a strong mandate to enhance reporting, modelling and analytics capabilities.  
Supported by an established team of Data Engineers and Solution Architects, you will play a hands-on role delivering Business Intelligence and management reporting solutions with the Finance teams that support Macquarie’s business units. You will
          work across all aspects of business intelligence product delivery, including; capturing business requirements, defining technical requirements for our Data Engineers and building reporting processes and dashboards. You will help our operations
          team implement robust reporting processes. By partnering with Finance and business teams, your contribution will help build our data and analytics capabilities.
With a minimum of two years’ experience in data analysis, business intelligence or management reporting, you will bring your strong understanding of data modelling and data architecture principles to this role. You will have the ability to extract
          and transform data from multiple sources and be a confident user of data analysis and visualisation tools such as Alteryx and Power BI. Experience with big data platforms would be beneficial. Your strong communication skills, well developed
          organisation skills and willingness to take ownership of delivery will ensure your success. 
If you are looking for a challenge and are motivated by the chance to join a strong and growing team, we want to hear from you.



The Financial Management Group provides financial, tax and treasury services to all areas of Macquarie. The group is focused on providing strategic analysis and advice to Macquarie's businesses and senior management, managing Macquarie's
                funding, liquidity and capital position, ensuring Macquarie continues to meet regulatory and compliance obligations and managing Macquarie's corporate communications and investor relations.



Find out more about Macquarie careers at www.macquarie.com/careers 
Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common
          is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.
We facilitate a range of flexible working arrangements within our teams. Talk to us about what flexibility may be available.
