templatetext:
GHD is one of the world's leading professional services companies operating in the global markets of water, energy and resources, environment, property and buildings, and transportation. With a global network of 10,000 professionals, we combine
          the benefit of local knowledge with an ability to access our people from anywhere, helping clients enjoy the rewards of one GHD network.
 
We operate in an environment where the power of technology is advancing at an astonishing rate. Regardless of business size or industry, digital transformation is vital. Our digital services have been designed to help our clients reimagine their
          future business model, to improve the customer experience and reduce total cost of ownership of infrastructure assets. GHD Digital helps our clients to think differently, to embrace rapidly emerging digital advancements and to future-proof their
          businesses. 
 
Please visit our website for more information: www.ghd.com/en/services/digital.aspx.
 
Our Data and Analytics team understand that big data means nothing without intelligent insights. Using leading edge data analytics and business intelligence technology, we help clients see patterns in their data and find insights to improve the
          way the business operates. We work with our clients to help them make better business decisions.  
 
The role:
 
Reporting to the Team Leader – Location Intelligence, this key position is pivotal to supporting the Team to deliver existing and new projects. As the Senior Developer / Spatial Analyst, you will liaise with internal
          and external clients to identify new work opportunities. This is a unique opportunity to develop and expand the Location Intelligence Team. 
 
The key responsibilities for the Senior Developer / Spatial Analyst are delivery of spatial projects for our clients and with colleagues across GHD, and technical guidance and mentoring to junior spatial team members.
 
Key responsibilities include:

Undertake and provide technical leadership on projects, particularly in the areas of: Scoping applications development and problem solving strategies for data visualisation platforms, spatial tools and solutions
Workflow automation
Spatial and non-spatial data analysis
Design, implementation and administration of spatial databases
Design, implementation and administration of web mapping 
Contribute to driving and promoting the spatial technology infrastructure strategy for the business
Lead proposals and projects with targeted technical documentation
Lead opportunities within the market to design and deliver project solutions
Drive innovation within GHD’s growing Digital Business
Promote relationships with existing and potential clients

 
 Desired Skills and Experience


Relevant tertiary qualification with 5+ years’ experience (Computer Science, Geomatic Engineering, Spatial Sciences, or equivalent)


Extensive experience in GIS web application development and web services in the enterprise environment


Experience in systems integration between spatial and non-spatial technology


Experience in database and enterprise GIS design and administration


Programming skills (python, java script, SQL etc)


Data analysis skills


Experience in workflow automation


Experience in project/task management


Proven ability to work independently with minimal supervision to tight deadlines


Strong communication and interpersonal skills - both oral and written


Experience with building direct client relationships and solutions within the industry


Team player, cooperative with other staff with a demonstrated commitment to sharing of information and knowledge, including mentoring younger staff


Why work for GHD?


It is an exciting time to join GHD Digital as we are part of the new digital revolution;

GHD Pty Ltd is an Australian company with global operations and opportunities; 
You will have exposure to and work closely with other interesting GHD Digital teams, including Digital Transformation Strategy, Smart Technology, Cyber Security and Digital Innovation.
You will be surrounded and inspired by leading industry specialists; 
Working in a multidisciplinary environment promotes a collaborative working environment; 
We are proud of our culture, and promote flexible working arrangements, foster gender balance and diversity;

We are committed to creating a nurturing environment where people are empowered and are encouraged to bring their whole-self to work.


We offer a professional and friendly culture based on our core values of Safety, Teamwork, Respect and Integrity. 


GHD also provides attractive career and lifestyle options including professional development through the GHD Business School, flexible work options and family-friendly practices.


Please click the following link to apply.

title: Network Engineer

templatetext:
If you are a change agent who can dream big and inspire people – we want to meet you!
Oracle is looking for dynamic and creative Cloud Evangelists to be part of our Oracle Cloud Platform Strategy Group in Australia and New Zealand.
Oracle is changing the cloud industry and has built the most modern, performance focused, and resilient cloud offering in the market today. We seek Cloud Platform Evangelists who have strong solution architecture expertise, have worked on cloud
          deployments, possess knowledge of enterprise applications and workloads, and are great communicators to deliver a game changing cloud experience to our customers.
 Your responsibilities will include:
· Provide direction and specialist knowledge in applying Oracle cloud technology to client business challenges. Exposure to prior cloud deployments in public sector, finance, telecommunications or manufacturing is desired.
·Provide support and mentoring to the field sales organization and prospective customers.
· Provide feedback to product management on the customer experience and gather feedback on new desired features and capabilities.
·  Develop and deliver high quality presentations and demonstrations to customers, partners and at industry events. Where appropriate, package these demonstrations as reusable for the field.
·Present and articulate advanced solution capabilities, future direction and organisational benefits.
·Ability to lead and drive Innovation Initiatives across the Customer and Oracle Organisations including the facilitating of fast learning or hackathon type workshops, manifesting a greater collective
· Develop, acquire and manage outstanding customer relationships, turning this success into new customer sales references.
· Evangelize messaging on PaaS+IaaS and sell the vision of building and migrating enterprise applications and software towards Autonomous Cloud Services.
You will leverage your understanding of cloud and enterprise architectures to identify suitable use cases (Autonomous, Cloud@Customer, Kubernetes, Chatbots, APIs, Blockchain, etc); identifying the relationships between business services,
          information, applications and infrastructure assets.  
These can be expressed as something basic such as a migration or upgrade of Oracle application to the Oracle Public Cloud or Cloud@Customer Configuration.
As a Cloud Platform Evangelist, you should have the following capabilities:
· Good understanding of cloud industry and technology trends, usage trends, competitive buying behaviours in both enterprise and start up world.
· Broad systems experience such as Cloud Native (Docker & Kubernetes), SAP, Oracle, Microsoft and custom Java/.NET applications, or experience in software architecture in HPC (auto, industrial, rendering, GPU), IoT, Mobile Application
          Development, or data analytics is desired.
· Past experience on legacy Cloud Computing platforms is preferred.  Current working knowledge of AWS or Azure platforms is a bonus.
· 5 years’ experience as a technical specialist or consultant in Customer-facing roles, in enterprise application deployment or devops, with special emphasis on cloud, networking, application services, big data and distributed computing.
          Should be comfortable with open source software, software defined networking, and software defined data centre concepts (eg. Terraform)
·Should be able to run and manage proof of concepts, demo, build simple/sample apps etc.
·Good communication skills to articulate the message and vision clearly
·Experience working with sales teams, and an understanding of sales methodologies is a plus.
Strong verbal and written communication skills are required: needs analysis, positioning. Demonstrated ability to solve complex technical problems. Ability to travel as needed. BS degree or equivalent; advanced degree desirable but not required.
          We are looking for people with the passion, experience and talent to make our customers successful.
If this is you, please reach out!
title: Cloud Platform Strategist

title: Data Analyst

templatetext:
Create interactive environments for data exploration!
Work on innovative projects in our Scientific Computing Program team!
Join CSIRO - Australia's premier science and technology research organisation!

 
The Scientific Computing Program (SC) is focused on delivering expertise and access to CSIRO’s computing and data facilities to all researchers within CSIRO. 
In this role you will provide scientific visualisation expertise to members of CSIRO’s research community and in two main components. 

Providing research groups expertise and support to address their data visualisation needs. This includes development of software, workflows, converting and remapping data, and facilitating efficient use of a range of resources including CSIRO’s
            high-performance visualisation systems.
Providing expert guidance on third party visualisation applications, including their recommendation, selection, training, demonstration and use across a range of scientific disciplines.

 
More specifically you will:

Create interactive environments for data exploration.
Develop scientific animations based on computational or simulation datasets.
Make dynamic visualisation content available via a web interface.
Undertake data analysis to better understand complex scientific datasets.

 
Location:       Melbourne, Sydney, Canberra and Perth.Tenure:          IndefiniteSalary:           AU$97K – AU$105K + up
          to 15.4% superannuationReference:    59515
 
To be successful you will need:Under CSIRO policy only those who meet all selection criteria can be appointed.

A tertiary qualification in computer science, mathematics or equivalent
At least 5 years’ experience in the interrogation of scientific data through various means such as visualisation or data analytics 
Demonstrated experience in at least three of the following:
            
Modern programming languages such as Python, and JavaScript 
Big data visualisation platforms using Jupyter, R and D3.js
Software engineering best practices, including requirements analysis, agile methodologies and assuring quality through the use of appropriate testing and validation suites.
3D graphics, modelling, animation and rendering tools such as Unity3D and Maya.
Interactive web-based presentation of complex data.



 
For more information please view the  Position Description.We’re working hard to recruit diverse people
          and ensure all our people feel supported to do their best work and empowered to let their ideas flourish
 
Flexible Working ArrangementsWe work flexibly at CSIRO, offering a range of options for how, when and where you work.  Talk to us about how this role could be flexible for you. Balance
 
About CSIROAt CSIRO you can be part of helping to solve big, complex problems that make a real difference to our future.  We spark off each other, learn from each other, trust each other and collaborate to achieve more
          than we could individually in a supportive, rewarding, inclusive and truly flexible environment.
 
Apply OnlineTo apply online, please provide a CV and cover letter outlining your suitability and motivation for the role.
 
Applications CloseWednesday, 6th February, 2019

          ecosystem.  This collaborative team work on the ongoing improvement of the information management framework and related processes. You will work in a small team of three to own the end to end data management processes for the business
          and third party datasets on to the platform.  This team was established 18 months ago and there is a start up feel towards it. The governance framework has been established and part of your role will be to facilitate the engagement of
          dataset owners and internal governance committees to agree to usage rules and access rights of a dataset, as well as information classification.  You will work closely with Data Scientists and Data Engineers to assess their activity
          and maintain quality assurance. Working as an SME of datasets on the platform, you will also support internal and external product development.  In addition, you will report on the quality aspects of data and metadata and ensure data
          governance controls are effective and being adhered to all the way to operationalisation of data products to end users.  The hiring manager is very selective about the type of person they want to bring into the business. You must be
          willing and creative and able to empathise with the business and problem solve for stakeholders.  In this role, you must be able to work with senior stakeholders, as well as deal with technical challenges and provide solutions for the
          business through data manipulation with Python and SQL.  The ideal candidate will be passionate about data governance, quality and compliance. Attitude is a huge part of this role; a collaborative, smart and personable person with technical
          and business facing skills is what we are looking for.  SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

Strong experience in Data Management
Knowledge of Data Governance practices
Data Analysis, Modelling & Metadata management skills
Desirable to have Capital Markets knowledge or a banking and financial services background
Worked with structured, semi-structured, unstructured and streaming data
Data manipulation skills with Python and / or SQL or similar
Desirable to have worked with a Big Data platform
Experienced driving and supporting process improvement
Excellent stakeholder management skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills

If the above sounds like you, please get in touch. We can wait for a notice period to be served and we are interviewing immediately.

templatetext:
As a Delivery Manager you will manage multiple in-house agile projects, typically to deliver features in their platform or ecosystem and via a multidisciplinary and highly skilled development team.  You’ll be great at building and maintaining
        motivated teams, while making sure there is an iterative and achievable plan to work towards. You’ll protect the team from outward influences and remove blockers and obstacles to progress while also making sure the team collaborates,
        communicates and focuses on what is most important.On a daily basis you’ll be acting as scrum master and delivering projects that enable products and features within their platform.  You’ll be a servant-leader to your team
        and coach team members and others to facilitate continuous improvement and apply the most appropriate agile and lean tools and techniques suitable for environment. Experience and Skills

Delivery: Proven experience in delivering digital projects and products via multidisciplinary teams in an agile environment.
Agile & Lean Practices: Able to identify and compare the best delivery processes and practices to use; Quick to recognise when something isn’t working and to encourage a mindset of experimentation to resolve problems; Is adaptable and resilient
            and able to reflect on the higher-level problems outside of the process.
Communication: Ability to listen to and clearly interpret the needs of technical and other business stakeholders; Able to manage expectations and be flexible; Facilitates difficult conversations within the team with a constant view on continuous
            improvement.
Planning: Experience of balancing multiple priorities and dealing with ambiguity; Understanding of the environment and ability to prioritise tasks by importance and business value; Able to manage complex internal and external dependencies; Works
            to ensure teams plan appropriately for their own capacity.
Teamwork & Collaboration: Able to bring people together to form a motivated team; Able to empower the team and create the right environment for the team;
Processes: Able to identify processes that add value and those that don’t; Experienced in adding value and coaching an organisation to adapt and evolve process; Can guide teams through implementation of new processes while emphasising the value
            they add.
 Desirable

Product Knowledge of Big Data: ETL, AWS Redshift, Hadoop, Hive, AWS EMR
Experience of Team Collaboration Tools: Jira, Confluence
 Key Accountabilities

Deliver projects and products using the appropriate agile project management methodology, learning & iterating frequently
Work with the Product Manager to define the roadmap for any given product and work with the team to translate this into user stories.
Lead the collaborative, dynamic planning process - prioritising the work that needs to be done against the capacity and capability of the team.
Championing the agile practice within the company, sharing and re-applying skills and knowledge and bringing in best practice.
Building and maintaining motivated teams, making sure there are clear objectives and a path to success.
Protecting the team from outside influences and making sure the team collaborates, communicates and focuses on what is most important.
Mentoring and coaching team members and others while also facilitating continuous improvement and applying the most appropriate agile and lean tools and techniques for their environment.
Proactively managing dependencies, overcoming obstacles and getting the best value against constraints.
Awareness and management of risks and resources.
 If this sounds like your next career move then please apply now!

templatetext:
The role
Deakin University and Southwest University based in Chongqing, China have established a joint research Centre on Agricultural Big Data.  The intent being to build upon the long-term focus of Southwest University in the area of agriculture
          with Deakin’s growing reputation in data analytics and sustainable regional and rural development through the establishment of industry focused, innovative research projects.
The Postdoctoral Research Fellow will play a key role in the development of this collaboration and will make a substantial contribution to managing the relationship between the two Universities and in coordinating joint research activities in
          the areas of Agricultural Big Data and higher degree research (HDR) supervision.
This is a 3 year fixed-term position and can be situated at either the Geelong Waurn Ponds or Melbourne Burwood campus.
To be successful, you’ll have:

post-doctoral/professional experience in multidisciplinary research with a focus on life sciences or a closely related discipline with evidence in high-quality publications, conference papers, reports, or professional or technical contributions
a capacity to plan and coordinate the design and delivery of collaborative research projects within your area of expertise and organisation of related meetings, workshops and conferences
an ability to plan, initiate and conduct high quality research in the life sciences area including an ability to supervise research students
strengths in establishing and maintaining highly effective working relationships with a diverse range of people
a willingness to travel to China, and demonstrated fluency in English and Mandarin is preferable

Your key responsibilities will be to:

contribute to your specific area of research, scholarship or creative activity through publication or exhibition in quality outlets
contribute to research projects and collaborations to create new insights and opportunities in relation to the joint collaboration and which lead to demonstrable outcomes
contribute to the successful development of research programs and partnerships between the two Universities
supervision and/or examination of honours students or assistance with supervision, management and timely completion of HDR students
lifting the research profile and reputation of Deakin by means of public lectures, seminars, public debate and policy formation on key research issues

Culture
Deakin University is proud to be recognised as an organisation that offers a friendly, supportive and challenging working environment. Our staff are committed to making a genuine difference to people’s lives through excellence in education and
          research.
We acknowledge the importance of providing a dynamic and diverse working environment and offer variety in day-to-day roles as well as professional development opportunities to assist staff to grow and progress their careers.
Deakin University staff have the opportunity to interact with colleagues from a diverse range of cultures and professional backgrounds, all of whom share a common interest in lifelong learning.
Benefits
We value our staff and understand that they are more than just their jobs, that's why we offer benefits that enhance work life. Some of Deakin’s workplace benefits include:

17% superannuation
flexible work arrangements
discounts with third party suppliers for health insurance, car rentals IT and more

About us
The flexible learning options we provide our students and our diverse team of professionals and academic experts has enabled us to achieve a 5-star rating by the prestigious university ranking organisation Quacquarelli Symonds. For eight consecutive
          years, we've achieved the highest level of overall student satisfaction among Victorian universities.
We have a network of campuses, learning centres and research centres across Victoria and corporate offices in Melbourne, China, Indonesia, India and Sri Lanka. Our online Cloud campus provides more than 13,000 students with access to state-of-the-art
          digital tools and direct access to world-renowned academics.
As a Victorian university with a global impact, Deakin is translating its research into commercial outcomes that will help drive innovation for Australia’s economy.
 
 Level B - Postdoc Research Fellow - Life Sciences.pdf
Applications close on Sunday 3rd February 2019. When applying, please include a complete resume and responses to the selection criteria.
 
At Deakin we value diversity, embrace difference and nurture a connected, safe and respectful community.  We recognise that our academic workforce is increasingly diverse with a variety of backgrounds, experiences and responsibilities. In many cases, academic careers can be put on hold through career breaks or part-time work arrangements to take on caring duties, gain experience in other industries, for medical reasons or other personal circumstances.   Achievement relative to opportunity places more emphasis on the quality as opposed to the quantity of research outputs. In your application, we encourage you to comment on your achievements relative to opportunity.
title: Post Doctoral Research Fellow, Life Science

Principal Software Architect needed for growing technology company
Sydney CBD location
Competitive package + Super + Equity

A Principal Software Architect is needed for Financial Services company based in the Sydney CBD. This company are going through a significant growth period and are looking for an experienced C++ Principal Architect to join the team to help develop
          systems and build products. They have built a highly scalable technology that is one of a kind in the market. The Principal Architect will be a key hire, as one of the most senior roles in the company.  To make sparks fly you will have:As
          a Principal Software Architect you will need to have - 

12-15 years’ experience in Software Development in C++
At least 3 years’ experience in Visual C++
Expertise in designing and architecting complex systems in a Financial Services/Trading environment
Evidence of leading a team in previous roles
Significant IPC and parallel processing experience
Experience with Cloud computing and Containers
Advanced math, Big data, SOA & AI
Ability to communicate your ideas effectively both written and verbal

 What makes this role shine?

Sydney CBD location
Highly competitive package including stock and bonus (up to $225k base)
Exciting opportunity to join a growing company fostering a high-quality environment

Spark your interest?
To find out more about this exciting Principal Architect role please apply by attaching your resume (in MS WORD format only please) or contact Helen Tankard on 02 8090 7781.
title: Principal Software Architect (C++)

templatetext:
An outstanding long term contract opportunity has arisen for an experienced BI Solution Designer with one of Queensland's iconic financial services organisations. 
Working within the IT Architecture team, you will be reposnible for providing techncial leadership in the design and development of the organisation's BI Solutions, and will be the techncial lead on data modelling, data ingestion and ETL transformation
          proceses, utilising Microsoft's Azure Business Intelligence tools. Key duties will include:

Designing standards, methods and tools, consistent with agreed enterprise and solution architectures.
Design and develop intuitive reports, dashboards, and graphs using Azure Business Intelligence, Data Warehouse and Big Data analytics.
Review and analyze complex, integrated data, models and information from various business systems and Big Data sources using Azure Data Lake, Azure Analysis Services and Power BI Service.
Evaluate new BI Platform software and tools ensuring that software is fit for purpose and aligns with agreed enterprise and solution architectures. 

Suitable candidates will be able to demonstrate the following atrributes:

Senior level of expertise and software development experience, designing, developing and supporting various BI products including MS SQL Server 2016, Visual Studio 2016, SSAS - multi-dimensional & tabular and SSIS.
Senior level of MS Azure cloud expertise, designing, developing and supporting various MS products including Azure Data Factory, Azure Blob Storage, Azure Databricks, Azure SQL DB, PowerBI.com.
Senior level of expertise/technical leadership and business skills in the provision of effective Enterprise Data Warehouse environments including systems and database management and support services.
Senior level of expertise and experience using data modelling methodologies such as Kimball; Inmon and Data Vault.

In return our client can offer a professional yet friendly team environment and access to leading edge cloud technologies. For more information, please 'APPLY NOW' quoting reference 4A/21674 or contact Tim Smith on 07 325 88453 for a confidential
          discussion.
title: Senior BI Solution Designer

templatetext:
Our leading media client is looking for a Data Analyst to join in a permanent position to manage the organisation's data and analysis needs. This includes; video campaign reporting, dashboard building, and quantitative surveys.
This role will work closely with the Web Developer and bring insights to drive distribution and content strategy within the organisation, demonstrate campaign effectiveness and provide actionable intelligence to the business. 
Key Responsibilities:

Build and maintain real-time campaign dashboards; creation and maintenance of data templates, use of formulas to interpret data and updating databases.
Extract, gather, clean, and organise data from multiple sources. 
Collate and analyse data. 
Roll-out of a new reporting dashboard, ensuring all relevant data is measured and represented optimally to all users.
Design, build and populate results benchmarking. 

Role Requirements:

Experience with Microsoft suite, in particular Excel and PowerPoint
Organisational skills
Excellent attention to detail
Ability to work independently and prioritise workload to meet deadlines

Highly Desirable:

Previous experience working within a creative/media industry organisation is highly regarded. 
Experience working with Google Sheets & Google Data Studio
Programming skills, ideally with experience in languages commonly used in big data frameworks
Sound SQL skills
Knowledge of database design principles
Experience using API's to extract data
Familiarity with social and video ad buying systems, such as Google Ads & Facebook Ads
Experience with dashboarding tools (eg: Tableau, Qlik etc.)
To be considered for the role click the 'Apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Alyssa Lau on 02 9464 5658. Please quote our job reference number: 200184510.
title: Data Analyst

templatetext:
The Company
This business has an enthusiastic and driven technology team who build great product and offer innovative services to a big range of clients. This organisation prides itself on its use of best of breed technologies, its big data analysis and the
          customer experience they deliver. Established in the early 2000’s this organisation has around 80 people globally and has undertaken controlled growth that has allowed it both to invest in its people and solutions even as the business expands
          internationally.
The Role
You will be a key linchpin between software engineers, product owners, clients and a number of key internal business orientated stakeholders. Great interpersonal skill, enthusiasm and drive will go a long way to seeing you effectively communicate
          with a wide variety of people, and will also be key to driving workshops and acting as a catalyst for the teams ideas. 
Key responsibilities include:

Drive high levels of communication and transparency between teams and team members.
Collaborate with your team and the wider business to improve agile capability.
Manage the technical design process to identify and solve business issues.
Create user stories, process flows & wireframes, to effectively outline and communicate.
Balance clients, budgets, needs, constraints, relationships and outcomes.
Elements of strategic planning, data modeling, and process design.

About You
You will be a BA who has excellent communication and an affinity with the SDLC. You will enjoy servicing the needs of a range of stakeholders in a multifaceted small-medium environment. You should be an excellent problem solver with exceptional
          analytical skills who can work autonomously and as part of a close-knit team.
Your experience and skills should include most, if not all:

Confidence in engaging with and managing client interactions at all levels.
An adaptive and innovative approach to rapidly changing needs and circumstances.
Solid experience as a BA/Iteration Manager/Consultant in an Agile set-up.
Exposure to the full SDLC, & the ability to communicate with technical and non-technical stakeholders.

In addition you will have an IT degree or other relevant technical/project/delivery qualifications. The role also requires the ability to prioritize your work and excellent written communication skills.
How to Apply
If this sounds like you then click on the apply button now.
910103986BP
Learn more about our Melbourne recruitment services: http://www.roberthalf.com.au/recruitment-agency-melbourne

title: Data Engineer

templatetext:
THE COMPANY
A2K Technologies fosters innovation through delivering software and hardware solutions, consulting, training, development and managed services. Covering the entire ANZ region, the company has offices based in Brisbane, Sydney, Melbourne, Adelaide
          and Perth, backed by a team of highly skilled hands on technical experts. A2K is an IT Services Company as one of the leading managed services providers for Microsoft, Autodesk, Siemens, and others.
 
RIB Software SE is an innovator in construction business. The company creates, develops, and offers iTWO³ – new thinking, new working method and new technology - for construction projects across various industries worldwide. iTWO today is the
          world’s first Cloud / License based Big Data 5D BIM enterprise solution for construction companies, industrial companies, developers and investors.
We are now looking for the right candidate to help us deliver the world’s leading advanced vertical cloud solution for the construction industry.
 
THE ROLE
Due to our expansion and growth in the ANZ region, an exciting opportunity within A2K’s business awaits the right candidate. This is a dynamic, fast-paced and friendly environment that will suit an energetic and strategic thinker with clear vision
          and solid networking and communication skills. This is an opportunity to join a respected company and assist in driving the future of construction.
As the MTWO Solution Consultant you will work as a trusted and integral team member reporting directly to the MTWO Business Unit Lead.  The successful candidate responsible for supporting sales leads and assisting in defining and developing
          the technical strategies to be implemented to an extensive customer base in the Construction and AEC industries. This position is ideally located in the Brisbane office but for the right candidate could be in another major capital city.
The Successful Applicant Key Accountabilities of the Position include but not limited to...

Forging and maintaining strong relationships with key contacts in existing and new accounts;
Strategic brainstorming and implementation planning of the technical requirements to our customer base;
Providing the technical presentations and assisting with account planning for clients in construction, infrastructure, manufacturing and Energy & utilities sectors in ANZ Area;
Driving solution-based sales into A2K’s client base with the extensive sales teams;
Preparing and presenting solution offerings with a driven and enthusiastic ethos focusing on accountability for technical accuracy and understanding of the clients requirements;
Maintaining the highest level of technical skills in the functionality and implementation strategies of multiple software applications;
Develop marketing strategies and networking opportunities;
Computer literacy to include Microsoft Suite coupled with experience in updating a CRM package;
Excellent verbal/written communication, organisation and strong interpersonal skills;
Developing and leveraging the company’s branding and professional profile.

 
THE SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE
The successful applicant will be a team player, proactive and results-oriented.  Other requirements of the role are:

3+ years of previous experience in a construction/cost estimation based role or a construction management graduate with previous site experience desirable.
A proven ability to plan, develop and execute business development strategies and deliver strategy workshops to identify client requirements
Experience of enterprise-level technology solutions strongly preferred.
Demonstrated ability to work within a multidisciplinary team
Proven ability to develop and implement software implementation strategies based on strategy workshop outcomes
Excellent communication, listening and presentation skills
Strong background in negotiating, tendering and estimating
Able to work flexibly with regard to activities and hours in a role that will involve travel

 
The Benefits:

You will be backed by the company's resources to help you achieve your targets;
Dedicated customer service and support teams to provide ongoing post-sales support;
Experienced leadership and mentors to develop and grow your skills.

This role presents the successful candidate with a great market place, a good team environment and real growth opportunities supported by a highly competitive salary, uncapped commission structure and superannuation.The successful applicant
          will be a team player, proactive and results oriented. You will have excellent attention to detail, a dynamic approach to task orientation and the ability to communicate with people at all levels.A2K Technologies Pty Ltd offers an expanding
          and dynamic environment where success and initiative are recognised and rewarded.
If this role is what you are looking for and you meet our requirements, please click the ‘Apply online’ button below or email your resume to Human Resources via hr@a2ktechnologies.com.au.
Your interest will be treated in the strictest of confidence. We look forward to hearing from you!
**Agency applications will not be accepted.**

title: MTWO Solution Consultant

templatetext:
The Company
 
Are you fascinated by the strategy behind development, digging into big data, and working alongside business leaders on complex, multi-source data to explore, generate and test business assumptions? If that sounds like you, our client is offering
          an exciting opportunity for your skills as a BI Developer. If you are an exceptional professional who is passionate about strategy, analysis, presenting ideas to partners and team members and being responsible for driving business process models,
          this could be the role for you.
 
The Role
 
You’ll be part of a talented team responsible for accelerating and improving decision-making, increasing efficiency and gaining competitive advantages. Harness your technical skills across the full Microsoft stack (SSIS, SSRS, SSAS, PowerBI, Azure)
          to allow the business to focus on forecasting future events and behaviors. You will collaborate with the business to understand requirements, manage ETL processes (SSIS), Tabular design (SSAS), and utilise established data warehousing practices
          and data visualizations (PowerBI).
 
This diverse role will also see you work closely with the business and developing technical solutions. As part of their BI environment they are moving from an on-premise solution to Azure of which you will be heavily involved in.
 
Your Skills & Experience
 

Experience on the Microsoft Stack; SSIS SSRS SSAS
Experience with Tabular DAX
Experience with PowerBI (Open to Tableau, Qlikview etc)
Experience working with the business to elicit requirements
Experience with Azure is a +
Experience with Python OR R is a +

 
 
About you
 
You thrive in a fast-paced work environment and are easily able to handle a number of large projects while also managing smaller, filler projects at the same time while meeting strict deadlines. You have exceptional problem solving ability with
          the natural creative flair to provide innovative solutions. You have outstanding interpersonal skills to motivate and mentor your team.
 
What’s on offer?
 

An exceptional opportunity to be part of a growth-focused company that champions innovation and excellence.
A rare chance to build on your current skill set and play an active role leading a variety of projects.
A fast-paced, high energy workplace where your talent will make a real contribution to business growth.
The camaraderie of an impressive team in an environment where work-life balance is actively supported.

 
Robert Half Ltd is committed to equal opportunity and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of categories protected under local law.
title: Senior BI Developer, MSBI, Azure

templatetext:
Due to growth, this large consumer bank is looking to recruit a number of Credit Risk Analysts. In this position, you will take responsibility for the design and deployment of statistical analysis and reporting which is used to improve the risk
          performance of the credit portfolio. 
Accountabilities will include;

Analyse, monitor and provide insight on the performance of the portfolio
Using SAS provide key insights on trends, risks and credit quality
Preparation and delivery of reports and presentations to key stakeholders (these could include senior leadership, regulators and rating agencies)
Understand and provide insight on greater economic events that might drive things such as delinquency etc
Utilise big data to drive forward looking analysis 

To be considered you will need;

1+ years data analytics experience 
Prior credit risk experience is not needed 
Experience using large data to develop actionable insights; deep dives, segmentation etc.
Tertiary qualifications in a quantitative discipline i.e. mathematics, statistics, economics, commerce
Advanced SAS skills is highly desirable, however SQL, R or Python would also be considered 
Inquisitive mindset 
Strong communication skills and a proven ability to engage with senior leadership

For more information please contact Alex on 9270 2602 or apply online.
IMPORTANT: By submitting your email address and any other personal information when you APPLY to a job, you consent to such information being collected, held, used and disclosed in accordance with our COLLECTIONS NOTICE and PRIVACY POLICY.
http://www.bluefinresources.com.au/privacy-policy

templatetext:
Showcase your Data Analytics skills to derive critical insights that further enhance the running of our SaaS Software
Push outside your comfort zone and join a team of talented senior technical experts designing, building and supporting world class SaaS
With 14 offices in six countries, more than 1000 employees, 14 software products and a comprehensive range of preconfigured solutions, it's easy to see why TechnologyOne is a leading ERP software provider



How you'll make a difference...

As a SaaS Data Analyst you’ll be responsible for driving the delivery of analysis & intelligence on our SaaS operations and business. From this you will derive pivotal insights that our Senior Leaders will use to make critical decisions, whilst
          enabling operational teams to exceed established SLAs for customers. 


What you'll be doing...



Providing advanced business intelligence and analysis that informs stakeholders across operations, finance and executive leadership, focusing on cost, capacity and optimisation
Exploring and evaluating new technologies and solutions to push our capabilities forward
Working with and educating all cloud teams to demonstrate the value SaaS data analytics provides in supporting them to deliver an awesome service
Collaborating with senior stakeholders and architects



Your talents…




Strong background in data analytics or business intelligence, ideally with knowledge and experience in AWS and big data including EMR, Insights and data pipeline
Advanced skills in Tableau, Excel, and R/Python or similar 
An ability to look at seemingly disparate and unrelated data and drawing it together to deliver amazing business intelligence
Exceptional communication skills and a continual desire to be an active contributor; you're not afraid to stand up and share your ideas


Who we are...

TechnologyOne (ASX:TNE) is Australia's largest enterprise software company and one of Australia's top 150 ASX-listed companies, with offices across six countries. We create solutions that transform business and make life simple for our customers.
          We do this by providing powerful, deeply integrated enterprise software that is incredibly easy to use. Over 1,000 leading corporations, government departments and statutory authorities are powered by our software
We pride ourselves on providing our people with earned recognition through career progression, competitive salaries and a supportive environment. We double in size approximately every 5 years so career opportunities abound. Everything is about
          to change. Are you ready?
 
For more information on this opportunity; contact Adam Petterson +61 7 3167 7981
 
We value creativity, innovation and people with an entrepreneurial spirit. See us in action at Hack Day.

*Please note you must hold permanent working rights for Australia to be eligible to apply for this position.

templatetext:
KPMG Australia is part of a global network providing extensive services across a wide range of industries and sectors. Our people collaborate, share their expertise and create innovation as we partner with clients to solve complex challenges,
          empower change, drive disruption and growth. We look for talented people with the potential to make an extraordinary difference for our clients, our firm and our communities.
We partner with clients to help them address complex business problems to ensure sustainable business outcomes; from distilling ‘big data’ to reveal valuable insights, to improving operational performance, optimising risk, restructuring an operation
          or seizing a new business opportunity through a merger, acquisition, strategic alliance or other transaction.
KPMG Transaction Services is positioned within our Deals Tax and Legal (DTL) group and specialises in providing services to clients undertaking a broad range of transactions including mergers, acquisitions, capital raising, public
          takeovers, demergers and disposals. We assist clients across a diverse range of industries to identify and manage transaction risks and facilitate quality investment decisions.
Your Opportunity
Our Perth office is looking for an experienced Analyst to join this niche group. Working as a member of a close knit supportive team you will be responsible for the following:

Supporting the project management for transaction advisory engagements (mergers and acquisitions, divestitures and complex capital raisings), providing financial and business due diligence assistance
Helping to co-ordinate the approach of KPMG’s engagement teams, client needs and other third party diligence/service providers throughout the transaction process
Analyse target company data to identify historical and projected financial and operating trends, quality of earnings, working capital considerations, potential liabilities, net debt and risks which impact valuation, deal negotiation and execution
Assist in the preparation and presentation of due diligence reports
Assist in business development activities such as proposals, client identification, pitch packs and tenders

How are you Extraordinary?
At KPMG, we believe diversity of thought, background and unique experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, our clients and communities.
To be considered for this opportunity, your qualifications, skills & experience could include: 

CA or CFA qualification(s), or are in the process of achieving the qualification(s), and a strongly aligned tertiary qualification (Commerce, Law etc)
Demonstrated experience at Analyst level within a similar professional services firm or corporate environment
Strong project management and stakeholder engagement skills
Advanced financial analysis, reporting and problem solving skills

The KPMG Difference
Our people are focused on creating a diverse and dynamic environment that embraces and values differences. We value the variety of unique experiences, qualities and characteristics our people possess and we share and learn from each other.
We are proud to be consistently recognised as an employer of choice for women, and for our achievements in LGBT+ workplace inclusion.
Our commitment to ‘Flexibility’ allows our people to manage the changing demands of work, personal or family life. Explore the links below to hear our people share their experience @ KPMG:
Flexibility empowers wellbeing [link removed]
Flexibility enables contribution to the community [link removed]
Flexibility inspires technology [link removed] & innovation
Flexibility [link removed] supports family
Make KPMG the clear choice for your career and be Extraordinary!
title: Transaction Services - Analyst

templatetext:
My industry leading client, whos main focus is in the sporting and gaming industry, are currently builidng their Data capability.
They are looking for a talented Senior Data Engineer who is a specialist in AWS and its technologies. 
A snapshot of your usual repsonsbiltites is below: 

Utilizing open source tool sets related to the AWS ecosystem. 
Develop and extend frameworks for ingestion, data curation, and metadata. 
Using languages such as Spark, Python, Scala, Java, Hive, etc build data pipelines for advanced analytics 
Complete both the development and testing of components that ultimately lead to the same goal of any data platform which is to provide reliable, stable and operationally sound applications that meet business requirements 
Provide a sound and progressive business focused design to data pipelines that meets the needs of the business 
Create high quality API's for data accessibility on the AWS platform, that ultimately integrate with the broader environment. 
Using big data analytics techniques provide data and analytics output as required to the broader community including business partners in a manner they can understand to ensure communication and buy in. 
Plan and conduct component testing of software solutions. 
Translate complex technical and functional requirements into detailed designs and functional components 
Contribute to development of standards and best practices. 

To be successful all you resume needs to illustrate is the below:

Solid programming and applications design 
Experience in design and build of data ingestion framework using open source tools on AWS big data platform 
Architecture experience in a multi cloud environment 
Development / testing experience in AWS environment 
Strong problem solving and analytical skill implemented in AWS domain where you never give up!

Solutions Architect - Core Systems Consolidation
*Central Coast *ERP Implementation and Systems Integration experience required*12 Month Contract
The Company
This is an exciting opportunity for a Solutions Architect with significant experience in large ERP implementations to join a Government organization based on the Central Coast.
The Role
You will become a partner with the business and technical teams, you will align the strategic goals with decisions regarding business and IT initiatives and the related systems that link these aspects of the business. Reporting to the Project
          Delivery Team Leader you will be responsible for the implementations and systems integrations to assist in creating systems architectures to enable the development of a unified system for the organization.
You will be:
*Analysing business requirements and system specifications and provide strategic expertise in Cloud (SaaS) ERP systems and associated integrated business applications.*Performing complex analyses of business procedures and processes to define
          and document business requirements in order to formulate technical requirements, diagnosing business problems and using a strong understanding of the technical architecture and the underlying drivers of the business to advise on technical solutions.*Developing
          Enterprise Architecture artefact, technology governance and business technology advice to business and technology stakeholders to ensure optimum business aligned technology investment and technology governance.*Responsible for developing
          the technical architecture for major (cross-domain) programs/ projects and ensuring programs/projects are initiated and aligned to the IT and business strategies.*Identifying business improvement opportunities using research, analysis, staff
          feedback and reporting of specific performance indicators that are consistent with organisational requirements and values.
Who you are
You will have the following skills and experience:
*Has 8 to 10 years' hands-on background in systems implementation and business & technology analysis, experienced developing and analysing (business) solution architecture.*Has 5–10 years' (hands-on) experience in large ERP cloud solutions
          (Oracle, Infor,Kronos and Payroll system knowledge would be highly regarded).*Experience in (project) implementations related to Asset Management, , Property & Rating/Billing s, Property Administration, Time & Attendance / Payroll
          and System Integrations.*Experience in the development of solution architecture for complex systems covering business, application, information and technology architecture domains.*Demonstrated experience in applying proven written and
          verbal communication, analytical and problem-solving skills to ensure that deliverables meet specifications.*Outstanding ability to analyse, isolate and interpret business needs and develop appropriate technical solutions.*Knowledge
          of some or all of the following types of tools, methods and frameworks:  -Familiarity with TOGAF, ADM or equivalent methodology for establishing an architecture function and delivery of specific business outcomes. -Cloud Services
          such as AWS, Azure and O365 -ERP SaaS and PaaS services -Business Process Management (BPM) and Business Process Re-engineering -OAUTH2 -APPIAN -Content management services (e.g. SQUIZ) -LDAP -SPARX
          Enterprise Architect -Sharepoint and MS Office 365
What’s on offer?
*Immediate start*12 Month Contract*Central Coast Location
Who we are
The Finite group is a multi-award winning consultancy recognised across Australia and New Zealand for excellence in recruitment for the technology consultancy space. We have 20 years of year on year success. Our teams specialise in the following

If you would like to be considered, please send applications to Anthony Gregory at  anthonyg@finite.com.au or click the apply button!

title: Business Development Manager

templatetext:
But when you meet the team here, that's exactly what you'll think of them. Just nice, good people. Just like Casey from the team, in this video.
With more than 29,000 customers, who collectively service over 10M Australians we're the absolute market leader in business messaging. That being said, we're undergoing some change; we're transitioning from a Technology business to a design-led
          Product businesses. As such our product offering is being redesigned and expanded, meaning we need to grow a World class Product team.
Our vision is for beautifully interactive products and we've got a whole bunch of super smart ideas, from AI to Big Data and beyond. Some of them will go on to become fully fledged products that our customers will leverage to succeed, some may
          not.
Our Product team has been in place for about 9 months or so now and we've made good headway in delivering on our vision.
To round out our team, we're hiring a Technical Business Analyst to work with our team to build an API suite that our customers will love, and that we'll consume ourselves for our own library of user interfaces.
Ideally, you'll come from an engineering background as you'll need some solid API/Technical understanding. We're expecting about 2/3 years minimum experience in an engineering role.  More importantly, you're going to need understanding
          or at least an opinion of what makes a great API Development experience and be able to articulate and build on that.  
Experience in a Business Analyst or Product owner role will be a big bonus and if you've worked in an Agile environment, well that's even better.  It's important that you know the difference between JSON and Jason, and that you're comfortable
          working in Trello, JIRA, Confluence and (of course), Slack.  If you're someone who normally has Postman open, and enjoy stuffing around with public APIs and webhook endpoints, we want to speak to you. We'll expect you to be able to test
          our API products and work closely with our Dev Rel team in getting to understand our client base and what they actually want.
You'll get to work in a cross-functional team, with an insanely smart engineering team, a ridiculously talented Product team and a business with a relentlessly entrepreneurial spirit.  That means you'll actually get smarter, which along with
          enjoying what you do and getting paid, makes this an actual dream gig.
We're kind of like a start-up within an established business, so you get to try stuff, fail fast, iterate and come up with ways to make our customers' lives easier and ensure they love doing business with us via thoughtfully design, beautifully
          simple products.
With ambitious goals and a Melbourne HQ, we offer some great perks for our team such as health and wellness initiatives, regular events, training and development programs, flexible work options, birthday leave, advanced technology stack, breakfast
          bar, end of trip facilities and more in the pipeline.
I hate inane lists and dot points of required technical skills on ads, but we run an AWS/Java/React tech stack on the whole, so your technical understanding of how that stack works is going to help you no end. As is your understanding of how API's
          work. I can't be any clearer than saying that this is a technical role as much as it is strategic. So at an interview, you'll need to be able to talk about API design and talk through the process and how you'd do that.
If you choose to apply and don't come from this background then it's going to be hard for us to progress your application. But if you do and you're able to work from either our Sydney or Melbourne locations and can start soon then hurrah!
          Because we're hiring right now.

templatetext:
Allow us to provide you with an overview of who we are and what we could offer an Account Manager here at IRI Worldwide, in Melbourne.
What’s in it for you? 

An agile and results driven environment where we truly value innovation and new ideas
A team dedicated to lead in their industry, who have a lot of fun along the way
Progressive learning and development programs to support your growth
An environment where you can be yourself
Flexible working hours
Casual dress code
Opportunities to give back to the community with Charity Days
Attractive salary package
Perfect office location in the heart of Melbourne - St Kilda Rd with trams at the doorstep!

What’s in it for us?
We are looking for a talented individual who can utilise their knowledge of the FMCG sector and data insights to manage one of our key Client accounts, ensuring effective use of IRI Data. You bring knowledge and understanding of numerous data
          sources, the FMCG sector and know how to provide excellent account management to our client
We are looking for someone who can:

Ensure the service deliverables are provided to the client in full and on time as per the contracts in place
Provide analysis that influences the client’s tactical and strategic decisions
Provide guidance and training on IRI software, data measures and their application
Keep up to date on the Client’s key business areas and issues from the Client’s perspective
Keep abreast of changes within the broader environment (the economy, the supermarket(s), client competitors), that impact on the Client’s business
Maintain an excellent knowledge of the IRI business and software, data measures and their application
Build and maintain a strong network of cross-functional relationships within the client’s business, drawing on senior support where appropriate, in order to develop the client relationship

Our Shopping List:

2+ years’ experience working with data in an FMCG business (Grocery, Liquor, Pharmacy or P&C)
2+ years’ Account Management experience
Tertiary qualification in a commercial/business field (preferred)
Passionate about delivering results and maintaining positive client relationships
A collaborator, able to work with others to ensure databases are checked and are accurate prior to timely delivery
Strengths in the delivery of high quality analysis and interpretation (ideal but not essential in this role)
Ability to take a good, clear brief from the client that leads to delivery of insights that meet their business needs

Our Mission
With the world’s largest set of consumer, purchase, media, social and mobile data, we ignite extraordinary growth for our clients in the FMCG, retail and over-the-counter health care industries. Whether it’s analysing how to increase profitability,
          tailoring media strategies, or guiding some of the world’s most exciting business through new product or market planning, we go beyond Big Data to supercharge growth.
Find out more
If the above sounds of interest, give us a call! We’d love to hear from you.

title: Data Engineer
Data Modeller

templatetext:
Deloitte is the world’s largest professional service firm, with one of the largest and most experienced Analytics and Information Management (AIM) practices. We have 400+ specialised consultants in Australia and more than 6,000 practitioners in
          the Deloitte global network. With the ever increasing complexity and volume of data, the rise of in-memory, high performance computing, data discovery and visualisation solutions and the convergence of Big Data and Advanced Analytics,
          organisations are faced with increasing number of choices to ensure they are able to exploit their data assets for maximum advantage. Deloitte is able to draw from its vast global experience delivering complex BI/DW solutions for our clients
          across the full spectrum of technology and business domains to provide the right strategic advice to help an organisation respond effectively to these changes - as well as partner with our clients to execute on our recommendations. About the Role  Do you want to be a part of how we help companies utilise their valuable data resources through effective use of the right technology, backed by a clear vision and strong executive sponsorship. As a Big Data Director, you will play
          the role of a domain expert in data transformation, working with senior client stakeholders and able to provide strategy and transformation consultancy to clients across diverse industries and domains.  You will be responsible for designing
          and implementing Business Intelligence (Inc. BI & Information strategy, Enterprise BI & analytics solutions and BI organisational design) and Data Management (Inc. data architecture & data management, master data management, data
          modelling, data warehousing, data governance and data quality) solutions for our key clients.  You will be responsible for:

Play an evangelist role on how to leverage data engineering and business intelligence for our clients by using cutting edge data science applications across industries
Work with clients to define their strategy and building internal data governance framework- testing, security, accuracy and consistency
Manage teams responsible for Data preparation, transformation and presentation using SQL on several different database platforms - Teradata, Oracle, DB2, Hadoop/similar platform
Working with the wider business to influence the strategies, architecture & design.
Delivering insights through a range of corporate data sources through the application of analytics, data mining, ETL, Big Data or dashboards and real-time decision making techniques and applications using Tableau/Qlikview/Power BI/Similar Tools.
Provide analysis and consultation on data quality issues for clients, and manage projects for changes to data supply and data quality from conception to completion

About You  You will have:

Solid experience in BI and Big Data Management Delivery
Business Development and client management experience.
Must have managed mid to large data teams.
Experience of working within a structured project delivery environment, perhaps where AGILE techniques are used.
Experience with Data Warehousing techniques and technologies, with advanced SQL skills
Proven experience with scripting data visualisations with an enterprise BI tool such as Tableau, Qlik, Power BI etc.
Experience of cloud solutions (AWS, Cloudera, Google Analytics/Similar Solutions) which support the transformation of business services provided will be preferred.
Experience of explaining and presenting technical information to non-technical stakeholders.
Tertiary qualification in a technical or quantitative discipline.

This is an excellent role for an experienced professional who is looking for an opportunity to build best in class data frameworks and be a part of one of the fastest growing teams in NSW.  About Us: Deloitte Culture          Join a high performing culture of talented people, who are highly motivated and passionate about delivering impactful analytics solutions and insight. We are innovative and different because YOU are… we pride ourselves on our team of diverse,
          high performing Deloitte Professionals who are talented, supportive, inclusive and social - and who are at the heart of our success. Our aim is to ensure that all our people feel comfortable to bring their whole selves to work, and as a result,
          build a workplace that encourages the true spirit of 'And different'.  From day one at our firm you’ll be considered part of the Deloitte community and our development and career progression framework will help you develop the skills
          and capabilities that will set you up to succeed - in every sense of the word. At Deloitte, we assume that you perform other roles within your life…you could be a student, a teacher, a passionate hobbyist and a caring family member. We recognise
          the importance of balance and embrace agility, understanding that this means different things to each and every one of our employees.  If you have questions regarding this role, the Talent Acquisition Team is available to have a confidential
          discussion. Please contact Aditi Aggarwal via the Our Recruiters section on our careers website.

Tech leadership level experience in a DevOps environment where you demonstrated driving innovation.
Experience in an extremely fast-paced, lean agile environment, ideally in a start-up or start-up like environment.
Advanced capability with the majority of the above technologies.
    What is on offer?

Work alongside talented, driven people who will push you to learn and excel
An environment where you have the autonomy to focus on the important things
Casual friendly start-up working environment
Flat organisational structure where everyone is accessible
Cutting edge tech stack
There will be opportunities for problem solving and innovation; where your contribution will have a direct impact on organisation success.
Circular Quay location in a modern office with great views
Free lunch every day.
Modern equipment and tools
       How to Apply If you are interested Call Heath on 0410 203 574 (outside 830am – 530pm) or 02 8047 4032 to find out more information. Alternatively if you know this role is for you click Apply Now!
title: DevOps Engineer, Tech Start-Up, rapid growth, Sydney CBD, great $, Free lunches!

templatetext:
At Arq Group, our people solve complex challenges, and provide seamless, end-to-end solutions for businesses, big and small.
We use data to help Rio improve their mining safety. We manage the data and web capabilities for Beyond Blue. We’ve developed Qantas’ inflight entertainment system. We support Domino’s cloud, managed services and security – and help you track
          your pizza. Our people help our clients deliver a solution that matters.
We are Australia’s leading digital partner, unleashing the possibilities between business and people.
What you get to do? 
As a Product Manager (12-month opportunity), you will be responsible for driving product strategy across the business to support and proactively drive profitability in key customer solution product sets. You will also:

Work collaboratively with key internal and external partners to develop tactical initiatives to drive sales and key margin opportunities.
Understand and explain complex financial metrics across the business as part of influencing group initiatives.
Provide thought leadership across the business in the SMB digital journey and emerging market opportunities.
Develop, modify or exit (including ownership of the migration process) products within a key customer solution space.

What makes you perfect for this role?

You have demonstrated product management experience in the digital space.
You have the ability to work across a diverse range of stakeholders within and external to the business
You have demonstrated end-to-end experience from interpreting strategy, developing tactical solutions to delivery.
You have a test-and-learn, continuous improvement focus.
You are commercially savvy, curious and action orientated
You enjoy working with ambiguity and thrive on the opportunities it presents.
You understand the start-up mindset and ways of working and can use that as a mantra to support the creation of cutting edge product solutions

#LifeatArq
Barista style coffee machines? Check. Brand new offices with a purpose-built wellness space? Check. Learning and talent programs to support YOU at every stage of your career. Check. A range of social activities from diversity driven events to
          board game nights and LAN parties. Check. We believe in culture contribution. Whatever your interests, we’ve got you covered. 
At Arq Group, you can find your space to (change). Our tag line is about YOU. As a team we thrive on your success, we encourage your self-development, your creativity and self-expression. Our people have the freedom in their role and in their
          physical office environment to think outside the box, innovate and grow.
We’re a WORK180 endorsed employer for women, WGEA recognized as a pay equity employer and ‘Our Way’s continue to encourage a collaborative, inclusive, innovative and passionate approach to everything we do.
Join us. Become an Arqadian and find your space to (change).
title: Product Manager

company: Cognizant Technology Solutions Australia Pty Ltd
templatetext:
About Cognizant
Cognizant is a leading provider of information technology, consulting, and business process outsourcing services, dedicated to helping the world's leading companies build stronger businesses. Headquartered in Teaneck, New
          Jersey (U.S.). With over 75 development and delivery centres worldwide and approximately 187,400 employees as of June 30, 2014, Cognizant is a member of the NASDAQ-100, the S&P 500, the Forbes Global 2000, and theFortune 500 and
          is ranked among the top performing and fastest growing companies in the world. 
Our Culture
Your passion and experience are integral to Cognizant's success. You will be welcomed into a dynamic and expanding global leader in IT and Business
          consultancy where you will be valued for who you are. We take pride in our partnership with our clients, so your ability to add value and provide exceptional service to our clients is fundamental
          to your success. In return, you will be offered opportunities and support to develop your career and collaborate with people focused on innovation and ideas.
About the role:
Thought leader with 15+ years of experience into Global delivery including strong India delivery experience
· Proven ability to lead complex IT testing programs in large integration environments including testing, automation, non-functional testing, environment management, and infrastructure support is mandatory
· Proven ability to conceptualize, design and implement large Multi-Service Integration Transformation programs
· Certified Scrum Master (CSM) or Certified Scrum Professional (CSP) is mandatory
· Strong technical expertise into Automation, Performance, Functional and Big Data testing, TOSCA, Salesforce, and Hadoop strongly recommended.
· Solid Telecom domain understand, primarily into the area of Billing applications like MICA, RBILL and legacy applications like LOLO, MAXIM and RCRM is mandatory
· Excellent testing and environment management understanding of emerging technologies like IoT, AI, Blockchain and Cloud
· Strong global program management experience, preferably a strategic management program with premium business school is strongly recommended
· Master’s degree in computer science is a must 
· Initiative, drive and the ability to work and demonstrate leadership in a collaborative and multi-disciplinary team environment. Ability to drive consensus among stakeholders.
· Superior negotiation skills, commercial acumen. Excellent analytical and writing skills.
Next steps: If you would like to express interest in role, please send your updated resume. Due to a high number of applicants, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for a further discussion within 2-3 business days.
          We thank you for taking interest in this opportunity with us. For a complete list of opportunities with Cognizant visit http://www.cognizant.com/careers.
Cognizant is committed to providing Equal Employment Opportunities. Successful candidate will be required to undergo a background check.

title: IT Solutions Consultant

templatetext:
Squiz delivers amazing customer experiences with CMS, CRM, Marketing Automation, and Search and Innovation technology. We provide enterprise level solutions to the corporate, government, educational, not for profit and cultural sectors worldwide.
          Our goal is to empower our customers by providing the platform, tools and confidence needed to thrive in a digital first world.
Our greatest assets are the people we interact with, and we create a supportive, fun, flexible and progressive work environment to ensure all our employees and clients have the best possible experience. We love what we do and we're confident you'll
          love it too.          ________________________________________
We’re looking for a technically minded, commercially driven CRM Consultant, interested in being at the forefront of Customer Insights and Big Data.
With a complementary blend of technical ability and strong commercial know how, you’ll be at ease working alongside the sales team, pulling together detailed and complex technical solutions in answer to client pitches and RFIs. Whether you’re
          extending existing functionality or explaining the benefits of our solutions to a room of C-suite clients, you’ll feel right at home.
Please note, this role can be based in either our Brisbane, Sydney or Melbourne office. 
About you:


Consultation skills to ensure requirements, research and priorities are aligned


Education


Strong conceptual thinking ability


Experience handling cost management and building business cases


Experience with change management frameworks


Exceptional presentation and communication skills


Ideally, you will have:


Requirements gathering and research skills


Consultation skills to ensure requirements, research and priorities are aligned


Testing and prototyping skills


Experience creating diagrams and visual representations of solutions


Some project management skills are required as you’ll be responsible for the delivery of your own projects


Experience consolidating and aligning systems


Benefits:
You’ll work with some of the most intelligent and down-to-earth people you’ll ever meet. We are made up of a diverse range of passionate people who love challenging the status quo. Every day is different, but what is constant is we work hard and
          have a lot of fun doing it.
Every Squiz employee enjoys a range of workplace benefits such as a generously stocked kitchen, games areas, a healthy lifestyle allowance and an innovative leave scheme allowing you to manage your 30 day leave in a way that suits you.
If this sounds like you, tell us why this role should be yours.
