title: Junior UI/UX Designer

templatetext:
THE COMPANY
A2K Technologies fosters innovation through delivering software and hardware solutions, consulting, training, development and managed services. Covering the entire ANZ region, the company has offices based in Brisbane, Sydney, Melbourne, Adelaide
          and Perth, backed by a team of highly skilled hands on technical experts. A2K is an IT Services Company as one of the leading managed services providers for Microsoft, Autodesk, Siemens, and others.
 
RIB Software SE is an innovator in construction business. The company creates, develops, and offers iTWO³ – new thinking, new working method and new technology - for construction projects across various industries worldwide. iTWO today is the
          world’s first Cloud / License based Big Data 5D BIM enterprise solution for construction companies, industrial companies, developers and investors.
We are now looking for the right candidate to help us deliver the world’s leading advanced vertical cloud solution for the construction industry.
 
THE ROLE
Due to our expansion and growth in the ANZ region, an exciting opportunity within A2K’s business awaits the right candidate. This is a dynamic, fast-paced and friendly environment that will suit an energetic and strategic thinker with clear vision
          and solid networking and communication skills. This is an opportunity to join a respected company and assist in driving the future of construction.
As the MTWO Solution Consultant you will work as a trusted and integral team member reporting directly to the MTWO Business Unit Lead.  The successful candidate responsible for supporting sales leads and assisting in defining and developing
          the technical strategies to be implemented to an extensive customer base in the Construction and AEC industries. This position is ideally located in the Brisbane office but for the right candidate could be in another major capital city.
The Successful Applicant Key Accountabilities of the Position include but not limited to...

Forging and maintaining strong relationships with key contacts in existing and new accounts;
Strategic brainstorming and implementation planning of the technical requirements to our customer base;
Providing the technical presentations and assisting with account planning for clients in construction, infrastructure, manufacturing and Energy & utilities sectors in ANZ Area;
Driving solution-based sales into A2K’s client base with the extensive sales teams;
Preparing and presenting solution offerings with a driven and enthusiastic ethos focusing on accountability for technical accuracy and understanding of the clients requirements;
Maintaining the highest level of technical skills in the functionality and implementation strategies of multiple software applications;
Develop marketing strategies and networking opportunities;
Computer literacy to include Microsoft Suite coupled with experience in updating a CRM package;
Excellent verbal/written communication, organisation and strong interpersonal skills;
Developing and leveraging the company’s branding and professional profile.

 
THE SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE
The successful applicant will be a team player, proactive and results-oriented.  Other requirements of the role are:

3+ years of previous experience in a construction/cost estimation based role or a construction management graduate with previous site experience desirable.
A proven ability to plan, develop and execute business development strategies and deliver strategy workshops to identify client requirements
Experience of enterprise-level technology solutions strongly preferred.
Demonstrated ability to work within a multidisciplinary team
Proven ability to develop and implement software implementation strategies based on strategy workshop outcomes
Excellent communication, listening and presentation skills
Strong background in negotiating, tendering and estimating
Able to work flexibly with regard to activities and hours in a role that will involve travel

 
The Benefits:

You will be backed by the company's resources to help you achieve your targets;
Dedicated customer service and support teams to provide ongoing post-sales support;
Experienced leadership and mentors to develop and grow your skills.

This role presents the successful candidate with a great market place, a good team environment and real growth opportunities supported by a highly competitive salary, uncapped commission structure and superannuation.The successful applicant
          will be a team player, proactive and results oriented. You will have excellent attention to detail, a dynamic approach to task orientation and the ability to communicate with people at all levels.A2K Technologies Pty Ltd offers an expanding
          and dynamic environment where success and initiative are recognised and rewarded.
If this role is what you are looking for and you meet our requirements, please click the ‘Apply online’ button below or email your resume to Human Resources via hr@a2ktechnologies.com.au .
Your interest will be treated in the strictest of confidence. We look forward to hearing from you!
Agency applications will not be accepted.
title: MTWO Solution Consultant

templatetext:
Change people’s lives and love what you do!  Cochlear develops world-leading medical devices that help people hear. As a top 100 medical device company and the market-leader in implantable hearing devices, more people choose a Cochlear-branded
          cochlear implant system than any other. Our employees tell us that the number one reason they enjoy working for Cochlear is the opportunity to make a difference to people’s lives.
This is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced Senior Solution Architect to work in our IT Architecture team at our Cochlear Global HQ. You will work closely with project managers, agile delivery teams and business partners
          to define solutions and guide their implementation.
Key Responsibilities 
The Senior Solution Architect role provides technical direction for projects from concept to completion. In order to be a successful candidate for this role you need to have a passion for technology and “full stack” experience in modern digital
          solutions. Your previous designs are elegant in their simplicity and have enabled others to build upon the foundations you laid. You understand modern architectures and the rationale behind those architectures. You are also prepared to design
          solutions involving legacy systems too.
You have experience with waterfall and agile delivery methodologies and understand how to work in either. In your previous roles you have advocated test and deployment automation. You have also had some exposure in operational roles and understand
          why it is important to do the job properly. In previous organisations you have identified the strategic capabilities required and contributed to architecture roadmaps and standards accordingly.
You are not afraid to challenge the status quo but understand the balance between perfection and practicality. You understand your audience and can communicate potentially complex solutions to a wide range of stakeholders.
In this role you will be responsible for:

Developing Reference Architectures for architectural domains
Lead the definition of the Solution Architecture and deliver conceptual and detailed designs to resolve the business requirement.
Close collaboration on project implementation with project managers, business stakeholders and delivery teams
Constantly look for opportunities to leverage and reuse existing IT capabilities, Services and Solutions where appropriate
Identify and investigate opportunities to utilize and integrate emerging technologies to provide cost effective flexible solutions.
Assist the IT Broker team and associated Business Stakeholders in the development of business cases and value propositions to support the proposed solutions
Wherever possible, advocate the architecture services, processes across the global Information Technology teams and business functions by means of sharing documentation, providing advice or impromptu education
Contribute ideas on systems and process methods to improve Information Technology products and services

The successful candidate will have the unique opportunity to shape Cochlear’s flagship business. You will have the benefit of working across multiple interesting and innovative projects, with significant career development avenues for the right
          person. Cochlear offers a supportive and collaborative working environment with ample opportunity to progress.
Key Requirements 

A Bachelor’s degree in Computing or Engineering
Demonstrated experience as a Senior Solution Architect
Demonstrated experience in identifying, researching, evaluating and recommending new and emerging technologies
Strong enterprise applications background, with an ability to grasp the big picture
Project planning and specification skills, together with problem solving and analysis
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with executives, managers and subject matter experts

Desired Requirements

Post Graduate qualification
Architecture certification such as TOGAF
Demonstrated 3-5 years experience as a Senior Solution Architect
Previous experience in project teams using agile and waterfall delivery methodologies.
Strong technical background in any of the following:
            
Salesforce / APEX / Heroku




Oracle E-Business Suite
Modern web technologies, ( React, Bootstrap, GraphQL – etc)
Digital Marketing and eCommerce platforms
Mobile Applications (iOS, Android, React Native)
DevOps (CI/CD Pipelines, Immutable architecture, DevSecOps, )
Integration patterns (MDM, data virtualisation, iPaaS)
Test Automation
Big Data (Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, Hive, HBase)
Machine Learning / AI
Cloud/Networking/Infrastructure automation (AWS and on premise)



Cochlear Summary
Cochlear’s mission is to help people hear and be heard. Around the world, more people chose a Cochlear-branded hearing implant system than any other. Our employees tell us that the number one reason they enjoy working for Cochlear is the opportunity
          to make a difference to people’s lives. Learn and grow with us as we tackle the most complex challenges in helping people to Hear Now. And Always. Cochlear is the global market leader in implantable hearing solutions including cochlear implant
          systems (CI) and bone anchored hearing aids (Baha™).
If you feel that you have the skills and experience to be successful in this role and take on new challenges to build your career with Cochlear, please start your application by clicking the apply button below.

title: Senior Solution Architect (Digital)

templatetext:
Visualisation and Reporting Analyst

Be part of a fast growing multitalented Development team
Work with enterprise and Tier1 clients
$90,000 – $ 130,000 Package
 You will work with a small tight knit team of driven individuals. Everyone currently on board has a great deal of belief in the company and the products and with good reason. They are looking to bring on someone else to not just do the work
          but to be a valued member of the team. Before tech comes mentality for these guys. Being able to work without requirements and autonomously find solutions is a must. Presentation and communication skills will be key as leading team members
          client side will be leaning on your expert findings for advice and guidance with future development decisions. Responsibilities/ Duties

Develop intuitive and attractive static and interactive data visualizations using data internal and external data sources that may be either structure and/or unstructured - i.e. RDMS, NOSQL, Graph, document etc.
Interpret and produce unique data visualizations for a variety of output products, including reports, briefs, presentations and dashboards
Design, develop, implement, and maintain data models to be used by various reporting and data discovery tools.
Collaborate with a business and technical subject matter experts to solve problems and convey key messages using data visualization approaches, techniques, and methods
Work with large data sets and ensure integrity and accuracy is maintained throughout.
 Skill and experience  

3 years minimum exposure to analytics field.
Consultative approach critical. Being able to work without requirements, autonomous lateral thinking
Clear experience with reporting to stake holders
Developer level experience in Qlikview, Qlik Sense, PowerBI, Tableau, Domo or similar
Data warehousing, ETL/ELT development background
Big data exposure Favourable
Exposure to development of frameworks for data ingestion, data curation and metadata including tools such as SSIS, Informatica, Talend well regarded
Experience implementing APIs and modern real time data ingestion techniques
Experience working in cloud based environments highly regarded
Understanding of Human Centred Design principles and techniques
 Don’t wait till it’s gone. Hit apply now and send in your CV (word format) and let’s get started or call Arthur on 02 8089 0157

Our Client, a leader in the tertiary education sector, is seeking a highly motivated and experienced leader who will drive the strategy, development, and uplift of their Integration services environment.In this exciting and transformative
        role you will take accountability for leading a comprehensive and innovative suite of integration services that address the data and system integration requirements of all ICT projects and operations, inclusive of governance, consultation and
        advisory services; design, scoping and estimating; integration solution development and support.You will lead the integration teams to provide effective and efficient end-to-end, enterprise integration that services both existing systems
        and emergent API-driven connectivity demands arising from the convergence of technologies such as cloud, IoT, Software/Platforms as-a-Service, big data, social and mobile. Your skills and experience  
        
Prior experience providing transformational leadership of an end-to-end integration enterprise
A strong understanding of best-practice strategies, frameworks and standards, policies and processes, enabling tools, ESB and API platforms and libraries.
Ability to drive quality contemporary integration and testing services, toolsets and assets across a complex solution portfolio (in-house built, third-party procured, on-premise and cloud), that meet the Clients strategic aims and enable
            the ICT and digital solution landscape to evolve and adjust rapidly as necessary.
Experience establishing and maintaining metrics, SLAs, and processes, including formal relationships with key customers and eSolutions' teams (e.g. Solution Architecture, PMO, Application Development, Digital Solutions & Products, Infrastructure,
            etc.), that ensure overall effectiveness and suitability of integration .

            at all times.

About the role & client
A fantastic position working for a large media/ retail business who are looking for a commercially astute finance professional. You will help drive commercial excellence across the group through the analysis of key data to help improve business
            performance. 
The responsibilities
Reporting to the Senior Commercial Manager, you will be responsible for providing commercial expertise to the business with a focus on strategic planning, analysis and business partnering. More specifically, your role will
            include:

Support operations through the provision of effective management information and analysis
Business case preparation
Drive strategic initiatives to ensure revenue and profit growth
Financial models to support business cases
Monitoring of major projects
Development of customer pricing models and profitability analysis
Spearhead process improvements across both operations and finance

The successful applicant 
CA/CPA qualified you will be a commercially astute analyst who has demonstrated success within broad, strategically focused roles. You will have a proven track record of business partnering with senior executives and have the ability to effectively
            communicate financial data to operations. Experience in the Big 4, Media, Telecommunications or a similar industry is advantageous.  
Additional benefits 

 Fun, friendly environment 
Car parking available

Work for a market leader
Career progression and development

title: Commercial Analyst

templatetext:
Digital Marketing Campaign Analyst    Big Wave Digital is
        excited to be in partnership with this growing Australian Financial Services Brand and excited to be hiring a digital marketing campaign analyst for their growing marketing team. We are on the hunt for an experienced campaign
        analyst with proven experience analysing data and trends predominately across digital and direct marketing campaigns.    The role is focused on the delivery/deployment and analysis of marketing campaigns nationally. This will
        see you working in an end to end role from pre analysis, campaign design and execution, through to campaign measurement and review. You will need to have recognised experience within a fast paced and dynamic business working very closely
        with multiple internal stakeholders and external agency suppliers.    In a nutshell, we are looking for an analytical guru, with a passion for digital marketing, someone with a knack for deploying and analysing digital campaigns.           Briefly what the role entails:

Ensuring that all projects are scoped and delivered on time and to budget
Deploying email marketing campaigns through Adobe Campaign Studio
Project planning, coordination and follow through to completion
Constant liaison with marketing teams in terms of strategy and planning
Assisting with the development of resource plans for proposals and projects
Helping to implement ideas and strategies for campaigns
Supplier (agency) liaison, working closely with your leadership team on campaign timelines and strategy
Strong reporting and analysis skills, analysing campaign effectiveness and working out which campaigns to continue with and which to pull.
    What the right candidate looks like:

Minimum of 3 years’ experience within a fast paced, deadline driven environment as a campaign analyst or Marketing analyst or Digital analyst.
Established production skills & strong working knowledge of web based applications
Proficiency with SQL and ideally an understanding of HTML/CSS
Experience testing campaigns
Tag management experience would be ideal
Experience using Adobe Campaign Studio (ideally), or Campaign Monitor, Traction or similar
Passion for solutions delivery
The absolute best in written and verbal communication with the ability to confidently liaise with senior stakeholders
High attention to detail, curious by nature, accurate
Massive amount of passion for campaign analysis, reporting and presenting. 
 If you want to work in a fast paced marketing team, have a keen interest in digital marketing, plus the technical capabilities required, APPLY NOW Applications to Dayna Stewart| Big Wave Digital | Head of Digital & Data Recruitment | dayna@bigwavedigital.com.au
        |www.bigwavedigital.com.au
title: Digital Marketing Campaign Analyst - SQL, Adobe Analytics.

templatetext:
About us    We recognise talent, ambition and passion in people and welcome this to our team; we’re raising the benchmark on service and strive to make a genuine difference.    Macquarie Government
          has over 15 years’ experience in providing Government agencies with secure, reliable and proactive services. We provide secure internet gateway services to 42% of federal Government agencies and are the first Australian cloud approved by the
          Australian Signals Directorate (ASD).    Here’s your chance to become a part of this.   About the role  The Senior SOC Engineer works with the SOC and delivers high quality Managed Security
          Services (MSS) and provides the world's best Customer Care to government customers. This is measured by technical and customer performance parameters and are at the core of our values at Macquarie Telecom Group.   The purpose of
          the senior engineer is to detect, contain, remediate and prevent security incidents affecting the Macquarie Telecom Group's Secure Internet Gateway and Government Infrastructure. This infrastructure operates within our Datacentres.   The is a hands on role, working with the team, delivering on the accountabilities of the function. The role is also a central point of coordination for major security incidents, management of incidents and ensuring the correct incident
          management processes are adhered to.   In detail you will:  

Manage and maintain Macquarie Telecom's Secure Internet Gateway as well as government infrastructure and services
Respond to security incidents & resolve/mitigate them within agreed thresholds and with appropriate sense of urgency
Pro-actively use cyber threat information, skills and intuition to explore vast amount of data to detect security threats
Implement preventive and corrective counter-measures against cyber-threat
Troubleshoot IP, Firewall& Internet networks
Evaluate impact of security bulletins & alerts including, AUSCert, SANS, ASD, vendors

About you   

At least 5 years' experience in security operations role in Customer Facing environments (working in SOC/Technical Contact Centres with external clients - not internal IT Help Desk)


In depth understanding of IP network networks (Layer 3 to 7) and correlate higher level protocols such as HTTP, HTTPS, SMTP and the ability to perform packet captures and other steps required to troubleshoot incidents


Hands-on experience with at least one major SIEM technology


Familiarity with ASD Information Security Manual


Ability to interpret reverse engineering reports from research teams or sandboxing platforms
Exposure to Hadoop and similar Big Data analytic technologies
Familiarity with data analysis and statistics via a degree in Maths, Computer Science or similar
Ability to automate mundane tasks using scripting languages such as Bash, Python and Ruby
Out of box thinker
Work well in a busy team, being quick to learn and able to deal with a wide range of issues
Strong analytical skills and able to collate and interpret data from various sources

  The technologies   

Windows Unix/Linux Server
LAN/WAN equipment (Juniper, Cisco), switches & routers
SIEM
Firewalls (Cisco & Fortinet)
DNS, Mail and Antivirus systems
F5
Hadoop

You possess security clearance or are eligible for it. This means that you will need to be an Australian citizen.    You will be joining a great team who know what they’re doing. Our customers enjoy working with
          us, we’re working with new technology and new ideas. We have a flat management structure and a management team who want the best for, and from, their team. We’d love to have you join us - apply now.
title: Senior SOC Engineer

title: Senior Oracle Developer

templatetext:
Progressive IT are currently seeking talented full-stack engineers with a proven track record of building robust, scalable products and an eye for finding elegant solutions to complex problems for a global marketing company.  Software
          Engineers are in integral part of this company’s autonomous, multi-disciplinary product teams, working closely with UX designers, Product Managers, and other software engineers to deliver quality, rock-solid customer experiences and scale our
          systems for ever-increasing growth.  The company’s stack is mainly C#, Java, Python, Golang, Javascript, and SQL, and they are looking to fill roles for a variety of projects including:

Event-driven microservices and APIs in a distributed architecture
Web applications (ReactJS, Node.js, Backbone.js, Hapi)
Infrastructure development on AWS (EC2, ECS, SNS/SQS, RDS, Elasticache, Elasticsearch)
Deploying, scaling, automating, and monitoring servers in multiple data centers and the cloud (DevOps & SREs)
Event streaming & big data solutions (Kafka, Spark)

Requirements:

BA/BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent industry experience
5+ years’ experience as a software developer (we would also consider talented and driven Junior Developers)
Fluency in at least two programming languages (C#, .Net, Java, Python, Go, C/C++, JavaScript)
You've used a range of storage engines (SQL, Elasticsearch, Cassandra, RDS offerings) and know when each type is useful
Effective communication skills, via interactive mediums and documentation

Desirable:

Experience in event streaming architecture and stream processing (Kafka, Spark)
All your infrastructure is code, you're experienced with configuration and orchestration tools for AWS and bare-metal provisioning (Terraform, Kubernetes, Puppet, Chef, Salt, Ansible)

Benefits:

An awesome work environment using the best available equipment
Adjustable desks so you’re comfy
A personal chef and loads of snacks and drink options
Weekly happy hours and super fun, frequent team events
Flexible work hours and great vacation (we believe in the importance of work-life/personal-life balance)
Paid birthday day off
Paid time off to volunteer in our community
Training budget to make sure you're always learning and growing

Apply today to be considered and a consultant from Progressive will be in contact to discuss the role further.
To find out more about Progressive Recruitment please visit our website. 
 
 
Award Winner for:
Best Medium Recruitment Company of the Year by Recruitment International 2018
Training & Development Initiative of the Year by Recruitment International 2018

company: Chamber of Commerce and Industry WA Inc
templatetext:
This is a newly created role in the Information Technology (IT) team.  Reporting to the IT Operations Manager, the Database Engineer role will assist in the ongoing support and development of CCIWA’s ongoing transition to a Cloud based
        IT strategy. You will be part of a growing and talented group of technical people working within an agile framework who work together to achieve phenomenal outcomes for our internal customers.    This role is responsible
        for the design, on-going development, implementation and maintenance of the company’s Data Warehouse projects. Your day may include designing, maintaining and supporting the platform and analysing requirements before implementation. You
        will also be assisting stakeholders in building management information reporting.  About you You will have:

proven experience in full implementation of a data warehouse structure, with experience in a DevOps/continuously integrated environment incorporating high levels of automation
proven success as a developer who is proficient in object-oriented programming and or modular programming
experience in developing and supporting data management applications, projects and big data solutions
expeience with application developers to identify opportunities to improve data collection within our operational systems
Microsoft BI technologies (SQL Server, Power BI, etc) experience with a sound programming and troubleshooting background
experience in data warehouse performance tuning and optimisation
experience of writing queries, working closely with the business, to source data from multiple locations and solution which will be utilised for business reports with the PowerBI team
possesses good levels of communication - both written and verbal
knowledgeable in SQL queries, stored procedures, indexes, execution plans, etc.
passionate about new technologies and interested in how technology is changing the way businesses and customers interact.
 Experience across the technologies available on the Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services Platforms (e.g. Azure Data Warehouse, Azure Blob Storage/Data Lake, etc.), supporting and developing Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Microsoft Business Central
        will be highly regarded.    About CCI CCI is an independent, not-for-profit organisation that has been the voice of business for more than 125 years. With more than 8,000 members from across all regions and
        industries, our mission is to make it easier to do business in this state and ensure that WA is a place where businesses of all shapes and sizes can succeed.  We want this State to be the best place to live and work. To do that we need
        to change how we operate. We need to reach further across the community to find new ways to positively impact our society.  At CCIWA we choose to be the most contemporary reflection of the community we represent. We choose ideas. We choose
        action. And we choose great people who want purpose in their lives.  About our Culture At CCI, our People is our most important Asset.  We will work with you to develop your career, ensure you feel supported and
        have the skills and capabilities you need to succeed at CCI and in your whole career.   Applications close 4pm WST on Friday 18 January 2019.  Shortlisting for this position will commence
        immediately and the position may close earlier than stated should we shortlist a suitable candidate.  For additional information, please contact Paisha Cook on (08) 9365 7492.  We welcome and encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with disability and people from culturally diverse backgrounds.  Applications from Recruitment agencies will not be accepted.
title: Database Engineer

templatetext:
Welcome to This Australian Life.
From the millions of Australians we protect, to those that make it happen every day at TAL, people really are what we’re all about.
TAL needs people who represent our diverse Australian community.   People who embrace our spirit and inspire confidence in their colleagues, customers and community.  People who are passionate about making the most of the choices
          and options we provide.  People who do what’s right, aim high, and work smart. 
About the Opportunity
As a Manager in our Strategic Enterprise Risk Management team, your aim will be to mature the risk management capabilities and facilitate risk transparency and risk informed decision making across TAL.
With a diverse range of responsibilities, you’ll be charged with utilising your knowledge of life insurance prudential requirements and capital standards, to assess and report on strategic and emerging risks across the organisation. 
In this role you will be responsible for:

Providing risk and compliance advice and insights from risk analytics
Development of and enhancement to the existing risk reporting framework
Implementation of various risk and compliance initiatives
Prudential compliance, policy development and maintenance
Management of the ongoing maintenance and evolution of the Risk Appetite Statement
Operationalising the Risk Appetite Statement
Provision of input and independent oversight over the annual stress testing program
Assisting in the implementation of robust risk management systems and reporting tools
Stakeholder management
Representation on various Steering Committees and Management Forums
Working closely with the business on developing and maintaining a TAL culture reflective of company values and key performance drivers

About You
To be successful in this role you will have:

A finance, actuary or accounting degree
A sound knowledge of life insurance prudential requirements and capital standards
Work experience in either a life insurance company, another type of insurance company, or a consulting role where you’ve focused on the insurance sector
Strong analytical skills
Willingness to seek to contribute to the culture and shared vision of the Risk Office and the broader organisation
The initiative to critically assess and facilitate change where required
Excellent consultation, collaboration and influencing  skills at a senior management level
Computer literacy and a good knowledge of relevant software
Ability to assimilate complex risk analytics into understandable, written analyses
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong internal and external customer service focus
Strong commercial acumen
Experience within the life insurance sector, desirable
Experience with data / financial modelling, desirable

Work is a big part of this Australian life, and we work hard to make it one of the best parts.  We want our employees to work in ways that suits their life and the nature of their role, so they feel able to meet their work life commitments
          and support their wellbeing. Everyone’s welcome to work for us – regardless of their age, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, intersex status or any disabilities they might be living with.
We know it’s the people we work with and experiences we share that make work meaningful and fulfilling, and we’d love for you to be part of it.
You don’t have to be an artist, adventurer, doer or dreamer, but it really helps.
If you would like to apply or refer a friend please click on the relevant button below and follow the instructions.  Alternatively, if you would like further information please contact Kirsty Donnelly - kirsty.donnelly@tal.com.au
title: Manager, Risk and Compliance (Strategic Enterprise Risk Management)

templatetext:
The Firm 
Since the day Maurice Blackburn opened our doors nearly a hundred years ago, we’ve been in the business of helping people; fighting to make a genuine difference to people’s lives. We exist to help everyday Australians use the law to fight back
          against unfair treatment. Our passion for righting wrongs is at the heart of everything we do. This is why we’ve grown to become Australia’s leading social justice law firm. After all, we believe wholeheartedly in what we do.
About the Role
We have a newly created opportunity for a Commercial Finance Manager to join our Finance team in our Melbourne CBD head office on a permanent, full-time basis. The Commercial Finance Manager will have a true opportunity to immerse themselves within
          the operations of the firm, so that they can develop a strong understanding of the business drivers and provide support to key leaderships within the firm. This is a senior business partnering role that will provide commercial/operational insights
          supporting the decision making process for senior management.
Key Responsibilities

Delivery of the weekly and monthly financial results across the leadership team including insightful analysis and commentary
Delivery monthly business divisions’ performance packs and ad hoc business reports.
Delivery of quarterly forecasting processes
Provide analysis and advice to the business divisions’ to better enable understanding of complex issues, leading to robust decision-making processes across a range of commercial and technical issues
Partner with all Practice Divisions to provide management reports and analytics on the P&L and projects
Strategic planning including forecasting & budgeting process, budget tracking, performance management and reporting.
Identify areas of potential risk, under-performance, improvement and other opportunities, working with the business division to mitigate or promote these
Drive process improvements and reporting enhancements across the business
Work with the FP&A team to provide input and continuous improvement on business intelligence tools
Support ERP and systems projects

Key Selection Criteria

CA qualified, you trained at a Big 4/leading second tier firm
Excellent technical accounting capability
Strong communication skills, stakeholder management and relationship building skills
Ability to take complex financial information and present it in a simple and concise manner
Strong commercial nous and a proven track record in partnering with stakeholders at an operational level
Commercial and analytical mindset, with the ability to think big picture
Data and solutions driven, with a passion for process improvement and best practice within finance
Strong team player who has the ability to work well in a collaborative environment
Ability for regular travel

A law firm like no other
Work with people who are truly passionate about the work we do and the impact we have on the community. From the kind of people who work here, to the kind of cases we take on, these values have run deeply throughout our organisation for almost
          a century.
We also offer great employee benefits, some of which include:

Ongoing coaching and career development opportunities
Fully paid gym membership
Salary Continuance & Life Insurance
17.5% Annual Leave Loading
Wellbeing Programs for you and your family
Generous leave entitlements
Health and Wellbeing Leave

title: Commercial Finance Manager

templatetext:
The Firm 
Since the day Maurice Blackburn opened our doors nearly a hundred years ago, we’ve been in the business of helping people; fighting to make a genuine difference to people’s lives. We exist to help everyday Australians use the law to fight back
          against unfair treatment. Our passion for righting wrongs is at the heart of everything we do. This is why we’ve grown to become Australia’s leading social justice law firm. After all, we believe wholeheartedly in what we do.
About the Role
We have a newly created opportunity for a Commercial Finance Manager to join our Finance team in our Melbourne CBD head office on a permanent, full-time basis. The Commercial Finance Manager will have a true opportunity to immerse themselves within
          the operations of the firm, so that they can develop a strong understanding of the business drivers and provide support to key leaderships within the firm. This is a senior business partnering role that will provide commercial/operational insights
          supporting the decision making process for senior management.
Key Responsibilities

Delivery of the weekly and monthly financial results across the leadership team including insightful analysis and commentary
Delivery monthly business divisions’ performance packs and ad hoc business reports.
Delivery of quarterly forecasting processes
Provide analysis and advice to the business divisions’ to better enable understanding of complex issues, leading to robust decision-making processes across a range of commercial and technical issues
Partner with all Practice Divisions to provide management reports and analytics on the P&L and projects
Strategic planning including forecasting & budgeting process, budget tracking, performance management and reporting.
Identify areas of potential risk, under-performance, improvement and other opportunities, working with the business division to mitigate or promote these
Drive process improvements and reporting enhancements across the business
Work with the FP&A team to provide input and continuous improvement on business intelligence tools
Support ERP and systems projects

Key Selection Criteria

CA qualified, you trained at a Big 4/leading second tier firm
Excellent technical accounting capability
Strong communication skills, stakeholder management and relationship building skills
Ability to take complex financial information and present it in a simple and concise manner
Strong commercial nous and a proven track record in partnering with stakeholders at an operational level
Commercial and analytical mindset, with the ability to think big picture
Data and solutions driven, with a passion for process improvement and best practice within finance
Strong team player who has the ability to work well in a collaborative environment
Ability for regular travel

A law firm like no other
Work with people who are truly passionate about the work we do and the impact we have on the community. From the kind of people who work here, to the kind of cases we take on, these values have run deeply throughout our organisation for almost
          a century.
We also offer great employee benefits, some of which include:

Ongoing coaching and career development opportunities
Fully paid gym membership
Salary Continuance & Life Insurance
17.5% Annual Leave Loading
Wellbeing Programs for you and your family
Generous leave entitlements
Health and Wellbeing Leave
18 weeks paid parental leave / 4 weeks paid secondary carers leave

How to Apply
Click the ‘Apply’ button and include your resume and cover letter.
Please note, the application process may close earlier than the listed date.
title: Commercial Finance Manager

templatetext:
See yourself in our team
As part of Group Finance, Financial Operations, the Regulatory Reporting team (circa 35) is responsible for reporting to the Group’s regulator, APRA and other regulatory bodies (RBA & ABS) which supports the Group’s banking license.
Do work that matters
Partnering with key stakeholder groups, the Senior Analyst is responsible for:

Delivering quality credit risk reporting to meet the needs of APRA and other regulatory bodies, essential for the Group’s banking license
Driving and delivering continuous improvements across reporting processes 
Building strong relationships with stakeholders across the Group as well as APRA and PwC
Assisting in preparation of the Pillar 3, Profit Announcement and Annual Report table and ensure deadlines are met
Taking an active role in in integration projects
Championing and driving productivity across the team, promoting collaboration, coaching & recognition

We're interested in hearing from people who have 

Experience preparing financials in line with regulatory requirements, either in the Big 4 or a commercial environment
A keen interest in process improvement and leveraging data/information toolsets to drive efficiency, such as SQL or SAS
An ability to build effective working relationships with business partners both in and outside the group
Proven problem solving and analytical skills
Experience in analysing and presenting reports to management and stakeholders

The people, businesses and communities we serve are wonderfully diverse. To reflect this, we're committed to hiring a similarly diverse workforce. With a focus on inclusion, accessibility and flexibility, we'll support you at every stage of your career.

templatetext:
This company is a worldwide provider of innovative technology and services for enriching global customer experience through the provision of a range of software products and services.
As a result of ongoing growth, the company is looking to recruit a talented, enthusiastic, customer facing E-Commerce Consultant who understands web & content development but not necessarily does development. A self starter who wants to be
          part of a  team delivering market leading projects in the online merchandising/retail space. The position, whilst based in Botany NSW will require some travel throughout Australia.
As the ideal candidate you should possess the following skills:

University degree in Business, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics or similar.
At least 2+ years of Web development or E-Commerce based experience.
Strong client-facing, presentation and relationship building skills.
Excellent English written and verbal communication skills.
Self starter with strong drive who mobilises people and gets things done.
Familiar with XML, CSV and JSON. Experience with data and file manipulation and processing.
CMS Systems experience with products like Magento, or Big Commerce ideal
Experience integrating with Web APIs and RESTful / SOAP web services.
Familiar with Linux/Unix.

Skills considered an advantage:

eCommerce experience such as search, merchandising, personalisation, data engineering, Hybris, Intershop, Websphere, Magento.
Experience with website technology such as JSP, .NET; Java programming.
Understanding of Cloud based services / SaaS.

A great opportunity to forge an exciting career within a  result driven environment.  
Please email your application (Word format) in confidence to tom@jigsawcorp.com quoting reference 101871.S in the subject line or call Tom Slomovic at Jigsaw on 0412 580 243.

templatetext:
Finance Editor - Sydney Office/Melbourne Office - Permanent Full TimeDo you want to lead the national conversation about property? You will be an experienced finance or business journalist/editor who is passionate about
            digital publishing and who understands the complexity and excitement of growing audiences. In this role, you will run Domain's Money & Markets section, covering the banking and financial sector as well as personal finance, wealth
            and the economy. You will work closely with contacts in the banking and financial industry as well as Domain's in-house economists and data scientists. We are big on flexibility and all about finding the best talent so this role has
            the option of being based from either our Sydney or Melbourne office!  A day in the life:

Breaking stories about the markets that impact the wealth and wellbeing of Australians.
Keeping your finger to the pulse by being present at key industry and media events throughout the year
Sourcing/creating highly-engaging news stories
Securing exclusive stories from industry figures
Providing analysis of key events/announcements/trends in the financial and banking sector
Coordinating daily with Domain's topic editors
Long form editorial projects and analysis

To kick goals you will have:

At least five years experience in business, finance or economics journalism
The ability to work to tight deadlines
Experience working in a newsroom
Key contacts in the banking/financial sector
A nose for stories that will educate and engage the millions of Australians who read Domain's journalism

It would be extra special if you have:

In front of camera video experience
Experience leveraging social media platforms to drive audiences

So…what happens next?We will give your application the attention it deserves and you will hear from us either way. If you have the right experience, one of our Recruitment Consultants will give you a call (so make sure you
            keep your phone handy!) and from there the interviews will commence. Interested?Go on then, click apply, we would love to see your application pop up!  *A little note to recruitment agencies: We have this role covered; there is no need to get in touch. We do not accept unsolicited agency resumes and are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Thanks!
title: Finance Editor

templatetext:
At Arq Group, our people solve complex challenges, and provide seamless, end-to-end solutions for businesses, big and small. We manage the data and web capabilities for Beyond Blue. We’ve developed Qantas’ inflight entertainment system. We support
          Domino’s cloud, managed services and security – and help you track your pizza. Our people help our clients deliver a solution that matters. We are Australia’s leading digital partner, unleashing the possibilities between business and
          people.
What you get to do. 
In this critical role you will own the business analysis function for projects within the Delivery Team. You will enable change by defining business needs and recommending solutions that deliver value to stakeholders. This
          includes eliciting and documenting business and solution requirements, assessing capability, and recommending an appropriate solution scope.   
About You 
You will be a passionate team player with excellent communication and interpersonal skills. You will possess strong analytical thinking and problem solving skills with the ability to create rapport with stakeholders.
          Ideally you will have had experience in an Agile environment involved in delivering impactful projects in a fast paced environment.  
 Essential Skills and Experience    


Minimum of 3 years Business Analysis experience in a delivery environment. 


Solid understanding of SDLC, and experience working on Waterfall, SCRUM, and hybrid projects. 


Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. 


Strong analytical thinking and problem solving skills. 


CCBA or higher designation (highly desired). 


A self-starter


A curious and proactive mind set


#LifeatArq 
Barista style coffee machines? Check. Brand new offices with a purpose-built wellness space? Check. Learning and talent programs to support YOU at every stage of your career. Check. A range of social activities from diversity driven events to
          board game nights and LAN parties. Check. We believe in culture contribution. Whatever your interests, we’ve got you covered.  
At Arq Group, you can find your space to (change). Our tag line is about YOU. As a team we thrive on your success, we encourage your self-development, your creativity and self-expression. Our people have the freedom in their role and in their
          physical office environment to think outside the box, innovate and grow. 
We’re a WORK180 endorsed employer for women, WGEA recognized as a pay equity employer and ‘Our Way’s continue to encourage a collaborative, inclusive, innovative and passionate approach to everything we do.
Join us. Become an Arqadian and find your space to (change).   
Please note, you do require full work rights in Australia to apply for this position.

title: Business Analyst

templatetext:
We are looking for a people leader who can inspire and bring the team through transformation, has the technical know-how to contribute innovative ideas to strategic initiatives and deliver business oriented outcomes. We are also looking for someone
          who is articulate and can communicate with influence and credibility.
Our Mission
With the world’s largest set of consumer, purchase, media, social and mobile data, we ignite extraordinary growth for our clients in the FMCG, retail and over-the-counter health care industries. Whether it’s analysing how to increase profitability,
          tailoring media strategies, or guiding some of the world’s most exciting business through new product or market planning, we go beyond Big Data to supercharge growth.
 
What will you be doing?

Responsible for IT Infrastructure (servers, network, security, storage) and End User Compute (desktop support) ensuring appropriate IT infrastructure, services and support are maintained and delivered to the business
Work closely with senior management and other departments within Business Technology (BT) and the business to manage engagements and be responsible for the complete lifecycle management of infrastructure based services
Oversee the delivery of infrastructure projects, manage OPEX and CAPEX budget and ensure projects are delivered on time and on budget whilst meeting desired business outcomes
Drive forward planning, evaluate new technologies to determine suitability to solving business needs and challenges
Collaborate with Global IT team to ensure delivery and alignment of technology, projects and initiatives
Ensure appropriate policies and procedures are in place and followed to secure IRI and client data assets
Accountable for continuous improvement and innovation to enhance the service delivery experience
Act as the technical escalation point for complex issues to the business and internal BT teams and articulate complex issues succinctly and professionally
Responsible for the Disaster Recovery Plan
Management of key vendor relationships
Lead, coach and develop the Infrastructure Team through regular feedback, appropriate support in their development goals and performance reviews

 
What’s in it for you?

An agile and results driven environment where we truly value innovation and new ideas
A team dedicated to lead in their industry, who have a lot of fun along the way
An environment where you can be yourself
Progressive learning and development programs to support your growth
Flexible working hours
Smart casual dress code
Opportunities to give back to the community with Charity Days
Attractive salary package
Free Gym membership
Childcare facilities within the Rhodes Corporate Park
Great location next to Rhodes Station – 25 mins train journey from Redfern Station or Parramatta Station
The millennial office staples of a ping pong table etc

Our Shopping List:

Minimum 7 years’ industry experience with a broad variety of Technologies
Experience leading and managing a team
Deep knowledge of technology, ie Network, security, storage, HCI, cloud.
Qualifications such as MSCA, CCNA, ITIL would be well received.
The ability to write and present technical information to a non-technical audience
Tertiary qualification in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field
Strong analytical skills, strategic thinker and adaptive to changing environments
Ability to influence with outstanding communication and presentation skills
Strong initiative and assertive
Highly collaborative
High attention to detail with excellent documentation skills

Find out more
If the above sounds of interest, apply now!
title: Infrastructure & Workplace Technology Manager
